pattern_name: SKULL TRICK OR TREAT BAG (TO CROCHET)
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) Main Color (MC) (00001) White 1 ball
Contrast A (00002) Black 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Piece of lightweight cardboard for bottom of Bag.
measurements: Approx 6 ins [15 cm] in diameter x 6 ins [15 cm] high, excluding handle.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of each rnd counts as hdc.
BAG
With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 11 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 12 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 24 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in next hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 36 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 48 hdc.
6th rnd: As 4th rnd.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 60 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loop only of each hdc, 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
9th to 13th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
14th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 72 hdc.
15th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 84 hdc.
16th to 22nd rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 
23rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. *Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 hdc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – hdc2tog made. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog over last 2 hdc. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 72 sts.
24th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. *Hdc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 60 sts.
25th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. *Hdc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 48 sts. Fasten off.
Eyes (make 2)
With A, ch 8. 
1st rnd: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 1 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 17 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 3 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Handle
With MC, ch 45.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 44 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 4 times more. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Eyes to Bag. With A, embroider mouth and teeth as shown in picture. Attach Handle to either side of Bag. Cut circle of cardboard to fit in bottom of Bag.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton (50 g/1.75 oz), 22 balls of #00002 (Off White)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: 12 ins [30.5 cm] wide x 15 ins [38 cm] high x 12 ins [30.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 13½ sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn.
instructions:
Note: Bag is worked with 2 strands of yarn tog throughout.
FRONT and BACK Panels (make 2).
**With 2 strands of yarn tog, ch 41.
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 40 sc.
2nd row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.**
Rep last row until work from beg measures 15 ins [38 cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off.
Side Panels (make 2).
Work from ** to ** as given for Front and Back Panels.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 14 ins [35.5 cm], ending with a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sc. Ch 4. Miss next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Ch 4. Miss next 4 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sc. 4 sc in next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 4 sc in next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Work a further 2 rows in sc. Fasten off.
Join Panels:Arrange Panels to form a box, having Side Panels opposite each other.
With WS of 2 Panels tog, join 2 strands of yarn with sl st at top left corner. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc evenly along side edge. Fasten off.
Rep for rem Panels.
Base: Work from ** to ** as given for Front and Back Panels.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 12 ins [30.5 cm], ending with a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Join Base to Panels: With RS of Base facing, place lower edge of joined Panels behind Base with WS of work tog, aligning corners of Base with joining rows of Panels.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc evenly around all 4 sides of Base. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
Top edging: With RS of work facing, join 2 strands of yarn with sl st to any corner of top edge. Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 rnd of reverse sc evenly around top edge. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
Handles (make 2).
With 2 strands of yarn, ch 95 loosely.
1st row:1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 94 sc.
2nd row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row once more. Fasten off.
With RS of Basket facing, push ends of Handle through slits on Side Panel to WS. Sew ends tog. Bring halves of Handle tog and taking 2 strands of yarn tog, wrap center 4 ins [10 cm] of Handle as shown in picture. Fasten ends securely.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton® (14 oz/400 g; 710 yds/650 m)
Contrast A Off White (00002) 2 balls or 720 yds/654m
Contrast B Robins Egg (27215) 1 ball or 135 yds/123m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] diameter x 12" [30.5 cm] high.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] holding 2 strands of yarn together.
instructions:
Base: With 2 strands of A, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th to 15th rnds: Cont in this manner, inc 6 sc evenly around each rnd. 90 sc.
16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc.
17th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Rep from * around to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 94 sc.
Place marker at end of last rnd.
Main Section: Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. 94 hdc.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 9½" [24.5 cm]. Join 2 strands of B at end of last rnd. Break A.
With 2 strands of B, rep last rnd 3 times more.
Make handles: Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 6 times. *Ch 18. Skip next 18 sps between 2 hdc.* (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 29 times. Rep from * to * once more. **1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from ** around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 6 times. Work 18 hdc in next ch-18 sp. (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 29 times. Work 18 hdc in next ch-18 sp. *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. 94 hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Cobalt (39784) 1 ball or 288 yds/264 m
Contrast B Chartreuse (39771) 1 ball or 299 yds/273 m
Size U.S. 7 [4.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Susan Bates® locking stitch marker
measurements: Approx 12" x 12" x 3" [30.5 x 30.5 x 7.5 cm], excluding Strap.
gauge: 16 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Chart Pat.
instructions:
Note: When working from chart and joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through 2 loops, then proceed in new color. 
BAG BASE 
With A, ch 13. 
Work Chart on page 2, noting each square of chart is equal to 1 sc and reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right. Carry color not in use across top of entire previous row and work sts around it. This will ensure even gauge as all sts will be worked around an extra strand of yarn held across top of previous row. Carry both colors up side of work. 
1st row: (1st row of Chart - RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sc. 
2nd row: (2nd row of Chart - WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until 6th row of chart is complete. 
Rep last 6 rows of Chart Pat until Bag Base measures approx 12" [30.5 cm], ending on 3rd row or 6th row. Fasten off. 

STRAP & SIDES 
With A, ch 13. 
Work Chart as noted for Bag Base. 
1st row: (1st row of Chart - RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sc. 
2nd row: (2nd row of Chart – WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until 6th row of chart is complete. 
Rep last 6 rows of Chart Pat until Strap measures approx 12" [30.5 cm], ending on 3rd row or 6th row of chart. PM on each end of last row. Cont in Chart Pat, until Strap measures approx 36" [91.5 cm], ending on 3rd row or 6th row of chart. PM on each end of last row. Cont in Chart Pat until Strap measures approx 48" [122 cm], ending with 3rd row or 6th row of chart. Fasten off. 

FRONT & BACK PANELS 
With A, ch 49. 
Work Chart as noted for Bag Base. 
1st row: (1st row of Chart - RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 48 sc. 
2nd row: (2nd row of Chart – WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until 6th row of chart is complete. 
Rep last 6 rows of Chart Pat until work from beg measures approx 12" [30.5 cm], ending on 3rd row or 6th row of chart. 
Next row: With B only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off. 

FINISHING 
Join Bag Base to Front & Back Panels: 
With RS of Base facing, place lower edge of Front Panel behind long edge of Base with WS of work tog, aligning corner of Base with corner of Front Panel. 
1st row: Join B with sl st. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly across edge. Fasten off. 
Rep to join Base to Back Panel. 
Join Strap & Sides to Bag Base: 
With RS of Base facing, place beg edge of Strap & Sides behind short edge of Base with WS of work tog, aligning corner of Bottom with corner of Strap. 
1st row: Join B with sl st. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly across edge. Fasten off. 
Rep to join opposite end of Strap & Sides to Base. 
Join Strap & Sides to Front & Back Panels: 
Align top corners of Front and Back Panels to rows marked with st markers on Strap & Sides. Pin pieces tog if desired. Beg at bottom right corner of Panel, join B with sl st. 
1st row: Beg at bottom right corner of Front Panel, join B with sl st. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly up edge of Front Panel, across single edge of Strap, and down opposite edge of Front Panel. Fasten off. 
Rep for other side.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Version 1: Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 120 yds/109 m
Version 2: Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball or 120 yds/109 m
Version 3: Robins Egg (01215) 1 ball or 120 yds/109 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Coats® Dual Duty XP® all-purpose thread in matching color
Printed cotton fabric (bottom of Tote) ½ yd [45 cm]
Sewing needle
Pins
Sewing machine
Fabric marking chalk
Iron
Scissors
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] wide and 14" [35.5 cm] tall, excluding handles
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Fabric Base 
Cut 1 square 15" [38 cm]. 
Note: Seam allowances are ½" [1.25 cm]. 
Top edges of fabric base:  
Fold one side edge ¼" [75 mm] to 
WS of fabric and press (Pict 1). Fold 
over again ¼" [.75 cm] to WS and 
press. Pin into place (Pict 2).
With machine set to longest stitch 
length, sew 1/8" [30 mm] from 
folded edge, taking out pins as 
you sew (Pict 3).
Note: Be sure to keep fabric flat 
as this row of stitches will later be 
worked into with crochet hook.
 
Sew Side Seams
Note: Sides will be sewn using a 
French seam to enclose raw side 
edge.
Fold piece in half with WS together 
and RS facing, matching shorter 
side edges with folded edges at 
top. 
Pin into place (Pict 4).
With stitch length set to 2.5 mm, 
sew seams ¼" [75 mm] from each 
side edge.
Press seam, with seam allowance 
to one side.
 
Turn piece so right  sides are 
together, and wrong side is facing. 
Press fabric in half, making sure 
seam is at very edge.
Pin into place (Pict 5).
Sew seams ½" [1.25 cm] from each 
side edge, encasing raw edges of 
first seam within the allowance 
(Pict 6).
Box Corners
With RS together, fold corner flat 
to form triangle. With tailor’s chalk, 
mark sewing line 2" [5 cm] from 
corner, perpendicular to side seam. 
Sew across sewing line (Pict 7).
Rep for all 4 corners of Bag.
Turn piece so RS is facing. Press 
corners (Pict 8).
Work should measure approx 14" 
[35.5 cm] wide and 7" [18 cm] deep.
 
Foundation rnd: With RS of Fabric 
Base facing, insert crochet hook 
from bottom to top under first 
machine made guide stitch. Yoh 
and draw up a loop, being careful not 
to break thread. *Insert crochet hook 
from bottom to top under next guide 
stitch. Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh 
and draw through 2 loops on hook  
– sc made. Rep from * 99 times 
more evenly around. 100 sc will be 
worked around.
 
2nd rnd:  Ch 4 (counts as dc and 
ch-1). *Skip next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 
Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with 
sl st to 3rd ch of ch-4. 
3rd to 10th rnds: Sl st in next ch-1 
sp. Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1). 
*Skip next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 
Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with 
sl st to 3rd ch of ch-4.
11th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 
1 sc in same sl as last sl st. *Skip 
next dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 
Rep from * around. Join with sl st 
to first sc.
12th and 13th rnds:  Sl st in next 
ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sl as last 
sl st. *Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 
sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to first sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to 
right, instead of from right to left, 
as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each 
ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to 
first sc. Fasten off. 

Handles: (make 2). 
See Diagram below. 
Ch 80. 
1st row: Sl st in 41st ch from hook 
and each of next 19 ch. Turn. Leave 
rem 20 ch unworked.
2nd row:  Ch 40. Sl st in first sl st 
and each of next 19 sl sts. Turn. 
Rep last row 4 times more.
Next row: Ch 40. Sl st in first sl st 
and each of next 19 sl sts. Ch 20. 
Fasten off.
Start Here
Ch 80
Ch 40
Ch 20
Sl st in 41st ch 
from hook 
Sl st each 
of next 19 ch
Sl st each 
of next 20 ch
Fold Bag flat. Place markers  
2" [5 cm] in from side edges along 
top edge of Bag. 
Arrange Ch-40 loops of Handles 
beg at markers placing loops 
towards center. Sew loops to WS 
under last rnd of reverse sc.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A White (00001) 3 balls or 310 yds/282 m
Contrast B Seabreeze (01201) 3 balls or 310 yds/282 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch markers.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 18½” [47 cm] square, excluding Handles.
gauge: 15 single crochet (sc) and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 19 stitches (sts) and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Moss St Pattern (including sc and ch sts).
instructions:
Notes:
• To join new color, work to last loop on hook of previous color. Yoh with new color, draw through remaining (rem) loops and proceed with new color.
• Carry color when not in use loosely up side of work unless otherwise indicated.
Color Placement (Worked in Moss St Pattern)
See diagram on page 2.
With A, work 62 rows. Join B and work Stripe Pat for 60 rows as follows:
*With B, work 2 rows.
With A, work 2 rows.
Rep from * 14 times more. Break A.
With B, work 64 rows in Moss St Pattern.
These 186 rows complete Color Placement.

TOTE
With A, chain (ch) 62, leaving 10" [25.5 cm] tail for sewing seams later in Finishing.
Foundation row: (Right Side - RS). 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Repeat (Rep) from * to end of chain. Turn. 61 stitches (sts) (including sc and ch sts).
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in first ch-1 space (sp). *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
First 3 rows of Color Placement are complete.
Rep last 2 rows for Moss St Pattern (Pat) and continue (cont) following Color Placement until 186 rows of Color Placement are complete. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Fold along diagonals indicated in Folding Diagram, matching A to A and B to B.
Sew edges of Bag together (tog) where indicated in Seaming Diagram.
Handle
Sew left handle point to right handle point using foundation row yarn end, leaving no gap between two points.
Handle Cover
With B, ch 16. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 15 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Cover measures 3" [7.5 cm] ending on a Wrong Side (WS) row. Do not fasten off. 
Fold Handle Cover in half lengthwise with WS facing, sandwiching Handle. Working through both thicknesses, join last row to 1st row, working 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m) Steel Blue (06001) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch markers.
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] wide x 11" [40.5 cm] high, excluding handles
gauge: 11 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Ch 31. 
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in 
last ch. Working across opposite 
side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each 
ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 62 sts. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc 
in each of next 28 sc. 2 sc in each 
of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 
28 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 68 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc 
in each of next 31 sc. 2 sc in each 
of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 
31 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 74 sc. PM at 
end of rnd. 
Note:
• Work in spirals (do not join at 
end of rnd for remainder of 
Bag).
• Move marker at end of each 
rnd as work progresses. 
Next rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
PM for beg of next rnd. 
Rep last rnd until work from 3rd 
rnd measures 2" [5 cm]. 

Next rnd: (Inc rnd). *1 sc in each 
of next 17 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in 
each of next 18 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 
Rep from * around. 78 sc. 
Next 5 rnds: 1 sc in each sc 
around. 
Next rnd: (Inc rnd). *1 sc in each 
of next 18 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc 
in each of next 19 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 
Rep from * around. 82 sc. 
Next 5 rnds: 1 sc in each sc 
around. 
Next rnd: (Inc rnd). *1 sc in each 
of next 19 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in 
each of next 20 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 
Rep from * around. 86 sc.
Next rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
Rep last rnd until work from beg 
measures 11" [28 cm]. Fasten off. 
Lay work flat. PM on first sc at 
right side. 
First Shaped Side: With RS facing, 
skip first 10 sc (including marked 
sc at right side). 
**1st row: (RS). Join yarn with  
sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same 
sp as sl st and each of next 22 sc. 
Fasten off. 23 sc. Do not turn. 
2nd row: (RS). Skip first sc. Join 
yarn with sl st to next sc. Ch 1.  
1 sc in same sp as sl st and each 
of next 20 sc. Fasten off. 21 sc.  
Do not turn.
3rd row:  (RS). Skip first sc. Join 
yarn with sl st to next sc. Ch 1.  
1 sc in same sp as sl st and each 
of next 18 sc. Fasten off. 19 sc.  
Do not turn.
4th row: (RS). Skip first sc. Join 
yarn with sl st to next sc. Ch 1.  
1 sc in same sp as sl st and each 
of next 16 sc. Fasten off. 17 sc.  
Do not turn.
5th row: (RS). Skip first sc. Join 
yarn with sl st to next sc. Ch 1.  
1 sc in same sp as sl st and each of 
next 14 sc. Fasten off. 15 sc.**
Second Shaped Side: With RS 
facing, skip next 20 sc.
Rep from ** to ** as given for First 
Shaped Side. 
Handles: 1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn 
with sl st to first sc at right marker 
at top edge of Bag. Ch 1. 1 sc in 
same sp as last sl st and each of 
next 9 sc. Working upwards, 1 sc 
in first sc of 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th and 
5th rows or First Shaped Side.  
Ch 30 for handle. Skip next 13 sc. 
Working downwards, 1 sc in last sc 
of 5th, 4th, 3rd, 2nd and 1st rows 
of First Shaped Side. 1 sc in each 
of next 20 sc. Working upwards, 
1 sc in first sc of 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th 
and 5th rows or Second Shaped 
Side. Ch 30 for handle. Skip next 
13 sc. Working downwards, 1 sc in 
last sc of 5th, 4th, 3rd, 2nd and 1st 
rows of Second Shaped Side. 1 sc 
in each of last 10 sc. Join with sl st 
to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and 
1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl 
st to first sc. 
3rd to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each 
sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off at end of 6th rnd.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Warm Brown (01130)  2 balls
Contrast B Hot Green (01712) 1 ball
Contrast C Soft Ecru (01004)  1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Pair of 9mm safety eyes.
2 stitch markers.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: 18" [45.5 cm] in diameter (excluding straps, arms, legs, and tail).
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join each rnd with sl st to first dc or sc. Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Hexagons (make 7)
With C, begin using magic loop method, demonstrated here.
1st rnd: Ch 2. (3 dc. Ch 2) 6 times in ring. Join. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 2. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. *(3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join A with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in each of next 6 sts. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to last ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 6 sts. Join. Fasten off.
Triangles (make 6)
With A, begin using magic loop method.
1st row: Ch 2. (4 dc. Ch 2. 4 dc) in ring. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 2 sc in last st. Fasten off.
Following diagram, stitch Hexagons and Triangles tog with mattress st for Front of Tote Bag. Place stitch markers per diagram.
Back
With A, begin using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: As 4th rnd.
7th row: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
9th rnd alt rnds: As 4th rnd.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep form * around. Join. 90 sc.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 100 sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 110 sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc.1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 120 sc.
Fasten off. With WS facing each other, align Front of Tote Bag over Back. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc evenly around Tote Bag between stitch markers, leaving top section open. Fasten off.
Handles (make 2)
With A, ch 7.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sc.
8th to 42nd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
43rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc.
44th to 49th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Fold Handles in half lengthwise. Seam between 8th and 42nd rows. Sew wide ends of Handles to Tote Bag as shown in photo.
Arms (make 2)
With B, begin using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: As 4th rnd. Fasten off. Fold in half and stitch edges tog.
Legs (make 2):
Work from ** to ** as given for Arms.
Fold in half and stitch edges tog.
Sew Arms and Legs to Tote Bag as shown in photo.
Tail
Join B with a sl st two stitches to the right of centre at bottom of Tote Bag.
1st to 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Head
With B, begin using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Attach safety eyes two rows from edge and and 4 sts apart as shown in photo. Fold in Head half and sew edges tog. Sew to top hexagon of Front of Tote Bag.
Assembly Diagram
*do not seam this section to Back
Place stitch marker here
Place stitch marker here

materials: Bernat® Softee Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Golden (69013) 2 balls
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch markers.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times in indicated space. Yoh and draw through 6 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through rem 2 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] wide x 15" [38 cm] high, excluding handles.
gauge: 15 hdc and 10 rnds = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc. Base: Ch 55. 1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 52 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 110 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 53 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 54 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 114 sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 54 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 56 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 118 sc. 4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 55 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 58 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 122 sc. 5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 56 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 60 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 126 sc. Place marker on last st. Main Section: 1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc around, inc 4 sts evenly around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 130 hdc. 2nd rnd: Sl st in next sp between 2 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp. *1 hdc in each sp between 2 hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 3rd rnd: As 2nd rnd. 4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 Cluster in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 Cluster in next hdc. Rep from * around to last hdc. Ch 1. Skip last hdc. Join with sl st to top of first Cluster. 5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. 1 hdc in top of next Cluster. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdc in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to first hdc. Rep 2nd to 5th rnds for pat until work from marked rnd measures approx 12½" [32 cm], ending on a 4th rnd of pat. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in top of next Cluster. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures approx 14" [35.5 cm]. Fasten off. Mark Sts for Handles: Fold Bag flat. Mark side sts. Place 2 markers for each handle, 13 sts away from each side st. (38 sts unworked between markers on Front and Back of Bag). Remove side st markers. Make Handles: 1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st at left back marker. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc to next marked st. 1 sc in next marked st. Ch 101 (for Handle). Skip next 38 sts. 1 sc in next marked st. 1 sc in each st to next marked st. 1 sc in next marked st. Ch 101 (for Handle). Skip next 38 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc or ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 3 times more. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Bright Yellow (0324) 1 ball
Contrast B Soft White (0316) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® tapestry needle.
measurements: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] wide x 18" [45.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
Back and Front of Tote (make 2)
With B, ch 13.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook  (counts as 1 dc.) 1 dc in each of next 9 ch. 4 dc in last ch. 
Working into opposite side of chain, 1 dc in each of next 10 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first st. 1 dc in each of next 7 sts. 2 dc in each of next 8 sts. 1 dc in each of next 7 sts. 2 dc in last st. Turn. 34 sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 12 sts. 2 dc in each of next 10 sts. 1 dc in each of last 12 sts. Turn. 44 sts.
4th row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first st. 1 dc in each st to last st. 2 dc in last st. Turn. 46 sts.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 12 sts. 2 dc in each of next 22 sts. 1 dc in each of last 12 sts. Turn. 68 sts.
6th row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first st. 1 dc in each st to last st. 2 dc in last st. Turn. 70 sts.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 2. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in next st) 9 times. 1 dc in each of next 34 sts. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in next st) 9 times. Turn. 88 sts.
9th and 10th rows: As 7th row.
Break B. Join A.
11th to 13th rows: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Turn to work along top edge. Work 2 sc in each row along edge. 52 sts. Fasten off.

Assembly
With WS tog, place Front on top of Back. With A, working through both thicknesses, sl st curved edge of Tote tog. 
When you reach the top opening of bag, work around circumference of opening as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sts. Ch 40. Skip next 40 sts. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. Ch 40. Skip next 40 sts. 1 sc in each of last 6 sts. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 36 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 36 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 36 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 14 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dsc in each of next 36 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in each of last 7 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Top Triangles (make 4)
**With A, ch 4.
1st row: 1 dc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 2 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 dc in each st. Turn. 4 sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 6 sts.
4th row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first st. 1 dc in each st to last st. 2 dc in last st. Turn. 8 sts.
5th to 9th rows: As 4th row. 18 sts.** 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

Bottom Triangles (make 4)
Work from ** to ** as given for Top Triangles.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 sc in last st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

Seeds (make 8)
With B, ch 4.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. (1 hdc. 1 sc) all in next ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

Stitch Seeds onto Triangles, and Triangles onto Front and Back of Tote, as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® "Super Saver®": 1 Skein each 528 Medium Purple A and 315 Artist Print B.
Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5].
One pair 6” diameter round bamboo handles; ¾” button; yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Bag is 17” wide x 9½” tall without handles.
gauge: 12 sc = 4”; 14 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PURSE
With A, ch 59.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 58 sts.
Rows 2-59: Ch 1, sc in the back loop of each sc across; turn.
Row 60: Ch 1, sc in each st across. Do not turn.
Handle Flap
Rotate Bag 90 degrees to work along side edge.
Row 1: Ch 1, sc 31 sts evenly along short edge; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog across, sc in last st; turn – 16 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc to last 2 sts, sc2tog; turn – 14 sts.
Rows 4-7: Ch 1, sc across; turn.
Fasten off, leaving a 12” tail.
With Right Side facing, join A at right corner of other short edge. Repeat Handle Flap directions.
Flower
With B, ch 5; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1), [dc in ring, ch 1] 5 times; join in 3rd ch of ch-4 – 6 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, * (sc, 3 dc, sc) all in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around – 6 petals.
Round 3: Holding petals forward, * slip st in next dc from Round 1, ch 3; join.
Round 4: Ch 1, * (sc, hdc, 3 dc, hdc, sc) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, holding petals forward, * ch 4, sc between next 2 petals; repeat from * around; ch 4; join.
Round 6: Ch 1, * (sc, hdc, 5 dc, hdc, sc) all in next ch-4 space; repeat from * around; join. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Wrap Handle Flap over bamboo handle so that Row 7 of Flap meets Row 1. Sew securely. Repeat for 2nd handle.
Fold bag in half with right sides together. Working through both layers, join A 3” below handles, ch 1, sc down side edge. Fasten off. Repeat for 2nd side.
Gusset: With right sides together, fold bottom corner perpendicular to side seam to create a triangle at lower corner. With yarn needle, sew a seam approximately 2” across, perpendicular to side seam. Repeat for other corner.
Turn bag right side out. Sew flower to bag. Sew button in center of flower. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Ecru (00004)
Contrast B Tangerine (01699) or Teal (01133)
3 balls or 250 yds/228 m
1 ball or 68 yds/62 m
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Pair of 5" [12.5 cm] diameter plastic ring purse handles.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] wide x 14" [35.5 cm] long, excluding handles.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
FRONT and BACK (make alike)
With A and smaller hook, ch 43.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 41 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS-see diagram) in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more.
Proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next hdc. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 dc in each of next 2 hdc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and 2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Ch 1. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for pat until piece measures 9" [23 cm] from beg, ending on a WS row.
Top Shaping: Right Half:
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 17 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 18 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS-see diagram) in each st to end of row. Turn. 17 sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each st to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 16 sts.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows twice more, then 2nd row once. Fasten off. 11 sts rem at end of last row.
Top Shaping: Left Half:
1st row: (RS). Skip next 3 unworked sts. Join A with sl st to next st. Ch 2. Beg in same sp as join, Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 18 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS-see diagram) in each st to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 17 sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each st to end of row. Turn. 16 sts.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows twice more, then 2nd row once. Fasten off. 11 sts rem at end of last row.
Top edging: (RS). Join A with sl st to top of right half shaping. Ch 1. Work 16 sc evenly down right half shaping. Work 1 sc in each of 3 skipped sts. Work 16 sc evenly up left half shaping. Fasten off. 35 sc.
HANDLES
Holding 2 strands of B tog, and larger hook, join yarn with sl st to purchased ring. Ch 1. Work 73 sc around ring. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
With smaller hook, join single strand of A with sl st to any sc. Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each of next 35 sc. Fasten off.
Attach Handles: Hold WS of Handle and side of Bag tog, lining up rows of sc. With smaller hook, join A with sl st to first sc. Working through back loop of Handle and front loop of Bag edging only, join Handle and Bag tog by working sl st in each of 35 sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Join Front and Back
With WS of Bag pieces tog and smaller hook, join A with sl st at top right corner. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc evenly down right side edge, along bottom and up left side edge. Fasten off.
TASSEL
Wrap B around an 8" [20.5 cm] piece of cardboard 30 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops 1" [2.5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly. Attach Tassel to Bag Handle as shown in picture.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Contrast A Soft Green (9739) 1 ball or 307 yds/280 m
Contrast B Soft Pink (9719) 2 balls or 424 yds/388 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Susan Bates® Split Lock stitch markers.
measurements: Approx 8½" [21.5 cm] diameter x 12" [30.5 cm] tall, excluding Frills and Strap.
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
BAG
See Diagram on page 3.
Base: With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: (RS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
9th to 17th rnds: Cont in this manner, working 6 inc evenly spaced around for 9 more rnds. 102 sc at end of 17th rnd.
18th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 108 sc.
19th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. PM at end of last rnd.
Sides: 20th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 3" [7.5 cm]. Fasten off A. Join B with sl st to first sc.
**Next rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. PM at end of rnd.
Rep last rnd until work from last marked rnd measures 3" [7.5 cm]. Next rnd (Frill rnd): Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.**
Rep from ** to ** once more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. PM at end of rnd.
Rep last rnd until work from last marked rnd measures 2" [5 cm].
Next rnd: (Eyelet rnd): Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 11 sc) 8 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 hdc in each of last 5 sc. Join. 99 hdc and 9 ch-1 sps.
PM in skipped sc under 2nd and 8th ch-1 sps for Strap placement.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc and ch-1 sp around. Join. 108 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from Eyelet rnd measures 1" [2.5 cm].
Fasten off.
FRILLS
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• See Diagram on page 3.
With top of Bag facing, join B with sl st to first rem loop of first marked Frill rnd.
***1st rnd: (RS). Ch 3. Working in rem loops of Frill rnd, 1 dc in each of next 10 loops. *2 dc in next loop. 1 dc in each of next 11 loops. Rep from * to last loop. 2 dc in last loop. Join. 117 dc. Fasten off B.
2nd rnd: Join A with sl st to first dc. Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next d. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Join. 156 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Join. 234 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each dc around. Join. 468 sc.
Fasten off.***
With top of Bag facing, join B with sl st to first rem loop of second Frill rnd.
Rep from *** to ***.
STRAP
Join A with sl st at marker under 2nd ch-1 sp of Eyelet rnd. Ch 152. Sl st in marked st under 8th ch-1 sp of Eyelet rnd.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 152 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fold in half lengthwise and sl st in marked st under 2nd ch-1 sp of Eyelet rnd. Working through both thicknesses of Strap to join 3rd row to foundation row, work 1 sc in each st to end of row. Sl st in marked st under 8th ch-1 sp of Eyelet rnd. Fasten off.
Drawstring: With A, ch 121.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten off.
Beg in 5th ch-1 sp of Eyelet rnd, weave Drawstring through ch-1 sps around to 5th ch-1 sp, so both ends of Drawstring are on RS, noting this is front of Bag. Tie knot 1" [2.5 cm] from each end of Drawstring.
Cinch top of Bag closed with Drawstring and tie ends in bow to secure.
Weave in ends.

materials: STITCH NATION by Debbie Stoller™ “Full o’ Sheep™”: 1 ball each 2301 Latte A, 2605 Honeycomb B, 2205 Little Lamb C and 2260 Clementine D.
Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
Yarn needle
Large sew-on snap
Sewing needle and matching sewing thread.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Purse is 5½” wide x 5” long before felting; 4” wide x 4¾” long after felting.
gauge: First 4 rounds of large eye circle = 3” in diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Body of owl is worked in a spiral from bottom to top. The flap is then worked in turned rows. Every few rounds, you will be instructed to work one uncounted stitch at the beginning of the round. The purpose of this is to shift the location of the beginning of rounds slightly to the left. After working the uncounted stitch, the next stitch becomes the 1st st of round.

Large Eye Circle (Make 2)
Round 1: With B make an adjustable loop, 6 sc in loop, pull beginning yarn tail to tighten loop, do not join -6sts.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 4: [2 hdc in next st, 1 hdc in next st] 9 times, slip st in next st to join – 27 hdc. Fasten off leaving a sewing length. Later you will use this tail to stitch eye circle onto body.

Small Eye Circle (Make 2)
With C, work rounds 1-3 of Large-eye Circle. At end of last round, slip st in next st. Fasten off leaving a sewing length. With sewing length and yarn needle whipstitch Small Eye Circle onto center of Large Eye Circle.

Pupils (Make 2)
Row 1: With A, make an adjustable loop, work 9 hdc in loop, pull beginning yarn tail to tighten loop. Do not join, but leave a little wedge of space between first and last hdc of round. Fasten off leaving a sewing length. With sewing length and yarn needle whipstitch Pupils to center of Small Eye Circle.

Body
With A ch 11.
Round 1: Working in bottom loops of ch sts, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each of next 9 ch. Do not join. Work in a spiral. Mark beginning of round, moving marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: Continuing around to other side of foundation chain (rotate work clockwise 180 degrees), 2 sc in same ch, sc in each of next 8 ch, 2 sc in next ch, (rotating work again in the same way and remembering to skip the turning chain from Round 1), 2 sc in next st, sc in each of next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st – 24 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in each of next 10 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice -28 sts.
Round 4: Sc in next st (uncounted st used to shift beginning of round; the next st counts as the first st of this round), [2 sc in the next st, sc in each of next 12 sts, 2 sc in the next st] twice – 32 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next st, sc in each of next 14 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice – 36 sc.
Round 6: [2 sc in next st, sc in each of next 16 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice – 40 sc.
Round 7: Sc in next st (uncounted st used to shift beginning of round; the next st counts as the first st of this round), [2 sc in next st, sc in each of next 18 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice – 44 sc.
Rounds 8-14: Sc in each st around – 44 sts.
Round 15: Sc in next st (uncounted st used to shift beginning of round; the next st counts as the first st of this round), [sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 18 sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts] twice – 40 sc.
Round 16: Sc in each st around – 40 sts.
Round 17: [Sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 16 sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts] twice – 36 sc.
Round 18: Sc in each st around -36 sts.
Round 19: [Sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 14 sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts] twice – 32 sc. Do not fasten off.

Flap
Work now progresses in rows. 
Row 1: Turn, ch 1, sc in each of next 16 sts, turn – 16 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 12 sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts – 14 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 10 sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts – 12 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 8 sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts – 10 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 6 sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts – 8 sts.

Toes (Make 6)
Round 1: With B make an adjustable loop, 6 sc in loop, pull on beginning yarn tail to tighten loop, do not join – 6 sts. Work in a spiral as before.
Rounds 2-3: Sc in each st around – 6 sts.
Fasten off leaving a sewing length. Using sewing length and yarn needle, weave yarn through front loop of each of the last 6 sts and pull tight to close top of toe. Line up 3 Toes in a row with sides touching and tops of toes (last rounds) all pointing upwards. Using sewing lengths, sew sides of 3 Toes together securely. Repeat for other set of 3 Toes. Sew each set of Toes securely to bottom of body using remaining yarn tails and yarn needle. NOTE: These attachments must be secure enough to withstand the agitation from the washing machine during the felting process.

FINISHING
With wedge of pupil facing the same direction for each eye (see photo), position Eyes on front of Body. When you are happy with the expression of the eyes, using yarn tails and yarn needle, sew Eyes securely in place. Using D and yarn needle, satin stitch the beak onto face using photo as a guide. Felt purse in washing machine to desired measurements using a small amount of detergent. Run through 2 complete warm wash cycles in a small load. For best results check owl a few times during felting process. After felting is complete, shape it with your hands and lay it flat on a towel to dry. After it dries completely, use a pair of scissors to trim off some of the fuzziness around the eyes. Using sewing needle and thread, sew male side of snap to inside tip of flap. Sew female side of snap to face opposite of male snap.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Stonewash (01118) 5 balls or 600 yds/545 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Locking stitch markers.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
Hdcbp2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Hdcfp2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Hdc5tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop) in each of next 5 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Popcorn = Work 4 hdc into next stitch. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first hdc of 4 hdc group. Pull dropped loop through st. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] wide x 4" [10 cm] deep x 17" [43 cm] tall.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
BOTTOM
Ch 15.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 14 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 14" [35.5 cm]. PM on 7th st of last row.
Fasten off.
SIDES
Notes: Join all rnds with sl st to first st. Turn at end of each rnd to alternate working around RS and WS.
With WS facing, join yarn with sl st to marked stitch. Remove marker. See diagram on page 5.
1st rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Work 49 sts along long edge of Bottom. Work 14 sts along short end of Bottom. Cont down long edge, working (19 sc. 5 hdc in each of next 2 sps. 7 sc. 5 hdc in each of next 2 sps. 19 sc) evenly along Bottom. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 142 sts. Join. Turn.
2nd rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 16 sc. 1 hdcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdcfp around next st. PM on post of st just worked. 1 hdcbp around each of next 6 sts. Hdcfp2tog. 1 hdcfp around each of next 6 sts. Hdcfp2tog. 1 hdcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdcfp around next st. 1 hdcbp around each of next 3 sts. Hdcfp2tog. 1 hdcfp around each of next 6 sts. Hdcfp2tog. 1 hdcbp around each of next 6 sts. 1 hdcfp around next st. PM on post of st just worked. 1 hdcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. Turn.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 79 sc. 1 hdcfp around each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 hdcfp around each of next 6 hdc. Hdcbp2tog. 1 hdcbp around each of next 4 hdc. Hdcbp2tog. 1 hdcfp around each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 hdcfp around each of next 3 hdc. Hdcbp2tog. 1 hdcbp around each of next 4 hdc. Hdcbp2tog. 1 hdcfp around each of next 6 hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 hdcfp around each of next 3 hdc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. Turn.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 16 sc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 trfp around marked hdc 2 rows below. Skip next hdc. *1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 trfp around marked hdc 2 rows below. Remove marker.* 1 hdcbp around each of next 4 hdc. Hdcfp2tog. 1 hdcfp around each of next 2 hdc. Hdcfp2tog. 1 hdcbp around each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 hdcbp around each of next 3 hdc. Hdcfp2tog. 1 hdcfp around each of next 2 hdc. Hdcfp2tog. 1 hdcbp around each of next 4 hdc. 1 trfp around marked hdc 2 rows below. Remove marker. Skip next hdc. Rep from * to * once more. Skip next hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. Turn.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 79 sc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. Popcorn in next tr. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. Popcorn in next tr. 1 hdcfp around each of next 4 hdc. Hdcbp2tog twice. 1 hdcfp around each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 hdcfp around each of next 3 hdc. Hdcbp2tog twice. 1 hdcfp around each of next 4 hdc. Popcorn in next hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. Popcorn in next hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. Turn.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 16 sc. 1 hdcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdcfp around next st. PM on post of st just worked. 1 hdcbp around each of next 6 sts. Hdcfp2tog. 1 hdcbp around each of next 3 hdc. (1 hdcfp. Ch 1. 1 hdcfp) all around next hdc. 1 hdcbp around each of next 3 hdc. Hdcfp2tog. 1 hdcbp around each of next 6 sts. 1 hdcfp around next st. PM on post of st just worked. 1 hdcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. Turn.

Rep 2nd row until Strap measures 1½" [4 cm].

Sew ends of Strap in position as shown in photo.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ Bamboo™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 180 yds/165 m)
Version 1 Color 1 Ghost Gray (03037) 1 braid
Version 1 Color 2 Indigo (03038) 1 braid
Version 2 Color 1 Indigo (03038) 1 braid
Version 2 Color 2 Ghost Gray (03037) 1 braid
Version 3 Color 1 Celestial Blue (03004) 1 braid
Version 3 Color 2 Sandy Toes (03002) 1 braid
Version 4 Color 1 Sandy Toes (03002) 1 braid
Version 4 Color 2 Celestial Blue (03004) 1 braid
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch markers. 1 button.
measurements: Approx 11" [28 cm] wide x 6" [15 cm] long.
gauge: 14 sts and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Before working with Caron® x Pantone™ Bamboo™ multi-shade yarn braid, separate each color link and wind into 5 separate balls.
• Each color link will be referenced by its Pantone # (see ball band)
• Due to finite amount of yarn in each shade, pattern gauge must be matched to ensure successful results.
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc
With Color 1, ch 46. 
1st row:  1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to last ch. 5 hdc in last ch. Do not turn. Work in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 hdc in each ch to end of row. Turn. 91 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 42 hdc. 2 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 96 hdc.
3rd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first hdc. *1 tr in next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. Rep from * 20 times more. **1 tr in next hdc. (1 sc. 1 tr) all in next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. (1 tr. 1 sc) all in next hdc. Rep from ** once more. 1 tr in next hdc. (1 sc. 1 tr) all in next hdc. ***1 sc in next hdc. 1 tr in next hdc. Rep from *** to last hdc. 1 sc in last hdc. Turn. 101 sts.
4th row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in each of next 42 sts. (1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in next st) 5 times. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 106 hdc.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 42 hdc. (1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 5 times. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 111 hdc.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 42 hdc. (1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 5 times. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 116 hdc.
7th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first hdc. *1 tr in next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. Rep from * 20 times more. **(1 tr in next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc) twice. 1 tr in next hdc. (1 sc. 1 tr) all in next hdc. (1 sc in next hdc. 1 tr in next hdc) twice. 1 sc in next hdc. (1 tr. 1 sc) all in next hdc. Rep from ** once more. (1 tr in next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc) twice. 1 tr in next hdc. (1 sc. 1 tr) all in next hdc. ***1 sc in next hdc. 1 tr in next hdc. Rep from *** to last hdc. 1 sc in last hdc. Turn. 121 sts.
8th row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in each of next 42 sts. (1 hdc in each of next 6 sts. 2 hdc in next st) 5 times. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 126 hdc.
9th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 42 hdc. (1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 5 times. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 131 hdc.
10th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 42 hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 136 hdc.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first hdc. *1 tr in next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. Rep from * 20 times more. **(1 tr in next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc) 4 times. 1 tr in next hdc. (1 sc. 1 tr) all in next hdc. (1 sc in next hdc. 1 tr in next hdc) 4 times. 1 sc in next hdc. (1 tr. 1 sc) all in next hdc. Rep from ** once more. (1 tr in next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc) 4 times. 1 tr in next hdc. (1 sc. 1 tr) all in next hdc. ***1 sc in next hdc. 1 tr in next hdc. Rep from *** to last hdc. 1 sc in last hdc. Turn. 141 sts.
12th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in each of next 42 sts. (1 hdc in each of next 10 sts. 2 hdc in next st) 5 times. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Join Color 2. Turn. 146 hdc.
13th row:  With Color 2, ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in each of next 42 sts. *1 hdc in each of next 11 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 151 hdc.
14th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in each of next 42 sts. (1 hdc in each of next 12 sts. 2 hdc in next st) 5 times. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 156 hdc.
15th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in each of next 42 sts. (1 hdc in each of next 13 sts. 2 hdc in next st) 5 times. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Join Color 1. Turn. 161 hdc.
16th row:  With Color 1, ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in each of next 42 sts. PM. (1 hdc in each of next 14 sts. 2 hdc in next st) 5 times. PM. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. 166 hdc.
Fasten off.
Assembly
Fold Clutch in half to st markers.
Join Color 2 with sl st to bottom left corner of Bag. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, sc evenly across edge to st marker. 1 sc in each of next 40 hdc. Ch 4 for Button Loop. 1 sc in each of next 40 hdc. Work sc evenly across rem edge.
Fasten off.
Sew on button as shown in picture.
Tassel: Cut a piece of cardboard 4" [10 cm] wide. Wind Color 1 around cardboard 30 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops ¾" [2 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly. Sew Tassel to top right corner of Clutch as seen in picture.

materials: Caron® Cotton Painterly Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 481 yds/440 m)
Fuchsia Fun (42030) 2 balls or 862 yds/788 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch markers.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Bag: Approx 24" [61 cm] wide x 16" [40.5 cm] deep, excluding handles. Water Bottle Holder: Approx 10¼" [26 cm] circumference x 6" [15 cm] high, excluding strap.
gauge: 14 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as d. 
TOTE BAG 
Ch 13. See diagram on page 4. 
1st rnd: 2 dc in 4th ch from hook. (Ch 1. Skip next 2 ch. 3 dc in next ch) twice. Ch 1. Skip next 2 ch. [(3 dc. Ch 2) twice. 3 dc] all in next ch. Working along opposite side of ch, (Ch 1. Skip next 2 ch. 3 dc in next ch) twice. Ch 1. Skip next 2 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2) twice all in next ch. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 sts and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 3 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 
3rd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 sts and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 4 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 
4th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 sts and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 5 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 
5th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 sts and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 6 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 
Cont as established, working (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp and (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in each ch-2 sp, having 1 more dc group along each edge of Bag each rnd for 3 more rnds – base of Bag measures approx 12" [30.5 cm] across longest edge. 8 rnds total. 
Next rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 sts and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 or ch-2 sp around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 
Next rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 sts and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 
Rep last rnd until work from last inc rnd of base measures 12" [30.5 cm]. 
Edging: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc or ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Next 4 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 

Bag Straps (Make 2) 
Ch 93. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 92 sc. 
2nd to 8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Fold Strap in half lengthwise and working through both thicknesses to join Row 8 to foundation row, work 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off. 

BOTTLE HOLDER BAG 
Base 
Note: Do not join at end of rnds, unless otherwise stated. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. Move marker onto first st at beg of each rnd. 
Ch 2. See diagram on page 4. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM on first st of rnd. 6 sc. 
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc. 
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc. 
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc. 
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc. 
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc. 
7th rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving long tail for seaming. 

Motif (Make 6) 
Optional: Before working Motifs, wind off next 3 colors from rem ball. Cut at each color transition and separate into 3 balls, working approx 2 Motifs from each color. 
Notes: 
• Ch 4 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-1 sp. 
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-4 unless otherwise indicated 
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 4. 
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1 sp). (3 dc. Ch 1) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-1 sp. Ch 4. 3 dc in same ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. Join. 
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-1 sp. Ch 4. 3 dc in same ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. Join. 
Fasten off. 
Whipstitch Motifs tog in 3 x 2 grid as shown in Assembly Diagram, then whipstitch side edges tog to form tube. 
WHIPSTITCH 
ASSEMBLY DIAGRAM 

Whipstitch bottom of Motifs tube to top of base (7th rnd worked in dc), easing in tube as needed. 
Top Edging: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to any ch-1 corner sp along top edge of Motifs tube. Ch 3 (counts as st). Work dc evenly around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 
Bottle Holder Straps (make 2) 
Ch 161. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 160 sc. 
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Fold Strap in half lengthwise and working through both thicknesses to join 5th row to foundation row, work 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off. 
FINISHING 
Sew appropriate Straps to top of Bag and Bottle Holder as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Smoothie™: 2 balls 2113 Oatmeal A, 1 ball each 9330 Tan B, 9205 Aqua C, 9235 Lemony D, and 9579 Lavender E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
14" [35 cm] long x 1" [25 mm] wide leather purse handles with perforated holes for sewing
pompom maker, 5" [13 cm] x 5" [13 cm] cardboard
yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Tote measures 30" [76 cm] circumference x 12" [30 cm] tall.
gauge: 17 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 16½ rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BASE
With B, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across – 8 sc.
Rows 2-56: Ch 1, turn, sc into each st across – 8 sc.
Do not fasten off.
Body
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, turn work to work along side edge, [sc in first row, ch 1, skip next row] across to next corner, turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, [sc in first st, ch 1, skip next st] across to next corner, turn work to work along opposite side edge, [sc in first row, ch 1, skip next row] across to next corner, turn to work along last row, [sc in first st, ch 1, skip next st] across to next corner – 128 sts; 64 sc and 64 ch-1 spaces.
Rounds 2-20: Sc in first ch-1 space, [ch 1, skip next st, sc in next ch-1 space] around – 128 sts; 64 sc and 64 ch. Cut B. 
Rounds 21-42: Change to A and repeat Round 2. 
Rounds 43-44: Working in back loops only, slip st in each st around.
FINISHING
Tassels (Make 1 with C and 1 with E) Wrap yarn around cardboard 60 times. Cut open along one edge. Place yarn strands in center across one 24" [61 cm] length of yarn. Tie length around yarn strand bundle tightly and knot securely. Fold yarn strands so ends are even. Cut second 24" [61 cm] length. Fold in half and tie tightly around bundle, 1" [2.5 cm] below first knot. Knot securely and tuck ends in bundle. Trim ends evenly.
Tie tassels to one purse handle.
Pompom
With D and pompom maker, make a 1½" [4 cm] pompom and tie to same purse handle. 
Purse Handles
With yarn needle and A, sew purse handles in place securely. 
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Bamboo Wool”: 8 balls 3365 Cocoa A
2 balls each 3265 Gold B, 3650 Dill C, 3920 Cayenne D, and 3525 Peacock E.
Knitting Needles: 6mm [US 10].
Crochet Hook: H.
Embroidery needle, yarn needle, 4 D-Rings, magnetic snap closure.
Optional Materials: Lining: 1 piece 22” x 26” fabric.
Interfacing: 2 pieces 17” x 10½” fabric and 1 piece 17” x 3” plastic canvas.
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E = color A, B, C, D, E
st st = Stockinette st (k on right side rows, p on wrong side rows)
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Finished bag measures 12½” tall x 18” wide.
gauge: 18 sts = 4”; 22 rows = 4” in St st unfelted.
instructions:
PURSE
Front
With A, cast on 90 sts. 
Begin with a k row, work 4 rows even in St st.
Begin Color Pattern
Begin with Row 1, work color pattern from chart until Row 92 has been completed.
With A, work 4 rows in St st. Bind off.
Back
With A, cast on 90 sts.
Begin with a k row, work even in St st until piece measures same as front. Bind off.
sides and Bottom of Purse
With A, cast on 25 sts.
Begin with a k row, work even in St st until piece fits down one side edge, across bottom edge and up opposite side edge of back piece. Bind off.
FINIsHING
Embroidery
Stem Stitch vines and make French knots following chart for placement. Weave in yarn ends.
Crochet Handles and Trim
Holding 4 strands of B together, crochet 3 chains, each 6’ long.
seam and Prepare for Felting
Pin bottom and sides to front and back pieces, leaving top 2” on each side unattached (will be trimmed after felting). With A, sew in place.
FELTING
Place chains in a mesh laundry bag or a pillow case. Set a washer to hot, heavy-duty cycle, and low water. Add the purse and bag with chains. Run one wash (agitation only) cycle, removing pieces several times during process to check progress. Two or more cycles may be needed before satisfied results are achieved. Remove pieces when measurements are correct, pieces are stiff to the touch, and the stitch definition is nearly invisible. Rinse in cool water to stop the felting process. Flatten out chains so they are uniform in size and length. Shape the purse by squaring off the bottom and sides. If possible, dry the purse on a form that is the correct proportion, like a cardboard box. This will help ensure the purse maintains its crisp edges. Dry pieces thoroughly away from heat. Trim excess (if necessary) from side pieces left unattached when seaming. Fold pieces in half toward inside of purse at top edge to form a pleat, whip stitch together. Whip stitch front and back pieces together from top edge of purse to pleat.
With B, whip stitch length of chain around sides and bottom of front and back of purse beginning at top edge working down side, across bottom and up opposite side to top edge.
With C, embroider blanket stitch across top edges of front and back of purse. With crochet hook, make 1 sc in first blanket st, * ch 3, 1 sc in same ch as last sc, 1 sc in next blanket st; repeat from * across.
Attach Handles
* Holding 3 strands of chain together, each approximately 30” long, thread one end through first D-Ring 1½”. Wrap an 8” length of B around chains and ends to secure and close pocket. Repeat for second D-Ring. Attach these 2 D-Rings to purse front. Repeat for purse back.
Optional Interfacing
For Interfacing, whip stitch each 17” x 10½” piece of plastic canvas (front and back) to 17” x 3” piece (bottom) to make purse form. Insert form into purse. Tack pieces into place, being sure bottom fits correctly and securely before tacking in place.
Optional Lining
Fold fabric in half lengthwise. Stitch ½” side seams from the top down on each side. Turn top raw edge over ½” and press. Insert lining into purse, folding bottom side edges into a triangle to form flat bottom. Tack top of triangle to side seam on each side. 
Insert magnetic closures following manufacturer’s instructions to center top edges of lining. Sew around top edges to attach lining to purse.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Golden (69013) 2 balls
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Size U.S. K/10.5 (6.5 mm) crochet hook (for shoulder strap only)
Yarn needle
3" [7.5 cm] piece of cardboard for tassels
measurements: Approx 10" x 13" [25.5 x 33 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 16 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm] with U.S. G/6 (4 mm) hook.
instructions:
Note: Bag is worked in 3 Sections. Front Overlay is joined to plain Front piece.
Front Overlay
See diagram on page 3.
With U.S. G/6 (4 mm) hook, ch 39.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each st to end of chain. Turn. 38 sc.
2nd row: Ch 2 ( does not count as sc). 1 hdc in first sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 4. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 5. Skip next 4 sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Ch 4. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 hdc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first hdc. (9 dc in next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) 3 times. 9 dc in next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in last hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). Skip first sc and dc. *(1 dc in next dc. Ch 1) 6 times. 1 dc in next st. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * to end of row, ending last rep by skipping 1 dc. 1 tr in last sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first tr. *(1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3) 5 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch-1 sps. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3) 5 times. 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in top of ch-4. Turn.
6th row: Ch 6 (counts as 1 tr and ch 1). Skip first ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. (Ch 4. Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 5. Skip next 2 ch-3 sps. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) 3 times. Ch 4. Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 tr in last sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first tr. (9 dc in next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) 3 times. 9 dc in next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in 4th ch of ch-6. Turn.
Rep 4th to 7th rows 3 times more for pat, then rep 4th to 6th rows once more.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. (3 sc in next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 4 sc in next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 3 sc in next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in 4th ch of ch-6. Fasten off.
Front and Back (make 2 pieces alike)
With U.S. G/6 (4 mm) hook, ch 39.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each st to end of chain. Turn. 38 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg is equal to length of Front Overlay. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Layer the 3 pieces for joining: With RS of Front and Front Overlay facing up, and RS of Back facing down, place Front (with Front Overlay in position) on top of Back. With U.S. G/6 (4 mm) hook, join yarn with sl st at top edge to work down side edge.
1st row: Working through all 3 thicknesses, work 1 row of sc evenly around sides and bottom edge, working 3 sc in each corner and leaving top edge open. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to first corner. 3 sc in corner sc. *1 sc in next st. Ch 1. Skip next st. Rep from * to next corner. 3 sc in corner sc. 1 sc in each sc to top. Fasten off.
Fringe
Cut strands of yarn 16" [40.5 cm] long. Fold in half and knot into fringe across Bottom of Bag, working around ch-1 sps from final row.
Top Band
With RS of Bag facing and using size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) hook, join yarn with sl st at side seam to work around top edge.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of 76 sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd (Strap holes): Sl st in next sc. Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 36 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts) twice. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and 2 sc in each ch-2 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc.
9th to 11th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
Fasten off.
Strap
Working with 6 strands of yarn held tog, and using size U.S. K/10.5 (6.5 mm) hook, join yarn with sl st to Strap Hole worked in 7th rnd of Top Band. Cont working chains until chain measures approx 60" [152.5 cm] long when slightly stretched. Join with sl st to opposite Strap Hole. Fasten off.
Tassels
Wrap yarn around a 3" [7.5 cm] piece of cardboard 30 times. Tie securely at Top end. Cut across other end. Tie strand securing Top of Tassel to base of Strap. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel 1½" [4 cm] from tied end, incorporating any strands rem from Strap, and fasten securely. Rep for opposite end of Strap.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver Ombré™ (10 oz/283 g; 482 yds/440 m) Seaside (4935) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 adjustable purse straps, ¾" [2 cm] wide x 21-23" [55.5-58.5 cm] long
optional large plastic canvas sheet and yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] wide x 12" [30.5 cm] long, not including straps.
gauge: 12 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
