To make matching Panels, start at the same point in the colorway on the 2nd Panel as in the first. There is sufficient yarn in 1 skein to match the Panels.
TOTE
Panel (make 2)
Ch 47.
Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 3rd hook from ch (beginning skipped ch do not count as a st), hdc in each ch across, turn – 45 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2, hdc in each st across. Turn.
Rows 3-27: Rep Row 2.
Row 28: Ch 2, hdc in first 10 sts, ch 2 (strap opening), skip next 2 sts, hdc in next 21 sts, ch 2 (strap opening), skip next 2 sts, hdc in last 10 sts, turn – 41 hdc and 2 ch-2 spaces.
Row 29: Ch 2, hdc in each st and ch across, turn – 45 hdc.
Row 30: Rep Row 2.
Facing
Row 31: Working in back loops only, repeat Row 2.
Row 32: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 33 and 34: Rep Rows 28 and 29.
Fasten off.
Pocket Panel
Ch 35.
Rows 1-20: Rep Rows 1-20 of Panel – 33 hdc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Optional: For stability across top edges of Tote, cut 2 pieces of plastic canvas as shown in Diagram, taking care to leave smooth edges and trimming as needed to fit.
With right sides facing up, center Row 1 of Pocket on Row 5 of one Panel. Pin in place and sew around 3 sides with end tail.
With right sides held together, seam side and bottom edges of Panels together.
Fold Facing to wrong side, insert stabilizers with strap openings aligned, and sew last row of Facing to wrong side of Panels.
Turn right side out.
Weave in ends.
Insert straps through openings and adjust to desired length.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 61 yds/56 m
Contrast B Country Red (01530) 1 ball or 76 yds/69 m
Contrast C Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 54 yds/49 m
Contrast D Mod Green (01223) 1 ball or 63 yds/57 m
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] tall x 12" [30.5 cm] circumference.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = 4" [10 cm] square.
instructions:
GRANNY SQUARE  (See diagram on page 2).
Make 3 using D as Color 1, B as Color 2, A as Color 3 and C as Color 4
Make 3 using C as Color 1, D as Color 2, B as Color 3 and A as Color 4.
Make 3 using B as Color 1, A as Color 2, C as Color 3, and D as Color 4.
Make 3 using A as Color 1, C as Color 2, D as Color 3, and B as Color 4.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc in ring. Ch 3) 3 times. 2 dc in ring. Join. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join Color 4 with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-2 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp across to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp across to first ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off.
Whipstitch Squares tog as shown in Assembly Diagram. Sew back seam closed.
WHIPSTITCH
Base
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd:  10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
4th rnd:  Ch 2. *2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.
Sew Body of Bag around circumference of Base.
Drawstring
1st st: With A, ch 2. Draw up a loop in 2nd ch from hook. Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook - ch made. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook - sc made.
Rem sts: *Draw up a loop in “ch” of previous st. Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook (ch). Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Rep from * until Drawstring measures approx 24" [61 cm]. Fasten off.
Beg at center front of Bag, weave Drawstring through sps around bottom edge of upper row of Squares as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® Chic Sheep by Marly Bird™: 6 balls of 5622 Dragon Fruit
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle, rust-proof pins and spray bottle for blocking
(2) magnetic purse snaps
48” long x 1” (122 x 2.5 cm) wide leather purse strap
sewing needle and matching thread
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Project measures 16” [40.5 cm] in width and height, 4.5” [11.5 cm] in depth.
gauge: 16 sc = 4" (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PATTERN NOTES: Beginning chain 2 and chain 1 do not count as a stitch throughout. Beginning chain 3 does count as a double crochet throughout. Special Stitches: Front Post Double Crochet (fpdc): Yarn over hook, insert hook from the front around post of stitch indicated, yarn over and pull up a loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice. Back Post Double Crochet (bpdc): Yarn over hook, insert hook from the back around post of stitch indicated, yarn over and pull up a loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice. Cable A (cbl-a): Skip 1 st, fpdc around next st, fpdc around skipped st (in front of previous fpdc just made). Cable B (cbl-b): Skip 1 st, bpdc around next st, fpdc around skipped st (in front of previous bpdc just made). Cable C (cbl-c): Skip 1 st, fpdc around next st, bpdc around skipped st (behind previous fpdc just made). Bobble: Insert hook in stitch indicated, yarn over and pull up a loop (2 loops on hook), [yarn over and draw through only the first loop on hook] three times, yarn over and draw through both loops on hook. Gently tug the post of the bobble (the chain stitches just made) to the front of the fabric.
SIDE PANEL: Make 2
Round 1 (RS): Ch 4, 11 dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch count as dc), slip st to top of beginning ch to form circle. Do not turn - 12 dc. 
Round 2: Ch 2, 2 fpdc around each dc, join with slip st to first dc. Do not turn - 24 dc. 
Round 3: Ch 2, *2 fpdc around next dc, bpdc around next dc; repeat from * around, slip st to first dc. Do not turn – 36 dc. 
Round 4: Ch 2, *2 fpdc around next dc, fpdc around next dc, bpdc around next dc; repeat from * around, slip st to first dc. Do not turn – 48 dc. 
Round 5: Ch 2, 2 fpdc around first dc, ch 2, *2 fpdc around next dc, fpdc around next dc, bpdc around next dc, [cbl-a around next 2 dc, fpdc around next dc, bpdc around next dc] twice**, 2 fpdc around next dc, ch 2; repeat from * around ending at **, slip st to first dc. Do not turn – 56 dc + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 6: Slip st into next dc, slip st into corner ch-2 space, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, *[cbl-a around next 2 dc, fpdc around next dc, bpdc around next dc] 3 times, cbl-a around next 2 dc**, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in corner ch-2 space; repeat from * around ending at **, slip st to top of beg ch-3. Do not turn- 72 dc + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 7: Slip st into next dc, slip st into corner ch-2 space, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, *cbl-a around next 2 dc, [fpdc around next 3 dc, bpdc around next dc] 3 times, fpdc around next 2 dc, cbl-a around next 2 dc**, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in corner ch-2 space; repeat from * around ending at **, slip st to top of beg ch-3. Do not turn- 88 dc + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 8: Slip st into next dc, slip st into corner ch-2 space, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, *cbl-a around next 2 dc, fpdc around next 2 dc, [bpdc around next dc, cbl-a around next 2 dc, bpdc around next dc] 3 times, cbl-a around next 2 dc, fpdc around next 2 dc, cbl-a around next 2 dc**, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in corner ch-2 space; repeat from * around ending at **, slip st to top of beg ch-3. Do not turn- 104 dc + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 9: Slip st into next dc, slip st into corner ch-2 space, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, *cbl-a around next 2 dc, fpdc around next 2 dc, cbl-a around next 2 dc, [bpdc around next dc, fpdc around next 2 dc, bpdc around next dc] 3 times, [fpdc around next 2 dc, cbl-a around next 2 dc] twice**, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in corner ch-2 space; repeat from * around ending at **, slip st to top of beg ch-3. Do not turn- 120 dc + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 10: Slip st into next dc, slip st into corner ch-2 space, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, *[cbl-a around next 2 dc, fpdc around next 2 dc] twice, [bpdc around next 2 dc, fpdc around next dc, bpdc around next dc] 3 times, [cbl-a around next 2 dc, fpdc around next 2 dc] twice, cbl-a around next 2 dc**, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in corner ch-2 space; repeat from * around ending at **, slip st to top of beg ch-3. Do not turn- 136 dc + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 11: Slip st into next dc, slip st into corner ch-2 space, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, *[cbl-a around next 2 dc, fpdc around next 2 dc] twice, [fpdc around next dc, bpdc around next 3 dc] 3 times, fpdc around next dc, bpdc around next 2 dc, fpdc around next dc, [cbl-a around next 2 dc, fpdc around next 2 dc] twice, cbl-a around next 2 dc**, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in corner ch-2 sp; repeat from * around ending at **, slip st to top of beg ch-3. Do not turn- 152 dc + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 12: Slip st into next dc, slip st into corner ch-2 space, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 sp, *[cbl-a around next 2 dc, fpdc around next 2 dc] twice, cbl-a around next 2 dc, bpdc around next 4 dc, cbl-b around next 2 dc, bpdc around next 2 dc, fpdc around next dc, bpdc around next 2 dc, cbl-c around next 2 dc, bpdc around next 3 dc, [fpdc around next 2 dc, cbl-a around next 2 dc] 3 times**, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in corner ch-2 sp; repeat from * around ending at **, slip st to top of beg ch-3. Do not turn- 168 dc + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 13: Slip st into next dc, slip st into corner ch-2 sp, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 sp, *[cbl-a around next 2 dc, fpdc around next 2 dc] twice, cbl-a around next 2 dc, fpdc around next dc, bpdc around next 6 dc, cbl-b around next 2 dc, bpdc around next dc, fpdc around next dc, bpdc around next dc, cbl-c around next 2 dc, bpdc around next 5 dc, fpdc around next dc, [fpdc around next 2 dc, cbl-a around next 2 dc] 3 times**, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in corner ch-2 sp; repeat from * around ending at **, slip st to top of beg ch-3. Do not turn- 184 dc + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 14: Slip st into next dc, slip st into corner ch-2 sp, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 sp, *[cbl-a around next 2 dc, fpdc around next 2 dc] 3 times, bpdc around next 8 dc, cbl-b around next 2 dc, fpdc around next dc, cbl-c around next 2 dc, bpdc around next 7 dc, cbl-a around next 2 dc, [fpdc around next 2 dc, cbl-a around next 2 dc] 3 times**, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in corner ch-2 space; repeat from * around ending at **, slip st to top of beg ch-3. Do not turn- 200 dc + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 15: Slip st into next st, slip st into corner ch-2 space, ch 1 (does not count as st), *(2 sc, ch 2, 2 sc) in corner ch-2 space, sc in each st across to ch-2 space; repeat from * around, slip st to first sc. Do not turn- 216 sc + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 16: Slip st into next st, slip st into corner ch-2 space, ch 1 (does not count as st), *(2 sc, ch 2, 2 sc) in corner ch-2 space, [sc in next sc, bobble in next sc] across to ch-2 space; repeat from * around, slip st to first sc. Do not turn- 232 sts + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 17: Repeat Round 15- 248 sc + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 18: Slip st into next st, slip st into corner ch-2 space, ch 1 (does not count as st), *(2 sc, ch 2, 2 sc) in corner ch-2 space, [bobble in next sc, sc in next sc] across to ch-2 space; repeat from * around, slip st to first sc. Do not turn- 264 sts + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 19: Repeat Round 15- 280 sc + 4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 20: Slip st into next st, slip st into corner ch-2 space, ch 1 (does not count as st), sc in same corner ch-2 space, *ch 1, sc in front loop of previous sc just made (inserting hook from top of st), skip next st, sc in front loop of next st (edging shell made); repeat from * around, slip st to first sc. Fasten off.
GUSSET: Ch 18.
Row 1 (WS): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each across. Turn – 17 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, bobble in next sc; repeat from * across to last sc, sc in last sc. Turn
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across. Turn
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in next 2 sc, *bobble in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across to last sc, sc in last sc. Turn
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each st across. Turn
Repeat Rows 2-5 until piece measures 54” [137 cm] from the beginning and ending with a Row 3 or Row 5. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Weave in all loose ends. Pin side panels to 16” [40.5 cm] by 16” [40.5 cm] square. Spray with water to block. Allow to dry. With RS facing, whipstitch edge of gusset to unworked loops of Round 19 of side panel. Repeat on other side panel.
Clasp Band: Row 1: Join with a sc to first unworked loop of Round 19 on top edge of side panel. Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Turn – 70 sc.
Rows 2-6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Turn
Fasten off yarn. Measure 4” [10 cm] from sides of clasp band and attach magnetic clasps according to manufacturer’s instructions. Whipstitch to secure clasp band on all three sides to side panel. Repeat on other side of purse.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Berry (01148) OR Blue (01146) OR Botanical Green (01144) 3 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 19" [48 cm] wide x 14" [35.5 cm] tall, excluding Straps.
gauge: 3.5 ch-5 sps and 8.5 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Mesh St.
instructions:
BODY
Ch 90. See diagram on page 2. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 5. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 22 ch-5 sps. 
2nd row: Ch 5 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 2). 1 sc in first ch-5 sp. *Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 2. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * to last ch-sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in last dc (3rd ch of beg ch-5). Turn. 
4th to 53rd rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 25 times more for Mesh St, ending on a 3rd row.
1st Cinched Edge: **1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to sc at top right corner to work across last row of Body. Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each ch-5 sp to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 24 sc. 
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.** Fasten off.
2nd Cinched Edge: Work from ** to ** as for First Cinched Edge across foundation edge. Do not fasten off.

STRAPS AND EDGING
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 60. Skip next 22 sc. 1 sc in next sc, taking care not to twist ch - Strap made. Do not turn. Cont working around Body: work 6 sc along side of 2nd Cinched Edge. Work 1 sc around each st along first side edge of Body. Work 6 sc along side of 1st Cinched Edge. Cont working around 1st Cinched Edge: Make Strap as before. Cont around second side edge of Body: Work 6 sc along side of 1st Cinched Edge. Work 1 sc around each st along second side edge of Body. Work 6 sc along side of 2nd Cinched Edge. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 60 ch. 1 sc in each of next 67 sc. 1 sc in each of next 60 ch. 1 sc in each of last 66 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 254 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 0365 Coffee CA and 0885 Delft Blue (knit) OR 0774 Light Raspberry (crochet) CB.
Knitting Needles: 5mm [US 8].
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Bags measure approximately 12” wide x 10” deep.
gauge: 3 repeats = 5¼”; 14 rows = 5” in pat. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BAG: With CA, ch 58. 
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, * 3 sc in next ch, sc in next 2 ch **, sc-dec over next 3 ch, sc in next 2 ch; rep from * to last 2 ch, end at **; sc in last 2 ch; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, dec over first 2 sc, sc in next 3 sc, * 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc **, sc-dec over next 3 sts, sc in next 2 sc; rep from * to last 3 sc, end at **; sc in next sc, dec over last 2 sc changing to CB; turn.
Rep Row 2 for pat, working next 2 rows with CB, then next 2 rows with CA and repeat until there are a total of 54 rows (27 stripes) – about 20” from beg. Last stripe will be CA. Fasten off.
Decrease for FLAP: Skip first 2 sts, attach CB in next st; dec over this and next sc, sc in next sc, * 3 sc in next sc **, sc in next 2 sc, sc-dec over next 3 sts, sc in next 2 sc; rep from * to last 5 sts, end at **; sc in next sc, dec over last 2 sc; turn leaving last 2 sts unworked.
Work in pat as now established until there are 16 rows (8 stripes) from decrease. Last stripe will be CA. Work 2 more rows as established with CA. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Work same as Knit Bag from ** to **.
Flap Edging: With right side facing, join CA and work 2 rows sc evenly across row ends (side edge) of flap. Fasten off. Repeat on opposite edge.
Strap: With CB, ch 151.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 150 sc. Fasten off.
Row 2: With right side facing, attach CA in first sc; ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Row 4: With right side facing, attach CA in first ch of beginning ch edge; ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Row 5: Rep Row 3. Fasten off.
Place ends of strap over side seams and sew in place.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) main color (mc) Soft Ecru (01004) 59.5 m/65 yds or 1 ball
contrast A Mod Green (01223) 15 m/16.5 yds or 1 ball
contrast B Robin’s Egg (01215) 16.5 m/18 yds or 1 ball
contrast C Hot Blue (01742) 13 m/14 yds or 1 ball
contrast D Hot Orange (01628) 16.5 m/18 yds or 1 ball
contrast E Yellow (00010) 16.5 m/18 yds or 1 ball
contrast F Warm Brown (01130) 14 m/15 yds or 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 stitch markers.
measurements: Approx 12” [30.5 cm] wide x 14” [35.5 cm] high, excluding handles.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
note: When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.

stripe Pat
With MC, work 1 row.
With A, work 1 row.
With E, work 1 row.
With MC, work 1 row.
With B, work 1 row.
With MC, work 1 row.
With D, work 1 row.
With F, work 1 row.
With MC, work 1 row.
With C, work 1 row.
With MC, work 1 row.
With D, work 1 row.
With E, work 1 row.
With B, work 1 row.
With MC, work 1 row.
With A, work 1 row.
With F, work 1 row.
With MC, work 1 row.
With E, work 1 row.
With B, work 1 row.
With A, work 1 row.
With MC, work 1 row.
With D, work 1 row.
With MC, work 1 row.
With F, work 1 row.
With B, work 1 row.
With E, work 1 row.
With C, work 1 row.
With A, work 1 row.
With MC, work 1 row.
With D, work 1 row.
With B, work 1 row.
With MC, work 1 row.
These 33 rows form Stripe Pat.

BAG
With MC, ch 84. Join in ring with sl st into first ch, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each ch around. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 84 hdc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join E with sl st to first hdc.
First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd rnd for pat until all 33 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Fasten off. Place markers on 32nd hdc and 74th hdc of last rnd.

HAnDLEs
With RS facing, join MC with sl st at first marker.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 hdc. turn. Leave rem st unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 18” [45.5 cm].
next row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Turn
next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn.
next row: Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Rep for second handle, starting at second marker.
Tie handles in knot at desired length.

FInIsHInG
Join bottom edge: With RS tog, join MC with sl st at bottom edge. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sl st across bottom edge to join. Fasten off.

materials: Peaches & Creme® Stripey™ (2 oz/56.7 g; 102 yds/93 m) Green Stripe (17007) 7 balls or 630 yds/576 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Popcorn = 5 dc into same stitch or space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 5 dc group. Pull dropped loop through st. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] deep and wide, excluding handles.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Motifs (make 13)
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to top of ch 3.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2. 
1st rnd: Ch 3. 3 dc in ring. Ch 1. (4 dc in ring. Ch 1) 3 times. Join. 
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 3 dc and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *(4 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more. Join. 
3rd rnd: Sl st in each of next 3 dc and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Skip next dc. *1 dc in each dc to next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before next ch-1 sp. Skip next dc. (2 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 dc in each dc to next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before first ch-1 sp. Join.

4th rnd: Sl st in next dc and next popcorn. Ch 3. (1 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Skip 1 dc. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before next popcorn. Skip next dc. (2 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in top of popcorn. Rep from * twice more. Skip 1 dc. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before next popcorn. Join. 
Rep 4th rnd until Motif measures 7" [18 cm] square. Fasten oﬀ.

Straps
Ch 75. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 74 sc. 
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten oﬀ at end of last row.

FINISHING
Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. 
With WS tog, following diagrams, join Motifs tog, matching lettered sides and working in sc through back loops only. 
Edging: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to any corner st. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around, working 3 sc in corners. Join with sl to to top of first sc. Fasten oﬀ.
Sew Straps in position.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1601 Lettuce A and 1321 Chocolate B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [G-6 US] and 5mm [H-8 US]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Bag measures 12½” long and 12½” wide x 2½” deep (32 x 32 x 6.5 cm) without shoulder straps. Strap measures 24” long x 2¼” wide (61 x 5.5 cm).
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm) in pattern; 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Panel (make 2)
With larger hook and A, ch 34.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc) and in each ch across, turn—32 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each dc to beginning ch, sc in top of beginning ch, turn—32 sc.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 1, sc in each st, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, fptr around 2nd dc 4 rows below, *skip next 4 dc 4 rows below, fptr around next dc 4 rows below, sc in next 4 sc, fptr around dc 4 rows below immediately following last fptr made; repeat from * to last 3 sc, sc in last 3 sc, turn—22 sc and 10 fptr.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, *dc in next 2 skipped sc 2 rows below, sc in next 4 sc; repeat from * to last 5 sts, dc in next 2 skipped sc 2 rows below, sc in last 3 sc, turn—22 sc and 10 dc.
Rows 7 and 8: Repeat Row 3.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in first sc, fptr around both posts of first 2 fptr 4 rows below, *sc in next 4 sc, fptr around both posts of 2 fptr just worked, fptr around both posts of next 2 fptr 4 rows below; repeat from * to last 6 sts, sc in next 4 sc, fptr around both posts of 2 fptr just worked, sc in last sc, turn—22 sc and 10 fptr.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in first sc, dc in next skipped sc 2 rows below, sc in next 4 sc, *dc in next 2 skipped sc 2 rows below, sc in next 4 sc; repeat from * to last 2 sts, dc in next skipped sc 2 rows below, sc in last sc, turn—22 sc and 10 dc.
Rows 11 and 12: Repeat Row 3.
Row 13: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, fptr around first fptr 4 rows below, *fptr around both posts of next 2 fptr 4 rows, sc in next 4 sc, fptr around both posts of 2 fptr just worked; repeat from * to last 4 sts, fptr around next fptr 4 rows, sc in last 3 sc, turn—22 sc and 10 fptr.
Rows 14–37: Repeat Rows 6–13 three times. Do not turn at end of Row 37.
Border
Note: Continue working in joined rounds.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in end of each row of side, working across opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch (corner made), hdc in next ch, *sc in next 4 ch, hdc in next 2 ch; repeat from * across to last 6 ch, sc in next 4 ch, hdc in next ch, 3 sc in last ch (corner made); sc in end of each row of other side; 3 sc in first sc of Row 37 (corner made), hdc in next st, **sc in next 4 sts, hdc in next 2 sts; repeat from ** to last 6 sts, sc in next 4 sts, hdc in next st, 3 sc in last st (corner made); join with slip st in first sc—146 sts.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each st around, working 3 sc in center st of each corner; join with slip st in first sc—154 sc. Fasten off.
Round 3: Join B with sc to back loop of any st, working in back loops only, sc in each st around, working 3 sc in center st of each corner; join with slip st in first sc—162 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, bpsc around each sc, working 3 sc in back loop of center st of each corner; change to A; join with slip st in first sc—170 sts.
Rounds 5–7: Repeat Rounds 2–4. Fasten off.
Gusset
With right side of Row 1 facing, hold first panel so left side is horizontal; with larger hook, join B with sc in back loop of end of first row.
Row 1 (right side): Working in back loops only, sc in end of each row down side, in each st across bottom, and in end of each row up other side; change to A, turn. Change to smaller hook.
Rows 2–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Change to B and larger hook at end of Row 8.
Row 9: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
With Row 1 facing, hold 2nd panel to gusset with wrong sides together. Working through back loops only of panel and both loops of Row 9, whipstitch panel and gusset together on 3 sides.
Straps (make 2)
With smaller hook and A, chain 82.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th chain from hook (beginning ch count as first dc) and in each ch across, turn—80 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each dc to beginning ch, sc in top of beginning ch, turn—80 sc.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each sc; change to B.
Border
Note: Continue working in joined rounds.
Round 1 (right side): *Working across ends of rows, 3 sc in first row (corner made), sc in next row, 3 sc in last row (corner made);* working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch across; repeat from * to * once; sc in each st across to first sc; join with slip st in first sc—174 sc. Do not turn.
Round 2: Ch 1, bpsc around each sc, working 3 sc in center st of each corner; join with slip st in first st—182 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Place short end of one strap ¾” (2 cm) below top edge of first panel on wrong side and 2¼” (5.5 cm) from outer edge; repeat for other end on same panel. Whipstitch ends in place. Repeat to attach 2nd strap to other panel. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Gold (0321) 1 ball
Size U.S. 7 [4.5 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Sl stfp = Slip stitch in front post
measurements: Approx 4½" x 3½" [11.5 x 9 cm]
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = 6½" [16.5 cm] square.
instructions:
Notes:
• To work front loop only, insert hook through front arm of “v”. See Diagram B.

DIAGRAM B

• To work back loop only, insert hook through back arm of “v”. See Diagram C.

DIAGRAM C

• In 6th rnd of square and 2nd rnd of button, work sl st loosely.

Square Motif:
See diagram on page 3.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to make a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Working in back loops only, ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 2 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st in first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 5 (counts as first dc and ch 2). 1 dc in same st as join. *1 dc in each of next 3 sts. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next st. Rep from * twice more. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Join with sl stfp around first dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as first dcfp). *(1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc.) in next ch-2 sp. (1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st) twice. **1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * twice more. Rep from * to ** once. Join with sl st in first dcfp.
5th rnd: Working in front loops only, ch 1. 1 sc in same st as join. 1 sc in next st. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc.) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Join with sl st in back loop of first sc.
6th rnd: Working in back loops only, ch 1. Sl st in same st as join. Sl st in each of next 2 sts. *Sl st in 1st ch of ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Sl st in 2nd ch of ch-2 sp. Sl st in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * twice more. Sl st in 1st ch of ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Sl st in 2nd ch of ch-2 sp. Sl st in each of next 6 sts. Join with sl st in back loop of first sl st.
7th rnd: Working in back loops only, ch 2. 1 hdc in same st as join. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. *(1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 11 sts. Rep from * twice more. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sl sts. Join with sl st in first hdc.
8th rnd: (Buttonhole rnd). Ch 4 (counts as first tr). 1 tr in each of next 4 sts. (1 tr. Ch 3. 1 tr) in next ch-2 sp (buttonhole). (1 tr in each of next 13 hdc. 3 tr in next ch-2 sp) 3 times. 1 tr in each of next 8 sts. Join with sl st in first tr. Fasten off.

Button: Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to make a ring. Leaving a long end for sewing.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sl st into horizontal bar created below st on WS in each sc (see diagram D). Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off. Weave in working end.

DIAGRAM D

Sew button to RS of work to correspond to buttonhole when Envelope is folded.
Flip to WS up. Fold in and sew tog 3 corners without ch-3 sp to form envelope. See Diagram A.

DIAGRAM A: ASSEMBLY

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton (50 g/1.75 oz)
Main color (MC) (Blue) 2 balls
Contrast A (Green) 1 ball
Contrast B (Orange) 1 ball
Contrast C (Pink) 1 ball
Size 4.5 mm (U.S. 7) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 7 ins [18 cm] wide and 11½ ins [29 cm] high.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: When changing colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st, then draw new color through rem 2 loops and proceed. 
BASE
With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 3 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 18 dc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 27 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 54 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 68 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 82 dc. Fasten off. 
BODY OF BAG
With MC, ch 33. 
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch across. 31 sts. Join A. Turn.
2nd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc across. Join MC. Turn.
3rd row: With MC, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc across. Join A. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row. Join B. Turn.
5th row: With B, as 3rd row. Join C. Turn.
6th row: With C, as 2nd row. Join B. Turn.
7th row: As 5th row.
8th row: With C, as 2nd row. Join A. Turn.
9th row: With A, as 3rd row. Join MC. Turn.
10th row: With MC, as 2nd row. Join A. Turn.
11th row: As 9th row.
12th row: With MC, as 2nd row. Join C. Turn.
13th row: With C, as 3rd row. Join B. Turn.
14th row: With B, as 2nd row. Join C. Turn.
15th row: As 13th row.
16th row: With B, as 2nd row. Join MC. Turn.
17th row: With MC, as 3rd row. Join A. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 17th rows for Stripe Pat until work from beg measures approx 22 ins [56 cm], ending on a 16th row of pat. Fasten off. Sew first row and last row tog for center back seam. (Stripes are vertical)
Top Edging: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to center back seam and work 72 sc evenly around top edge. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: (eyelet rnd). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next sc. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last st. Ch 1. Miss last st. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st or ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Pin Body of Bag to Base. With RS facing, join MC with sl st at center back seam. Work 1 row of sc evenly around to join Body of Bag to Base. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Straps: (make 2) With MC, ch 72.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. 71 sc. Turn.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Do not turn. 
5th row: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each st across. Fasten off.
Edging: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to last rem loop of foundation ch. Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each rem loop across. Fasten off.
Drawstring: With MC, make a chain 42 ins [107 cm] long. Turn ch sideways and sl st in each ‘bump’ at side of chain. Fasten off. 
Weave drawstring through eyelet rnd at top of Bag having ends meet at center front. Knot ends. 
APPLIQUE FLOWER
With color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. Fasten off.
First Petal: 1st row: Join color 2 with sl st to front loop only of any sc. *Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in front loop only of next sc. 4 sc for petal. Turn.
Next 3 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc of petal. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. (Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook– sc2tog made) twice. Fasten off.*
Second Petal: **Rejoin color 2 with sl st to front loop of next unworked sc of 2nd rnd. Rep from * to * once.**
Third to Sixth Petals: Rep from ** to ** 4 times more. 6 petals.
Flower A (make 1)
Follow instructions for Applique Flower using MC for color 1 and A for color 2.
Flower B (make 1)
Follow instructions for Applique Flower using C for color 1 and B for color 2.
Flower C (make 1)
Follow instructions for Applique Flower using A for color 1 and MC for color 2.
Flower D (make 1)
Follow instructions for Applique Flower using B for color 1 and C for color 2. 
FINISHING
Sew ends of straps on either side of back seam at top of bag, under Top Edging. Sew other ends of straps 3 ins [7.5 cm] on either side of back seam at base. 
Pin Applique Flowers randomly on Bag, as shown in picture, and sew in position.

materials: Patons® Hempster™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 190 yds/174 m)
Main Color (MC) Deep Ocean (11008) 3 balls
Contrast A Spice (11016) 1 ball
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch markers.
Tapestry needle.
measurements: Approx 8½" [21.5 cm] diameter x 11" [28 cm] tall.
gauge: 18 sc and 22 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc.
• In Patterned Section, 2 dc are used to create a faux “seam”. Beg ch-3 (counts as dc) and last dc make up one “seam,” and 2 dc placed in middle of rnd create the second.
Base: With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc.
9th to 17th rnds: Cont in this manner, working 8 inc evenly spaced around for 9 more rnds. 136 sc at end of 17th rnd.
18th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 144 sc. PM at end of last rnd.
Main Section: Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 35 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 148 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 3" [7.5 cm].
Patterned Section: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 73 sc. PM. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. *Skip next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Working in front of rnd, 1 dc in previously skipped sc – X-st made**. Rep from * to marker. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to ** to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Join. 36 X-sts and 4 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 sc in sp between last st and next st. Skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc.** Rep from * to marker. 1 sc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * to ** to last dc. 1 sc in last dc. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 74 sc. PM. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join.
5th rnd: Skip first sc. Sl st into next sc. Ch 3. *Skip next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Working in front of rnd, 1 dc in previously skipped sc – X-st made**. Rep from * to marker. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to ** to end of rnd. 1 dc in first skipped sc. Join. 36 X-sts and 4 dc.
Last 3 rnds form Pat.
Cont in pat until Patterned Section measures approx 6" [15 cm], ending on a 4th rnd.
Note: Sl sts at beg of 5th rnds are important to keep Pat lined up.
Top: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from end of Patterned Section measures 2" [5 cm]. Fasten off.
Drawstring (Strap)
Instructions are written for Drawstring. If changes are necessary for Strap, the instructions will be written thus (). When only 1 number is given, it applies to both projects.
With A, ch 118 (261).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of row. Turn. 117 (260) sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fold in half lengthwise and working through both thicknesses to join 3rd row to foundation row, work 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Drawstring Stopper:
With A, ch 13. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 1¼" [3 cm]. Fasten off.
Press Drawstring Stopper tube flat, and with A, sew through both thicknesses along middle to form two channels.
FINISHING
Drawstring: Pleat Bag as shown below and thread Drawstring through sps formed by crossed dc.
Thread each end of Drawstring through channel of Drawstring Stopper. Sew ends of Drawstring tog to form continuous loop.
Strap: Thread each end through sp between 2 dc at faux seam and secure in place with Bowline Knot as shown below.

materials: Bernat® Maker Fashion™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 126 yds/115 m)
Contrast A Gray (06008) 3 balls
Contrast B Yellow (06005) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
Approx 150 pony beads.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of the next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
gauge: 11 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
INSTRUCTIONS
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
With A, ch 31.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join. 62 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 68 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 31 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 31 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 74 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 34 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 34 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 80 sc. PM at end of rnd. Beg working in spirals (do not join at end of rnd).
5th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 4" [10 cm].
Next rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 76 sc.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Rep last 4 rnds twice more, having 1 st less between decs on each dec rnd. 68 sts. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut strands of B 20" [51 cm] long. Fold in half and knot into fringe around top edge of Bag, working around posts of sts of last rnd. Trim fringe evenly. Thread 1 bead onto each strand of fringe, knotting end to secure.
Edging rnd: (RS). Join 2 strands of A with sl st to last row at top of Bag. Sl st in each st around. Fasten off.
Handle: With 2 strands of A held tog, ch 56. Sl st in back “bump” of 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. Sew to Bag as shown in picture.

materials: Lily sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) main color (mc)
Jute (00082 )  400 m/440 yds or 4 balls contrast a
Warm Brown (01130 )  218 m/240 yds or 2 balls contrast B
Yellow (00010 )  35 m/40 yds or 1 ball contrast c
Country Yellow (01612)  35 m/40 yds or 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 yd [90 cm] of yellow satin ribbon ¼” [0.5 cm] wide.
measurements: Approx 17” [43 cm] wide x 16” [40.5 cm] tall excluding handles.
gauge: 15 hdc and 12 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
InstructIons
Bag
Base: With MC, ch 33.
1st rnd: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 30 ch. 
3 sc in last ch. Working into rem loop along opposite side of ch, 1 sc 
in each of next 30 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 66 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 31 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 32 sc. 3 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 70 sc.
3rd to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (1 sc in each sc to center sc of next 3 sc group. 3 sc in center sc) twice. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 90 sc at end of 7th rnd.
Body of tote: 8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Working in back loops only, [1 sc in each sc to next group of 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next (center) sc. 2 sc in next sc] twice. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 94 sc.
9th and 10th rnds: Ch 1. Working into both loops, 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (1 sc in each sc to next group of 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to next group of 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 102 sc at end of 10th rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (1 sc in each sc to next group of 2 sc 2 rows below. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to next group of 2 sc 2 rows below. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last 2 rnds 10 times more. 146 sc.
next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. 
Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 20 times more.
next rnd (eyelet rnd): Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). Miss first 2 sc. 
*1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. Rep from * around. Join with 
sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4.
next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each st (dc and 
ch-1 sp) around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to 
left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to 
first sc. Fasten off.
Thread satin ribbon through eyelet rnd. Sew ends of ribbon tog 
at WS of Bag.
straps (make 2).
With 2 strands of A, ch 84.
1st rnd: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end 
of ch. Working into rem loops along opposite side of ch, work 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Ch 1. Do not fasten off.
Fold Strap in half lengthwise with RS facing each other (WS 
of last rnd will show). Join Strap by working 1 sl st through 
tops of corresponding dc and foundation ch to end of row. 
Fasten off.
sunflowers (make 3).
• WS of work is facing throughout.
• Push tr to RS of work to form ‘bobble’ . Work sc beside tr 
tightly to form ‘bobble’ .
center: With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 tr) in same sp as sl st. *(1 sc. 1 tr) in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in next st. *1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 tr) in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in next sc. 1 tr in next sc. (1 sc. 1 tr) in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 tr in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in next st. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in in each of last 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 tr) in same sp as sl st. *(1 sc in next sc. 1 tr in next sc) twice. (1 sc. 1 tr) in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 1 tr in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (1 tr. 1 sc) in same sp as sl st. *(1 tr in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. (1 tr. 1 sc) in next sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. (1 tr in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join with sl st to first tr. 48 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * to last 6 sts. 1 sc in each of last 6 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 tr) in same sp as sl st. *(1 sc in next sc. 1 tr in next sc) 4 times. (1 sc. 1 tr) in next sc. Rep from * to last 8 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 1 tr in next sc) 4 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sts. Fasten off.
1st group of Petals:
1st rnd: With RS of Center facing, join B with sl st in any 
st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 8. 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. 
Miss next st of center. 1 sc in next st. Ch 3. Miss next 3 sts. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around, ending with sl st in first sc. 
2nd group of Petals: 
1st rnd: With RS of Center facing and working in front of 
ch-3 sp, join C with sl st in any first missed sc of 3-st group. 
Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 8. 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. 
Miss next st of center. 1 sc in next st. Working behind petal 
of 1st group, ch 3. Miss next petal of 1st group. Working in 
front of ch-3 sp, 1 sc in next missed st. Rep from * around, 
ending with: Working behind petal of 1st group, ch 3. Miss 
next petal of 1st group. Join with sl st in first sc of 2nd 
group.
Sew Sunflowers to front of Bag as illustrated.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 786 Candy Print A, 706 Perfect Pink B, 321 Gold C, and 313 Aran D.
Crochet Hooks: 4mm [US G-6] and 6mm [US J-10].
Yarn needle; two 12mm buttons for eyes.
abbreviations: dec (decrease) = draw up a loop in next 2 sts, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

A, B, C, etc. = color A, B, C, etc.; ch = chain; dc = double crochet; hdc = half double crochet; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch (es); *= repeat whatever follows the * as indicated; [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Bag measures 8” wide (without wings) x 7” high.
gauge: 12 rounds = 4”; 12 sts = 4” in sc with larger hook and 2 strands held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BAG
Round 1: With 2 strands of A held together and larger hook, ch 12; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 9 ch, 3 sc in last ch, working in remaining loops on opposite side of ch, sc in next 9 loops, 2 sc in last loop; do not join but work in continuous rounds – 24 sc.
Round 2: 2 Sc in first sc, sc in next 9 sc, [2 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 9 sc, [2 sc in next sc] twice – 30 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 42 sc.
Rounds 5-20: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Strap
With 2 strands of A held together and larger hook, ch 66.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 65 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Wing (Make 2)
Row 1: With 1 strand of A and smaller hook, ch 2; 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across; turn – 10 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, [2 sc in next sc] 4 times, sc in last 3 sc; turn – 14 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, [2 sc in next sc] 4 times, sc in last 5 sc; turn – 18 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, skip first sc, 3 hdc in next sc, [skip next sc, 3 hdc in next sc] 8 times. Fasten off. Sew in place on each side of bag as pictured.
Eye (Make 2)
Round 1: With 1 strand of A and smaller hook, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join but work in continuous rounds.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 30 sc. Fasten off.
Round 6: Join B in any sc with a slip st; 3 sc in next sc, [slip st in next sc, 3 sc in next sc] 14 times, slip st in first slip st. Fasten off. Sew button to center of eye.
“White” of Eye
With 1 strand of D and smaller hook, ch 13; 3 hdc in 2nd ch from hook, [ch 1, slip st in next ch, ch 1, 3 hdc in next ch] 5 times, slip st in last ch. Fasten off. Sew in a circle around button. Sew eyes in place.
Beak
Round 1: With 1 strand of C and smaller hook, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join but work in continuous rounds.
Round 2: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice – 8 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times – 12 sc.
Rounds 5-7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [Sc in next 2 sc, dec over next 2 sc] twice – 8 sc. Fasten off. Insert a very small amount of stuffing. Sew Round 8 flat and sew in place.
Heart
With 1 strand of D and smaller hook; ch 2.
Rounds 1-4: Repeat Rounds 1-4 of eye – 24 sc.
Round 5: Slip st in next sc, ch 1, (hdc, dc) in next sc, [2 dc in next sc] twice, (dc, hdc) in next sc, sc in next 6 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc, (hdc, dc) in next sc, [2 dc in next sc] twice, (dc, hdc) in next sc, ch 1; slip st in first slip st. Fasten off. Sew in place.

materials: RED HEART® Holiday®: 1 ball each 9040 Red/Silver A and 140 White/Silver B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Split lock stitch marker
Yarn needle
3” (8 cm) x 3” (8 cm) cardboard
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Bag measures 12” (30 cm) tall and 6” (15 cm) wide
gauge: 13 sts = 4”(10 cm); 8 rounds = 3½” (9 cm) in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2012 Coats & Clark
Crochet a cheerful bag for the bottle of cheer you bring for hostess and friend! For other seasons of the year, simply change the colors for a year-round gift-giving idea.
Rounds 12-29: Repeat Rounds 10 and 11.
Round 30: Repeat Round 10, but do not change color. Continue with A only.
Eyelet Round 31: With A, ch 4, skip first 2 sts, * dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-4; turn.
Rounds 32-34: Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in each dc around; join; turn. Fasten off at end of Round 34.
Tie: With A, ch 75; slip st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across. Fasten off. Weave through Eyelet Round 31.
Pompons (Make 2): Wrap B around a 3” (8 cm) board 45 times. Tie loops tightly in center. Cut and trim ends. Attach a pompom to each end of tie.
Special Abbreviations: Inc (Increase) = 2 sc in next sc; dec (decrease) = draw up a loop in next 2 sc, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops.
BAG
Round 1: With A, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join but work in continuous rounds. Place marker in first sc and move up each round.
Round 2: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, inc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, inc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, inc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, inc] 6 times – 42 sc.
Round 8: Sc in back loop of each sc around; remove marker and join to first sc; TURN.
Round 9: Ch 1, dec, sc in next 19 sc, dec, sc in last 19 sc; join; turn – 40 sc.
Round 10: Ch 3, skip first st, dc in next st and each st around changing to B in last st; join with a slip st in top of ch-3; turn. Carry unused color inside bag as you go.
Round 11: Ch 1, slip st in slip st, dc in next dc, * slip st in next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, changing to A in last dc; join with slip st to first slip st; turn.

materials: RED HEART ® “Super Saver ®”: 1 Skein 312 Black A, small amounts 254 Pumpkin B and 316 Soft White C.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch markers
Yarn needle
Two white buttons
Two black chenille stems
5” X 10” piece black felt
Hand sewing needle and black thread
Hot glue gun and glue
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Bag measures 7½ ” tall x 5” diameter at top.
gauge: 6 sc and 6 rows = 2”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BAG
Round 1: With A, ch 2; 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed – 8 sc.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 16 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 24 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 32 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 40 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 48 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 56 sc.
Rounds 8 – 10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 64 sc.
Rounds 12 – 20: Sc in each sc around.
Round 21: [Sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog] 8 times – 56 sc.
Round 22: Sc in each sc around.
Round 23: [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 8 times – 48 sc.
Round 24: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off.
Round 25: Join B with sc in any st; sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 26: Ch 1, rsc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Handle
Using 2 strands of B, ch 23.
Row 1: Working in back bumps of chains, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end. Join with a slip st to first sc – 22 sc.
Fasten off.
Perfect for filling with candy as youngsters go door to door, this whimsical bag is fun to crochet. Wings are cut from felt and grinning face is embroidered. Without the handle it will also serve as a treat bowl.

Bat Wings (Make Two)
Cut wing shape from felt. Glue chenille stem to outer edge of felt wing. Trim chenille stem ends. Sew wings to back of bag.
Finishing
Weave in ends. Sew on buttons for eyes. Sew on handle. Using single strand of C and yarn needle, embroider grin in back stitch and two fangs in satin stitch.

pattern_name: H and Icrafter Cotton Shopping Tote Bag
materials: Bernat H Andicrafter Cotton (50 g/1.75 oz)
Main Color (MC) (00083 Cornflower) 9 balls
Contrast A (00089 Banana) 2 balls
Contrast B (00001 White) 2 balls
Contrast C (13712 Hot Green) 2 balls
Size 6.5 mm (U.S. K or 10 ½) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: Approx 7 x 13 ½ ins [18 x 34.5 cm].
gauge: 11 hdc and 7 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn.
instructions: Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw loop of next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed. Ch 2 does not count as hdc. Stripe Pat Work 1 row with A. Work 1 row with MC. Work 1 row with C. Work 1 row with MC. Work 1 row with B. Work 1 row with MC. Rep last 6 rows twice more. These 18 rows form Stripe Pat. Front and Back (make alike) With 2 strands of MC, ch 38. 1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 37 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 3 times more. Join A at end of last row. Next row: (RS). With 2 strands of A, ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in next st through back loop only. *1 hdc in next st through front loop only. 1 hdc in next st through back loop only. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn. 1st row of Stripe Pat is complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row until 17 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Join MC at end of last row. Next row: (WS). With 2 strands of MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first hdc. 1 sc in next hdc in back loop only. *1 sc in next hdc in front loop only. 1 sc in next hdc in back loop only. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 sc in last hdc. Place marker at each end of row. Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 4 times more. Fasten off. Edging: With RS of Front facing, join 2 strands of MC with sl st to bottom right corner. Ch 1. Work 27 sc up right side of Front. Fasten off. With RS of Front facing, join MC with sl st to top left corner. Ch 1. Work 27 sc down left side of Front. Rep for Back. Gusset With 2 strands of MC, ch 3. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. Rep last row 6 times more. Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc. Next 7 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc. Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 30 ins [76 cm], ending with RS facing for next row. Next row: Ch 1. Draw up loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook - sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc. Next 7 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sc. Next 6 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off. Handles (make 2) With 2 strands of MC, ch 51. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 50 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 7 times more. Fasten off. Fold handle lengthwise and sew closed. FINISHING Pin Front and Gusset together between markers, WS facing each other. Join 2 strands of MC with sl st at left marker and working through both thicknesses proceed in sc down left side of Bag, across bottom and up right side to opposite marker. Do not turn. Next row: Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off. Rep for Back. With RS of work facing, join 2 strands of MC with sl st to marked st. Ch 1. Work 1 row of reverse sc around upper edge of Bag. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Sew Handles to inside of Bag 2 ½ ins [6 cm] in from side edges as shown in picture.

materials: Patons Classic Merino Wool (100 g/3.5 oz)
1 ball each of 00238 (Paprika) as A, 00202 (Aran) as B and 00205 (Deep Olive) as C.
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
½ yd [0.5 m] lining fabric.
Pair of handles.
measurements: Approx 14 ins [36 cm] square before felting. Approx 12 ins [30.5 cm] square after felting.
gauge: 15 sc and 17 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 5 counts as dc and ch 2.
FRONT and BACK (Make alike)
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd:Ch 5. (3 dc in ring. Ch 2) 3 times. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5. Fasten off.
2nd rnd:Join B with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. [Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-2sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join C with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. [Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5. Fasten off.
4th rnd:Join A with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5. Fasten off. (Four 3-dc groups on each side of square, including corner groups).
Rep last rnd, having 1 more 3-dc group on each side of square on every following rnd to twelve 3-dc groups on each side of square, changing colors in following sequence: B, C, A, C, B, A, C, A.
FINISHING: With WS of Front and Back tog, join B with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to next ch-2 sp. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, having 1 sc in last ch-2 sp. Fasten off.
Felt Bag following “How to Felt” instructions. Shape bag to measurements and dry flat.
Cut lining fabric to size of Bag. Sew side seams. Sew lining to inside of top edge of Bag. Center handles on top edge of Bag and sew in position.
… a part of your life.
P.O. Box 40 Listowel ON  N4W 3H3
Important to know before felting
• Record all the measurements and changes before and after felting. You will be able to adjust the method to produce proper results.
• Always test a sample. Different colored yarns may felt differently.
• Colorfastness can be affected by very hot water.
• Any knitting that has been properly felted becomes very dense and matted.
How To Felt
• Using low water level, run a Hot/Cold cycle for 5 to 15 min. Add a pair of old jeans for agitation.
• Add 2 tablespoons of baking soda for a small load. After one cycle, check for size. Repeat if necessary.
• Run through the rinse and dry spin cycle.
• Do not use a clothes dryer.
• Shape piece to correct measurements.
• Lay felted piece onto a dry towel, away from direct heat or sunlight.
• If an edge ripples, baste a thread through the edge and gather in. Remove the thread after the felting is dry.

materials: Patons® Hempster™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 190 yds/174 m)
Contrast A Navy (11010) 2 balls
Contrast B Ecru (11014) 1 ball
Contrast C Jungle (11006) 1 ball
Contrast D Deep Ocean (11008) 1 ball
Contrast E Lime Punch (11004) 1 ball
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 16" wide x 13.5" high [37 cm] high.
gauge: 16 hdc and 13 rnds = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. Beg at Base, with A, ch 58.
1st rnd:  1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 54 ch. 5 hdc in last ch. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 hdc in each of next 54 ch. 4 hdc in last ch. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 56 hdc. 5 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join B with sl st to first hdc.
3rd rnd:  With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Working into back loop only of each st, 1 hdc in each of next 58 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 62 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 130 hdc.
4th to 11th rnds:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join A with sl st to first hdc at end of 11th rnd.
12th rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join C with sl st to first hdc.
13th to 21st rnds:  With C, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join A with sl st to first hdc at end of 21st rnd.
22nd rnd:  With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join D with sl st to first hdc.
23rd to 31st rnds:  With D, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join A with sl st to first hdc at end of 31st rnd.
32nd rnd:  With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join E with sl st to first hdc.
33rd to 41st rnds:  With E, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join A with sl st to first hdc at end of 41st rnd.
42nd rnd:  With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
43rd rnd:  Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.
Straps (make 2).
With A, ch 111.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain.
Turn.
2nd to 5th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fold Handle in half lengthwise and working through both thicknesses to join 5th row to foundation row, work 1 sc in each st to end of row.
Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m) Aqua (14016) or Clay (11008) 1 ball or 270 yds/246 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
stitch markers
yarn needle
tape measure
optional: Keychain finding for Tassel Keychains
small amount of polyfill stuffing
piece of cardboard 6" [15 cm] long
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] wide x 14" [35.5 cm] long, excluding handles.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.

NOTES
• Bag Base is worked from base up in a continuous spiral. Do not join at end of rounds.
• Place marker (PM) on first stitch of round (rnd) and move marker up each round to keep place.

MAKE THIS
1st round (rnd): [Right side (RS)]. 2 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 36 ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch to create corner turn. Now work rotates and you will work sc into opposite side of foundation chain.
Do not turn. Working into remaining (rem) loops of foundation chain, work 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 1 sc in last ch (same ch as first 2 sc of rnd). Do not Join. 78 sc. Place Marker (PM) on first sc of rnd to indicate beginning (beg) of rnd. 1st rnd is complete.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Repeat (Rep) last rnd 7 times more, moving marker up to indicate first stitch of rnd. Note: After a few rnds have been worked, Bag Base will naturally curve up to form bottom of Bag. Note: Because the Mesh Pattern pulls in a little, 6 sts will be increased in the next rnd to make sure Bag’s width is consistent. Increase (inc) rnd: 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * around. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first sc. 6 sc have been inc’d. There are now 84 sc in rnd.

MESH PATTERN SECTION
See Diagrams on page 11. Note: To keep Mesh Pattern Section aligned, rnds are now joined and then turned. Right side (RS) and Wrong Side (WS) of work will alternate.
1st rnd: Ch 5 - counts as 1 Treble crochet (Tr) and ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 treble crochet (Tr) in next sc.

3rd rnd: (RS). Ch 5 - counts as 1 tr and ch 1. *Skip next ch-1 space (sp). 1 tr in next tr. Ch 1. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. Skip last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to 4th ch of beg ch 5. Turn.

TOP EDGING AND HANDLES
See Diagram 3 on page 15. Notes:
• 1 rnd of sc is now worked, followed by a rnd of decreases to return to original stitch count.
• For all following rnds, beg in same sp as last sl st.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next tr. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. 84 sc.

2nd rnd: (Decrease rnd). Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. (Sc2tog).

3rd to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.

HANDLE PLACEMENT
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Ch 68 (First Handle). Skip next 19 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. Ch 68 (Second Handle). Skip next 19 sc. 1 sc in each of last 10 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.

9th and 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

OPTIONAL: TASSEL KEYCHAIN
Make a slip knot and place on hook. (See instructions on page 4). Ch 2. 1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.

3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th and 5th rnds: As 3rd rnd.

TASSEL
Wrap yarn around 6" [15 cm] piece of cardboard 25 times. Thread length of yarn 15" [38 cm] long through loops at top and tie securely, leaving ends to attach to Ball. Cut across other side of loops. Wrap yarn 5 times around Tassel ½" [1.25 cm] down from tied end and fasten securely by threading end behind wrapped yarn and bringing tail into the Tassel.

materials: RED HEART® Chic Sheep™: 2 balls of 5312 Stiletto A and 1 ball of 5311 Lace B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Split stitch marker
Yarn needle
Pair of 23” (58 cm) leather purse handles (with perforations for sewing)
Sewing needle and matching thread
6” (15 cm) piece of cardboard for tassel (optional)
Lobster claw key ring for tassel (optional)
Contrasting yarn for tassel (optional)
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Tote measures 26.5” [67.5 cm] in circumference, 12” [30.5 cm] in height.
gauge: 20 sc = 4" (10 cm); 21 rnds = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
TOTE
Ch 51, with A
Round 1 (RS):  2 sc in 2nd ch from hook (place marker in 1st sc), sc in each ch to last ch, 3 sc in last ch (place marker in 2nd sc). Turn to work in unused loops of foundation chain. Sc in each ch to first ch, sc in first ch. Do not turn- 102 sc.
Round 2: 3 sc in first sc (move marker to middle sc), sc in each sc to marker, 3 sc in marked sc (move marker to middle sc), sc in each sc to beginning. Do not turn- 106 sc.
Round 3: Sc in first sc, 3 sc in next sc (move marker to midde sc), sc in each sc to marker, 3 sc in marked sc (move marker to middle sc), sc in each sc to beginning. Do not turn- 110 sc.
Repeat Round 3 five times- 130 sc.
Rounds 9-15: Sc in each sc around. Do not turn, Do not fasten off A.- 130 sc.
Round 16: Join B with sc, sc in each sc around. Do not turn.
Rounds 17-18: Sc in each sc around. Do not turn. Do not fasten off B. 
Rounds 19-21: Switch to A, sc in each sc around. Do not turn. 
Repeat Round 9 for 33 more rounds switching Color A and B every 3 rounds. 
Rounds 55-62: Switch to A, sc in each sc around. Do not turn.
Round 63: Slip st in each sc around. Fasten off. 
FINISHING 
Weave in all loose ends. Lay tote flat. 
Position handles where desired. Use sewing needle and matching thread to attach handles to purse.
Optional Tassel
Cut 2 pieces of contrasting yarn, 12” (30 cm) each, put aside. Wrap yarn around 6” (15 cm) piece of cardboard 50 times, cut on one side creating 1 bundle of 50 strands. Place bundle evenly between one 12” (30 cm) piece of yarn, tie bundle into place (assure strands are even). Fold bundle so that strands are even, tie second 12” (30 cm) piece of yarn around bundle, 1” (2.5 cm) below knot. Trim bundle ends to make even. Fasten tassel to Lobster Claw Key King, clip to purse handle as desired.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300g; 220 yds /201 m)
Contrast A Vintage White (10006) 1 ball or 150 yds/137 m
Contrast B Crimson (10786) 1 ball or 70 yds/64 m
Size U.S. K/101/2 (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch markers.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] tall x 6" [15 cm] wide.
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
MUSHROOM STIPE
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM. 8 sc.
Do not join, cont working in spiral as follows. PM (first marker) for beg of rnd. Move marker up on rnds as work progresses.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 32 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 40 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. PM at end of rnd.
9th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep 9th rnd until work from marked rnd measures 6" [15 cm].
Next rnd (eyelet rnd): Ch 2. 1 dc in each sc around. Do not join.
Next rnd: 1 sc in each dc around.
Next rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Fasten off.
Drawstring
With A, ch 70.
Fasten off.
Weave Drawstring back and forth through eyelet rnd of dc.
MUSHROOM CAP
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
9th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 54 sc.
10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 60 sc.
11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 66 sc.
12th to 15th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Break B at end of 15th rnd. Join A.
16th rnd: With A and working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around.
17th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
18th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 60 sc.
19th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 54 sc.
20th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
21st rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
22nd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
23rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
24th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
25th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
26th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
27th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten off.
With A, embroider spots on Cap as shown in photo with short straight stitches, tacking both thicknesses of Cap tog every few sts.
STRAP
With A, ch 150 or until desired length is achieved. Fasten off.
Fold Mushroom Stipe in half with center front (where drawstrings meet and tie) in middle facing up. Sew Strap to one folded side, thread through one side of Cap, then down through the other side of Cap. Sew other end of Strap to second folded side.

materials: lily® sugar ’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
main color (mc) (01118 Stonewash) 4 balls
contrast a (01130 Warm Brown) 2 balls
Sizes 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) and 6.5 mm (U.S. K or 10½) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 22" [56 cm] wide x 10" [25.5 cm] deep excluding handle.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
Bag
With smaller hook and MC, ch 33.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last chain. 3 sc in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 66 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 30 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 30 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 31 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 30 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 78 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 32 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 30 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of 2 next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 84 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 33 sc. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 30 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of 3 next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 90 sc.
6th to 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 100 sc.
12th to 16th rnds: As 6th rnd.
17th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 110 sc.
18th to 22nd rnds: As 6th rnd.
