evenly. Sew tassel to zipper pull.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A White (00001) 3 balls or 280 yds/255 m
Contrast B Overcast (01042) 1 ball or 115 yds/105 m
Contrast C Country Red (01530) 1 ball or 70 yds/64 m
Contrast D Tangerine (01699) 1 ball or 106 yds/96.5 m
Contrast E Seabreeze (01201) 1 ball or 100 yds/91 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch markers.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Button ¾" [2 cm] diameter.
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] wide x 12" [30.5 cm] tall, excluding Handles.
gauge: 15 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = Approx 4¼" [11 cm] square.
instructions:
MOTIFS  (34 total)
Note: After 1st Motif is complete, subsequent Motifs are joined tog as you work following color placement of Motifs to make/join as shown on Assembly Diagram (see page 2). 
Make 5 with E as Color 1, D as Color 2.  
Make 1 with D as Color 1, E as Color 2.  
Make 5 with B as Color 1, C as Color 2.  
Make 2 with C as Color 1, B as Color 2.  
Make 5 with B as Color 1, E as Color 2.  
Make 1 with E as Color 1, B as Color 2.   
Make 4 with B as Color 1, D as Color 2.  
Make 4 with D as Color 1, B as Color 2. 
Make 5 with E as Color 1, C as Color 2.  
Make 2 with E as Color 1, C as Color 2. 

MOTIF 1
With Color 1, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 12 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. Break Color 1. 12 dc and 12 ch-1 sps.
3rd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in same sp as last sl st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – beg cluster made. Ch 2. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in next ch-1 sp. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – cluster made. Ch 2. Cluster in next ch-1 sp. Ch 5. *(Cluster in next ch-1 sp. Ch 2) twice. Cluster in next ch-1 sp. Ch 5. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st in top of beg cluster. Break Color 2.
4th rnd: Join A with sl st in any corner ch-5 sp. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 3. 4 dc) all in same corner sp. *(Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp) twice. Ch 3. (4 dc. Ch 3. 4 dc) all in next corner ch-5 sp. Rep from * twice more. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp) twice. Ch 3. Join with sl st to top of first ch-3. Fasten off.

MOTIF – JOIN ON 1 SIDE 
Work 1st to 3rd rnds as for Motif 1.
4th rnd: Join A with sl st in any corner ch-5 sp. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 3. 4 dc) all in same corner sp. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp) twice. Ch 3. (4 dc. Ch 3. 4 dc) all in next corner ch-5 sp. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp) twice. Ch 3. 4 dc in next corner ch-5 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to corner ch-3 of joining Motif. Ch 1. 4 dc in same corner ch-5 sp. (Ch 1. Join with sl st in next ch-3 sp of joining Motif. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp) twice. Ch 1. Join with sl st in next ch-3 sp of joining Motif. Ch 1. 4 dc in next corner ch-5 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to corner ch-3 of joining Motif. Ch 1. 4 dc in same corner ch-5 sp. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp) twice. Ch 3. Join with sl st to top of first ch-3. Fasten off.

MOTIF – JOIN ON 2 SIDES 
Work 1st to 3rd rnds as for Motif 1.
4th rnd: Join A with sl st in any corner ch-5 sp. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 3. 4 dc) all in same corner sp. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp) twice. Ch 3. *4 dc in next corner ch-5 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to corner ch-3 of joining Motif. Ch 1. 4 dc in same corner ch-5 sp.** (Ch 1. Join with sl st in next ch-3 sp of joining Motif. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp) twice. Ch 1. Join with sl st in next ch-3 sp of joining Motif. Ch 1. Rep from * once more, then rep from * to **. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp) twice. Ch 3. Join with sl st to top of first ch-3. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Join Sides and Bottom: Fold Bag piece tog to align sides and bottom edge. With RS facing, join A with sl st through both thicknesses at corner of top left side seam. Work 1 row of sc down side, 3 sc in corner, sc evenly across bottom edge, 3 sc in corner and sc evenly up opposite side to top right corner. Do not fasten off. 
Cont as follows for Strap Edging:
Strap Edging: Working through single thickness of Strap, work 1 row of sc along side of Strap to side seam. Join with sl st into side seam. Fasten off.
With RS facing, join A with sl st at base of opposite Strap. Work 1 row of sc along side of Strap to side seam. Join with sl st into side seam. Fasten off.
Inner Edging: With RS facing, join A with sl st at base of left Strap at inner (unworked) edge. Work 1 row of sc evenly across top edge of Bag, sc evenly along side of inner Strap, sc evenly across opposite top edge of Bag (this edge will become Front) and sc evenly along side of inner Strap. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Button loop: With RS facing, join A with sl st at center of Back of Bag at top edge. Ch 14. Sl st back into 10th ch from hook. Ch 4. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew button to Front of Bag to correspond to loop.

pattern_name: BERNAT HANDICRAFTER COTTON STRIPES #424 BEACH BAG WITH MAT
materials: Bernat Handicrafter Cotton Stripes (42.5 g / 1.5 oz): 21 balls
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 17 x 60 ins [43 x 152.5 cm] unfolded.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: This yarn is designed to create stripes as you crochet. There are sections of Contrast colors each approx 14 yds [12.5 m] long.
FRONT
**With 1st ball, starting at beg of contrast 1section, ch 22. With 2nd ball, starting at beg of contrast 2 section, ch 23. With 3rd ball, starting at beg of contrast 3 section, ch 26. 71 ch.
P.O. Box 40 Listowel ON  N4W 3H3    
“home style… life style… your style.”
1st row: (RS). With 3rd ball, 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 22 ch. With 2nd ball, 1 hdc in each of next 23 ch. With 1st ball, 1 hdc in each of next 23 ch. Turn.
69 hdc.
2nd row: With 1st ball, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 22 hdc. With 2nd ball, 1 dc in each of next 23 hdc. With 3rd ball, 1 dc in each of next 23 hdc. Turn. 
3rd row: With 3rd ball, ch 2 (do not count as st). 1 hdc in each of first 23 dc. With 2nd ball, 1 hdc in each of next 23 dc. With 3rd ball, 1 hdc in each of next 23 dc. Turn. 
Last 2 rows form pat.**
Cont working in pat, until work from beg measures 14 ins [35.5 cm], ending with a 2nd row. Fasten off.
BACK
Work from ** to ** as given for Front. Cont working in pat, until work from beg measures 64 ins [162.5 cm], ending with a 2nd row. Fasten off.
Side/Bottom Panel: 
Ch 18.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 16 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 2 (do not count as st). 1 hdc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 45 ins [114.5 cm], ending with a 2nd row. Fasten off.
Straps: (make 2). 
Ch 113.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Fold Handle in a half length-wise and work through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off. 
FINISHING 
Pin pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth, leaving cloth to dry.
With WS of Front and Side tog, join yarn with sl st to top left corner.
Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc down left side, across bottom and up right side of Bag. Fasten off. 
Rep for Back, leaving rem fabric free for Mat.
Front Edging: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to top of Front. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Work 1 row of sc across top of Front. Do not turn. 
2nd row:Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew handle to Front as shown in picture. Roll Mat inside of bag. Sew handle to Back at same position as for Front.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Contrast A Blue Waves (69025) 1 ball
Aunt Lydia® Crochet Thread Classic™ 10 (350 yds/320 m) Contrast B Aqua (154-0450) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) and U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 11" [28 cm] wide x 13" [33 cm] tall, excluding Straps.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook using Bernat® Softee Cotton™.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Bag is worked in the round, from base to top edge.
• Body of Bag is worked in 3 rnd pat repeat.
• 1st and 2nd rnds are worked with RS facing.
• To keep pat aligned, work is turned and 3rd rnd of pat is worked on WS.
Base
With A and larger hook, ch 53.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 106 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until piece measures 5" [13 cm]. Break A, join B at end of last rnd.
Change to smaller hook and proceed as follows:
1st rnd: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 160 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Proceed in pat as follows:
Set-up rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip last 2 sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 dc. *2 sc in ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to last ch-2 sp. 2 sc in last ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
3rd rnd: (WS). Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). Skip next 2 sc. *1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 dc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn.
Rep last 3 rnds for pat until piece measures approx 11" [28 cm], ending on a 2nd rnd of pat. 
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Break B, join A.
Change to larger hook and proceed as follows:
Next 8 rnds: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Skip next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 106 sc.
Fasten off at end of last rnd. 
Strap 
With larger hook and A, ch 113. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 112 sc.
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fold Handle in half lengthwise and working through both thicknesses to join 6th row to foundation row, work 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Attach Strap to top of Bag at either side as shown in picture.

materials: Caron® Colorama Lacy™ (8 oz/227 g; 361 yds/330 m) Rose (11002) 2 balls or 469 yds/429 m
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
4 Susan Bates® stitch markers
measurements: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] wide x 17½" [44.5 cm] high, excluding handles.
gauge: 15 dc and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
• All rows begin in first dc.
Front and Back (make 2 pieces alike)
See diagram on page 3. 
Ch 61.
1st row: 1 dc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 59 dc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 2. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. *Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc and ch-1 sp to last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 5 dc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 5 sts. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc to last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 5 dc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. *Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to 4 sts before next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 5 dc. Turn.
9th row: Ch 2. (1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in each ch-1 sp and dc to second-last ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc) twice. Turn.
10th row: Ch 2. (1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in each dc to next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc) twice. Turn.
11th row: Ch 2. (1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. *Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to 5 sts before next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc) twice. Turn.
12th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc) twice. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 23 dc/ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc) 3 times. Turn.
13th to 18th rows: Ch 2. (1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp) 3 times. 1 dc in each dc to next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc) 3 times. Turn.
19th row: Ch 2. (1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp) 3 times. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) 11 times. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc) 3 times. Turn.
20th row: Ch 2. (1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in each dc/ch-1 sp to second-last ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc) twice. Turn.
21st row: Ch 2. (1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in each dc to next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc) twice. Turn.
22nd row: Ch 2. (1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp) twice. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) 17 times. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc) twice. Turn.
23rd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc and ch-1 sp to last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 5 dc. Turn.
24th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc to last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 5 dc. Turn.
25th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next st. *Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 5 dc. Turn.
26th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each dc and ch-1 sp to end of row. Turn.
27th and 28th rows: Ch 2. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.
Straps (make 2)
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each chain to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 24" [61 cm].
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Place Front on top of Back with WS facing. Join yarn with sl st to upper left corner. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc down side, across bottom and up opposite side of Tote, working 3 sc in each bottom corner. Fasten off.
Place Straps on RS, with each end approx 3" [7.5 cm] from side edges of Tote as shown in photo, placing 1 strap on Front and other on Back. Work 1 rnd of reverse sc around top of Tote, joining Straps as you work. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
REVERSE SC

materials: 4 balls RED HEART® Sashay Sequins™ 1948 Mediterranean
1 ball RED HEART® Sashay Sequins™ 1101 Champagne
Susan Bates® Luxite® Bulky Crochet Hook: 16 mm [Q]
1 pair 6 x 5" (15 x 12.5 cm) bamboo purse handles
yarn needle
Stiff cardboard 6” (15 cm) long to make tassel
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Tote measures 9½ x 13" (24 x 33 cm) not including the handles.
gauge: 6 sc = 4" (10 cm); 7 sc rounds = 4" (10 cm) CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
TOTE
Ch 29.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in second ch from hook and in each ch to end – 28 sc. Slip st in first sc of the row to join into a round.
Next round: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc.
Repeat this round until piece measures 8½" (21.5 cm) in length.
Begin Mesh
Next 4 rounds:
Round 1: * Ch 2, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in second of 2 beginning ch.
Round 2: Ch 1, * sc in next space, ch 2; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 3: * Ch 2, sc in next space; repeat from * around, join with slip st in second of 2 beginning ch.
Round 4: Repeat Round 2.
Attach Handles
Next round: Ch 2, sc in next space, ch 2, remove hook being careful to not unravel last loop, insert ch-2 just made into one ring of one purse handle, replace hook in last loop, sc in next space, [ch 2, sc in next space] 3 times, ch 2, remove hook, insert ch-2 into other ring of same purse handle, replace hook, sc in next space, [ch 2, sc in next space] twice, ch 2, remove hook, insert ch-2 into one ring of second tote handle, replace hook, sc in next space, [ch 2, sc in next space] 3 times, ch 2, remove hook, insert ch-2 into other ring of second tote handle, replace hook, sc in next space, ch 2, sc in next space, join with slip st in second of 2 beginning ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Flatten tote and sew bottom edge closed.
Weave in all loose ends.
Tassel
1. Cut a 15” (38 cm) length of yarn and lay across top of cardboard; this will be used to tie top of tassel.
2. Wrap yarn around cardboard 13 times.
3. Using the 15” (38 cm) tie, knot top of tassel tightly. Cut tassel at opposite end.
4. Cut a 24” (61 cm) long length of yarn for wrapping neck of tassel. Wrap around tassel 3 times and knot ends together. Allow ends to become part of tassel.
5. Use ties at top of tassel to tie onto purse handle. Trim lower ends of tassel evenly.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) Contrast A Red (00095) 60 m/66 yds or 1 ball
Contrast B Hot Orange (01628) 65 m/71 yds or 1 ball
Contrast C Yellow (00010) 90 m/100 yds or 1 ball
Contrast D Hot Green (01712) 95 m/105 yds or 1 ball
Contrast E Robin’s Egg (01215) 200 m/220 yds or 2 balls
Contrast F Mod Blue (01111) 215 m/236 yds or 2 balls
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Optional: Fabric for lining approx 18” x 36” [45.5 x 91.5 cm].
measurements: Approx 15” x 17” [38 x 43 cm] excluding handles.
gauge: 15 hdc and 12 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Motif (make 15).
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. 
(See Chart on page 2).
With A, ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. *(Yoh and draw up a loop in ring) 3 times. Yoh and 
draw through all loops on hook – cluster made. Ch 3. Rep from  
* 5 times more. Join with sl st to top of first cluster. Fasten off. 
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to any ch-3 sp. Ch 2. (Cluster. Ch 3) twice 
in same sp as sl st. *(Cluster. Ch 3) twice in next ch-3 sp. Rep from 
* 4 times more. Join with sl st to top of first cluster. Fasten off. 
3rd rnd: Join C with sl st to any ch-3 sp. Ch 2. (Cluster. Ch 3) twice 
in same sp as sl st. **(Cluster. Ch 3) in next ch-3 sp. (Cluster. Ch 3) 
twice in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. (Cluster. Ch 3) in 
next ch-3 sp. Join D with sl st to top of first cluster. Break C. 
4th rnd: With D, ch 2. *(2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-3 sp. (3 hdc 
in next ch-3 sp) twice. Rep from * 5 times more. Join E with sl st to 
first hdc. Break D.  
5th rnd: With E, ch 2. *1 hdc in each hdc to next ch-2 sp. (2 hdc. 
Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 5 times more. 1 hdc in 
each hdc to end of rnd. Join F with sl st to first hdc. Break E.  
6th rnd: With F, ch 1. *1 sc in each hdc to next ch-2 sp. (1 sc. Ch 1. 
1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 5 times more. 1 sc in each hdc to 
end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
With RS of Motifs facing each other and F, work 1 row of sc to 
crochet Motifs tog as shown on Chart, noting at each corner 
of bottom edge, one side of Motif will be folded in half and 
crocheted tog as shown on Assembly Diagram. 
Top border: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join F with sl st to any  
ch-1 sp at top point. Sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last  
sl st. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sc. 1 dc in 
each of next 3 sc. 1 tr in each of next 2 sc. (Yoh) twice and draw 
up a loop in last st of working Motif. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops 
on hook) twice. (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in first sc of next 
Motif. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw 
through all loops on hook – tr2tog made. 1 tr in each of next 2 sc. 
1 dc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sc. 1 sc in each 
of next 5 sc. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next  
4 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 21 sts. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Straps: (make 2).
With 1 strand each of E and F held tog, ch 84.
1st rnd: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end 
of ch. Working into rem loops along opposite side of ch, work  
1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Ch 1. Do not fasten off. 
Fold Strap in half lengthwise with RS facing each other 
(WS of last rnd will show). Join Strap by working 1 sl st 
through tops of corresponding dc and foundation ch to 
end of row. Fasten off.
Sew Straps to WS 4” [10 cm] in from side edges of Bag (see 
picture). 
Optional: Lining: Cut fabric to 16” x 35” [40.5 x 89 cm]. 
Fold in half lengthwise and stitch sides tog using a ½”  
[1 cm] seam allowance. Fold over ½” [1 cm] seam allowance 
along top edge of lining and sew 1” [2.5 cm] below top 
edge of Bag.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
contrast A Hot Blue (01742) 2 balls 215 m/235 yds
contrast B Hot Orange (01628) 2 balls 200 m/220 yds
contrast C Hot Green (01712) 2 balls 210 m/230 yds
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 16" x 17" [40.5 x 43 cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
stripe Pat: Work 1 row of each color: A, B, C. These 3 rows form Stripe Pat.
note: Do not break color at end of row. Carry color not in use loosely up side of work.
First section: (See Diagram on page 2) With A, ch 26.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Join B. Turn. 25 sts.
2nd row: With B, ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp - counts as beg dc2tog. *Yoh and draw up a loop in same ch-1 sp as last st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch-1 sp. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook - dc2tog made. Ch 1. Rep from * to last sc. Dc2tog over last worked ch-1 sp and last sc. Join C. Turn.
3rd row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next st. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last st. Join A. Turn.
4th row: With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). Dc2tog over first st and next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. Dc2tog over last worked ch-1 sp and next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Dc2tog over last worked ch-1 sp and last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Join B. Turn.
5th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 sc in last st. Join C. Turn. 2nd to 5th rows form Zig-Zag pat.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 4 rows until work from beg measures approx 6" [15 cm], ending on a 5th row. Fasten off.
second section: 1st row: (WS). With appropriate color, ch 25. With WS facing, pat across 25 sts of First Section. Ch 26. Join next color. Turn.
2nd row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 sc in last ch. **Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from ** to last st of First Section. Ch 1. Miss last st. ***1 sc in next ch. Ch 1. Miss next ch. Rep from *** to last ch. 1 sc in last ch. Join next color. Turn. 75 sts.
Beg with 4th row of Zig-Zag pat, work for next 6" [15 cm], ending on a 5th row.
Third section: 1st row: (WS). Pat across 75 sts of Second Section. Ch 51. Join next color. Turn.
2nd row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 sc in last ch. **Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from ** to last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last st. Join next color. Turn.
Beg with 4th row of Zig-Zag pat, work for next 6" [15 cm], ending on a 4th row.
Fourth section: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. (Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 36 times. Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 sc in last st. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. Beg with 2nd row of Zig-Zag pat, work for next 6" [15 cm], ending on a 4th row. Fasten off.
Fifth section: 1st row: (RS). Miss first 25 sts (ch-1 sps and dc2tog). Join appropriate color in next dc2tog. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next st) 11 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next st. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Beg with 2nd row of Zig-Zag pat, work for next 6" [15 cm], ending on a 4th row. Fasten off.
Sew corresponding sides. (See Assembly Diagram).
Opening edging: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join A with sl st to any outer corner. Ch 1. Work 18 sc along each side, having 3 sc in outer corners and sc2tog in inner corners. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: As 1st rnd. Fasten off.
straps: (Make 2).
With A, ch 80.
1st rnd: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Working into rem loops along opposite side of ch, work 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Ch 1. Do not fasten off.
Fold Strap in half with RS facing each other (WS of last rnd will show). Join Strap by working 1 sl st lengthwise through tops of corresponding dc and foundation ch to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew Straps to WS at outer corners (see picture).

materials: Bernat® Plush™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 146 yds/133 m)
Contrast A Deep Woods (68025 ) 2 balls or 280 yds/255 m
Contrast B Mustard (68029) 1 ball or 75 yds/68 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Coats & Clark™ All Purpose thread in matching color of Contrast B.
Coats & Clark™ All Purpose zipper 12" [23 cm] long – color 83F or to match Contrast B.
2 pipe cleaners to match Contrast B for Antennae.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook
Dtr = (Double treble crochet). (Yoh) 3 times. Insert hook in next stitch and pull up a loop. (Yoh and draw up a loop through 2 loops on hook) 4 times
Hdchb = (Half double crochet in back loop) Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram)

Joined tr = Insert hook into top horizontal bar of tr just worked and draw up a loop. Insert hook into 2nd horizontal bar of same tr and draw up a loop. Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop. 4 loops on hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times – Joined tr made

Joined dtr = Insert hook into top horizontal bar of dtr just worked and draw up a loop. Insert hook into 2nd horizontal bar of same dtr and draw up a loop. Insert hook into 3rd horizontal bar of same dtr and draw up a loop. Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop. 5 loops on hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times – Joined dtr made

Joined triple-tr = Insert hook into top horizontal bar of triple-tr just worked and draw up a loop. Insert hook into 2nd horizontal bar of same triple-tr and draw up a loop. Insert hook into 3rd horizontal bar of same triple-tr and draw up a loop. Insert hook into 4th horizontal bar of same triple-tr and draw up a loop. Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop. 6 loops on hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times – Joined triple-tr made
Tr (Treble crochet) = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times
Triple-Tr (Triple treble) = (Yoh) 4 times and draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] diameter x 3½" [9 cm] wide.
gauge: 10 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: • Ch 2 does not count as st at beg of rnd. • Move marker as work progresses.

SNAIL SIDE (make 2)
See Diagram on page 3.
With A, ch 4. Join to first ch with sl st to make a ring.
1st rnd: With A, ch 1. (6 sc. 2 hdc) in ring. Do not join. Pull up and drop long loop of A. PM on first st for beg of rnd. 8 sts.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to horizontal bar on WS of last hdc. 2 hdcbl in each st around. Do not join. Pull up and drop long loop of B. Move marker. 16 sts.
3rd rnd: Re-insert hook in A loop. Working into horizontal bar on WS in row below, (2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in next st) twice. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * around. Do not join. Pull up and drop long loop of A. Move marker. 24 sts.
4th rnd: Re-insert hook in B loop. *2 hdcbl in next st. 1 hdcbl in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Do not join. Pull up and drop long loop of B. Move marker. 32 sts.
5th rnd: Re-insert hook in A loop. Working into horizontal bar on in row below, (1 dc. 1 tr) in next st. *1 joined tr in each of next 3 sts. 2 joined tr next st. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 joined tr in each of last 3 sts. Do not join. Pull up and drop long loop of A. Move marker. 40 sts.
6th rnd: Re-insert hook in B loop. *2 hdcbl in next st. 1 hdcbl in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Do not join. Pull up and drop long loop of B. Move marker. 50 sts.
7th rnd: Re-insert hook in A loop. Working into horizontal bar on WS in row below, (1 joined tr. 1 dtr) in next st. *1 joined dtr in each of next 4 sts. 2 joined dtr next st. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 joined dtr in each of last 4 sts. Do not join. Pull up and drop long loop of A. Move marker. 60 sts.
8th rnd: Re-insert hook in B loop. *2 hdcbl in next st. 1 hdcbl l in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Do not join. Pull up and drop long loop of B. Move marker. 75 sts.
9th rnd: Re-insert hook in A loop. Working into horizontal bar on WS in row below, (1 joined dtr. 1 triple-tr) in next st. *1 joined triple-tr in each of next 4 sts. 2 joined triple-tr next st. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 joined triple-tr in each of last 4 sts. Do not join. Pull up and drop long loop of A. Move marker. 90 sts.
10th rnd: Re-insert hook in B loop. *2 hdcbl in next st. 1 hdcbl in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Do not join. Fasten off A and B. 105 sts.

BACK STRAPS (make 2)
With A, ch 5, leaving long end.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until Strap measures 26” [66 cm]. Fasten off, leaving long end.

ANTENNAE (make 2)
With B, ch 24, leaving long end.
1st row: Bobble in 4th ch from hook. Sl st in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off, leaving long end.
Using Overhand st, sew Antennae over pipe cleaner, leaving excess of pipe cleaner at opposite end from Bobble.

FINISHING
Sew zipper along 1 side, beg at last st of 9th rnd. Following diagram, place 2 Sides with WS tog. Sew zipper to other side. Join Sides tog using Flat Sl St.
Seaming with Flat Sl St Join: (RS). Join B with sl st to back loop of first hdc after zipper. Sl st 2 Sides tog to last hdc at opposite side of zipper, working through back loops only and keeping working yarn to WS of work to create a flat sl st chain detail on RS of work (see diagram). Fasten off.
FLAT SL ST JOINING DIAGRAM
Sew Back Straps using long yarn ends as shown in picture on either side of joining seam. Poke excess of pipe cleaners through fabric at top of Backpack. Using long yarn ends of Antennae, secure in place.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Main Color (MC) Sand (10014) 2 balls or 257 yds/235 m
Bernat® Blanket Small Ball™ (5.3 oz/150 g; 108 yds/98 m) Contrast A Taupe (00029) 1 ball or 18 yds/16 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch markers.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
1 toggle button.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] diameter x 4½" [11.5 cm] deep, excluding straps.
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
FRONT
See diagram on page 2.
**With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 sc.**
PM in 27th and 54th sts for Ear placement, and in 80th st of last rnd for Assembly and Border.
Fasten off, leaving long yarn tail.
BACK
Work from ** to ** as given for Front. Do not fasten off at end of 10th rnd.
PM in 7th, 35th, 46th and 73rd sts of last rnd for Strap placement.
Cont as follows:
11th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
12th to 14th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 30 sc. Ch 20. Skip next 20 sc. 1 sc in each of last 30 sc. Join. 60 sc and 1 ch-20 sp.
16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 30 sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 ch. Ch 8. Sl st in first ch of ch-8 (Toggle loop made). 1 sc in each of next 10 ch. 1 sc in each of last 30 sc. Join. 80 sc.
17th to 19th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
PM in last st for Assembly.
Fasten off.
STRAPS (Make 2)
With MC, and leaving long yarn tail, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Strap measures approx 16" [40.5 cm]. Fasten off, leaving long yarn tail.
EARS (Make 2)
With MC, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc across. Turn. 8 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 12 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off, leaving long yarn tail. 16 sc.
Align both Ears, RS up, centered over designated markers on Front. Using long yarn tail, and working into front loops only of Front, sew Ears to Front, as shown.
NOSE
With A, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Working around sts at ends of rows, 1 sc in each of next 2 rows. Working in rem loop of foundation ch, 3 sc in next ch. Working around sts at ends of rows, 1 sc in each of next 3 rows. 2 sc in same sp as first sc. Join.
Fasten off, leaving long yarn tail.
With RS facing and using long yarn tail, sew Nose to Front as shown.
With A, embroider eyes and mouth to Front, as shown.
FINISHING
Align assembly markers on Backpack Front and Back with WS tog. Using long yarn tail from Front, working through back loops only of Front, sew Front and Back tog. Do not remove marker on Front.
Using long yarn tails at beg of Straps, sew both Straps evenly across 10 rem loops between 35th and 46th markers of Back.
Using long yarn tails at ends of Straps, sew each Strap at 7th and 73rd markers of Back, working in rem loops over marked sts and 2 sts on either side.
With A, sew Toggle to Back, aligned with Toggle Loop and on opposite side of ch-20 sp, as shown.
Border: Join A with sl st at marker in rem loop of Front.
1st rnd: *Loosely sl st in each rem loop of Front to next Ear. Working in front loops only, loosely sl st in each of next 16 sc of Ear. Rep from * once more. Loosely sl st in each rem loop of Front. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 368 Paddy Green A
RED HEART® Boutique Holiday Sassy Fabric™: 1 hank 9950 Holiday Chevron B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle, 2 stitch markers
One 1¼” (32 mm) button, sewing needle and matching thread, fabric sealant (optional)
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Purse measures 8½” high x 11” across bottom (21.5 x 28 cm).
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 11 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet with A. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PURSE
Bottom
With A, ch 25. 
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—24 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. Do not fasten off. Continue in rounds.

Sides
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; working across ends of rows of first side, *3 sc in first row, sc in next 3 rows, 3 sc in last row*; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch; working across ends of rows of other side; repeat from * to * once; join with slip st in first sc—66 sc. Place marker in first stitch and move up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2–22: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc. Place marker on first stitch of Round 6 for ruffle placement.
Round 23: Working in back loops only, *sc in next 9 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—60 sc. 
Round 24: Working in back loops only, *sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—48 sc.
Round 25: Working in back loops only, *sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—42 sc.
Round 26: Working in back loops only, *sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—36 sc.
Round 27: Working in back loops only, slip st in next 9 sc, ch 15 (button loop made), slip st in next 27 sc; join with slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off.

Ruffles
Round 1: With right side and marked stitch of Round 6 facing, beg ruf slip st in marked sc, ruf slip st in each remaining sc around—66 ruf slip sts.

Rounds 2–4: Skip next round; working in next round, ruf slip st in each sc around. Fasten off as follows: cut B after next hole, insert hook through last hole and pull top edge of fabric through loop on hook. Gently pull remaining tail through loop and tighten.

Handles 
Flatten purse so button loop is centered and stitch at end of each top edge is obvious.
Round 1: Join A with slip st to st at end of top edge, ch 35, skip next 16 sts, slip st in next 2 sts, ch 35, skip next 16 sts, slip st in next st.
Round 2: Slip st in each ch. Fasten off.

FINISHING
With a strand of A, sew button on front of purse under button loop. 
If desired, apply fabric sealant to cut ends of B to prevent fraying. Tuck ends under and tack in place with sewing needle and thread.
Weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Classic Crochet Thread “, Size 10: 1 Ball each 661 Frosty Green A, 1 White B, 928 Oasis C, 21 Linen D and 226 Natural E.
Steel Crochet Hook: 1.5mm [US 8].
7” zipper, matching thread and sewing needle, stitch marker, yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Bag measures 5” x 3½” x 1¾”.
gauge: 36 sc = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Side piece is worked in continuous rounds. Place marker for beginning of round.

BAG
Front and Back (Make 2)
Round 1: With A, ch 17, slip st in 4th ch from hook (counts as ch-3 space), slip st in next 13 ch, ch 3, slip st in same ch.
Round 2: Turn, slip st in ch-3 space, (ch 3, 2 dc, [ch 3, 3 dc] twice) in same ch-3 space, [ch 1, skip 2 slip sts, 3 dc in next slip st] 4 times, ch 1, ([3 dc, ch 3] twice, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space, turn to work along opposite side of foundation chain, [ch 1, skip 2 slip sts, 3 dc in next ch] 4 times, ch 1, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Fasten off.
Round 3: Join B in any ch-1 space, ch 3 (counts as first dc), 2 dc in same space, ch 1, *[3 dc, ch 1] in each ch-1 space to next ch-3 space, [(3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in ch-3 space, ch 1] twice; repeat from * once more, [3 dc, ch 1] in each ch-1 space to beginning ch, slip st to top of beginning ch to join.
Fasten off.
Round 4: Join C in any ch-1 space, ch 3 (counts as first dc), 2 dc in same space, ch 1, *[3 dc, ch 1] in each ch-1 space to next ch-3 space, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in ch-3 space, ch 1; repeat from * 3 more times, [3 dc, ch 1] in ch-1 space to beginning ch, slip st to top of beginning ch to join.
Fasten off.
Round 5: Join D and repeat Round 4.
Round 6: Join C and repeat Round 4.
Round 7: Join E and repeat Round 4.
Round 8: Join C and repeat Round 4.
Round 9: Join A and repeat Round 4.
Fasten off.

Side
With A, ch 176, slip st to first ch to join.
Round 1: Sc in each ch around, place marker for beginning of round. – 176 sc.
Rounds 2-6: Sc in each sc around.
Rows 7-11: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 120 sts, leave remaining 56 sts unworked for zipper opening.
Round 12: Ch 56 for zipper opening, sc in first st of Row 12, sc in each sc around.
Round 13: Sc in each ch and sc around.
Rounds 14-17: Sc in each sc around.
Round 18: Sc in each sc around, slip st in first 3 sts.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew zipper along zipper openings.
Joining Round: With zipper centered along one long edge of Front piece, position one long edge of Side piece around outside edge of Front piece. Working through sts of both Side and Front pieces, join A in any st, ch 1, working through both layers, sc in each st around, slip st to first st to join. Repeat Joining Round to join opposite edge of Side piece to Back piece.
Weave in ends.
Help organize the necessities that you keep in your purse. Crochet it for yourself or to give!

materials: Bernat® Maker Home Dec™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m) Main Color (MC) Woodberry  (11001) 2 balls
Contrast A Clay (11008) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch markers.
Grommets size 5/8" [16 mm].
Assorted Beads.
abbreviations: Popcorn = 4 dc in next stitch. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into top of first dc of 4-dc group and pull dropped loop through.
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] wide x 14" [35.5 cm] tall, excluding handles.
gauge: 11 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With MC, ch 42.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 84 sc. PM on first sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 3 (does not count as st). 1 dc in next sc. 1 dc in same sp where sl st was made – beg X-st made. *Skip next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 dc in skipped sc – X-st made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to beg X-st. Sl st to next dc. 42 X-sts.
Note: Second sl st at end of X-st rnds are important to keep lined up on side of Bag.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in first sc. *Popcorn in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around, ending with: Popcorn in next sc. 1 hdc in last sc. Join with sl st to top of first hdc. 28 popcorns.
9th and 10th rnds: As 5th and 6th rnds.
11th rnd: As 5th rnd.
12th rnd: As 4th rnd.
Rep 5th to 12th rnds to form pat twice more. Break MC at end of last rnd. Join A.
Next 6 rnds: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Sl st in each st around. Fasten off.
FINISHING
To place grommets: Lay Bag flat. PM for grommets 4" [10 cm] in from each side to position grommet. Following manufacturer’s instructions, apply grommets (grommets will be squeezed between sc sts).
Handles (make 2)
For each Handle make 6 chain lengths as follows: Ch 110. Fasten off, leaving 10" [25.5 cm] tails on both ends.
Divide 6 chain lengths into 3 groups (2 chain lengths each). Braid 3 groups into Handle. Secure ends tightly. Slip into grommets and tie a knot. Adjust lengths as needed. Add beads to ends. Knot and trim as shown in picture.

materials: Simply Soft Party (85 g/3 oz; 150 m/164 yds)
Contrast A Spring Sparkle (0002) 2
Contrast B Black Sparkle (0007) 1
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Backpack measures approximately 13"/33cm long (not including fringe) x 11"/28cm wide (at lower edge) x 2"/5cm deep
gauge: In pattern, 14 sts and 18 rows = 4"/10cm.
instructions:
FRONT
Beginning at lower edge, with A, ch 40.
Row 1 (RS): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—39 sc.
Rows 2–6: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—37 sc.
Rows 8–13: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 14: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—35 sc.
Rows 15–28: Repeat Rows 8–14 twice—31 sc at the end of Row 28.
Rows 29–51: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off.
BACK
Work same as front—31 sc. Do not fasten off.
Row 52: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
FLAP
Rows 53–58: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Note: Row 53 is top of flap.
Row 59: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—29 sc.
Row 60: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 61–70: Repeat last 2 rows 5 times—19 sc at the end for Row 70.
Rows 71–73: Repeat Row 59 three times—13 sc at the end of Row 73.
Rows 74–78: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off.
GUSSET
With A, ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—6 sc.
Rows 2–127: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off.
STRAPS (make 2)
With B, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—5 sc.
Rows 2–91: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Round 92: Sl st evenly spaced around all edges of strap.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Assembly: Line up one end of gusset with Row 51 of front and Row 52 of back. Pin long edges of gusset to edges of front and back, making sure that the edges are even and other end of gusset lines up on opposite side of both front and back. With front facing you, and working through both thicknesses, join B with sc in top corner of front and gusset, sc evenly along long edge of gusset to join it to front. Fasten off. Repeat to join gusset to back.
Flap Trim and Buttonloop: With RS of flap facing you, join B with sc in edge of flap at top of flap, sc in end of each row down side of flap; working in sts of last row, 2 sc in first st (for corner), sc in next 5 sts, (sc, ch 5, sc) in next st (for buttonloop), sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in last st (for corner); working up other side of flap, sc in end of each row up side. Do not fasten off.
Top Trim: Sc evenly spaced across top of gusset, top of front, and across top of other end of gusset; join with slst in first sc of flap trim. Fasten off. Using yarn needle, weave in all ends.
Fringe: Cut strands of A and B, 7"/18cm long. Attach fringes to lower edge of backpack, beginning and ending with a B-colored fringe, as follows: Fold strand in half forming a loop at folded end. With crochet hook, draw loop through edge of backpack, thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten and secure. Trim ends to even. Repeat process across edge of flap, beginning and ending at opposite ends of Row 59 and using 2 1/2"/6.5cm lengths. Trim ends to about 1"/2.5cm.
With sewing needle and A, sew button to center of front, between Rows 35 and 36 to allow flap to fold over top of gusset properly. With yarn needle and B, using photograph as a guide, embroider 10 French knots on front of flap. With yarn needle and A, whipstitch two D-rings to back, between Rows 3 and 4 and about 1"/2.5cm from one outside edge. Sew two more D-rings to back, between Rows 3 and 4 and about 1"/2.5cm from opposite outside edge. With A, whipstitch straps to Row 51 of back, about 2"/5cm from outside edges. Using yarn needle, weave in any remaining ends.

materials: YARN MEDIUM 4 Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Colors: Contrast A Orchid (39717) 1 ball or 165 yds/151 m
Contrast B Persimmon (39754) 1 ball or 102 yds/93 m
Contrast C Fuchsia (39764) 1 ball or 102 yds/93 m
Tools: Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook
Susan Bates® steel yarn needle
Pair of purchased 10" [25.5 cm] bag handles
Tape measure
measurements: Approximately (Approx) 10" [25.5 cm] square, excluding handles.
gauge: 18 single crochet (sc) and 23 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
1st row:  1 single crochet (sc) in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 27 sc.

Gauge Swatch Pattern (Pat)
With A make a Slip Knot: Make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then pull through to make slip knot.
With A, chain (ch) 28.

Chain:
Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw up a loop – 1 chain made.
Repeat (rep) last step 27 times more – 28 chains made.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Repeat (rep) 2nd row until work from beginning (beg) measures 6" [15 cm].
Fasten off.
Measure your completed Gauge Swatch to determine if 18 single crochet (sc) across = 4" [10 cm] and 23 rows high = 4" [10 cm]. If you have fewer than 18 sc across, your crochet is loose and you will need to change to a smaller hook to achieve correct gauge. If you have more than 18 sc across, your crochet is tight and you will need to change to a larger hook to achieve correct gauge.

Notes:
• Stitches (sts) are worked into back loops only throughout.
• Worked over foundation chain (ch) multiple of 14 ch +2.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

TOTE Stripe Pattern (Pat)
With A, work 4 rows. Join B. Break A.
With B, work 4 rows. Join C. Break B.
With C, work 4 rows. Join A. Break C.
These 12 rows form Stripe Pat. See diagram on page 6.

1st row: [Right Side (RS)]. 2 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook.
With A make a slip knot and loosely chain (ch) 72.
*1 sc in each of next 6 ch. Skip 1 ch. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 3 sc in next ch.
Repeat (rep) from * to end of chain, ending last rep with 2 sc in last ch. Turn. 76 sc.

2nd row: Ch 1. Working into back loops only of each st, 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row, ending last rep with 2 sc in last sc. Turn.

Keeping continuity (cont) of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd row until work measures approx 20" [51 cm] long measured from valley to valley, ending on any 4th row of Stripe Pat. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

NOTE: Changing Colors (first change happens after 4th row)
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

Peaked Edge Handle:
Attach handle by wrapping 5 peaks around handle and fastening securely in place on inside of Bag.
FINISHING Aligning first and last row so that peaks are even, sew side seams together (tog), using whipstitch, from bottom fold up to bottom line of valleys approx 1" [2.5 cm] from top edge.
Valley Edge Handle:
Attach handle by wrapping 4 central peaks around handle and fastening securely in place on inside of Bag.
Wrap two half edge peaks to inside and fasten securely inside Bag.

materials: RED HEART® Comfort®: 1 ball 3152 Denim Heather
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Embroidered patches
stitch markers
1" [25 mm] decorative button
fabric glue
yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Back Pack measures 11" [28 cm] wide x 14" [35.5 cm] tall x 9" [23 cm] deep.
gauge: 12 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BACKPACK
Base
Ch 23 loosely.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, working in each ch, work Kernel st across – 21 sts.
Rows 2-26: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, work in Kernel st across. Do not fasten off.
Body
Round 1: Ch 1, turn, sc 20 sts evenly spaced across last row, work 3 sc in corner, turn to work along side edge, sc 33 sts evenly spaced along side edge, 3 sc in corner, turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, sc 20 sts evenly spaced across, 3 sc in corner, turn to work along opposite side edge, sc 33 sts evenly spaced along side edge, 3 sc in corner, slip st in first st to join – 118 sts.
Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each st around.
Rounds 3-9: Working in continuous rounds, sc in each st around.
Rounds 10-30: Hdc in each st around.
Round 31: Sc in each st around.
Round 32: Sc in next 8 sts, *sc in next 8 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 107 sts.
Round 33: Sc in next 8 sts, *sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 96 sts.
Round 34: *Sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 84 sts.
Round 35: *Sc in next 5 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 72 sts.
Rounds 36-37: Sc in each st around, slip st in first st of last round to join. Fasten off.
Top Flap
Row 1: Working in back loops only, join yarn in first st of last row with a slip st, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in next 26 sts – 27 sts.
Rows 2-19: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 27 sts.
Row 20: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 23 sts, sc2tog – 25 sts.
Row 21: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 9 sts, ch 3, skip 3 sts for buttonhole, sc in next 9 sts, sc2tog – 23 sts.
Row 22: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 8 sc, sc in each ch of ch-3 space, sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog – 21 sts.
Row 23: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 17 sts, sc2tog – 19 sts.
Fasten off.
Trim
Join yarn in top left corner with a slip st, working in the ends of rows, sc evenly spaced down edge, sc in each st along bottom edge, sc evenly spaced along opposite side edge. Fasten off.
POCKET FLAP
Ch 28.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 27 sts.
Rows 2-13: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 14: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sts, sc2tog – 25 sts.
Row 15: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sts, sc2tog – 23 sts.
Row 16: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sts, sc2tog – 21 sts.
Row 17: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sts, sc2tog – 19 sts. Fasten off.
Trim
Join yarn in top left corner with a slip st, working in ends of rows, sc evenly spaced down edge, sc in each st along bottom edge, sc evenly spaced along opposite side edge. Fasten off.
POCKET
Ch 28.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 27 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st – 29 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st – 31 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st – 33 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st – 35 sts.
Rows 6-21: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Pocket Assembly
Sew first row of Pocket to first round of Body, lining up placement under Top Flap. Sew sides to front of Body. Sew first row of Pocket Flap to Body 2 rows above Pocket so Flap folds over.
TIES
Left Tie
Join yarn with a slip st 2 rows below first st of Top Flap, ch 75. Fasten off. Weave in and out of sts to center of front of Body.
Right Tie
Join yarn with a slip st 2 rows below last st of Top Flap, ch 75. Fasten off. Weave in and out of sts to center of front of Body. Pull ties to gather top edge. Sew button on Back Pack to correspond with buttonhole on Flap.
STRAPS (make 2)
Ch 66.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 65 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), turn, hdc in each st across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Fasten off.
Sew one short end of each Strap on opposite corners of Top Flap. Sew opposite short ends on corresponding corners of Base. Weave in ends. Using fabric glue (not iron), attach patches to Flaps.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 3933 Dove
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [I-9 US]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Pouch measures 22” long x 15” wide (56 x 38 cm), with flap open
gauge: 14 dc = 4” (10 cm) in pattern; 8 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
POUCH
Ch 70.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—69 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as first dc, ch 1 here and throughout), skip next st, dc in next st, *ch 1, skip next st, dc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—35 dc and 34 ch-1 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 2, dc in first ch-space, *ch 1, skip next st, dc in next ch-space; repeat from * to beginning ch-2, dc in top of beginning ch-2, turn—36 dc and 33 ch-1 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 2, dc in each st and ch-1 space across, turn—69 dc.
Rows 6–10: Ch 2, dc in each st, turn.
Rows 11–13: Repeat Rows 3–5—69 dc.
Rows 14–18: Repeat Row 6.
Rows 19–26: Repeat Rows 11–18.
Rows 27–29: Repeat Rows 11–13.
Row 30: Ch 1, sc in each st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
With wrong sides and ends of rows held together, fold in half and sew across first and last rows to form sides of pouch.
Flap
Note: After Round 1, continue in turned rows.
Holding pouch with opening facing, join yarn with slip st in top right corner at back of pouch.
Round 1: Ch 1, working across ends of rows, work 43 sc evenly across back edge, work 44 sc evenly across front edge; join with slip st in first sc—87 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3, skip next st, dc in next st, *ch 1, skip next st, dc in next st; repeat from * 20 times, turn—22 dc and 21 ch-1 spaces.
Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Cotton Ripple Cakes™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 491 yds/449 m) Mauve Glow (37018) 2 balls
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Yarn needle
abbreviations: DblSpk = Double Spike: Yoh and draw up a loop in same sp as 3rd st to right 2 rows below. Yoh and draw up a loop in same sp as next st 3 rows below. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 18½” [47 cm] wide at top x 11½” [29 cm] deep.
gauge: 14 sc and 14 rows = 4” [10 cm] with larger hook and 2 strands held together. 18 sc and 20 rows = 4” [10 cm] with smaller hook and single strand.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Base: With larger hook and 2 strands held together, ch 32. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 29 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 29 ch. Join. 64 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 29 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 30 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 31 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 88 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 32 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 96 sc.
Cut 1 strand and proceed as follows with single strand and smaller hook:
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 120 sc.
2nd to 5th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Proceed in Shifting Chevrons St Pat as follows:
See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of first 3 sts. DblSpk. Skip next st (behind DblSpk just worked). Rep from * around. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. DblSpk. Skip next st (behind DblSpk just worked). 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. *DblSpk. Skip next st (behind DblSpk just worked). 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next st. DblSpk. Skip next st (behind DblSpk just worked). 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. DblSpk. Skip next st (behind DblSpk just worked). 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join.
These 4 rnds form Shifting Chevrons Pat. Rep Rnds 1 to 4 once more.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. 132 sts.
Work 8 rnds in Shifting Chevrons Pat.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. 144 sts.
Work 8 rnds in Shifting Chevrons Pat.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. 156 sts.
Work 8 rnds in Shifting Chevrons Pat.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * around. 168 sts.
Work 8 rnds in Shifting Chevrons Pat.
Next 5 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Fasten off.
STRAPS (make 2)
With larger hook and 2 strands held tog, ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 7 sc. Turn.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not turn.
Beg working rnds in a continuous spiral. Do not join at end of rnds. Place marker to indicate beg of rnd and move marker each subsequent rnd.
Next rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Rep last rnd until Strap from beg measures 25” [63.5 cm]. Turn at end of last rnd. Beg working in rows as follows:
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Turn.
Rep last row 4 times more. Fasten off.
Sew Straps to top edge of Bag as seen in photo.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Stripes (280 g / 9.8 oz) - 1 ball of #21732 (Pinky Stripes)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
4 grommets
measurements: 9 x 12 x 3½ ins [23 x 30.5 x 9 cm]
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions:
Front and Back (make alike). 
Ch 28.
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of ch. Turn. 27 sc. Work in sc for 11 ins [28 cm]. 
Next row:(Eyelet row). Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) twice. Turn.
Work 2 rows in sc. Fasten off.
Apply grommets in eyelets.
Gusset: Ch 12.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 11 sc. Work in sc for 33 ins [84 cm]. Fasten off.
With WS tog, crochet Gusset to sides and bottom of Front and Back.
Handles: Ch 5. Join with sl st in first ch.
1st rnd:(RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. 5 sc. Place marker for end of rnd and slip marker every rnd. 
Work in sc for 16 ins [40.5 cm].
Fasten off. Thread handles through grommets and knot ends.

materials: Caron® Coconut Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 481 yds/440 m)
Contrast A Tutti-Frutti (84002) 1 ball or 335 yds/307 m
Contrast B Sugar Teal (84005) 1 ball or 350 yds/320 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Susan Bates® stitch markers
measurements: Approx 12" x 12" x 3" [30.5 x 30.5 x 7.5 cm], excluding Strap.
gauge: 16 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Chart Pat.
instructions:
Note: When working from chart and joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

BAG BASE
With A, ch 13.
Work Chart, noting each square of chart is equal to 1 sc and reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right. Carry color not in use across top of entire previous row and work sts around it. This will ensure even gauge as all sts will be worked around an extra strand of yarn held across top of previous row. Carry both colors up side of work.
See Chart on page 2.
1st row: (1st row of Chart - RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sc.
2nd row: (2nd row of Chart - WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until 6th row of chart is complete.
Rep last 6 rows of Chart Pat until Bag Base measures approx 12" [30.5 cm], ending with either 3rd row or 6th row. Fasten off.

STRAP & SIDES
With A, ch 13.
Work Chart as noted for Bag Base.
1st row: (1st row of Chart - RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sc.
2nd row: (2nd row of Chart – WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until 6th row of chart is complete.
Rep last 6 rows of Chart Pat until Strap measures approx 12" [30.5 cm], ending with either 3rd row or 6th row of chart. PM on each end of last row. Cont in Chart Pat, until Strap measures approx 36" [91.5 cm], ending with either 3rd row or 6th row of chart. PM on each end of last row. Cont in Chart Pat until Strap measures approx 48" [122 cm], ending with 3rd row or 6th row of chart. Fasten off.

FRONT & BACK PANELS
With A, ch 49.
Work Chart as noted for Bag Base.
1st row: (1st row of Chart - RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 48 sc.
2nd row: (2nd row of Chart – WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until 6th row of chart is complete.
Rep last 6 rows of Chart Pat until work from beg measures approx 12" [30.5 cm], ending with either 3rd row or 6th row of chart.
Next row: With B only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Join Bag Base to Front & Back Panels:
With RS of Base facing, place lower edge of Front Panel behind long edge of Base with WS of work tog, aligning corner of Base with corner of Front Panel.
1st row: Join B with sl st. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly across edge. Fasten off.
Rep to join Base to Back Panel.
Join Strap & Sides to Bag Base:
With RS of Base facing, place beg edge of Strap & Sides behind short edge of Base with WS of work tog, aligning corner of Bottom with corner of Strap.
1st row: Join B with sl st. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly across edge. Fasten off.
Rep to join opposite end of Strap & Sides to Base.
Join Strap & Sides to Front & Back Panels:
Align top corners of Front and Back Panels to rows marked with st markers on Strap & Sides. Pin pieces tog if desired.
1st row: Beg at bottom right corner of Front Panel, join B with sl st. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly up edge of Front Panel, across single edge of Strap, and down opposite edge of Front Panel. Fasten off.
Rep for other side.

materials: 1 skein 319 Cherry Red Red Heart® Super Saver®
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.0 mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
Stitch markers
Stiff cardboard 12" (30.5 cm) long for making Tassel
abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Tote measures approximately 16" (40.5 cm) across widest part and 14" (35.5 cm) from bottom center to top of “V”.
gauge: 16 sc and 18 rows sc = 5" (12.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
TOTE 
Side (make 2)
Ch 2.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn—3 sc.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—5 sc. 
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn—
5 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc across to last 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—7 sc.
Row 5: Repeat Row 3—7 sc.
Rows 6-7: Repeat Row 4—11 sc.
Rows 8-31: Repeat Rows 5-7—43 sc. 
Rows 32-33: Repeat Row 3—43 sc. 
Row 34: Repeat Row 4—45 sc.
Rows 35-36: Repeat Row 3—45 sc. 
Row 37: Repeat Row 4—47 sc.
Rows 38-45: Repeat Row 3—47 sc.
Top Right Curve
Row 46: Ch 1, sc in first 23 sc; turn—23 
sc.
Row 47: Ch 1, sc2tog (see Special 
Stitches), sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog; 
turn—21 sts.
Row 48: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; 
turn—21 sc.
Row 49: Repeat Row 47—19 sts.
Row 50: Repeat Row 48—19 sc.
Rows 51-55: Repeat Row 47—9 sts. 
Fasten off.
Top Left Curve
Row 46 (Right Side): Go back to Row 
45; skip next sc on Row 45 and join with 
sc in next sc (see Special Techniques). 
Sc across remaining sc of Row 45; 
turn—23 sc.
Rows 47-55: Repeat Rows 47-55 of Top 
Right Curve; at end of last row, do not 
fasten off; turn.
Edge
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1; working 1 
sc in each sc or in the side of each row, 
sc in first 64 sts, 3 sc in back of ch at 
bottom point, place marker in middle sc 
of 3-sc group just made, sc in remaining 
85 sts; do not turn—152 sc.
Round 2: Slip st in front loop of each sc 
around, moving marker to st at center of 
bottom point—152 sts. Fasten off.
Gusset
Count 46 sts before and after marked st, 
place markers in both sts.
Round 1 (Right Side): Join with sc in 
marked st on left edge of Side; sc in 
each st around outside up to marked st 
on right edge of Side; turn—93 sc.
Rounds 2-3: Ch 1, sc in each sc on 
previous round; turn. At end of last 
round, fasten off.
Handle (make 2)
Ch 55.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each 
ch across; turn—54 sc.
Row 2: Slip st in front loop of each sc 
across; turn—54 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in remaining back loops 
of each sc on Row 1; turn—54 sc.
Row 4: Slip st in front loop of each sc 
across—54 sts. Fasten off.
Tassel
1. Wrap yarn around cardboard 20
times; cut one end.
2. Tie a long piece of yarn around center
of strands and pull strands down
away from knot.
3. Wrap a long piece of yarn around
piece about ¾" (2 cm) down from top.
Wrap strand tightly around, going
downward until wrapping is about 1"
(2.5 cm) long, knot ends together and
pull to the inside.
4. Trim lower ends of Tassel evenly.
5. Make a chain 15 chs long; fasten off.
FINISHING
With Right Sides together, sew front 
and back Sides of Heart together by 
sewing through both loops of sts on 
last rounds of Gussets; turn Right Side 
out. Referring to photo for placement, 
sew Handles to Tote; wrap ch-15 length 
around a Handle and sew to top of 
Tassel.

materials: Caron® Cotton Varied Stripes Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 481 yds/440 m) Gladiolus (42013) 2 balls or 877 yds/802 m
Caron® Cotton Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 481 yds/440 m) Candy Cookie (11006) 2 balls or 877 yds/802 m
Caron® Cotton Angel Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 481 yds/440 m) Elderberry Lilac (12017) 2 balls or 877 yds/802 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Stitch markers
measurements: Bag: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] diameter x 12" [30.5 cm] high, excluding strap. Strap: Approx 2" [5 cm] wide x 66" [167.5 cm] long.
gauge: 15.5 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 15.5 sc and 30 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Ridge St Pat.
instructions:
BAG
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
BASE
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM on first st.
2nd rnd: Loosely sl st in each sc around.
3rd rnd: 2 sc in each sl st around. 20 sc.
4th rnd: Working over sc from prev rnd, 2 sc in each sl st 2 rnds below (rnd 2) around.
5th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
6th rnd: *1 sc in next sl st. 2 sc in next sl st. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
7th rnd: *Working over sc from prev rnd and into sl sts 2 rnds below (5th rnd), 1 sc in next sl st. 2 sc in next sl st. Rep from * around.
8th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
9th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sl sts. 2 sc in next sl st. Rep from * around. 40 sc.
10th rnd: *Working over sc from prev rnd and into sl sts 2 rnds below (8th rnd), 1 sc in each of next 2 sl sts. 2 sc in next sl st. Rep from * around.
11th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
12th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sl sts. 2 sc in next sl st. Rep from * around. 50 sc.
13th rnd: *Working over sc from prev rnd, and into sl sts 2 rnds below (8th rnd), 1 sc in each of next 3 sl sts. 2 sc in next sl st. Rep from * around.
14th to 34th rnds: Cont working Ridge St Pat as established, working 1 rnd of sl sts, 1 rnd evenly inc 10 sc around, and 1 rnd working over sc from prev rnd. 120 sc at end of 34th rnd.
35th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
36th rnd: 1 sc in each sl st around.
37th rnd: Working over sc from prev rnd and into sl sts 2 rnds below (35th rnd), 1 sc in each sl st around. PM at end of last rnd.
SIDE OF BAG
Rep Base 35th to 37th rnds until work from marker measures approx 10" [25.5 cm], ending on a 37th rnd.
Next rnd (strap hole rnd): Loosely sl st in each of first 28 sc. Ch 4. Skip next 4 sc. Sl st in each of next 56 sc. Ch 4. Skip next 4 sc. Sl st in each of last 28 sc.
Next rnd: 1 sc in each sl st and ch around. 120 sc.
Next rnd: Working over sc from prev rnd and into sl sts or ch 2 rnds below, 1 sc in each st around.
Cont with Side as follows:
Rep Base 35th to 37th rnds until work from marker measures approx 12" [30.5 cm], ending on a 37th rnd.
Sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
STRAP
Loosely ch 257.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 256 sc.
2nd to 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
10th row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not turn. Cont working around Strap as follows: Edging rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Sl st evenly around 4 sides of Strap. Join with sl st to first ch. Fasten off.
Attach Strap: Insert ends of Strap and knot through ch‐4 sps in Sides to secure in place, adjusting to desired length and leaving ends hanging loosely (as shown in photo).

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Version I: Robins Egg (9780) 1 ball
Version 2: Orange (9778) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Tapestry needle.
4 buttons.
Small amounts of Black and White felt for eyes and mouth.
Hot glue gun and glue sticks.
Thread and sewing needle to sew on buttons.
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] wide x 5" [12.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 18 single crochet (sc) and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Chain 36.
1st row: (Right side). 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd chain (ch) from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 35 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to each sc to end of row. Turn.
Repeat last row until work from beginning measures 10" [25.5 cm], ending on a Wrong side row.
Buttonhole row: Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *Ch 3. Skip next 3 sc (buttonhole). 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Repeat from * once more. Ch 3. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *3 sc in next ch-3 space. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Repeat from * once more. 3 sc in next ch-3 space. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Ears (make 2)
Chain 4.
1st row: 7 double crochet (dc) in 4th ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as half double crochet). 1 half double crochet (hdc) in each dc to end of row. 1 hdc in top of turning ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Fold piece in half. Using tapestry needle, sew side seams. Sew buttons to inside of Pencil Case to correspond to buttonholes. Sew Ears at top edge of Case as shown in picture.
Cut eyes out of white felt. Cut pupils out of black felt. Cut mouth out of black felt. Using hot glue gun, glue to front of Pencil Case as shown in picture. Using hot glue gun, glue button on for nose.

materials: Bernat® Satin™ (100 g/3.5 oz; 182 m/200 yds)
Size 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
4" [10 cm] zipper
4" [10 cm] square piece of cardboard
Glue
Scissors
measurements: Approx 4" x 4" [10 x 10 cm].
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep 8th rnd until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm]. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew zipper to Purse opening as shown in picture.
Pompom (make 1)
1. Print out template provided with pattern for each disc (make 2 discs). Glue to cardboard. Allow to dry, then cut out along solid and dashed lines.
2. Cut a piece of yarn approx 8" [20.5 cm] long, place between 2 discs around the center cut out and hold discs together.
3. Wrap yarn around the cardboard template following color placement and number of wraps as indicated on template.
4. Pull yarn between 2 discs and tie tightly in center.
5. Slip scissors between 2 discs and cut the wrapped yarn all around the circle.
6. Pull the discs from the yarn. Fluff and trim Pompom into smooth round shape.
7. Attach Pompom to zipper pull as shown in picture.

pattern_name: #308 LILY SUGAR N CREAM TWISTS CROCHET BAG
materials: Lily Sugar’n Cream Twists (56.7 g/2 oz)   6 balls of #20117 (Denim Twists)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G/6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Plastic ring 3 ins [7.5 cm] in diameter for decoration.
measurements: Approx 14 ins [35.5 cm] wide x 25 ins [63.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 15 hdc and 11 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.

FRONT and BACK (make alike).
Ch 40.
1st row: (RS). 2 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to last ch. 2 hdc in last ch. Turn. 40 hdc.
Next 6 rows: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 52 hdc at end of last row.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row for 10 ins [25.5 cm], ending with a WS row.
**Shape strap: Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 17 hdc. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - Hdc2tog made. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 18 sts.
Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more. 14 sts.
Next 3 rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows 7 times more. 6 sts.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until strap measures 16 ins [40.5 cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off.**

With WS of work facing, join yarn with sl st to first st.
Work from ** to ** as given above, noting RS becomes WS.

FINISHING
With WS of Front and Back tog, sew bottom and side seams to top of Straps.
Decorative Flap: Ch 17.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. 15 hdc.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row for 6 ins [18 cm], ending with a WS row.
Fold ¾ inch [2 cm] of Flap around ring and sew in position. Sew Flap to Back.
Fringe: Cut yarn, 5 ins [12.5 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, knot into fringe around Ring. Trim fringe evenly (see picture).

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds /333 m)
Contrast A Real Teal (656) 2 balls or 390 yds/356.5 m
Contrast B Aruba Sea (505) 1 ball or 285 yds/260.5 m
Contrast C Hot Red (390) 1 ball or 29 yds/26.5 m
Contrast D Aran (313) 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
