Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: When working from chart and joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

BOTTOM AND SIDE PANELS (make 3 alike)
Note: Work Chart (see page 2), noting each square of chart is equal to 1 sc and reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right. Carry color not in use across top of entire previous row and work sts around it. This will ensure even gauge as all sts will be worked around an extra strand of yarn held across top of previous row. Carry both colors up side of work.

With A, ch 25.
1st row: (RS). Following Chart according to note above, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 24 sc.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row and cont working Chart until work measures 12" [30.5 cm] ending with either 3rd or 6th row of Chart.
Fasten off.

CHART
Start here6 st repeat
Contrast A
Contrast B

FRONT AND BACK PANELS
With A, ch 49.
1st row: (RS). Working in Chart as before, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 48 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row and cont working Chart until work measures 12" [30.5 cm] ending with either 3rd or 6th row of Chart.
Fasten off.

Join Side, Front and Back Panels:
Arrange Panels to form a box, having Side Panels opposite each other.
With WS of 2 Panels tog, join A with sl st to top left corner. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly along side edge. Fasten off. Rep for rem Panels.
Join Bottom: With RS of Bottom facing, place lower edge of joined Panels behind Bottom with WS of work tog, aligning corner of Bottom with joining rows of Panels. Join A with sl st. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around all 4 sides of Bottom. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

STRAPS (make 2)
With A, ch 73.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 72 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Strap measures 2" [5 cm]. Fasten off.
Sew Straps to Front and Back of Bag as shown in photo.

MUSHROOM CAP
With C, ch 10. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sc.
3rd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 16 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 16 sc.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 18 sc.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of nxt 4 sc. 1 dc in each of next 6 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Do not turn.
Cont working sc evenly around sides of and top of Mushroom Cap, ending at beg of last row. Fasten off.

MUSHROOM STEM
With D, ch 12. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 11 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 13 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 15 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

pattern_name: Radiant Crochet Glowy Granny Cross Body Bag
materials: Red Heart® Super Glow™ (1.8 oz/50 g; 50 yds/46 m)
Contrast A Lunar White (2000) 1 ball or 36 yds/33 m
Contrast B Glow Worm Green (2003) 1 ball or 17.5 yds/16 m
Contrast C Spectral Seafoam (2002) 1 ball or 31 yds/28.5 m
Contrast D Aurora Yellow (2001) 1 ball or 47 yds/43 m
Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast E Real Teal (0656) 1 ball or 49 yds/45 m
Contrast F Persimmon (0220) 1 ball or 33 yds/30 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Coats® zipper, 18" [45.5 cm] long
Coats® sewing thread
Susan Bates® yarn needle
measurements: Approx 18" [45.5 cm] wide x 6½" [16.5 cm] deep, excluding Strap.
gauge: 12 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
MOTIF (Make 4)
Notes: 
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts dc. 
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp. 
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join B in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join A in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join C in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off.
5th rnd: With D, as 4th rnd. Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Join Motifs as shown in Assembly diagram. 
Join Motifs: Hold WS of 2 Motifs tog with sts aligned. Join D with sl st in ch-3 corners of aligned Motifs at top right. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, work 1 sc in each dcs through both thicknessess. Fasten off.
Top edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join E with sl st to top edge of Bag at right corner. Ch 1. Work sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Strap
With F, ch 109. 
1st rnd: 2 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Skip next 2 ch. 3 dc in next ch. Rep from * to last 3 ch. Skip next 2 ch. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in last ch. Working along opposite side of ch, work 3 dc in each ch-2 sp (working around foundation ch), to last ch. 3 dc in first ch of rnd (same ch as first 2 dc). Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Join E. Break F.
2nd rnd: With E, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as joining sl st. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
With E, sew Strap to Bag along top edge at either end as shown.
FINISHING 
Using sewing thread and needle, sew in zipper along top edge opening.

materials: Lily Sugar’n Cream 4-ply Worsted Weight, 2.5 oz (solids) or 2 oz (ombres), 2 balls
Size 4.50 mm (U.S. H or 7) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Two large beads
measurements: Approx 9 ins [23 cm] high
gauge: 13 sts and 7 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in pattern
instructions: Bag: Ch 4. Join with sl st to form ring. Ch 1. 1st rnd: 8 sc in ring. Sl st in first sc. Ch 1. 2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc to end. Sl st in first sc. 16 sts. Ch 1. 3rd rnd:*1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Sl st in first sc. 26 sts. Ch 1. 4th rnd:*1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Sl st in first sc. 34 sts. Ch 1. 5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Sl st in first sc. 42 sts. Ch 1. 6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Sl st in first sc. 50 sts. Ch 1. 7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Sl st in first sc. 58 sts. Ch 1. 8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Sl st in first sc. 66 sts. Ch 1. 9th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Sl st in first sc. 72 sts. Ch 1. 10th rnd: 1 sc in back loop of each sc around. Sl st in first sc. Ch 3. 11th rnd: Miss first st. 1 dc in each st around. Sl st in top of ch-3. Ch 3. 12th to 15th rnds: Rep 11th rnd. 16th rnd: Miss first st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Make Flower (see Pattern Stitches). 1 dc behind same dc as beg of Flower. *1 dc in each of next 11 dc. Make Flower. 1 dc behind same post as beg of Flower. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 dc in each of last 8 dc. Sl st in top of ch-3. Ch 3. 17th rnd: Miss first st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Miss Flower. *1 dc in each of next 12 dc. Miss Flower. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 dc in each of last 8 sts. Sl st in top of ch-3. 72 sts. Ch 3. 18th and 19th rnds: Rep 11th rnd. 20th rnd: Miss first st. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Make Flower. *1 dc behind same dc as beg of Flower and in each of next 11 dc. Make Flower. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 dc in each of last 4 sts. Sl st in top of ch-3. Ch 3. 21st rnd: Miss first st. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Miss Flower. *1 dc in each of next 12 dc. Miss Flower. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 dc in each of last 4 sts. 72 sts. Sl st in top of ch-3. Ch 3. 22nd and 23rd rnds: Rep 11th rnd. 24th rnd: Miss first st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to last dc. Ch 1. Sl st to top of ch-3. Ch 3. 25th rnd: Miss first st. 1 dc in each dc and ch 1 around. Sl st in top of ch-3. Ch 3. 26th rnd: Miss first st. 1 dc in each dc around. Sl st in top of ch-3. Ch 1. 27th rnd: 1 sc in each dc around. Sl st in first sc. Fasten off. Finishing: Ch 120. Fasten off. One drawstring made. Rep for second drawstring. Thread drawstrings through eyelets in bag, having one extend out of the left side of the bag and one extend out of the right side. Add large bead and knot drawstring ends.

materials: Lily Sugar’n Cream Solids or Ombres: 3 balls
Lily Sugar’n Cream Super Size Solids: 2 balls or Ombres: 3 balls
Size 4.5 mm (U.S. 7) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Bag measures 11 ½ ins [29 cm] wide x 18 ins [45.5 cm] long.
gauge: 14 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions: Base: Ch 43. 1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Do not turn. Working into other side of ch, work 1 sc in each rem loop of ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 84 sc. 2nd rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 6 times more. Mesh Section: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. *Ch 5. Miss next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with ch 2. Miss last 3 sc. 1 dc in first sc. 2nd rnd:*Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 loop. Rep from * around, ending with ch 2. 1 dc in last dc of previous rnd. Rep last rnd until work from base when folded flat measures 12 ins [30.5 cm]. Next rnd:Sl st in next ch 5 loop. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp. *1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next ch-5 loop. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in last dc. Join with sl st to first sc. 84 sc. Next rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd once more. Fasten off. Strap: Lay bag on a flat surface. Mark centre 12 sts on upper edge of one side. Join yarn with sl st to first of these 12 sts. 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Ch 1. Turn. 2nd row: Draw up a loop in each of first 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook- sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Ch 1. Turn. 3rd row: 1 sc in each st across. Ch 1. Turn. 4th row: Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. 8 sts. Ch 1. Turn. 5th row: 1 sc in each st across. Ch 1. Turn. Rep last row until strap measures 18 ins [45.5 cm] ending with WS facing for next row. Next row:2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last st. 2 sc in last st. Ch 1. Turn. Next row:1 sc in each st across. Ch 1. Turn. Next row:2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last st. 2 sc in last st. 12 sts. Join strap to other side of bag working 1 sl st through corresponding centre 12 sts of bag at same time working sl st through 12 sts of strap. Strap and Upper Edging: With RS of work facing, join yarn with sl st to one side of strap and work 1 rnd sc evenly along strap edge and top edge of Bag. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep around other side of Bag.

materials: Simply Soft Paints (113 g/4. oz;190 m/208 yds) - Spring Break (0004) 1
measurements: Finished Measurements approximately 61/2"/16.5 cm diameter x 27"/68.5 cm tall
gauge: In single crochet, 16 sts and 18 rows = 4"/10 cm.
instructions: NOTE DESCRIPTION SIZING Bag is worked in continuous rounds; do not join and do not turn at the end of rounds. Use a marker to indicate the beginning of round, and move marker up as work progresses. BOTTOM Chain 3; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1 (RS): Ch 1, work 9 sc in ring; place marker for beginning of round, move marker up as work progresses. Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—18 sc. Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 9 times—27 sc. Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 9 times—36 sc. Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 9 times—45 sc. Round 6: Sc in each sc around. Round 7: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 9 times—54 sc. Round 8: Sc in each sc around. Round 9: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 9 times—63 sc. Round 10: Sc in each sc around. Round 11: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 9 times—72 sc. Round 12: Sc in each sc around. Do not fasten off. Sides Round 13: Working in front loops only, sc in each sc around. Round 14: Sc in each sc around. Repeat Round 14 until sides measure about 27"/68.5 cm. Last Round (drawstring channel): Ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in next sc, ch 1, sk next sc, *hdc in next 2 sc, ch 1, sk next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off. DRAWSTRING Chain 100. Row 1: Slip st in second ch from hook and in each remaining ch across. Fasten off. STRAP Chain 9. Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—8 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Repeat Row 2 until strap measures about 27"/68.5 cm. Fasten off. FINISHING Weave drawstring through spaces in last round of bag. Tie ends together. Sew one end of strap to first row of side of bag. Sew other end of strap 5"/12.5 cm below top of bag. Using yarn needle, weave in all ends.

materials: lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) Version 1
contrast A (00095 Red)  2 balls
contrast B (01317 Hot Purple)  1 ball
contrast C (01699 Tangerine)  1 ball
contrast D (01444 Mod Pink)  1 ball
contrast E (01628 Hot Orange)  1 ball
Version 2
contrast A (00082 Jute)  2 balls
contrast B (01215 Robin’s Egg)  1 ball
contrast C (01712 Hot Green)  1 ball
contrast D (01223 Mod Green)  1 ball
contrast E (01111 Mod Blue)  1 ball
Size 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] wide x 14½" [37 cm] high.
gauge: 15 hdc and 12 rnds = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Beg at Base, with A, ch 58.
1st rnd: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 54 ch. 5 hdc in last ch. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 hdc in each of next 54 ch. 4 hdc in last ch. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 56 hdc. 5 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 58 hdc. 5 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join B with sl st to first hdc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Working into back loop only of each st, 1 hdc in each of next 58 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 62 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 130 hdc.
4th to 11th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join A with sl st to first hdc at end of 11th rnd.
12th rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join C with sl st to first hdc.
13th to 21st rnds: With C, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join A with sl st to first hdc at end of 21st rnd.
22nd rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join D with sl st to first hdc.
23rd to 31st rnds: With D, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join A with sl st to first hdc at end of 31st rnd.
32nd rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join E with sl st to first hdc.
33rd to 41st rnds: With E, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join A with sl st to first hdc at end of 41st rnd.
42nd rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
43rd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Straps (make 2).
With A, ch 111.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fold Handle in half lengthwise and working through both thicknesses to join 5th row to foundation row, work 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Version 1
Version 2

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 2 Skeins 0319 Cherry Red A and 1 skein 0311 White B
Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle, one 1” button
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Tote measures 10” x 12”
gauge: 16 sts = 4”; 16 rows = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
To Change Color In Sc: With present color draw up a loop in st before change then complete the sc with the next color. Carry color not in use loosely across top of row and work over it as you go.
SPECIAL PATTERN STITCHES
DOTS (Worked over a multiple of 4 sts + 3 sts):
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, 1 sc A, 1 sc B, * 3 sc A, 1 sc B; repeat from * to last st; 1 sc A; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across with A; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, 3 sc A, * 1 sc B, 3 sc A; repeat from * across; turn.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2.
Repeat Rows 1-4 for Dots pattern.
CHECKS (Worked over a multiple of 6 sts + 3 sts):
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, 3 sc A, * 3 sc B, 3 sc A; repeat from * across.
Rows 2 and 3: Repeat Row 1.
Rows 4, 5 and 6: Ch 1, 3 sc B, * 3 sc A, 3 sc B; repeat from * across.
Repeat Rows 1-6 for Checks pattern.
BASE-Row 1: With A, ch 16; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 15 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across.
Rows 3-47: Work Rows 1-4 of Dots pattern 11 times, then work 1 more A row. Fasten off.
With wrong side facing, join A and slip st in each st and row around base. Fasten off.
BACK: With wrong side facing, join A and work 47 sc along one long edge of Base. Work Rows 1-4 of Dots pattern 9 times, then repeat Dots pattern Row 1 again. Fasten off.
FRONT: Work same as for Back across remaining long edge of Base.
SIDES (Make 2): With wrong side facing join A and work 15 sc along side edge of Base. Work 37 sc rows even with A. Fasten off.
Sew back and front to sides.
LARGE POCKET: With A, ch 46.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 2 ch, * 3 sc B, 3 sc A; repeat from * across; turn – 45 sts.
Rows 2-24: Repeat Checks pattern Rows 2-6, then Rows 1-6 three times. ** Fasten off.
Edging-Rnd 1: With right side facing, join A in any st, leaving chain row free, and slip st around; join with a slip st in back loop of first slip st.
Rnd 2: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each slip st around; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Sew pocket to Back through sc rnd on 3 sides.
BOTTLE POCKET: With A, ch 22. Work same as Large Pocket over 21 sts to **.
Row 25: With A, ch 1, [sc in sc; draw up a loop in next 2 sc, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook] 7 times – 14 sts. Fasten off.
Edging: Work same as for Large Pocket. Sew to Side through sc row on 3 sides.
FLAP-Row 1: With right side of Back facing, skip 13 sc, join A in next sc; ch 1, sc in same sc and next 2 sc,[3 sc B, 3 sc A] 3 times; turn – 21 sts.
Rows 2-19: Repeat Checks pattern Rows 2-6, then Rows 1-6 twice, then Row 1 once more.
Shape Flap: Keeping continuity of pattern, decrease 1 st at each end of next 2 rows – 17 sts. Fasten off.
Bag and Flap Edging: With right side facing, join A in first sc to the left of the flap; ch 1, sc evenly around bag to flap, work 1 sc in each row down side of flap, 7 sc across end of flap, ch 3 for button loop, skip next 3 sc, 7 sc across end of flap, 1 sc in each row sc up side of flap to first sc; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Flap Edging-Row 1: With right side facing, join A in first sc at right edge of flap; ch 1, sc in each sc along flap, working 3 sc in ch-3 space; do not turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, working left to right, sc in each sc around flap for reverse sc. Fasten off.
Sew button in center of front about 4” from top edge.
STRAP (Make 2): With a double strand of A, skip first 5 sc on top edge of bag, join in next sc; ch 1, sc in same sc and in next 2 sc; turn – 3 sc. Work 75 rows of sc. Fasten off, leaving a long sewing strand. Leaving last 5 sc of top edge free, sew end of strap to opposite edge of same side of bag.
LITTLE POCKET: With A, ch 16. Work same as Large Pocket over 15 sts to **. Fasten off. Fold in half and sew side seams. Join A at seam; ch 1, sc around top edge; join with a slip st in first sc; ch 20, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 7 ch; hold chain next to top edge of bag front 6 sts from strap and slip st together the next 3 ch and next 3 sc of bag front, then slip st in remaining ch; slip st in first slip st. Fasten off. The little pocket will hold a cell phone and can be used on inside or outside of bag.

materials: RED HEART® Gumdrop®: 2 balls of 620 Cherry A
RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball of 2515 Turquoise E
RED HEART® Gumdrop®: 1 ball each of 620 Cherry A, 202 Lemon B, 625 Apple C, and 750 Grape D
RED HEART® Soft®: 2 balls 4604 Navy F
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4.25 mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle, ½ yd (46 cm) black cotton fabric.
Sewing needle and black sewing thread.
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E, F = color A, B, C, D, E, F
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Size 13” x 13” (33 x 33 cm) without handles
gauge: Square = 4” x 4” (10 x 10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
We show this easy-to-crochet purse in two equally stunning versions. The first is just two colors, while the second uses four bright colors set off by a dark navy.
Round 5: With right side facing, join next color with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in same ch-3 space, *[3 dc between next two 3-dc groups] 3 times**, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
ASSEMBLY
Bag #1 With right sides of Squares facing, using A, whipstitch squares into 3 strips of 6 squares each. Whipstitch strips together in like manner.
Bag #2 Arrange squares randomly. With right sides of Squares facing, using F, whipstitch Squares into 3 strips of 6 squares each. Whipstitch strips together in like manner.
Measure for Optional Lining
Measure assembled Squares before sewing side seams. It should measure approximately 13” x 26” (33 x 66 cm). Add 1” (2.5 cm) in both directions for seams. Should be approximately 14” x 27” (35.5 x 68.5 cm). Cut lining fabric to this size.
Sew Side Seams
Fold crocheted piece in half crosswise, with right sides together. Fold is at bottom of bag. Whipstitch lower 2 squares together on both sides of bag. Leave 1 pair of squares on both sides un-joined. If adding optional lining, leave bag inside-out. Otherwise, turn bag right-side out. 
LINING (optional)
Press ½” (13 mm) seam allowance to wrong side on top and bottom of lining fabric so that piece now measures 14” x 26” (35.5 x 66 cm). Fold piece in half with right sides together, and press bottom fold. Piece now measures 14” x 13” (35.5 x 33 cm). Sew ½” (13 mm) side seam starting 4” (10 cm) below top edge and sewing to bottom fold; repeat on other side of lining. Press seams open. Turn lining right side out. Place inside-out bag into inside-out lining. Sew lining to bag with sewing needle and thread along top edge (leaving tops of sts in Round 5 open to attach handle); continue sewing 4” (10 cm) down side, 4” (10 cm) up other side, along top of other side of bag, 4” (10 cm) down side and 4” (10 cm) up other side. When sewing, make sure you sew only partially through stitches so that thread does not show on outside of bag. Turn bag right side out, so lining is inside.
JOIN HANDLE
With right side facing, join Round 5 color with a slip st in in top right-hand corner ch-3 space on either side of bag, ch 1, sc in same space, working loosely (or stitches will not slide over bumps on handles), and holding top of one handle behind top edge of bag, insert hook between next two 3-dc groups and through handle, yarn over, draw through handle and 3-dc group, yarn over and draw through both loops on hook (sc made), working over handle, work 2 more sc in same space, [working over handle, work 3 sc between next two 3-dc groups] 3 times, *[working over handle, sc in next corner ch-3 space] twice, [working over handle, work 3 sc between next two 3-dc groups] 4 times; repeat from * once, sc in last corner ch-3 space. Fasten off. Repeat for other side and other handle. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat Handicrafter® Crochet Thread (85 g/3 oz; 339 m/371 yds or 400 g/14 oz; 1596 m/1746 yds)
Sizes 1.75 mm (U.S. 6) and 2.75 mm (U.S. C/2) steel crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Optional: lining fabric and matching thread.
abbreviations: Popcorn = 4 dc in next stitch. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook in first dc and pull dropped loop through.
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] wide x 14½" [37 cm] high, excluding straps.
gauge: 30 sc and 32 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook. Motif = 3¼" [8.5 cm] square with smaller hook.
instructions:
Motif (make 32). (See diagram on page 2).
With smaller hook, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook in top of ch 3 and pull dropped loop through – beg popcorn made. (Ch 1. Popcorn in next dc) twice. *Ch 5. (Popcorn in next dc. Ch 1) twice. Popcorn in next dc. Rep from * twice more. Ch 5. Join with sl st to top of beg popcorn.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Beg popcorn in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. Popcorn in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 3. 3 dc in center ch of next ch-5 sp. Ch 3.** Popcorn in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Popcorn in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of beg popcorn.
4th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Beg popcorn in same sp as sl st. *Ch 4. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. 3 dc in next dc. Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 4.** Popcorn in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to **. Join with sl st to top of beg popcorn.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *4 sc in next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in next dc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 5. Miss next 3 dc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next dc. 4 sc in next ch-4 sp.** 1 sc in next popcorn. Rep from * 3 times more, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dc in each of next 8 sc. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-5 sp. 1 dc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * 3 times more, omitting 1 dc at end of last rep. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
Finishing
Join Motifs tog into 4 Strips, each 8 Motifs long. Front and Back of Bag are each 4 Motifs wide x 4 Motifs high.
Join 2 Motifs: Place RS of Motifs tog. Working through both thicknesses, join yarn with sl st through corresponding corner ch-3 sps. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Working through back loops only, sl st in each sc to next corner ch-3 sp. 1 sc in last corner ch-3 sp. Fasten off.
Join Strips of Motifs in same manner, then join side seam in same manner.
Lower Edging: 1st row: (RS). Working through both thicknesses, join yarn with sl st through corresponding corner ch-3 sps at side seam. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. (Work 23 sc across Motif to next corner ch-3 sp. Sc2tog over next 2 corner ch-3 sps) 4 times. Turn. 97 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 8. Miss next 5 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(4 sc. Ch 3. Sl st in last sc worked – picot made. 4 sc) in next ch-8 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Top Edging: With smaller hook, ch 11. 1st row: 1 dc in 9th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 8. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Turn. Rep 2nd row 62 times more. Do not turn at end of last row.
Next row: (RS). Working down side of previous rows, ch 3. *(4 sc. Picot. 4 sc) in next ch-8 sp. Rep from * across. Fasten off.
Join to Bag: Next row: With RS facing and working into opposite side of edging, join yarn with sl st in first ‘unworked’ ch-8 sp. Ch 1. (4 sc. Ch 1. Sl st to corner ch-3 sp of Motif at side seam of top edge. Ch 1. Sl st in last sc worked. 4 sc) in same ch-8 sp as last sl st. *[(4 sc. Ch 1. Miss next 5 sc of Motif. Sl st in next sc of Motif. Ch 1. Sl st in last sc worked. 4 sc) in next ch-8 sp] 3 times.** (4 sc. Ch 1. Miss next 5 sc of Motif. Sl st in next corner ch-3 sp of Motif. Ch 1. Sl st in last sc worked. 4 sc) in next ch-8 sp. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Sew edging tog at side seam.
Straps (make 2): With 2 strands of yarn held tog and larger hook, ch 130. 1st rnd: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Working into rem loops along opposite side of ch, work 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Ch 1. Do not fasten off. Fold Strap in half lengthwise with RS facing each other (WS of last rnd will show). Join Strap by working 1 sc through tops of corresponding dc and foundation ch to end of row. Fasten off. Sew ends of Straps in position 3" [7.5 cm] from side edges as shown in photo.
Optional: Lining: Before joining lower edge and side seam, mark WS of lining fabric according to the shape of piece with ¾" [1.5 cm] seam allowance on side and bottom edges and ½" [1 cm] seam allowance on top edge. Cut out lining pieces. Sew bottom and side seams. Stitch along top edge of lining ½" [1 cm] from edge. Press lining to WS along this stitching line. Stitch in position to Bag.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 886 Blue A, 316 Soft White B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75mm [US F-5] and 5.0mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Bag measures 5” (13 cm) tall.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
BAG
With H hook and A, ch 17. 
Foundation Row: 2 sc in second ch from hook, 
sc in next 14 chs, 2 sc in last ch, do not turn; 
working along opposite side of foundation ch, 
sc in next 14 chs; do not join – 32 sc. 
Row 1: Sc in each sc around.
Repeat Row 1 until bag measures 4½” (11.4 
cm) tall.
Draw String Loops: Slip st in next sc, ch 1, 
sc in next sc, *ch 2, skip 2 sc; repeat from * 
around; join – 11 ch-2 spaces made.
Last Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc and 2 sc in each 
ch 2 space; join---32 sc made, Fasten off. 
Drawstrings (Make 2)
With H hook and B, work ch st until drawstring 
measures 17” (43 cm). Fasten off. 
Star
With F hook and A, ch 2. 
Round 1: 6 sc in second ch from hook; join – 
6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join – 
12 sc. Fasten off. 
Round 3: With B, ch 1, *sc in next sc, [sc, ch 
2, sc,] in next sc; repeat from * around; join – 
18 sc.
Round 4: Slip st in each sc to first ch-2 space, 
*ch 5, slip st in second ch from hook, ch 3, slip
st in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around;
join – 6 star points made.
 Fasten off, leaving
long tail for sewing to bag.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds; ombre: 56.7 g/2 oz; 86 m/95 yds)
Hippi (02122) 1 ball
Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball
Mod Green (01223) 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
1 button
abbreviations: sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 7" [18 cm] long, excluding tie.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 5.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Beg working in rnds: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. Working in rem loops, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd to 21st rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Beg working in rows: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Fasten off.
Finishing:
Sew button to bottom of Pencil Holder as shown in picture.
twisted cord: Cut 2 strands of yarn 75" [190.5 cm] long. With both strands tog, hold one end and with someone holding other end, twist strands to the right until they begin to curl. Fold the 2 ends tog and tie in a knot so they will not unravel. The strands will now twist themselves tog. Sew to top of pencil holder as shown in picture.
Pom-pom: Wind yarn around 3 fingers approx 50 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Attach to cord end.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 512 Turqua A, 316 Soft White B, and 672 Spring Green C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
3 Sheets Plastic Canvas Clear No: 33900-1: 10.5” x 13.5” [27 cm x 34 cm]
3 Sheets Rainbow Classic felt: 9” x 12” [23 cm x 30.5 cm]
matching silky cloth for lining
sewing needle and matching thread
scissors
measuring tape
yarn needle
stitch marker
pins
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Tote measures 28” [71 cm] around x 9” [23 cm] high
gauge: 13 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 10 rows = 3” [8 cm] in hdc pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Edging Round: Join C in same st as joining; ch 1, insert hook in last st worked and draw through a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook, * insert hook in next st to the right and draw through a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook; repeat from * around. Fasten off.
Handle (Make 2)
With A, ch 110.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd from hook and in each ch across; turn – 109 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Handle Edging Round: Join C in first sc of Row 2; ch 1, 3 sc in first sc, sc in each sc to last sc; 3 sc in last sc, working on opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each ch to last ch; 3 sc in last ch; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Fold bag flat. Sew ends of handles to bag 3½” [9 cm] from sides of bag.
Cut a vertical 4½” [11 cm] wide strip from one plastic canvas sheet and one felt sheet. Using the measurement or tracing of the bottom of the bag after Round 7, cut the plastic canvas to that measurement and cut the felt ½” [1.3 cm] larger all the way around. Pin together and sew the felt to the canvas, covering the cut edges with the excess felt. Place in bottom of bag felt side down. Secure with thread around the bottom of the bag.
With remaining canvas, arrange the sheets to make a circle that fits into bag, overlapping canvas edges by ½” [1.3 cm]. Trim excess from circle and at top of bag. Sew overlapped edges together.
TOTE
Bottom of tote
With C, ch 21.
Round 1: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 18 ch, 3 sc in last ch, working on opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 18 ch; do NOT join but work in continuous rounds – 42 sc. Place marker in first st and move up each round.
Round 2: * [Inc] 3 times, sc in next 18 sc; repeat from * once more – 48 sc.
Round 3: * [Inc] 6 times, sc in next 18 sc; repeat from * once more – 60 sc.
Round 4: Sc in next 2 sc, [inc] 6 times, sc in next 23 sc, [inc] 6 times, sc in next 23 sc – 72 sc.
Round 5: Sc in next 4 sc, [inc] 9 times, sc in next 25 sc, [inc] 9 times, sc in the next 25 sc – 90 sc.
Rounds 6 and 7: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off at end of Round 7. Measure or trace bottom of bag for lining.
Body of Bag
Round 8: With right side facing, join A in back loop of next sc; ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in back loop of next sc and each sc around; join with a slip st in top of ch-2 – 90 hdc.
Round 9: Ch 2, hdc between ch-2 of row below and next hdc, * hdc between next 2 hdc; repeat from * to last hdc; do NOT place hdc between last hdc and the ch-2 of row below; join – 90 hdc.
Repeat Round 9 for hdc pattern in the following color sequence: 2 more rounds A, [1 round C, 4 rounds B, 1 round C, 4 rounds A] twice.
With remaining felt, arrange the sheets to cover the outside of the canvas circle, overlapping edges and allowing an extra ½” [1.3 cm] at top and bottom. Trim excess. Sew to canvas circle, covering the cut edges with the excess felt. Place in bag with the felt side next to the bag so that the canvas will not show through. Secure with thread around the bottom of the bag.
Cut lining cloth 10” x 29” [25 cm x 74 cm] for bag and 4½” x 11” [44 x 28 cm] for bag bottom. Check for fit inside the bag, then remove, adjust if necessary and sew side and bottom seams with ½” [1.3 cm] seams. Insert finished lining into bag and sew to bag closely below the bag edging; tack to canvas around bottom.

materials: Caron® Cotton Cakes™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 211 yds/193 m) Boho Floral (49011) 3 balls
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times in indicated space. Yoh and draw through 6 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through rem 2 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] wide x 15" [38 cm] high, excluding handles.
gauge: 15 hdc and 10 rnds = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
Base: Ch 55.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 52 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 110 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 53 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 54 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 114 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 54 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 56 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 118 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 55 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 58 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 122 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 56 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 60 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 126 sc. Place marker on last st.
Main Section:
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc around, inc 4 sts evenly around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 130 hdc.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next sp between 2 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp. *1 hdc in each sp between 2 hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
3rd rnd: As 2nd rnd.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 Cluster in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 Cluster in next hdc. Rep from * around to last hdc. Ch 1. Skip last hdc. Join with sl st to top of first Cluster.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. 1 hdc in top of next Cluster. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdc in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Rep 2nd to 5th rnds for pat until work from marked rnd measures approx 12½" [32 cm], ending on a 4th rnd of pat.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in top of next Cluster. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures approx 14" [35.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Mark Sts for Handles: Fold Bag flat. Mark side sts. Place 2 markers for each handle, 13 sts away from each side st. (38 sts unworked between markers on Front and Back of Bag). Remove side st markers.
Make Handles:
1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st at left Back marker. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc to next marked st. 1 sc in next marked st. Ch 101 (for Handle). Skip next 38 sts. 1 sc in next marked st. 1 sc in each st to next marked st. 1 sc in next marked st. Ch 101 (for Handle). Skip next 38 sts. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc or ch around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 3 times more. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m) Main Color (MC) Yellow (07445) 1 ball
Contrast A White (07391) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] in diameter, excluding petals.
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Front and Back (make alike). 
With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc. 
Cont in same manner, inc 8 sts every rnd to 88 sc. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Gusset
With MC, ch 7. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each sc to end of ch. 6 sc. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg measures 22" [56 cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off. 
Pin Gusset to Front and Back, having top opening approx 4" [10 cm] wide. 
To join Back and Gusset: Join MC with sl st to beg of Gusset. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses (where appropriate), work 1 rnd of sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
To join Front and Gusset: Working along opposite side of Gusset, join A with sl st to beg of Gusset. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses (where appropriate), work 1 rnd of sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not fasten off. Cont as follows for Petals:
First Petal: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 11 sc.
**2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. 14 sc. Turn. 
3rd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sts. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
Rep last row 3 times more. 6 sts.
Next row: (RS). Skip first 2 sts. 6 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 sts. Sl st in last sc. Fasten off.** 
Second to Eighth Petals: With RS of work facing, join A with sl st to next skipped sc of joining rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 11 sc. 
Work from ** to ** as given for First Petal. 
Eyes (make 2). 
With A, ch 2. 
1st row: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc across. 8 sc. 
Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off. 
Shoulder Straps (make 2). 
With MC, ch 49. 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of ch. 47 sts. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row twice more. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Sew Straps to Back of Bag. Sew Eyes in position. With A, embroider eyelashes and mouth with stem st as shown in picture.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) Contrast A Yellow (00010) 3 balls or  330 m/363 yds
Contrast B Black (00002) 1 ball or 30 m/33 yds
Contrast C White (00001) 1 ball or 20 m/22 yds
Contrast D Tangerine (01699) 1 ball or 20 m/22 yds
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Coats & Clark™ 20" [51 cm] long Polyester All-Purpose Zipper in Black (002) or Coats & Clark™ Yarn Zip 22" [56 cm] long
Dual Duty XP® All-Purpose Thread in Black (900)
2 stitch markers
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdc4tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) 4 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] wide x 14" [35.5 cm] high x 3" [7.5 cm] deep
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 for turning ch does not count as hdc.
Front and Back (make 2 pieces alike)
With A and smaller hook, ch 35.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 33 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures 9" [23 cm], ending with a RS row.

Shape top: 1st row:  (WS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Sc2tog. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: As 1st row.
4th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each st to last 2 sc. Hdc2tog. Turn.
5th to 8th rows:  Rep last 2 rows twice more.
9th row:  As 1st row. 17 sts rem. Fasten off.

Base and Gusset
With A and smaller hook, ch 12.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures 9" [23 cm], ending with a WS row. Place marker at end of last row.

Divide for zipper opening: 
Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Cont in pat on 5 sts until opening from marker measures 20" [51 cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off.
With RS facing, rejoin A with sl st to unworked sts. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of last 4 sts. Turn.
Cont in pat on 5 sts until opening measures 20" [51 cm], ending with a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Join sides: Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sc from first side. 10 hdc. Turn. Place marker on last st.
Cont in pat until work from marker measures 9" [23 cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off. Sew last row and foundation row tog (center of bottom base).

Wings (make 2)
With C and smaller hook, ch 8. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
8 hdc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. (1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 3 times. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 12 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) 5 times. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 18 hdc.
4th rnd:  Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. (1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 8 times. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 27 hdc.
Fold work flat.

Joining row:  Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 13 sc evenly across. Turn.
Next row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 3. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.

Antennae (make 2)
With B and smaller hook, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
4 hdc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
8 hdc. 
4th rnd:  Ch 2. (Hdc4tog) twice. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end onto yarn needle and draw tightly through rem 2 sts.

Pocket
With A and smaller hook, ch 33.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 31 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc to end of row. Join B. Turn. 
3rd row: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc to end of row. Join A. Turn. 
5th row:  With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Sc2tog. Join B. 
Turn.
7th row: As 3rd row.
8th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Sc2tog. Join A. 
Turn. 
9th row:  With A, ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each sc to last 2 sc. Hdc2tog. Turn.
10th row: As 6th row.
11th row: With B, ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each sc to last 2 sc. Hdc2tog. Turn.
12th and 13th rows:  As 8th and 9th rows.
14th row: As 6th row. Fasten off. 15 sts rem.

Pocket edging:  (RS). Join B with sl st at lower right corner. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around outer edge of Pocket to opposite corner. Fasten off. Leave edge of foundation row unworked.

Hanging loop
With D and smaller hook, ch 22.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 21 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row once more. Fasten off.

Straps (make 2)
With 2 strands of D and larger hook, ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. Turn. 5 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Strap measures 16" [40.5 cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off.

Eyes (make 2)
With B and smaller hook, ch 3.
1st rnd: 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long end.

FINISHING
Sew Eyes to Front as shown in photo. Embroider mouth with B, using chain stitch as shown in photo. Sew Pocket to Front leaving top edge open.
Pin Gusset and Base to outer edges of Front and Back, having Base seam at center of bottom edge.
Joining rnd:  With smaller hook and, RS of Front facing and working through both thicknesses, join A with sl st at center of bottom edge. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around to join Gusset and Base to Front. Join D with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Rep these 2 rnds to join outer edge of Back, Gusset and Base.
Sew Wings and Antennae to outer edge of Front (behind joining rnds) as shown in photo.
Sew zipper in position along Gusset opening. Attach Hanging Loop as shown in picture. Sew Straps in position.

materials: Patons® Linen™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 275 yds/251 m) Blue Hosta (14015) 2 balls
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 12½" x 14½" [32 x 37 cm], excluding handles.
gauge: 18 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: Ch 4 at beg of rnd counts as dc and ch 1.
Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Ch 112. Join to beg working in rnd, being careful not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 112 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
Rep last rnd until work measures 2" [5 cm].
MATERIALS
Patons® Linen™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 275 yds/251 m)
Blue Hosta (14015) 2 balls
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge. Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Approx = Approximately
Beg = Beginning
Ch = Chain(s)
Dc = Double crochet
Pat = Pattern
Rem = Remaining
Rep = Repeat
Rnd(s) = Round(s)
RS = Right side
Sc = Single crochet
Sl st(s) = Slip stitch(es)
Sp(s) = Space(s)
St(s) = Stitch(es)
Tog = Together
WS = Wrong side
Nicole Winer
Designer
CROCHET  I  SKILL LEVEL: EASY
Beg working in Dotty Pat (see diagram on page 3) as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 4. *Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-4.
2nd rnd: Ch 4. Skip next st. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next st) twice. *1 dc in each of next 3 sts (in dc. Ch-1 sp. dc). (Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 dc in next dc) 6 times. Ch 1. Skip next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-4.
3rd rnd: Ch 4. Skip next st. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. *1 dc in each of next 5 sts. (Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 dc in next dc) 5 times. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-4.
4th rnd: Ch 4. Skip next st. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. *1 dc in each of next 7 sts. (Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 dc in next dc) 3 times. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-4.
5th and 6th rnds: As 4th rnd, twice.
7th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 4. Skip next st. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next st) twice. *1 dc in each of next 3 sts. (Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 dc in next dc) 6 times. Ch 1. Skip next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-4.
9th rnd: Ch 4. Skip next st. *1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-4.
10th rnd: Ch 4. (Skip next st. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1) twice. Skip next st. *(dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next st.) 4 times. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts (dc. Ch-1 sp. dc).  (Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Ch 1. Skip next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-4.
11th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next st. *(1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next st) 3 times. 1 dc in each of next 7 sts. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
12th to 14th rnds: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. Ch 1. Skip next st. *(1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next st) twice. 1 dc in each of next 11 sts. Ch 1. Skip next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
15th rnd: As 11th rnd.
16th rnd: As 10th rnd.
17th rnd: As 9th rnd.
18th to 25th rnds: Rep 2nd to 9th rnds once more.
26th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc and ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 112 dc.
27th and 28th rnds: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
HANDLES
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 1 sc in each of next 17 dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
**Handle: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of 8 sc. Turn.
Rep last row until Handle measures 22" [56 cm], ending on a RS row.
Join Handle: Ch 1. Skip next 20 dc at top of bag. With WS of Handle and Bag tog, align 8 sts of Handle with next 8 dc of Bag. Working through both thicknesses, join Handle to Bag with sl st in each of next 8 sts.** Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 28 dc (at top edge of Bag). Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Work from ** to ** as given for Handle.
Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 dc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Finish Handles: Fold Handle in half with side edges tog. Join yarn with sl st to bottom of handle. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc evenly along edge to join sides of Handle. Fasten off at end of Handle.
Rep for other Handle.
Sew base of Bag closed.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) Tangerine (01699) 3 balls (250 m/275 yds)
Size U.S F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Purchased handle approx 22" [56 cm] long with metal rings.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcbp made.
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] wide x 10" [25.5 cm] high (excluding handle).
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Front and Back (make 2 pieces alike). (See Chart I on page 2). Ch 27.
1st row: (RS). Working in horizontal ‘bump’ at back of each ch, sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 26 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in each of next 22 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
3rd and alt rows: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in each of next 18 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
6th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in each of next 14 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
8th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in each of next 10 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
10th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in each of next 10 sts. Sl st in each of next 4 missed sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
12th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in each of next 14 sts. Sl st in each of next 4 missed sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
14th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in each of next 18 sts. Sl st in each of next 4 missed sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
16th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in each of next 22 sts. Sl st in each of next 4 missed sts. Turn. 26 sts.
17th row: As 3rd row.
Rep 2nd to 17th rows 7 times more, then rep 2nd to 16th rows once. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end onto tapestry needle and draw tightly through narrow row ends at center. Fasten securely.
Edging: (See Chart II). 
1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st at outer edge. Ch 1. Work 73 sc along outer edge to opposite corner. Fasten off.
2nd row: (RS). Inserting hook from back to front, work sl st around post of 1st sc of last row. Ch 2 (counts as st). Dcbp around post of each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Join Front and Back: Place RS of Front and Back tog and pin edging sts tog. Working through both thicknesses and in back loop only of each st across, join yarn with sl st in first dcbp. Sl st in each dcbp to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew handle rings in position at each side of Bag as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Main Color (MC) Black (0312) 1 ball or 165 yds/151 m
Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m) Contrast A Silver Sea (2039) 1 ball or 334 yds/305 m
Contrast B Scarlet Sands (2040) 1 ball 334 yds/305 m
Sizes U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) and U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Pair of wooden bag handles with approx 6" [15 cm] wide internal opening.
measurements: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] wide x 18" [45.5 cm] tall x 6" [15 cm] deep, excluding handles.
gauge: Motif = Approx 6” [15 cm] square with larger hook. 15 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
MOTIF (Make 3 each with A and B for sides of Tote).
Notes:
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4” [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• Each color aligns with 1 rnd in the Motif with 5 colors in total. 
• If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• When Motif is complete, cut yarn where Color 5 (longest color rep) ends, leaving a tail for weaving in. Begin next Motif with Color 1 and repeat 5 rnds for each Motif.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
With Color 1 and larger hook, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off.
Whipstitch squares tog into 2 Strips of 3 Motifs as shown in diagram below. 
Border 
Join MC with sl st to top left ch-3 sp of Strip.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same ch-3 sp. (1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch-3 sps) twice. (1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp) twice. (1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch-3 sps) twice. 1 sc in each dc and ch-2 sp to next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. 149 sc. Fasten off.
Rep for other Strip. 
Base and Front/Back of Bag (make 2)
Notes:
• Beg with Base, Front/Back are worked with smaller hook to add structure to Tote. 
• There is a slight variation in Granny Cluster Pat for this section with no ch-1 sps worked between 3-dc clusters. 
• When working Granny Stripe Pat, carry color not in use loosely up edge of work.
With MC and smaller hook, ch 60. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 59 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 6" [15 cm], ending on a WS row.
Granny Stripe Pat
With A, work 2 rows.
With B, work 2 rows.
These 4 rows form Granny Stripe Pat.
Proceed as follows (see diagram on page 3):
1st row: (RS). With A, ch 2. 1 dc in first sc. Skip next sc. *3 dc in in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 3 dc in next sc. Skip next sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc between first dc and next 3 dc. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc between 3 dc just skipped and next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next 3 dc. 1 dc between 3 dc just skipped and last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. Join B. 
3rd row: With B, ch 2. 1 dc in first dc. Skip next dc. 3 dc between dc just skipped and next 3 dc. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc between 3 dc just skipped and next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 5 dc. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc between 3 dc just skipped and last 2 dc. Skip next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
First 3 rows of Granny Stripe Pat are now in place. Keeping cont of Granny Stripe Pat, rep last 2 rows for Granny Cluster Pat until work from beg measures approx 21" [53.5 cm]. Fasten off.
With MC, whipstitch front to back along foundation ch edge - see 'Seam' on diagram.
With larger hook, join MC with sl st to upper left corner of Front.
Working down long edge of Front and Back, work 149 sc evenly down edge. Fasten off.
Join MC with sl st to upper left corner of back and rep for opposite side.
FINISHING
With WS of Bag Front/Back and Strip facing, and matching points A, B, and C as marked in diagram, join MC with sl st to point marked A. Join Bag Front/Back to Strip by working 1 row of sc through both thicknesses. Fasten off at point C.
Rep for opposite side (marked D, E, F), joining with sl st at point D and fastening off at point F.
Handle Tabs (make 2)
With smaller hook and MC, ch 23.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 22 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 3" [7.5 cm]. Fasten off. Fold Handle Tabs around purchased handle as shown in photo. With Handle Tabs held against RS of work and centered along top of Bag as shown in photo, whipstitch to Bag through all 3 thicknesses.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein 1101 Eggshell A
RED HEART® Boutique Sassy Lace™: 1 hank 9001 Vanilla B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [J-10 US]
Yarn needle
30” (76 cm) length of satin ribbon, 5/8” (16mm) wide
5mm [H-8 US] (for optional chain drawstrings)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Bag measures 8” wide x 7” high (20.5 x 18 cm), including ruffles and with open top
gauge: 14 rows = 4” (10 cm) in mesh pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Bag is worked from bottom up in 6 joined rounds with right side facing, then remainder of piece is worked in turned rounds. Drawstrings are woven through eyelet row.

With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc, turn—36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first st, *[ch 2, skip next st, sc in next st] 4 times, ch 2, sc in next st; repeat from * twice, [ch 2, skip next st, sc in next st] 4 times, ch 2; join with slip st in first sc, turn—20 sc and 20 ch-2 spaces.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in first ch-2 space, [ch 2, skip next sc, sc in next ch-2 space] 19 times, ch 2; join with slip st in first sc, turn.
Round 9 (right side): Ch 1, sc in first ch-2 space, [ch 2, skip next sc, sc in next ch-2 space] 19 times, ch 2, holding B to right side of piece with first hole at first sc; join with slip st in first sc, turn.
Note: Be sure to work Round 10 with B on right (inner) side of piece.
Round 10: Ch 1, rfsc in first ch-2 space, [ch 2, skip next sc, rfsc in next ch-2 space] 19 times; join with slip st to first rfsc, turn—20 rfsc and 20 ch-2 spaces.
Rounds 11–13: Repeat Round 8 three times.
Round 14: Repeat Round 10.
Rounds 15–22: Repeat Rounds 11–14 twice.
Rounds 23–25: Repeat Round 8 three times.
Round 26: Ch 1, rfsc in first ch-2 space, [ch 2, skip next sc, rfsc in next ch-2 space] 19 times; leaving a 3” (7.5 cm) tail, cut B, fold tail back so that next 2 holes are aligned together; working though last 2 holes, join with slip st to first rfsc, turn—20 rfsc and 20 ch-2 spaces.
Round 27 (eyelet row): Ch 1, sc in first ch-2 space, [ch 4, skip next sc, sc in next ch-2 space] 19 times, ch 4; join with slip st in first sc, turn—20 sc and 20 ch-4 spaces.

Round 28: Ch 1, sc in next ch-4 space, [ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-4 space] 19 times, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—20 sc and 20 ch-1 spaces.
Round 29: Ch 1, reverse sc in each sc and ch-1 space around; join with slip st in first sc—40 sc.

FINISHING
Tie a tight knot in the ends of B close to the inside of bag and trim excess yarn.
Either ribbon or yarn chain drawstrings can be made.

Ribbon Drawstrings: Cut satin ribbon into two 15” (38 cm) lengths. Weave each ribbon through 20 consecutive spaces of eyelet row and adjust so tails hang evenly at each end. Knot 2 tails tightly at each side and trim ribbon to desired length.

Yarn Chain Drawstrings (make 2): With smaller hook and A, ch 64. Fasten off. Weave each drawstring chain through 20 consecutive spaces of eyelet row and adjust so tails hang evenly at each end. Knot 2 tails tightly at each side.

Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Ribbons®: 1 ball 1944 Laguna A

Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.5mm [US E-4]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Bag measures 7” x 6” (18cm x 15cm)
gauge: 20 sc = 4” (10cm); 24 rows = 4” (10cm) in sc worked in the round. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Got-to-Have-It 
Bag
This little bag is perfect whatever your age! 
Crocheted with a plain yarn and also a ribbon 
yarn that ruffles, it has a spirited look you’ll 
love any time of the day or evening.
Round 5: With B, sc in each sc around.
Round 6: *With B, sc in next sc and over next 
ladder space of A, sc in next sc and same 
ladder space of A; repeat from * around.
Rounds 7-36: Repeat Rounds 5-6, 12 times; 
on Round 36, join last st with slip st in first st.
Fasten off A and B.
Handles (Make 2)
With B, ch 6, leaving long beginning tail for 
sewing.
Round 1: Sc in second ch from hook and in 
each ch across; join with sc in first st to form 
ring – 5 sc.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Repeat Round 2 until tube measures 10”  
(25 cm).
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Fold Bag in half. Using photo as a guide, skip 
8 sc from edge, sew one end of Handle over 
next 3 sc, skip 11 sc, sew other end of Handle 
over next 3 sc. Repeat on other side of Bag 
with other Handle.
Weave in ends.
ABBREVIATIONS
A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc; ch = 
chain; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; 
st(s) = stitch(es); * or ** = repeat whatever 
follows the * or ** as indicated.
Bag measures 7” x 6” (18cm x 15cm)
Note: Yarn is sufficient to make 2 bags
Notes
Bottom Base is worked in turned rows. Body is 
worked in continuous rounds; do not join and 
do not turn unless otherwise indicated. Place 
marker to indicate beginning of round; move 
marker up as work progresses.
Ribbons yarn A is joined to Body by working 
over ladder spaces with B.
BAG
Bottom Base
With B, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and in each 
ch across – 5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn; sc in each sc across.
Work Row 2 until piece measures 6.5” 
(16.5cm).
Body
Note: Round 1 is a joining round worked 
around entire Bottom Base.
Round 1 (RS): Ch 1, turn; sc in each sc across; 
rotate piece to work across row ends, (sc in 
each of next 3 row ends, skip next row) for 30 
sc; rotate piece to work across opposite side 
of foundation ch, sc in each ch across; rotate 
piece to work across row ends, (sc in each of 
next 3 row ends, skip next row) for 30 sc; join 
with slip st in first st, ch 1, turn – 70 sc.
Round 2 (WS): Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: Repeat Round 2.
Round 4: Hold A behind piece with short 
ladder edge across top, with B, sc in next sc 
and over first ladder space of A, sc in next sc 
and same ladder space of A, *with B, sc in 
next sc and over next ladder space of A, sc in 
next sc and same ladder space of A; repeat 
from * around.
Stitch marker, yarn needle
GAUGE: 20 sc = 4” (10cm); 24 
rows = 4” (10cm) in sc worked in 
the round. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
Use any size hook to obtain the 
gauge.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Wine (00015) 1 ball or 80 yds/73 m
Contrast B Country Red (01530) 1 ball or 80 yds/73 m
Contrast C Red (00095) 1 ball or 80 yds/73 m
Contrast D White (00001) 1 ball or 70 yds/64 m
Size U.S G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] wide x 15" [38 cm] high.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
BAG
Note: To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed in new color.
Stripe Pat
With A, work 2 rnds.
With B, work 2 rnds.
With C, work 2 rnds.
With D, work 2 rnds.
These 8 rnds form Stripe Pat.
Beg at base, with A, ch 39.
1st rnd: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 36 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Working into rem loops of foundation ch, work 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Join with sl st to first sc. 78 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
First 2 rnds of Stripe Pat complete.
Cont in Stripe Pat, rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures 13" [33 cm]. Do not fasten off.
Shape handles: Cont in Stripe Pat as follows:
Next rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 18 sc. Ch 21. Skip next 21 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 18 sc. 1 sc in each of next 21 ch) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 78 sc.
Next 6 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m)
Main Color (MC) Clay (53041) 1 ball
Contrast A Bronze (53609) 1 ball
Contrast B Rouge (53531) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] wide and 10" [33 cm] high, excluding handles.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
BAG (See Diagram I on page 3.) Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout. With larger hook and MC, ch 84. Join in ring with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: (Base rnd). Ch 3. 1 dc in each ch around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 84 dc.
2nd rnd: (Tears rnd). Ch 1. Work 5 dc down post of first dc of previous rnd. Ch 1. Work 5 dc up post of 2nd dc of previous rnd – beg scale st made. Miss next 5 dc. *Work 5 dc down post of next dc of previous rnd. Ch 1. Work 5 dc up post of next dc of previous rnd – scale st made. Miss next 5 dc. Rep from * 11 times more. Join with sl st to ch 1.
3rd rnd: (Base rnd). Sl st to 3rd dc of next missed 5-dc group of previous rnd. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc between 2 dc of scale st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc.** 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * 11 times more; then rep from * to ** once more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: (Tears rnd). Ch 1. Beg scale st. Miss next 5 dc. *Scale st. Miss next 5 dc. Rep from * 11 times more. Join with sl st to ch 1.
Rep 3rd and 4th rnds for pat until work from beg measures approx 8" [20.5 cm]. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc of last base rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 84 sc. Fasten off. 
Bag Edging: With smaller hook, join A with sl st to any sc.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as last sl st. Miss next 2 sc. *3 sc in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next sc. Ch 1. *3 sc in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until edging measures 2" [5 cm]. Fasten off.
HANDLES (make 2). With larger hook and 2 strands of A, ch 4.
1st rnd: Draw up a loop in 2nd ch from hook. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 ch (4 loops on hook). 
2nd rnd: Drop all loops from hook. Pick up last loop worked (4th loop). Working from right to left, insert hook in 1st loop (this will cause a circle to form). Yoh and draw through loop. Insert hook into 2nd loop. Yoh and draw through loop. Insert hook into 3rd loop. (4 loops on hook).
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm] long. Break yarn, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts and fasten securely.
FLOWER (See Diagram II on page 3). With larger hook and B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. Rep from * once more. Do not join with sl st. 3 petals.
3rd rnd: Do not ch 1. Working in rem back loops of 1st rnd, 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. Do not join with sl st. 6 petals.
5th rnd: Do not ch 1. Working in rem back loops of 3rd rnd, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. Rep from * 7 times more. Do not join with sl st. 9 petals.
7th rnd: Do not ch 1. Working in rem back loops of 5th rnd, 2 sc first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. Rep from * 10 times more. Do not join with sl st. 12 petals.
9th rnd: Do not ch 1. Working in rem back loops of 7th rnd, 2 sc first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. Rep from * 13 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 15 petals.
FINISHING
Join bottom edge: With larger hook, join MC with sl st at bottom edge. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sl st across bottom edge to join. Fasten off.
Sew Handles and Flower to top of Bag as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 369 Mushroom A, 313 Aran B, 3949 Reef C, 326 Oatmeal D, and 3862 Jade E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Pompom maker for 2" [5 cm] and 3" [7.5 cm] pompoms
One 18mm sew-on magnetic snap
Sewing needle and matching thread
7-8" [18-20.5 cm] piece of heavy cardboard (for making tassels)
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, B, C, etc.
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Bag measures about 16" [40.5 cm] wide and 13" [33 cm] high, not including handles.
gauge: 14 sc = about 4" [10 cm]; 12 rows = about 4" [10 cm] in flame stitch pattern (used in body of bag). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BODY
With A, ch 80 loosely.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—79 sc.
Row 2 (right side): With A, ch 1, turn, sc in first st, *hdc in next st, dc in next st, 3 tr in next st, dc in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * across; change to B in last st.
Rows 3 and 4: With B, ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts, *3 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, sc3tog, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * to last 5 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog; change to C in last st of Row 4.
Row 5: With C, ch 4, turn, skip first st, tr in next st (beginning ch-4 and following tr count as tr2tog), dc in next st, hdc in next st, *sc in next st, hdc in next st, dc in next st, tr3tog, dc in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * to last 5 sts, sc in next st, hdc in next st, dc in next st, tr2tog.
Rows 6 and 7: With C, ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 8: With C, repeat Row 2; change to B in last st.
Rows 9 and 10: With B, repeat Rows 3 and 4; change to D in last st of Row 10.
Rows 11-13: With D, repeat Rows 5–7.
Row 14: With D, repeat Row 2; change to E in last st.
Rows 15 and 16: With E, repeat Rows 3 and 4; change to A in last st of Row 16.
Rows 17–19: With A, repeat Rows 5–7.
Rows 20-37: Repeat Rows 2-19.
Rows 38-48: Repeat Rows 2-12.
Fasten off.

HANDLES (make 2)
With E, ch 81.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch to last ch, 2 sc in last ch—82 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st—88 sc in Row 4.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Rows 6–9: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog—80 sc in Row 9.
Fasten off.

POMPOMS
