Make as many pompoms as desired using yarn colors of your choice. Following package instructions make 2" [5 cm] and 3" [7.5 cm] pompoms. Leave ends of pompom tie for attaching pompom to bag.

TASSELS
Make as many tassels as desired using yarn colors of your choice. Wrap yarn color of your choice about 20 times around 7-8" [18-20.5 cm] piece of heavy cardboard. Thread a 14-16" [35.5-40.5 cm] length of yarn under the top of the wraps and tie into a tight knot for top of tassel. Do not cut ends of tie, leave ends for attaching tassel to bag. Slip wraps off of cardboard. Tie a 14-16" [35.5-40.5 cm] length of yarn around wraps about ¾-1" [19-25 mm] from top for tassel neck. Wrap ends of tie around wraps several times and then draw ends to inside of tassel. Cut the lower ends of the wraps and trim to even.

FINISHING
Weave in ends on wrong side of body. Fold body of bag in half and sew side edges together.

Top Band
With right side facing, join A with slip st in the top of one of the side seams.
Round 1: Ch 1, work sc evenly spaced all the way around top edge of body; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 2–6: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.

Using photograph as a guide, sew ends of handles to outside of top band. Tie pompoms and tassels to top corners of bag. Sew magnetic closure to inside center of top band. Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: Bernat Handicrafter Cotton (Solids: 50 g/1.75 oz or Ombres: 42.5 g/1.5 oz)
Size 4 mm (U.S. 6 or G) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
3 balls of Main Color (MC) and 2 balls of Contrast A and 1 ball of Contrast B
Version 1: MC (Sage Green 84), A (Country Sage ombre 23233), B (Natural ombre 112)
Version 2: MC (Buttercream ombre 106), A (Cream 13003), B (Ecru 04)
Version 3: MC (Rose Pink 13046), A (Banana Yellow 89), B (Spring Meadow 51)
Version 4: MC (Cornflower Blue 83), A (White 01), B (Cool Breeze ombre 110)
Version 5: MC (Cornflower Blue 83), A (Banana Yellow 89), B (Violet Veil ombre 107)
Version 6: MC (Faded Denim 23181), A (Denim Blue 23192)
Version 7: MC (Rose Pink 13046), A (Strawberry 23144)
measurements: Approx 9 ins [23 cm] square.
gauge: One Motif = 3½ ins [9 cm] square.
instructions:
3 COLOR VERSION
Motif (make 8)
With B, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc in ring) 3 times. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join MC with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp. [Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join A with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp. [Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.

2 COLOR VERSION
Motif (make 8)
Work as given for Motif of 3 Color Version, substituting A for B.
Both Versions: Sew 4 motifs tog for Front and Back.

Edging: Join MC with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 4 dc in same sp. *(1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in sp between 2 Motifs. (1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc.** 5 dc in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.

Place WS of Back and Front tog. Join MC at top left corner and work 1 row of sc around opposite corner to join 3 sides of Bag.

Top Edging: With RS of work facing, join MC at seam and work 1 rnd of sc around top of Bag. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Handles (make 2)
With MC, ch 49.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. 47 dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as first dc). 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: As 2nd row. Do not turn.
Fold Handle in half lengthwise. Work 1 row of sc through rem loop of foundation ch and corresponding st of last row to join edges tog. Fasten off. 
Sew on Handles as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 316 Soft White A and 312 Black B.
Crochet Hook: Size G-6 [4mm].
Yarn needle, small amount of polyfill stuffing.
measurements: Bag measures 11” long excluding handles.
gauge: 5 sts and 4 rows in pattern = 1½”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
With A, starting at bottom, ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in next ch, *sc in next ch, 2 sc in next ch; repeat from * across; turn – 18 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across; turn – 24 sc.
Rows 3-5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 6: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), skip first sc, dc in each sc across; turn – 24 dc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each dc across; turn.
Rows 8-13: Repeat rows 6-7 (3 times).
Row 14: Repeat row 6.
Row 15: Ch 1, starting in first dc, *sc in next dc, 2 sc in next dc; repeat from * across; turn – 36 sc.
Rows 16-25: Repeats rows 6-7 (5 times).
Row 26: Repeat row 6.
Row 27: Ch 1, starting in first dc, [sc2tog over next 2 dc] 6 times, sc in next 12 dc, [sc2tog over next 2 dc] 6 times; turn – 24 sc.
Rows 28-29: Repeat rows 6-7. Do not turn at end of last row. Do not fasten off.
Edging: Ch 1, sc evenly around, working 40 sc across side edge, 12 sc across bottom edge, 40 sc across opposite side edge, and 24 sc across top edge, join with a slip st in first sc – 116 sc. Fasten off.
Mouth: With B, back st a straight line across the center 12 sts of row 9 for mouth; make 4 vertical straight sts evenly spaced across mouth.
Nose
With A, ch 2.
Row 1: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn – 3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc; turn – 4 sc.
Rows 4-8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in next sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in last 2 sc; turn – 6 sc.
Row 10: Slip st in first 2 sc, sc in next 2 sc; turn leaving remaining sts unworked.
Rows 11-12: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 13: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sc – 1 st. Fasten off leaving a sewing length. Stuff nose lightly. With yarn needle and sewing length, sew nose in place above mouth.
Nostril (make 2)
With B, ch 3.
Rnd 1: 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (ch-2 counts as first hdc); join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 9 hdc.
Eye (make 2) 
With B, ch 3.
Rnd 1: Repeat round 1 of nostril. Do not fasten off.
Rnd 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, 2 sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc – 18 sc.
FINISHING
With wrong sides of 2 sides of bag facing, working through double thickness in back loops only of edging, join A, in top left-hand corner, ch 1, sc across left side edge, bottom edge and right side edge. Fasten off. 
Handle (make 2): With A, ch 51.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 50 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3, skip first sc, dc in each sc across; turn – 50 dc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc across. Fasten off leaving a sewing length. Sew ends of one handle to front and back of bag as pictured.

materials: 5 balls 2510 Aquamarine A
1 ball each of 2640 Thyme B
2925 Passionfruit C
2260 Clementine D
2205 Little Lamb E
2701 Cupcake F
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E, and F = color A, color B, color C, etc.
measurements: Tote measures 17” wide x 15” high, after felting (not including handles).
gauge: 10 sts and 4 rows = 3” in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTES 
1. Body of tote is worked in joined rounds, with right side facing at all times. Join, but do not turn at the end of rounds.
2. More or fewer leaves, roses, and curls can be made and sewn to top of tote, as desired.
TOTE
Beginning at lower edge of tote, with A, ch 51.
Round 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 48 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 48 ch, 2 sc in last ch; join with slip st in first sc, do not turn—102 sc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in same sc as joining, dc in next 48 sc, 3 dc in each of next 3 sc, dc in next 48 sc, 3 dc in each of last 2 sc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—114 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same ch as joining, 2 dc in each of next 2 dc, dc in next 48 dc, 2 dc in each of next 9 dc, dc in next 48 dc, 2 dc in each of last 6 dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—132 dc.
Rounds 4–34: Ch 3, dc in each dc around.
Round 35: Ch 1, sc in same ch as joining, sc in each dc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
Handle (make 2)
With A, ch 70.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc) and in each remaining ch across, turn—68 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), working in back loops only, dc in each dc across, turn.
Fold handle lengthwise, bringing foundation ch up to meet last row of stitches.
Last Row (joining row): Ch 1, working through both thicknesses, sc in each st across to join long edges of piece together. Fasten off.
rose garden tote
Tote your current crochet project in this vibrant bag of roses or use it as your everyday bag. Wherever it goes, it’s sure to make you smile!
LEAF (make 7)
With B, ch 10.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next 5 ch, hdc in next ch, 5 hdc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next 5 ch, hdc in next ch, sc in next ch, turn—21 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, hdc in next hdc, dc in next 5 dc, hdc in next 3 hdc, 5 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next 3 hdc, dc in next 5 dc, hdc in next hdc, sc in last sc, turn—25 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 12 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in last 12 sts—27 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
CURLS (make 6)
With B, ch 30.
Row 1: Work 2 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc), 3 dc in each remaining ch across—81 dc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
LARGE ROSES (make 8 – 1 with C, 2 each with D and E, and 3 with F)
Ch 15.
Row 1: Work 4 tr in 5th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first tr), 5 tr in each remaining ch across, turn—55 tr.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in first tr, 2 dc in each of next 19 tr, hdc in next tr, sc in each remaining tr across—75 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
SMALL ROSES (make four – 1 each with C, D, E, and F)
Ch 15.
Row 1: Work 4 tr in 5th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first tr), 5 tr in each remaining ch across, turn—55 tr. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Attach Handle: Sew ends of one handle to top front of bag, placing each end about 5” in from side edge. Sew ends of 2nd handle to top back of bag, placing each end about 5” in from side edge.
Attach Roses, Leaves and Curls: Roll roses into spirals and use tail to sew lower edges together to retain shape. Arrange leaves, curls, and roses across top front edge of tote, as desired or using photograph as guide. Weave in ends.
Felt Tote: Place tote in washing machine. Wash using hot water, maximum agitation, and a small amount of laundry soap. Check progress of felting every 3-5 minutes. Remove tote from washer before spin cycle. Repeat wash cycle until desired level of felting is achieved. Gently squeeze excess water from tote, pull into shape and allow piece to dry. Hints: A few pairs of jeans or a couple of old bath towels (avoid very fluffy towels that may produce lint) can be added to the washing machine to increase agitation. Place tote in a lingerie bag or pillow case before felting to capture lint.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton Country Colors (Solids 400 g / 14 oz) - 1 ball of #27106 (Country Blue)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Length of ½ inch [1 cm] wide grosgrain ribbon.
measurements: Approx 10½ ins [26.5 cm] wide x 15 ins [38 cm] high.
gauge: 13 dc and 7 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Beg at base, ch 34.
1st rnd: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 29 ch. 3 dc in last ch. Working
into rem loops of foundation ch, work 1 dc in each ch to last ch. 2 dc in last ch. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
66 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures 13 ins [33 cm].
Shape handles: Next rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Ch 17. Miss next 17 dc. 1 dc in
each of next 16 dc. Ch 17. Miss next 17 dc. 1 dc in each of last 8 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Next rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. 1 dc in each of next 17 ch. 1 dc in each of next
16 dc. 1 dc in each of next 17 ch. 1 dc in each of last 8 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 66 dc.
Next rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
Weave ribbon through rnd as shown in picture.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton (50 g/1.75 oz; 73 m/80 yds) 13712 (Hot Green) 4 balls
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 20 ins [51 cm] long excluding handles.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Body: Ch 39.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 38 sc. Turn.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3). (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop in next st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. *Ch 5. [(Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop in next st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – tr2tog made. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 3. 1 tr in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 5 (counts as tr and ch 1). Miss next 3 ch. Tr in next st. *Ch 5. (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop in same st as before. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Miss next 5-ch sp. (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop in next st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook– tr2tog over 2 sts made. Rep from * to last tr. Tr2tog over last st worked and next tr. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3). Tr2tog over first st and next tr2tog. *Ch 5. Tr2tog over st just worked and next tr2tog. Rep from * to last tr. Ch 3. 1 tr in 4th ch of ch 5. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beg measures approx 20 ins [51 cm], ending with 3rd row.
Next row:Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *2 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * to turning ch 7. 1 sc in ch-7 sp. 1 sc in 4th ch of ch 7. Turn. 
Next 3 rows:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of last row. 
Handles: With RS of work facing join yarn with sl st to top left corner of Bag. Ch 1. Work 30 sc evenly across side of Bag. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 57 (handle). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 55 ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 86 sc in total. 
Next 2 rows:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of last row, leaving a long end. Sew end of handle in position.
Rep for other side.

materials: Caron® Layer Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 312 yds/286 m) Bubblegum (09011) 1 ball or 160 yds/145.5 m
Size U.S. J/10 [6 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.

Lnkdc = Linked double crochet: Insert hook down through horizontal bar in center of previous stitch, yoh and pull up a loop. Insert hook in next stitch (through top loops in usual manner), yoh and pull up a loop. Yoh and pull through first 2 loops on hook. Yoh and pull through last 2 loops on hook – Linked Dc made.
measurements: Approx 7½" [19 cm] wide x 9" [23 cm] long, excluding Strap.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• All rnds are joined with sl st to first st. 
BAG
Ch 24.
See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in first sc. *1 lnkdc in next sc. Rep from * around Join. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in first dc. *1 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. Join.
Rep 3rd rnd until work from beg measures approx 7½" [19 cm].
Edging
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each Inkdc around. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first st. *Dcbp around next st. Dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last st. Dcbp around last st. Join. 
Rep last rnd once more. 
Fasten off. 
STRAP
Romanian Cord
Ch 2. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Rotate work clockwise. 
Skip sc just worked. 1 sc in rem loop from 2nd ch from hook (loop just below sc). 
*Rotate work clockwise.
Skip sc just worked. 1 sc in next 2 loops.
Rep from * until Strap measures 50" [127 cm].  Fasten off. 
Sew each end of Strap to Bag at corners as shown in photo, seaming each end of Strap approx 1½" [4 cm] down to inside of Bag.

materials: Caron® Anniversary Cakes™ (35.3 oz/1000 g; 1061 yds/970 m) Prism (7039) 1 ball or 721 yds/660 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Insert hook into first horizontal bar of stitch just worked and draw up a loop.
Insert hook into 2nd horizontal bar of same stitch and draw up a loop.
Insert hook into next unworked stitch and draw up a loop (4 loops on hook).
(Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] wide x 10" [25.5 cm] tall x 4" [10 cm] deep, excluding handles.
gauge: 10 joined tr and 4 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
FRONT & BACK (Make alike)
Ch 41.
1st row: (RS). Insert hook into 2nd ch from hook and draw up a loop. (Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop) twice. 4 loops on hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. – beg tr worked. *Insert hook into top horizontal bar of tr just worked and draw up a loop. Insert hook into 2nd horizontal bar of same tr and draw up a loop. Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop. 4 loops on hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times – Joined tr worked. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 38 sts.

2nd row: Ch 4. Beg tr [draw up a loop in 2nd, 3rd and 4th ch of t urning ch -4.  (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times]. Skip first tr. *1 joined tr in next tr. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm]. Fasten off.

GUSSET
Ch 13.
1st row: (RS). Insert hook into 2nd ch from hook and draw up a loop. (Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop) twice. 4 loops on hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. – beg tr worked. *Insert hook into top horizontal bar of tr just worked and draw up a loop. Insert hook into 2nd horizontal bar of same tr and draw up a loop. Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop. 4 loops on hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times – Joined tr worked. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 10 sts.

2nd row: Ch 4. Beg tr [draw up a loop in 2nd, 3rd and 4th ch of turning ch-4. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times]. Skip first tr. *1 joined tr in next tr. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures approx 35" [89 cm] (length of side edges and bottom of Front and Back pieces). Fasten off.

FINISHING
With WS of Front and Gusset tog and end of Gusset at top of Front left side edge, join yarn with sl st to top left corner. Ch 1. Work 1 row of sc through both thicknesses evenly down side, along bottom and up opposite side. Fasten off.
Rep to join opposite side of Gusset to Back.

HANDLES (Make 2)
Ch 56.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 55 sc.

2nd to 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Do not fasten off.
Join sides: Fold Handle in half lengthwise with sts of foundation ch and last row aligned.

1st row: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses. 1 sc in each sc and rem loop of foundation ch to end of row. Fasten off leaving a long end.

FINISHING
Using long yarn end, sew Handles inside top edge of Bag approx 3" [7.5 cm] in from each side edge.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds /333 m) Main Color (MC) Frosty Green (0661) 1 ball or 175 yds/159 m

Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Pastel Kit™ Kit includes: 12 balls (50 g/1.7 oz each; 600 g/21 oz total), yardage (93 yds/85 m each; 1116 yds/1020 m total) • Soft White, Dusty Grey, Pale Yellow, Coral, Baby Pink, Pale Plum, Light Blue, Light Periwinkle, Light Sage 1 ball or 50 g each
Size U.S. 7 [4.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Pair of purse handles with approx. 7" [18 cm] internal opening.
Tape measure.
measurements: Approx 9½" [24 cm] wide x 8" [20.5 cm] tall, excluding handles.
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Base of Bag
With MC, chain (ch) 31. 
1st round (rnd):  1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Place marker (PM) in center stitch (st).  Working in opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first sc. 64 sts.
2nd to 4th rnds:  Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to 1 st before marked st. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. PM. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in last st. Join with sl st to first sc. 76 sts.
Body of Bag
Note:  From this point forward, Bag is worked as a spiral. Do not join rnds. Move marker up each rnd to maintain rnd count.
1st rnd:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. PM on last st of rnd.
2nd rnd:  1 sc in each sc around. 
Rep 2nd rnd until work from first rnd of Body of Bag measures approx 8" [20.5 cm].
Next rnd:  1 sc in each sc to last st. Slip stitch (sl st) in last st. Fasten off.
Handle Casings (make 2)
With Light Sage, ch 23.
1st row:  1 sc in 2nd chain from hook. 1 sc in each chain to end of chain. Turn. 22 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures approx 3" [7.5 cm]. 
Fold around purchased handle as shown in photo. With Handle Casings held against Right Side (RS) of work and centered as shown in photo, whipstitch to Bag through all three thicknesses.
Puffy Flower
With Pale Yellow, ch 2. 
1st rnd:  6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off Pale Yellow.  
2nd rnd:  Join Soft White with sl st to any sc. *Ch 3 (counts as dc). Yarn over hook (yoh) and draw up a long loop, equal in height to beg ch 3. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 6 times all in same sc as sl st. Yoh and draw through 6 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through last 2 loops. Ch 3. Sl st in same sc – Petal Cluster made. 
Sl st in next sc. Rep from * 5 times more. Sl st in same sc as first sl st. Fasten off leaving a 3" [7.5 cm] long tail to seam to Bag. 6 petals total.
Grey and Blue Flower
With Dusty Grey, ch 2. 
1st rnd:  12 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd:  Ch 6 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 3). Skip next sc. *1 double crochet (dc) in next sc. Ch 3. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-6. Fasten off. 
3rd rnd:  Join Light Blue with sl st to any ch-3 space (sp). Ch 3. 4 dc in same ch-3 sp as last sl st. *Ch 4. 5 dc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 4. Join with sl st to top of beg ch 3.
4th rnd:  Sl st in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1.  Skip next 2 dc. (5 dc. Ch 3. 5 dc) all in next ch-4 sp. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join.
Rose
With Baby Pink, ch 14. 
1st row:  [1 half double crochet (hdc). Ch 2. 1 hdc] all in 3rd ch from hook. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in each ch to end of ch. Turn.
Leaf 
With Light Sage, ch 17. 
1st rnd:  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 half double crochet (hdc) in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 3 sc in next ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, rep from * once more, ending with 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Coil Rose into rose shape and sew to Leaf as pictured.
Coral Flower
With Coral, ch 8. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). 3 dc in ring. Turn. Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 
1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in 3rd ch of ch 3. Turn. – Beg Petal made. Ch 3. Working across back of petal just made, 4 dc in ring. Turn. 
Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Turn – Petal made. 
(Petal in ring) 6 times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3 of Beg Petal. Fasten off.
Pale Plum and Light Periwinkle Flower
With Pale Plum, ch 8. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd:  Ch 1. 18 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as sl st. *Ch 3. Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Ch 3. Skip last 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
3rd rnd:  Join Light Periwinkle with sl st to first ch-3 sp. (1 sc. Ch 3. 5 dc. Ch 3. 1 sc) all in same ch-3 sp. (1 sc. Ch 3. 5 dc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
4th rnd:  Join Pale Plum with sl st between 2 sc. *1 sc in same sp as sl st. Working behind sts in previous row, ch 5. 1 sc between next 2 sc. Rep from * around, ending with ch 5. Join with sl st to first sc. 
5th rnd:  Sl st in next ch-5 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 7 dc. Ch 3. 1 sc) all in same ch-5 sp. (1 sc. Ch 3. 7 dc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Craft Kit - 1 Kit (includes 12 balls, 1.7 oz/50 g each, 93 yds/85 m each)
Contrast A Shocking Pink - 1 ball or 19 yds/17 m
Contrast B Cherry Red - 1 ball or 19 yds/17 m
Contrast C Pumpkin - 1 ball or 19 yds/17 m
Contrast D Saffron - 1 ball or 19 yds/17 m
Contrast E Spring Green - 1 ball or 27 yds/25 m
Contrast F Royal - 1 ball or 31 yds/28 m
Contrast G Lavender - 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast H Soft White - 1 ball or 31 yds/28 m
Contrast I Black - 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] square.
gauge: 1st to 4th rnds of Motif = Approx 5½" [14 cm] square.
instructions:
NOTES
• Chain 3 (Ch 3) at beginning (beg) of round (rnd) counts as double crochet (dc).
• Ch 6 at beg of rnd counts as dc and ch-3 space (sp).

HEART MOTIF (Make 2)
With A, chain 4 (ch 4). Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. [3 double crochet (dc) in ring. Ch 3] 3 times. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-6.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 space (sp). Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. Ch 1. *(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-6.
Note: To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color, draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. (Ch 3. 2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp, changing to B in last dc.
4th rnd: With B, sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) all in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) all in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Break B.
5th rnd: Join C with sl st to any ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) all in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to next ch-3 sp. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) all in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Break C.
6th to 9th rnds: As 5th rnd, working 1 rnd each in D, E, F, and G.
Fasten off.

EDGING
With WS together (tog), and Heart Motifs oriented point down and bumps up, join H with sl st to top left ch-3 sps, working through both thicknesses.
1st row: Working through both thicknesses, ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in each st to next ch-3 sp. (2 sc. Ch 1. 2 sc) all in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * once, then from * to ** once. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Turn. 115 sc and 2 ch-1 sps.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(Skip next sc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc) Rep to last sc before next corner. Skip next sc. [1 sc. 1 half double crochet (hdc). 1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc. 1 hdc. 1 sc] all in next ch-1 sp. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * once, then from * to ** once ending last rep with: skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off.

STRAP
Join I with sl st to last sc in 2nd row of Edge. Ch 140. Join with sl st to 1st sc in 2nd row of Edge.
1st row: Ch 1. Working into horizontal bump at the back of each ch, 1 sc in each of next 140 ch. Join with sl st to 2nd row of Edging. Fasten off.
Turn ch to Wrong Side (WS) and insert hook into horizontal bump, Complete sc – rep to end of chain. Top and bottom of sc will now look the same.

materials: Red Heart® With Love® (5 oz/141 g; 223 yds/204 m) Rainforest Stripe (1974) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 12½" [32 cm] wide x 18" long [45.5 cm].
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
Panels with Handles are worked back and forth in rows, then sewn together.
Beginning chain-1 is intentionally omitted in Rows 2–6 of Handle so edges will curve evenly.
Outer Pocket is made separately and sewn to Front.
TOTE
Panel (make 2)
Ch 39.
Row 1 (right side): Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across to last ch, 2 sc in last ch, turn—40 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st across to last st, 2 sc in last st, turn—48 sc.
Rows 6–36: Ch 1, skip first st, 2 sc in next st, *skip next st, 2 sc in next st; rep from * across, turn.
Fasten off.
Handle
Row 1: With right side facing, skip first 12 sts, join yarn with slip st in next st, ch 1, sc2tog in same st as join and in next st, sc in next 20 sts, sc2tog; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—22 sc.
Rows 2–6: Sc2tog in first 2 sts, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—12 sc.
Rows 7–36: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off.
Pocket
Ch 16.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—15 sc.
Rows 2–19: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY & FINISHING
With wrong sides of Panels held together, sew sides and bottom together.
Sew top edges of Handles together.
Trim (work twice)
Round 1: With right side of Tote facing, join yarn with sc at seam; working in unworked sts of Row 36 of Panel and in ends of rows of Handle, sc evenly spaced around opening; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Pocket Trim
Row 1: With right side facing and working in ends of rows, join yarn with sc in Row 19, sc in each row to Row 1, 3 sc in Row 1; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, skip last ch; working in ends of rows of other side, 3 sc in Row 1, sc in each row across; leave remaining sts of Row 19 unworked. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Referring to photo as a guide for placement, sew Pocket to front Panel.
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ Super Craft Kit
Kit includes 12 balls (50 g/1.7 oz each; 600 g/21 oz total), yardage (85 m/93 yds each; 1020 m/1116 yds total).
Main Color (MC) Pale Yellow 1 ball or 85 yds/77 m
Contrast A Oatmeal 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast B Coral 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast C Baby Pink 1 ball or 38 yds/35 m
Contrast D Light Blue 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast E Pale Plum 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast F Light Periwinkle 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast G Frosty Green 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast H Light Sage 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast I Dusty Gray 1 ball or 75 yds/68 m
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch markers.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Printed or solid color cotton lining fabric 45" [114.5 cm] wide x ½ yd  [45 cm].
Coats® Dual Duty XP® All-Purpose Thread in matching color.
Sewing needle.
Sewing pins.
Fabric marking chalk.
Iron.
Scissors.
Optional: Sewing machine.
measurements: Approx 15¾" x 17" [38 x 43 cm] excluding handles.
gauge: 13 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 1 Motif = Approx 3" [7.5 cm] diameter.
instructions:
Notes: • Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. • Join Motifs as you work.
First Motif
***With larger hook and MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 5.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 12 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to top of first hdc, skipping beg ch 2. Fasten off. 12 hdc.
With RS facing join Color 1 to back loop (working through back loop and horizontal bar at WS of work) with sl st to any hdc.***
2nd rnd: *Ch 9. Sl st in same sp as last sl st.** Sl st in back loop (working through back loop and horizontal bar at WS of work) of next hdc. Rep from * around ending at **. Join with sl st to same sp as first sl st. Fasten off. 12 ch-9 petals.

Second Motif (join 1 side)
Work from *** to *** as given for First Motif. 2nd rnd: Ch 4. Sl st to 5th ch of any ch-9 loop of adjoining Motif. Ch 4. Sl st in same sp as last sl st. Sl st in back loop (working through back loop and horizontal bar at WS of work) of next hdc. Ch 4. Sl st to 5th ch of next ch-9 loop of adjoining Motif. Ch 4. Sl st in same sp as last sl st. Sl st in back loop (working through back loop and horizontal bar at WS of work) of next hdc *Ch 9. Sl st in same sp as last sl st.** Sl st in back loop (working through back loop and horizontal bar at WS of work) of next hdc. Rep from * around ending at **. Join with sl st to same sp as first sl st. Fasten off. 12 ch-9 petals.

Next Motif (join 2 sides)
Work from *** to *** as given for First Motif.
2nd rnd: Ch 4. Sl st to 5th ch of second ch-9 loop of first (right) adjoining motif before existing join. Ch 4. Sl st in same sp as last sl st. Sl st in back loop (working through back loop and horizontal bar at WS of work) of next hdc. Ch 4. Sl st to 5th ch of next ch-9 loop of the same adjoining Motif. Ch 4. Sl st in same sp as last sl st. Sl st in back loop (working through back loop and horizontal bar at WS of work) of next hdc. Ch 4. Sl st to 5th ch of first ch-9 loop of second (left) adjoining Motif after existing join. Ch 4. Sl st in same sp as last sl st. Sl st in back loop (working through back loop and horizontal bar at WS of work) of next hdc. Ch 4. Sl st to 5th ch of next ch-9 loop of the same adjoining Motif. Ch 4. Sl st in same sp as last sl st. Sl sl st in back loop (working through back loop and horizontal bar at WS of work) of next hdc. *Ch 9. Sl st in same sp as last sl st.** Sl st in back loop (working through back loop and horizontal bar at WS of work) of next hdc. Rep from * around ending at **. Join with sl st to same sp as first sl st. Fasten off. 12 ch-9 petals.

Following Assembly Diagram use Color 1 as shown in diagram and join Motifs as you work into Bag.
Top Border: 1st rnd: With RS facing and smaller hook, join I with sl st to 5th ch of first far-right free ch-9 loop of any Motif. Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch-2). *(Ch 2. 1 sc in 5th ch of next ch-9 loop) twice. (Ch 2. 1 dc in 5th ch of next ch-9 loop) twice. Rep from * around, ending with: Ch  2. 1 dc in 5th ch of next ch-9 loop. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-5.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st and 2 sc in each ch-2 sp around. 120 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Handles: (make 2). With smaller hook and I, ch 90. See diagram on page 5.
1st row: Sl st in 41st ch from hook and each of next 29 ch. Turn. Leve rem 20 ch unworked.
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 40. Sl st in first sl st and each of next 29 sl sts. Turn.
7th row: Ch 40. Sl st in first sl st and each of next 29 sl sts. Ch 20. Fasten off.
Fold Bag flat. PM 2" [5 cm] in from side edges along top edge of Bag. Arrange ch-40 loops of Handles beg at markers and placing loops towards center. Sew loops to WS under last rnd of reverse sc as shown in picture.

LINING
Using fabric, cut 1 rectangle 18" x 35" [45.5 x 89 cm].
Note: Seam allowances are ½" [1.25 cm].
Top edges of fabric bottom: Fold one side edge ¼" [.75 cm] to WS of fabric and press. Fold over again ¼" [.75 cm] to WS and press. Pin into place.
Sew seam by hand 1/8" [0.30 cm] from folded edge or with sewing machine set to longest stitch length, sew 1/8" [0.30 cm] from folded edge, taking out pins as you sew.
Note: Be sure to keep fabric flat as this row of stitches will later be sewn to crochet Bag.
Sew Side Seams
Note: Sides are sewn using a French seam to enclose raw side edge.
Fold piece in half with wrong sides together and right side facing, matching shorter side edges with folded edges at top. Pin into place.
Sew seams by hand or machine ¼" [75 mm] from each side edge.
Press seam, with seam allowance to one side.
Turn piece so right sides are together, and wrong side is facing. Press fabric in half, making sure seam is at very edge.
Pin into place.
Sew seams by hand or machine ¼" [75 mm] from each side edge, encasing raw edges of first seam within seam allowance.
Turn piece so WS is facing. Insert lining into Bag and hand sew top edge of lining to 2nd row of sc of Bag edging, using whipstitch over edge.

pattern_name: THE "MONSTER ATE MY HOMEWORK" TOTE BAG
materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
contrast A Hot Green (01712) 105 m/116 yds or 1 ball
contrast B Grape (00071) 250 m/276 yds or 3 balls
contrast C Red (00095) 52 m/57 yds or 1 ball
contrast D White (00001) 38 m/42 yds or 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small piece of black felt for eyes.
Craft glue.
abbreviations: sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] square, excluding handles
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
bag (make 2 pieces alike)
note: Ch 2 for turning ch does not count as hdc.
With A, ch 47.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 45 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 2" [5 cm]. Join B.
With B, rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm]. Join A.
With A, rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 12" [30.5 cm]. Fasten off.
mouth Pocket
With C, ch 18.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 17 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: (Folding row). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th to 8th rows: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Place marker at end of last row.
9th row: Ch 1. Fold work along 5th row. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each sc and rem loop of foundation ch to end of row. Turn. (first pencil pocket made).
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marked row measures 5½" [14 cm], ending on a WS row.
next row: (RS). Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Place marker at end of row.
next 3 rows: Ch 1. Working through both loops, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
next row: (RS). (Folding row). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
next 3 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off at end of last row.
Fold work along last Folding row worked. Thread yarn through needle and sew edge to rem loops of marked row (second pencil pocket made).
Teeth (make 2)
With D, ch 26.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 25 sc.
First Tooth: *1st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.*
second Tooth: **Join D with sl st to next unworked sc. Work from * to * as given for First Tooth.**
Third to Fifth Teeth: Rep from ** to ** 3 times more. 5 teeth made.
Sew Teeth to Mouth Pocket as shown in picture, taking care not to sew side pencil pockets closed.
eyes
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. Fasten off.
handles (make 2)
With B, ch 69.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 67 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 4 times more.
Fold work in half lengthwise. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each hdc and rem loop of foundation ch to end of row. Fasten off.
Finishing
With WS of Bag pieces tog, join A with sl st to top left corner. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc evenly around side edges and bottom, having 3 sc in each bottom corner. Fasten off.
Sew Mouth Pocket onto Front of Bag, leaving top edge open. Cut black circles from felt for Eyes approx ½" [1.5 cm]. Glue black felt circles to centers of Eyes and sew to Front of Bag. Attach Handles as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hooks
Susan Bates® yarn needle
2 large safety pins
2 pieces of medium-weight lining fabric 19" [48 cm] wide x 17" [43 cm] long
Coats & Clark™ All Purpose Sewing Thread
Tailor’s chalk
Straight pins
Sewing needle
Sewing machine
Tape measure
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] tall x 12" [30.5 cm] wide, excluding handle and straps.
gauge:
Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square with larger hook.
16 single crochet (sc) and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.
NOTES
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• Each color aligns with 1 round (rnd) in the Motif with 5 colors in total. If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some stitches (sts) and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• When Motif is complete, cut yarn where Color 5 (longest color rep) ends, leaving a tail for weaving in. Begin next Motif with Color 1 and repeat 5 rnds for each Motif.
• Granny Square how to: https://www.yarnspirations.com/pages/how-to-granny-square-guide

MOTIFS
With A, make 14.
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as double crochet (dc).
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with slip stitch (sl st) to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
With larger hook and Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
Fasten off.

Join Motifs
Notes: 
• Hold working yarn underneath work to create a flat seam.
• Keep a loose, even tension on the yarn while joining to keep Motifs flat and even. Too tight tension will cause them to bunch up.
Place 2 Motifs beside each other, RS up.
Using larger hook, join B with sl st to Motif on left in corner ch-1 sp. Insert hook from front to back into back loop of corner ch-1 on this same left Motif. Insert hook from front to back into back loop of corner ch-1 sp of right Motif. (3 loops on hook). Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
*Insert hook from front to back into back loop of next st on left Motif. Insert hook from front to back into back loop of corresponding st of right Motif. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Rep from * to end of Motif.

JOIN SIDES
Fold piece in half lengthwise, with WS tog.
Ch 1. Working along side edge, through both thicknesses to join, work 1 single crochet (sc) in each st to end of row. Fasten off.

STRAPS
(Make 2)
Using smaller hook and B, ch 93.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 92 sc.
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of 6th row.

PLACE STRAPS
Lay piece flat. Pin Straps into place at top edge on either side of 2 center Granny Squares, aligning ends of Straps with last 6 sts of each Motif. Using yarn needle, sew into place.

DRAWSTRING EDGING (See Diagram on page 8).
With larger hook and RS facing, join B with sl st to top right corner of back.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *Work 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to First Strap. Working through side of edge sts on Strap and sts of Motif to join, work 1 sc in each st. Work 1 sc in top of seam. Working through both thicknesses of second Strap and Backpack in each st to join. Cont around, working 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp of Motifs (21 sc along top of each Motif), and 1 sc in top of each joining seam to first sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 132 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 half double crochet (hdc) in first sc. 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
3rd rnd (Eyelet rnd): Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as sl st. Skip next 2 hdc. *3 dc in next hdc. Skip next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th and 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of 5th rnd.

FLAP
With larger hook and B, ch 30.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 28 dc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 3. *Skip next 2 dc. 3 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc (counts as 2 dc). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc between next 3-dc group. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next 3 dc. 2 dc in top of ch-3. Turn. 
6th row: Ch 3. Skip next dc and 3-dc group. *3 dc in sp between next 3-dc group. Skip next 3-dc group. Rep from * to last 2 dc. Skip next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
(6 groups of 3-dc)
7th row: Ch 3. *Skip next 3-dc group. 3 dc in sp between next 3-dc group. Rep from * to last 3 dc group and dc. Skip next 3-dc group. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
(5 groups of 3-dc)
8th to 10th rows: As 7th row. 2 groups of 3-dc at end of 10th row.
Fasten off.
With yarn needle and B, sew Flap to top edge at back, centering Flap at center back.

TOP EDGING
With larger hook, join B with sl st to any sc of last top edging rnd at back. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc around top edge of Bag and evenly along edges of Flap (approx 2 sc into side of each row, and 1 sc in each dc of last row of Flap). Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

BACK LOOP
With smaller hook and B, ch 25.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 24 sc.
2nd to 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Do not fasten off at end of 8th row. Fold Back Loop in half lengthwise.
Joining row: Ch 1. Work 1 sc through each sc and rem loop of foundation ch to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew Back Loop to Backpack, placing each end on either side of Straps.

DRAWSTRING
With larger hook and 2 strands of B held tog, ch 140. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Weave Drawstring through eyelet row to create drawstring closure, with ends at Center Front.

LINING
Cut 2 pieces of fabric 19" [48 cm] wide x 17" [43 cm] long. Sew side seams with ½" [1.25 cm] seam.
Fold down top edge to WS 1" [2.5 cm] and press. Fold again 1" [2.5 cm] down and press.

BOX CORNERS
With RS together, fold corner flat to form triangle. With tailor’s chalk, mark sewing line 3" [7.5 cm] from corner, perpendicular to side seam. Sew across sewing line. Rep on other side.
Place Lining in Backpack, with WS of Lining and Backpack tog. Pin top of lining along top of 2nd rnd of Drawstring edging. Sew Lining to Backpack using whipstitch.

pattern_name: FUN TO MAKE CROCHET CHECKERED TOTE
materials: YARN
• Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit™ - 1 Kit
Kit includes 12 balls (1.7 oz/50 g; 93 yds/85 m) each; Total (21 oz/600 g; 1116 yds/1020 m)
COLORS
Quantity
• Contrast A Soft White 1 ball or 93 yds/85 m
• Contrast B Black 1 ball or 93 yds/85 m
• Contrast C Shocking Pink 1 ball or 27.5 yds/ 25 m
• Contrast G Spring Green 1 ball or 16.5 yds/15 m
• Contrast H Royal 1 ball or 60 yds/55 m
TOOLS
• Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
• Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers.
• Susan Bates® steel yarn needle.
• Tape measure.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: Approximately (Approx) 12" [24 cm] wide x 9" [23 cm] tall x 3" [7.5 cm] deep, excluding handles.
gauge: 15 single crochet (sc) and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.
NOTES
• Join each round (rnd) with slip stitch (sl st) to first stitch (st).
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Carry color not use in across top of work. New stitches will be worked over strand of carrying yarn.

Bottom:  With C, chain (ch) 40.
1st row:  [Right Side (RS)]. 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook (counts as sc). 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 39 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 3" [7.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off. Do not turn.
Work around Bottom as follows:
1st rnd:  (RS). 2 sc in same space (sp) as last sc for corner. Work 11 sc evenly spaced along side edge of Bottom to corner. 3 sc in corner (first ch of foundation chain). 1 sc in each of next 37 remaining (rem) loops of foundation chain.
3 sc in corner (last ch of foundation chain). Work 11 sc evenly spaced along side edge of Bottom to top corner. 2 sc in same sp as first sc. Join with sl st to top of first sc. Fasten off C. 108 sc.

Body of Bag
Notes:  
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Carry color not in use across top of work. New stitches will be worked over strand of carrying yarn.

1st round (rnd):  With Right Side (RS) facing, join B with sl st to back loop at any corner sc. Ch 1. 1 single crochet in back loop only (scbl) in same space (sp) as sl st. 1 scbl in each of next 5 sc (6 sc total). *Join A.  Do not break B. With A, 1 scbl in each of next 6 sc. Join B. With B, 1 scbl in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. Join A.  Do not break B. With A, 1 scbl in each of last 6 sc. With B, join with sl st to first sc.

2nd rnd:  With B, ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *Join A. With A, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join B. With B, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. Join A. With A, 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. With B, join with sl st to first sc.

3rd to 6th rnds:  As 2nd rnd 4 times more (6 rnds total). Join in rnd with sl st into back loop only at end of last rnd.
At this point colors will be changed to create Check Pattern (Pat).  Do not break colors while you continue (cont) in pat.

7th rnd:  With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 scbl in same space (sp) as sl st. 1 scbl in each of next 5 sc (6 sc total). *Join B. With B, 1 scbl in each of next 6 sc. Join A. With A, 1 scbl in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. Join B. With B, 1 scbl in each of last 6 sc. With A, join with sl st to first sc.

8th rnd:  With A, ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *Join B. With B, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join A. With A, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. Join B. With B, 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. With A, join with sl st to first sc.

9th to 12th rnds:  As 8th rnd 4 times more (6 rnds total). Join in rnd with sl st into back loop only at end of last rnd.

13th rnd:  With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 scbl in same space (sp) as sl st. 1 scbl in each of next 5 sc (6 sc total). *Join A. With A, 1 scbl in each of next 6 sc. Join B. With B, 1 scbl in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. Join A. With A, 1 scbl in each of last 6 sc. With B, join with sl st to first sc.

Rep 2nd to 13th rnds to form Check Pat.
Cont in Check Pat until all length of A or B has been used, ending with complete rnd. Fasten off.

Top Border: 1st rnd:  With RS facing, join G with sl st to back loop of first sc. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 scbl in same space (sp) as sl st. 1 scbl in each sc around. Join with sl st to back loop of first sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 scbl in same space (sp) as sl st. 1 scbl in each sc around. Join with sl st to back loop of first sc.
3rd rnd:  As 2nd rnd. Fasten off.

Handles (make 2)
Note:  Ch 2 at beginning (beg) of rows does not count as st.
With H, ch 80.
1st row:  1 half double crochet (hdc) in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row:  As 2nd row. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Place Markers (PM) on 8th st from side edges on foundation ch and last row. With RS together (tog), fold Handle lengthwise. Working through both thicknesses and back loops of last row, join H with sl st to marked sts.

Join sides of Handles together (tog) with sl st between markers.
Fold Bag flat. Position Handles 1" [2.5 cm] from sides of Bag. With 2 strands of C, sew handles to RS of Bag using straight cross stitch as shown in picture.

materials: Simply Soft Party (85 g/3. oz;150 m/164 yds)
Contrast A Spring Sparkle (0002) 1
Contrast B Fuchsia Sparkle (0002) 1
One size US H-8 (5mm) crochet hook, or size to obtain gauge.
Two 5/8” beads or buttons for flower centers.
Circular elastic hair band—18"/45.5cm (or length of elastic tied in an 18"/45.5cm circle).
Yarn needle.
measurements: Finished measurements: Purse measures approximately 4 1/2"/11.5cm wide and 4 3/4"/12cm high.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
PURSE
Front
With A, ch 14 loosely.
Row 1 (RS): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—13 sc.
Rows 3–14: Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 15 and 16: Ch 1, [sk next sc, sc in next sc, working over sc just made, sc in skipped sc] 6 times, sc in last sc, turn.
Fasten off.
Back
Make same as front, but do not fasten off.
Joining Row: Hold front and back with wrong sides together; working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly spaced down side edge, across lower edge, and up other side edge to join front to back; leave top edge open. Do not fasten off.
Strap
Row 1: Ch 80, sl st in seam at top of opposite side of purse, sc in top edge of purse, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each ch across strap, sc in top edge of purse.
Fasten off.
Flower
With B, ch 3; join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), work 13 more dc in ring; join with sl st in top of beginning ch—14 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in next dc, *ch 2, dc in next 2 dc; repeat from * around, ch 2; join with sl st in top of beginning ch—7 ch-2 sps.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew button or beads to center of flower. Sew flower to center, front of purse. Using yarn needle, weave in all ends.

NECKLACE
Round 1: Work sc over hair band, as follows: Place a slip knot on the hook. *Insert hook, from front to back, into center of hair band. Take yarn over top of hair band to back, and over the hook. Draw loop to front, bring yarn back over top of hair band, yarn over and draw through both loops on hook (1 sc worked over hair band completed); repeat from * until hair band is completely covered. Push stitches together as you work, to ensure complete coverage; join with sl st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 2, dc in each sc around; join with sl st in top of beginning ch.
Fasten off.
Flower
Work same as flower for purse.
FINISHING
Sew button or bead(s) to center of flower. Sew flower to necklace. Using yarn needle, weave in all ends.

pattern_name: IN THE BAG GRANNY CROCHET TOTE
materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m) - Moody Cherry (2019) - 1 ball (13 Granny Squares)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
10 yds/9.5 m of black worsted yarn for joining Motifs may be required
Tape measure
measurements: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] wide x 16" [40.5 cm] deep, excluding Strap.
gauge: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
MOTIF
Make 13.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. **(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
Fasten off.
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as double crochet (dc).
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with slip stitch (sl st) to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
STRAPS (make 2)
Note: To work Straps, use yarn as ‘self-striping’ yarn allowing colors to change as they appear.
Ch 68 (using any section of color, saving black sections for joining Motifs).
1st row: 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 67 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.
Sew Straps in position as shown in photo.
ASSEMBLY
Notes:
• Join Motifs tog using just black sections of yarn.
• Extra length of black worsted yarn may be required for joining.
Join Motifs: Hold WS of 2 Motifs tog with sts aligned. Join black section of yarn with sl st in ch-2 corners of aligned Motifs at top right. With WS tog, following diagrams, join Motifs tog, matching lettered sides and working in whipstitch through back loops only through both thicknessess. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Pink Dust (10956) 1 ball or 110 yds/100 m
Contrast B Sunsoaked (10918) 1 ball or 150 yds/137 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Tape measure.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] square, excluding handle.
gauge: 10 single crochet (sc) and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools. NOTES • Ch 4 at beginning (beg) of rounds (rnds) counts as double crochet (dc) and chain (ch)-1 space (sp). • Do not break yarn at end of rnd when switching colors, keep yarn not in use at wrong side (WS) of work.

FRONT AND BACK GRANNY MOTIF  Make 2 alike.
With A, chain (ch) 4. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to form a ring.

1st rnd:  Ch 4. [3 double crochet (dc). Ch 1] 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch 4. 
2nd rnd:  Join B with sl st in next ch-1 space (sp). With B, ch 4. 3 dc in same corner ch-1 sp as sl st. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next corner ch-1 sp. Repeat (Rep) from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first corner ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch 4.
3rd rnd:  Join A with sl st in next corner ch-1 sp. With A, ch 4. 3 dc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next corner ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch 4.
4th rnd:  Join B with sl st in next corner ch-1 sp. With B, ch 4. 3 dc in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next corner ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first corner ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch 4.
5th rnd:  Join A with sl st in next corner ch-1 sp. With A, ch 4. 3 dc in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) to next corner ch-1 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next corner ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first corner ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch 4.
6th rnd:  With B, as 5th rnd.

Edging:  Join A with sl st in next corner ch-1 sp. With A, ch 2 (does not count as st). 2 half double crochet (hdc) in same sp as sl st. *1 hdc in each dc and ch-1 sp to next corner ch-1 sp.** 3 hdc in corner ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice, then from * to ** once. 1 hdc in first corner ch-1 sp. Join B with sl st to first hdc. Break A.

HANDLE
With B, ch 59.
1st row:  1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 58 sc.
2nd to 4th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of 4th row.

SIDE: 1st row:  With B, ch 2 ( does not count as st). 1 double crochet back post (dcbp) around each hdc down left side of Motif. 1 dcbp around each hdc along bottom of Motif. 1 dcbp around each hdc up right side of Motif. Fasten off at top of right side. Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.

JOIN FRONT AND BACK Flat sl st to join:  With Wrong Side (WS) of Front and Back together (tog) and B, join sides and bottom by working sl st through the back loops only of each dcbp to end of row. Fasten off.

FINISHING Using B and yarn needle, sew short ends of Handle to top edge of Back at either side edge.

TOP AND HANDLE EDGING Note:  On one side, you will work into each sc of Strap, and into the remaining (rem) loop of foundation ch on the other side. 
With Right Side (RS) facing, join A with sl st to 1st hdc at top edge of Bag. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across across top edge to Handle. Work 1 sc in each sc or rem loop of foundation ch along edge of Handle. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Rep on other side.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Bone (9703) 1 ball or 296 yds/270 m
Contrast B Autumn Maize (0008) 1 ball or 96 yds/88 m
Contrast C Taupe (9783) 1 ball or 96 yds/88 m
Contrast A Cobalt Blue (9784) 1 ball or 296 yds/270 m
Contrast B Plum Perfect (9761) 1 ball or 96 yds/88 m
Contrast C Sage (9705) 1 ball or 96 yds/88 m
Contrast A Neon Pink (9775) 1 ball or 296 yds/270 m
Contrast B Strawberry (0015) 1 ball or 96 yds/88 m
Contrast C Sunshine (9755) 1 ball or 96 yds/88 m
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 14½" [37 cm] tall x 9" [23 cm] wide x 2" [5 cm] deep, excluding straps.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Carry color not in use loosely along edge of work.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

CROCHET  I  SKILL LEVEL: EASY

SIDE (make 2)
Make 1 using B as Color 2.
Make 1 using C as Color 2.
Stripe Pat
With A, work 2 rows. 
With Color 2, work 2 rows.
These 4 rows form Stripe Pat. 
With A, ch 10.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 11 sc. Drop A. Join Color 2. 
3rd row: With Color 2, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
First 3 rows of Stripe Pat are now in place. 
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd and 3rd rows 35 times more. 81 sts. 
Fasten off. 

STRAP
With A, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 40" [101.5 cm]. Fasten off. 

Assembly
Fold Side of Bag worked in A and C in half lengthwise with WS facing tog. 
Fold other Side of Bag (worked in A and B) in half lengthwise, wrapping it around Side of Bag already folded.

Working through all 4 thicknesses, seam bottom of Bag closed using a whipstitch. Insert needle from front to back through 2 strands on each piece. Bring needle around and insert it from front to back through next strands of all 4 pieces. Rep along the edge.

Turn Bag right-side out.
Using a running stitch and A, seam sides of Bag tog at Front and Back along line marked in green in diagram, ensuring that you are catching only stripes worked in A along RS of work for a nearly invisible seam. 

Seam Straps to flat edge at top of Bag as shown in photo.

materials: Lily Sugar ’n Cream (70.9 g/2.5 oz) 16 balls of #00004 (Ecru)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: 12 ins [30.5 cm] wide x 15 ins [38 cm] high x 12 ins [30.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 13½ sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with 2 strands of Lily Sugar ’n Cream.
instructions:
Note: Bag is worked with 2 strands of yarn tog throughout.
FRONT and BACK Panels (make 2).
**With 2 strands of yarn tog, ch 41.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 40 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.**
Rep last row until work from beg measures 15 ins [38 cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off.
Side Panels (make 2).
Work from ** to ** as given for Front and Back Panels.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 14 ins [35.5 cm], ending with a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sc. Ch 4. Miss next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Ch 4. Miss next 4 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sc. 4 sc in next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 4 sc in next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Work a further 2 rows in sc. Fasten off.
Join Panels: Arrange Panels to form a box, having Side Panels opposite each other.
With WS of 2 Panels tog, join 2 strands of yarn with sl st at top left corner. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc evenly along side edge. Fasten off.
Rep for rem Panels.
Base: Work from ** to ** as given for Front and Back Panels.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 12 ins [30.5 cm], ending with a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Join Base to Panels: With RS of Base facing, place lower edge of joined Panels behind Base with WS of work tog, aligning corners of Base with joining rows of Panels.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc evenly around all 4 sides of Base. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
Top edging: With RS of work facing, join 2 strands of yarn with sl st to any corner of top edge. Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 rnd of reverse sc evenly around top edge. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
Handles (make 2).
With 2 strands of yarn, ch 95 loosely.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 94 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row once more. Fasten off.
With RS of Basket facing, push ends of Handle through slits on Side Panel to WS. Sew ends tog. Bring halves of Handle tog and taking 2 strands of yarn tog, wrap center 4 ins [10 cm] of Handle as shown in picture. Fasten ends securely.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 oz; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC) Indigo (01114) 585 yds/530 m or 5 balls
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble Cluster = [(Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times. Yoh and draw through 6 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook – bobble made. Ch 2. Bobble] all in next st.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Approx 27" [68.5 cm] around x 19" [48 cm] high, excluding handles.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
BAG
(See Charts VI and VII on pages 36 and 37). 
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Ch 4. Join with sl st in first ch to form ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 7 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 8 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dc. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc. (1 dcfp around next dc. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 16 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first d cfp. Ch 2. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. (1 dcfp around next dcfp. Ch 2. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 dcfp around first d cfp. Ch 1. Bobble Cluster in next sc. Ch 1. (2 dcfp around next dcfp. Ch 1. Bobble Cluster in next sc. Ch 1) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. Ch 1. Bobble Cluster in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (2 dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. Ch 1. Bobble Cluster in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 2 dcfp around first dcfp. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 1. Bobble Cluster in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (2 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 1. Bobble Cluster in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 2 dcfp around first dcfp. 1 dcfp around each of next 4 dcfp. Ch 1. Bobble Cluster in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (2 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dcfp around each of next 4 dcfp. Ch 1. Bobble Cluster in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
8th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around each of first 3 dcfp. Ch 2. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 2. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
9th rnd: Ch 2. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 2. Miss next ch-2 sp, sc, ch-2 sp) 8 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
10th rnd: Ch 2. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 1. Bobble Cluster in next sc. Ch 1. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Miss next ch-2 sp) 8 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
11th to 13th rnds: Ch 2. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 1. Bobble Cluster in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp) 8 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
14th rnd: Ch 2. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 2) 8 times. Join with sl st to first st.
15th rnd: Ch 2. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 2. Miss next ch-2 sp, sc, ch-2 sp. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2) 8 times. Join with sl st to first st.
16th rnd: Ch 2. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Miss next ch-2 sp. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 1. Bobble Cluster in next sc. Ch 1) 8 times. Join with sl st to first st.
17th to 19th rnds: Ch 2. (1 dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. Ch 1. Bobble Cluster in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1) 8 times. Join with sl st to first st.
20th to 31st rnds: As 8th to 19th rnds.
32nd to 37th rnds: As 8th to 13th rnds.
38th rnd: Ch 2. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp) 8 times. Join with sl st to first st.
39th rnd: Ch 2. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Ch 2. Miss next ch 2, sc, ch 2. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp) 8 times. Join with sl st to first st.
40th rnd: Ch 2. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Miss next ch-2 sp. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp) 8 times. Join with sl st to first st.
41st and 42nd rnds: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 48 dcfp.
Fasten off.
Strap (make 2)
With 2 strands held tog, ch 84. 
1st rnd: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Optional: Working into rem loops along opposite side of ch, work 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Ch 1. Do not fasten off.
Fold Strap in half lengthwise with RS facing each other (WS of last rnd will show). Join Strap by working 1 sl st through tops of corresponding dc and foundation ch to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew Straps to Bag as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Silk Sari™: 2 balls 9934 Dazzling
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 8mm [US L-11]
Yarn needle
2 stitch markers
9” x 17” (23 x 43 cm) piece of fabric (optional for lining)
sewing needle and matching thread (optional for lining)
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Bag measures 8” wide x 7½” long (20.5 x 19 cm), closed and with edging.
gauge: 8 sts = 4” (10 cm); 4 rows = 4” (10 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Edging and Half Strap
Ch 10.
Row 1: Working through both thicknesses, insert hook at lower edge near fold, sc evenly across ends of rows; work as many ch as needed for 30” (76 cm) strap, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, slip st in each sc along edge, slip st in last 10 ch. Fasten off. Knot beginning ch-10 into a small ball.
Turn bag to other side and repeat Row 1 for 2nd edging and half strap.
Lining
Draw tails to wrong side of bag to minimize weaving in.
With right sides together, fold lining fabric in half with short edges matching. Leaving ½” (12.7 mm) seam allowance, sew side seams. If desired, press open side seams. Turn top edges to wrong side along seam allowance and press. Insert lining in bag with wrong sides together and sew top edge of lining to inner edge of bag.
Weave in ends. Tie ends of half straps together to desired length of shoulder strap.

BAG
Ch 16.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch do not count as a st) and in each ch across, turn—15 dc.
Rows 2–16: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), dc in each dc across, turn.
Do not fasten off. Place marker on each end of last row.
Optional: lay piece on fabric. Add ½” (1.5 cm) seam allowance on all edges and cut fabric for lining.
Flap
Rows 17–20: Repeat Row 2.
Rows 21–23: Ch 2, dc in first dc, dc2tog, dc in each dc to last 3 dc, dc2tog, dc in last dc, turn—9 dc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold piece so first row is aligned with marked row and pin side edges together.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Soft White-Amethyst (2005) 1 ball or 132 yds/122
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Dual Duty XP® All Purpose thread in desired shade, shown in Bright Deep Purple (9238).
Tote Bag to upcycle.
All purpose or denim sewing machine needle suited to weight of tote bag, or hand-sewing needle.
Optional: Temporary or permanent fabric adhesive, washable glue stick, heavy-duty sewing pins or sewing clips.
Scrap fabric to cover designs printed on tote.
Iron.
Ruler.
measurements: Small Motif = Approx 8" x 8¾" [20.5 cm x 22 cm]. Large Motif = Approx 8" x 11" [20.5 cm x 28 cm].
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• As Tote surface will be visible 
underneath granny squares, you 
may wish to cover Tote sections 
with fabric first. See Finishing for 
instructions. 
• To determine final size of Motif(s) 
needed for your Tote, measure 
area(s) on your Tote you wish to 
cover with granny squares. 
Instructions for Motifs as shown 
are given below, but you can 
adjust the number of rounds and 
rows worked to suit your Tote. 

With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to 
first ch to form ring. 
See diagram on page 4.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 
3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join. 
Color 1 complete.
2nd rnd: Color 2 begins. Sl st in next 
ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. 
*Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 
sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc 
in first ch-3 sp. Join. Color 2 
complete.
3rd rnd: Color 3 begins. Sl st in next 
ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. 
*Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 
(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep 
from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last 
ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. 
Join. Color 3 complete.
4th rnd: Color 4 begins. Sl st in next 
ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. 
*(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next 
ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in 
next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, 
then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first 
ch-3 sp. Join. Color 4 complete.
5th rnd: As 4th rnd, with Color 5.
6th rnd: As 4th rnd, using yarn as 
self-striping yarn.
Small Motif only:
7th rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. 
Ch 2 (does not count as st). 2 hdc 
in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 hdc in next 
ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to next ch-3 sp. 2 hdc 
in ch-3 sp. Sl st in same ch-3 sp. 
Working in back loops only, sl st in 
each dc and each ch-1 (working 
into ch and not sp) to next ch-3 sp. 
Sl st in next ch-3 sp.** 2 hdc in ch-3 
sp. Rep from * to ** once. Fasten off. 
Large Motif only:
Note: Next rnd worked along 3 
sides only.
7th rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 2. 
2 hdc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 hdc 
in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to next ch-3 
sp.** (3 hdc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 
sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 
to next ch-3 sp. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 hdc) in 
next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to ** once. 
2 hdc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 2. Sl st in 
same ch-3 sp. Fasten off.
Proceed as follows in rows:
1st row: (RS). Join with sl st to top 
right ch-3 corner sp. Ch 3 (counts as 
dc). 1 dc in same ch-3 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc 
in next ch-1 sp) to next ch-3 sp. 
Ch 1. 2 dc in ch-3 sp. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. 
(Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) to end of 
row. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in 
same dc. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 
to end of row. Ch 1. 2 dc in last dc. 
Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Optional: If needed, to cover areas 
of Tote where Motifs will be placed, 
cut fabric approx 1" [2.5 cm] wider 
and 1" [2.5 cm] taller than area to 
be covered. 
Press ½" [1.25 cm] under to WS of 
fabric along all edges. Spray WS of fabric in a well-
ventilated area with temporary 
fabric adhesive following product 
instructions, or apply washable 
glue stick to all edges. Place WS of 
fabric on RS of Tote.
Attach Motifs: Carefully spray WS 
of Motif in a well-ventilated area 
with temporary fabric adhesive 
following product instructions 
being careful not to over-saturate 
Motifs. Place WS of Motif to RS of 
Tote. Alternatively, secure to Tote 
with heavy-duty sewing pins or 
clips.
Using a sewing machine or a hand-
sewing needle and matching 
thread, sew into place. 
Tip: Use a longer stitch length and 
a 90/14 or 100/16 machine needle 
for heavier canvas totes. 
Rep finishing steps for additional 
Motifs as needed.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Sunshine (00073) 1 ball or 56 yds/51.5 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 3 ball or 355 yds/324.5 m
Contrast C Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball or 45.5 yds/41.5 m
Contrast D Blueberry (01725) 1 ball or 86.5 yds/79 m
