Contrast E Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 35.5 yds/32.5 m
Anchor® Embroidery Floss (optional monogram) Black (0403).
Embroidery needle.
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch markers.
Yarn needle.
¾" [2 cm] diameter button.
abbreviations: Kernel St = Insert hook in last stitch worked. Yoh and draw up a loop. Insert hook in next stitch. Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 11" [28 cm] wide x 14" [35.5 cm] tall x 9" [23 cm] deep.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Beg with Base, Backpack is worked in sections built directly from previous sections. Body is worked in continuous rounds. Pocket, Flap and Straps are worked separately, then sewn on. 
BACKPACK
Base: With A, ch 23 loosely.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Kernel St across to end of ch. Turn. 22 sts.
2nd to 26th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Kernel St across to end of row. Turn.
Break A. Join B.
Body: 1st rnd: With B, ch 1. *Work 20 sc evenly across last row. Work 3 sc in corner. Work 33 sc evenly across side edge. Work 3 sc in corner. Rep from * once more. Join with sl st to first sc. 118 sc. PM at beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Do not join.
3rd to 9th rnds: Working in continuous rnds, 1 sc in each sc around. Do not join.
10th to 29th rnds: 1 hdc in each st around. Do not join.
30th rnd: 1 sc in each hdc around. Do not join.
31st rnd: 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Do not join. 107 sts.
32nd rnd: 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Do not join. 96 sc.
33rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Do not join. 84 sc.
34th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Do not join. 72 sc.
35th and 36th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to last sc.
Fasten off.
Top Flap: 1st row: Working in back loops only, join C with sl st in first sc of last rnd of Body. Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 26 sts. Turn. 27 sc.
2nd to 19th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
20th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 25 sc.
21st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Ch 3. Skip each of next 3 sc for Buttonhole. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 23 sts.
22nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 21 sc.
23rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. Sc2tog. 19 sc.
Fasten off.
Top Flap Edging: Join C with sl st to top left corner. Work sc evenly around edge of Top Flap to opposite corner. Fasten off.
Pocket: With D, ch 28.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 27 sc.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 35 sc at end of 5th row.
6th to 21st rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.
Pocket Flap: With D, ch 28.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 27 sc.
2nd to 13th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
14th to 17th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. 19 sc rem at end of 17th row.
Pocket Flap Edging: Join D with sl st to top left corner. Work sc evenly around edge of Top Flap, leaving foundation ch edge unworked. Fasten off.
Pocket Assembly:
Sew first row of Pocket to first round of Body, lining up placement under Top Flap. Sew sides of Pocket in position. Sew first row of Pocket Flap to Backpack 2 rows above Pocket to allow Flap to fold over.
Ties
Left Tie: **Join A with sl st 2 rows below first st of Top Flap. Ch 75. Fasten off. Weave in and out of sts to center front of Body.**
Right Tie: Rep from ** to ** sts.
Pull Ties to gather top edge of Body. Sew button on Body to correspond with buttonhole on Flap.
Straps (make 2 alike): With E, ch 66.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 65 sc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc). 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew one end of each Strap on opposite corners of Top Flap. Sew opposite ends on corresponding corners of Base. Using length of Black embroidery floss and back stitch, embroider monogram of choice.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 316 Soft White A, 254 Pumpkin B, and 324 Bright Yellow C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75mm [US F–5]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
measurements: Bag measures 9½” (24 cm) wide across top x 11” (28 cm) long, excluding handle.
gauge: 14 sc = 3” (7.5 cm); 5 rows = 1” (2.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Rounds 3–5: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Rounds 7–9: Repeat Rounds 3–5.
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Rounds 11–13: Repeat Rounds 3–5.
Round 14: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; change to B; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Rounds 15–17: Repeat Rounds 3–5.
Round 18: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Rounds 19–21: Repeat Rounds 3–5.
Round 22: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc.
Rounds 23–25: Repeat Rounds 3–5.
Round 26: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
Rounds 27–29: Repeat Rounds 3–5.
Round 30: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—54 sc.
Rounds 31–33: Repeat Rounds 3–5.
Round 34: Ch 1, sc in first 8 sts, 2 sc in next st,*sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc.
Rounds 35–37: Repeat Rounds 3–5.
Round 38: Ch 1, sc in first 9 sts, 2 sc in next st,*sc in next 9 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—66 sc.
Rounds 39–41: Repeat Rounds 3–5.
Round 42: Ch 1, sc in first 10 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 10 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; change to C; join with slip st in first sc—72 sc.
Rounds 43–45: Repeat Rounds 3–5.
Round 46: Ch 1, sc in first 11 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 11 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—78 sc.
Rounds 47–49: Repeat Rounds 3–5.
Round 50: Ch 1, sc in first 12 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 12 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—84 sc.
Rounds 51–53: Repeat Rounds 3–5.
Round 54: Ch 1, sc in first 13 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 13 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—90 sc.
Round 55: Ch 1, reverse sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Handle
With B, ch 57.
Round 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 54 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, sc in next 55 ch; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Using photograph as a guide, sew ends of handle 5–6” (12.5–15 cm) apart on wrong side of top edge. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Dusty Gray (0340)
Contrast B Soft White (0316)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] square and 10" [25.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 12 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
BAG
Middle Square (make 1) With A, form magic ring. Alternatively, ch 4, slip st to 1st ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 2 (does not count as st here and throughout), [2 hdc in ring, ch 2] four times, slip st in 2nd ch from beginning to join – 8 hdc.
Round 2: Slip st across to 1st ch-2 space, ch 2, [(hdc, ch 2, hdc) in ch-2 space, hdc across to next ch-2 space] three times, (hdc, ch 2, hdc) in ch-2 space, hdc across to beginning ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from beginning to join – 16 hdc.
Rounds 3-5: Repeat Round 2 – 40 hdc.
Rounds 6-10: With B, repeat Round 2 – 80 hdc after Round 10. Rounds 11-15: With A, repeat Round 2 – 120 hdc after Round 15.
Rounds 16-20: With B, repeat Round 2 – 160 hdc after Round 20. Fasten off.
Edge Squares (make 2) With A, form magic ring. Alternatively, ch 4, slip st to 1st ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 2, [2 hdc in ring, ch 2] four times, slip st in 2nd ch from beginning to join – 8 hdc.
Round 2: Slip st across to 1st ch-2 space, ch 2, [(hdc, ch 2, hdc) in ch-2 space, hdc across to next ch-2 space] three times, (hdc, ch 2, hdc) in ch-2 space, hdc across to beginning ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from beginning to join – 16 hdc.
Rounds 3-5: Repeat Round 2 – 40 hdc.
Rounds 6-10: With B, repeat Round 2 – 80 hdc after Round 10. Rounds 11-15: With A, repeat Round 2 – 120 hdc after Round 15. Rounds 16-17: With B, repeat Round 2 – 136 hdc after Round 17.
Round 18: Slip st across to 1st ch-2 space, ch 2, [(hdc, ch 2, hdc) in ch-2 space, hdc across to next ch-2 space] two times, hdc in ch-2 space, ch 22, hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in next 19 ch, hdc in ch-2 space, hdc across to next ch-2 space, (hdc, ch 2, hdc) in ch-2 space, hdc across to beginning ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from beginning to join – 164 hdc.
Round 19: Slip st across to 1st ch-2 space, ch 2, (hdc, ch 2, hdc) in ch-2 space, hdc across to next ch-2 space, (hdc, ch 2, hdc) in ch-2 space, hdc across to ch 20 from last row, hdc in bottom of each ch, (2 hdc, ch 2, 2 hdc) in side of ch, hdc in each hdc across other side of ch, hdc across to next ch-2 space, (hdc, ch 2, hdc) in ch-2 space, hdc across to beginning ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from beginning to join – 194 hdc.
Round 20: Slip st over to 1st ch-2 space, ch 2, (hdc, ch 2, hdc) in ch-2 space, hdc across to next ch-2 space, (hdc, ch 2, hdc) in ch-2 space, hdc across to 20 hdc from last row, hdc in next 22 sts, 4 hdc in ch-2 space, hdc in next 22 hdc, hdc across to next ch-2 space, (hdc, ch 2, hdc) in ch-2 space, hdc across to beginning ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from beginning to join – 204 hdc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Joining
Line up squares, referring to Diagram 1 for placement. Seam squares along the sides where the middle and edge squares meet (lined in red on diagram) using your favorite seaming method (e.g. whipstitch, locking mattress stitch).
Diagram 1
Fold fabric along red lines of Diagram 2. Seam squares along the two new sides where the middle and edge squares meet (lined in red and red dashes on Diagram 3).

materials: Bernat® Softee® Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m)
Contrast A Warm Red (69007) 2 balls
Contrast B Fuchsia (69023) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
4" [10 cm] piece of cardboard for tassels.
abbreviations: Mosaic Dc = Working in front of chain spaces, work 1 dc in skipped sc 3 rows below
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] diameter x 12" [30.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 16 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc. 
• When working dc in rows 3 rows below, work in front of ch-2 spaces, not around. 
• Each skipped sc has ch-1 worked above it for 2 rows. 
This establishes the ‘gap’ where Mosaic Dc will later be worked
• Mosaic Dc always replaces sc directly behind it on working row
• WS of your work maintains alternating 2-row striped pattern because you are working in front of chain spaces each time you work Mosaic Dc - you are never working around chain-spaces. 
The chain-spaces are positioned behind Mosaic Dc.

Beg at base with smaller hook and A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc. 
Cont in this manner, inc 8 sc evenly around next 8 rnds (as established). 112 sc.
Next rnd (bottom “seam”): (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc around. Join. Turn.
From this point on, rnds are joined and then turned to create a straight seam.
Next rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join B. Turn.
Proceed in Mosaic Diamond Pat as follows:
(See diagram on page 4).
Set-up rnd 1: (RS). With B ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
Set-up rnd 2:  (WS). With B ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join A. Turn.
1st rnd: (RS). With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. Mosaic dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
2nd rnd: (WS). With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join B. Turn.
3rd rnd: (RS). With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (Mosaic dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below. Ch 2. Skip next sc) 3 times. Mosaic dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
4th rnd: (WS). With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sts (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join A. Turn.
5th rnd: (RS). With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. (Mosaic dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below. Ch 2. Skip next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
6th rnd: (WS). With A, ch 1. *(1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp) 6 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join B. Turn.
7th rnd: (RS). With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Mosaic dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below. Ch 2. Skip next sc) 5 times. Mosaic dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
8th rnd: (WS). With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc) 5 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join A. Turn.
9th rnd: (RS). With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. (Mosaic dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below. Ch 2. Skip next sc) 5 times. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
10th rnd: (WS). With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next st) 6 times. Rep from * around. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join B. Turn. 
11th rnd: (RS). With B, ch 1. *1 sc in next 2 sc. (Mosaic dc in skipped sc 3 rows below. Ch 2. Skip next sc) 5 times. Mosaic dc in skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
12th rnd: (WS). With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc) 5 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join A. Turn.
13th rnd: (RS). With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 dc in skipped sc 3 rows below) 5 times. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
14th rnd: (WS). With A, ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc) 5 times. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join B. Turn.
15th rnd: (RS). With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Mosaic dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in next sc. (Mosaic dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below. Ch 2. Skip next sc) 3 times. (Mosaic dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
16th rnd: (WS). With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sts. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join A. Turn.
17th rnd: (RS). With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (Ch 2. Skip next sc. Mosaic dc in skipped sc 3 rows below) 3 times. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
18th rnd: (WS). With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc) 3 times. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join B. Turn.
19th rnd: (RS). With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (1 sc in next sc. Mosaic dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below) twice. Ch 2. Skip next sc. (Mosaic dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
20th rnd: (WS). With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. Join A. Turn.
21st rnd: (RS). With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. Mosaic dc in skipped sc 3 rows below. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
22nd rnd: (WS). With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join B. Turn.
23rd rnd: (RS). With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Mosaic dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join. Turn.
24th rnd: (WS). With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. Join A. Turn.
Rep 1st to 24th rnds once more. 
Break B. 
Next rnd: (RS). With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Mosaic dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
Next rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Turn.
Rep last rnd twice more (alternating RS and WS as established). 
Next rnd (eyelet rnd): (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc) 7 times. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join. Turn.
Next rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc) 7 times. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join. Turn.
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Turn. 
Rep last rnd twice more (alternating RS and WS as established). 
Fasten off.

Drawstring 
With 2 strands of A held tog and smaller hook, ch 120.
1st row: Working in bottom loops of chain only, sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. 
Insert Drawstring from front-to-back into the 4th eyelet at the top of Bag. Weave drawstring in and out through all eyelets finishing with ends protruding from 4th and 5th eyelets (this should be opposite of center back seam).

Tassels (make 2)
Wrap A around 4" [10 cm] piece of cardboard 40 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel ½" [1 cm] from tied end and fasten securely. Attach 1 Tassel to each end of Drawstring.

Straps (make 2)
With 2 strands of A held tog and larger hook, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Strap measures 20" [51 cm] ending on a RS row. Do not turn.
Edging:  Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around all edges of Strap, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Hold 2 Straps tog with short ends aligned and WS facing. Sew ends of Straps with WS facing to top of RS of Bag, aligning short ends with the last row of Mosaic Diamond pat and centering at the center back seam (see Diagram). Two straps will overlap each other with WS of Straps showing. Flip Strap over so RS is facing and sew rem short edges of Straps to bottom of Bag at bottom “seam" rnd, 3" [7.5 cm] to each side of center back seam.

materials: RED HEART® Vera™: 2 balls each 2360 Caffé A, and 2312 Nero B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Bag measures about 11” [28 cm] wide at base, 20½” [52 cm] wide at top edge, and 11” [28 cm] tall (not including handles).
gauge: 13 sc = 4” [10 cm]; 16 rows = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet (sc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Base
With A, ch 36.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across—35 sc.
Rows 2–25: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off.

Front
Row 1: Join B with sc at beginning of one long edge of base, work 34 more sc evenly spaced along edge—35 sc.
Rows 2–7: With B, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Change to A in last sc of last row.
Rows 8–14: With A, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Change to B in last sc of last row.
Rows 15–21: With B, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Change to A in last sc of last row.
Rows 22–35: Repeat Rows 8–21.
Rows 36–42: Repeat Rows 8–14.
Fasten off.

Back
Beginning along remaining long edge, work back the same as front.

Side
Row 1: Join B with sc at beginning of one short edge of base, work 20 more sc evenly spaced along edge—21 sc.
Row 2 (increase row): With B, ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across—22 sc.
Rows 3 and 4: With B, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 5 (increase row): Repeat Row 2—23 sc.
Rows 6 and 7: With B, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Change to A in last sc of last row.
Row 8: With A, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 9 (increase row): With A, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc to last sc, 2 sc in last sc—24 sc.
Rows 10 and 11: With A, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 12 (increase row): Repeat Row 9—25 sc.
Rows 13 and 14: With A, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Change to B in last sc of last row.
Row 15: With B, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 16 (increase row): Repeat Row 2—26 sc.
Rows 17 and 18: With B, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 19 (increase row): Repeat Row 2—27 sc.
Rows 20 and 21: With B, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Change to A in last sc of last row.
Rows 22–35: Repeat Rows 8–21—29 sc.
Rows 36–42: Repeat Rows 8–14—31 sc.
Fasten off. Repeat along remaining short edge for second side.

STRAPS (make 2)
With B, ch 11.
Row 1: Sc in 3rd ch from hook, [ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch] 4 times—5 sc, 4 ch-1 spaces, and 1 beginning ch-space.
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, skip first sc, sc in next ch-1 space, [ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, ch 1, skip last sc, sc in beginning ch-space.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures about 19” [48.5 cm] from beginning.
Fasten off. Repeat for second strap.

FINISHING
Sew edges of front, back, and sides together using yarn matching the stripes. Sew ends of one strap to inside of top edge of front and one strap to inside of top edge of back, sewing each end about 2” [5 cm] from seam. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Grape (00071) 1 ball
Contrast B Red (00095) 1 ball
Contrast C Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball

Contrast E Hot Green (01712) 1 ball

Contrast G Hot Blue (01742) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 11" [28 cm] long, excluding handles.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout.  Motif (make 3). With A, ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 1st rnd: Ch 3. 19 dc in ring. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 20 dc in total. Break A. 2nd rnd: With B, ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. Break B. 3rd rnd: Join C with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. *Ch 5. Miss next ch-1 sp. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Rep from * around. Ch 5. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break C.  4th rnd: Join D with sl st to any ch-5 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 12 dc.** (2 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break D.   5th rnd: Join E with sl st to any ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 16 dc.** (2 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break E. 6th rnd: Join F with sl st to any ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 2. Miss next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc) 6 times. Ch 2. Miss next 2 dc.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break F. 7th rnd: Join G with sl st to any ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. (Ch 2. Miss next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 6 times. Ch 2. Miss next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break G. Join sides of Motifs: With WS tog, join G with sl st to any corner ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each dc and 2 sc in each ch-2 sp. Fasten off at end of row. Join 3 Motifs into ring. Bottom With A, ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 1st rnd: Ch 3. Work 20 dc in ring. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 21 dc in total. Break A. 2nd rnd: With B, ch 4 (counts as d.c and ch 1). *1 dc in next dc. Ch 1.  Rep from * around.  Bottom of Bag  SKILL LEVEL:  |CROCHET INTERMEDIA TE SCC0103-007952M Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. Break B. 3rd rnd: Join C with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 6 times.** (1 dc. Ch 1) twice in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. Break C. 24 dc. 4th rnd: Join D with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice.** (1 dc. Ch 1) twice in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 6 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. Break D. 32 dc.  5th rnd: Join E with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 3 times.** (1 dc. Ch 1) twice in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 6 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. Break E. 40 dc. 6th rnd: Join F with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1.  *(1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 4 times.** (1 dc. Ch 1) twice in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 6 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. Break F. 48 dc. 7th rnd: Join G with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 5 times.** (1 dc. Ch 1) twice in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 6 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. 56 dc. 8th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 6 times.** (1 dc. Ch 1) twice in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 6 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. 64 dc. Fasten off. Join Bottom to Motifs: With WS tog, pin Motifs evenly around outer edge of Bottom. 1st rnd: (RS). Join G with sl st to any sp. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work in sc evenly around (Note: Total number of sts should be divisible by 3). Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop in same sp as last sc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – shell made. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Shell) in next sc. Rep from * around. Miss next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. top border: 1st rnd: (RS). Join G with sl st to any left corner ch-2 sp at top of Bag. Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 2. Miss next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 5 times. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc.** (1 dc in next corner ch-2 sp) twice. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. 1 dc in next corner ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5. 2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 2. Miss next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 3 times. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp.** 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. 1 dc in each of next 10 dc. Join C with sl st to top of ch 3. Do not break G. 3rd rnd: With C, ch 1. *1 sc in each dc to next ch-2 sp. (2 sc in next ch-2 sp. Miss next dc) 3 times. Rep from * twice more. 1 sc in each dc to end of rnd. Join D with sl st to first sc. 93 sc. Break C. 4th rnd: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join E with sl st to first sc. Break D. 5th rnd: With E as 4th rnd. Join F. Break E. 6th rnd: With F, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. Join G with sl st to first sc. Break F. 7th rnd: With G, ch 1. (1 sc. Shell) in same sp as last sl st. *(1 sc. Shell) in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. handle Note: To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed in new color. With F, ch 92. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Join E. Turn. 91 sc. 2nd row: With E, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join D. Turn. Rep last row, changing colors in the following sequence: D, C, B, A and G. Next row: With G, ch 1. (1 sc. Shell) in first sc. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Shell) in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off. Turn work up-side down. Working in rem loops of foundation chain, join G with sl st to first ch. Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch to end of row. Turn. 91 sc. Next row: With G, ch 1. (1 sc. Shell) in first sc. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Shell) in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off. Sew sides of Handle to top of Bag as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® “LusterSheen®”: 2 skeins 824 Medium Blue.
Crochet Hook: 3.75mm [US F-5].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: *= repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Bag measures 14” x 14”.
gauge: 21 sts = 4”; 10 rows = 4” in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BAG
Front and Back (Make 2)
Increase Rows
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 9, dc in first ch to make a square; turn.
Row 2: Ch 7, dc in dc, ch 2, skip 2 ch, (dc, ch 2, dtr) all in next ch; turn – 3 squares.
Rows 3-23: Ch 7, dc in dtr, * ch 2, dc in next dc; repeat from * to last ch-space; ch 2, skip next 2 ch, (dc, ch 2, dtr) all in last ch; turn – 45 squares at end of Row 23.
Decrease Rows
Row 24: Ch 1, slip st in dtr and next 2 ch and dc, ch 5, dc in next dc, * ch 2, dc in next dc; repeat from * to last dc; dtr in last dc; turn – 43 squares.
Rows 25-42: Ch 5, skip first dc, dc in next dc, * ch 2, dc in next dc; repeat from * to last dc; dtr in last dc; turn.
Row 43: Ch 5, skip first dc, dc in next dc; do NOT turn – 1 square.
Edging Rnd: Ch 3, 2 dc around post of last dc, work 3 dc in each space around and work 9 dc in next 3 corners and 6 more dc in last corner; join with a slip st in top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Sides and Bottom (Make 1)
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 35; dc in 4th ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 33 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in next dc and in each dc across, dc in top of ch-3; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until 42” from beginning. Fasten off.
Finishing
With wrong sides together, pin the Side and Bottom strip to 3 sides of bag Front. Attach yarn at top of strip; ch 1, working through both layers, sc around the 3 sides of the bag, taking care to keep work flat by working extra sts in the lower corners. Fasten off. Repeat for the back.
Handles
Attach yarn 1¼” in from seam on top edge of Front of the bag.
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, skip 2 dc, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in next dc, skip 2 dc, sc in next dc; turn.
Row 2: Ch 3, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in ch-2 space, dc in next sc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in ch-2 space, dc in top of ch-3; turn.
Repeat Row 2 about 33 more times or to desired length of handle. 
Join Top of Handle: Hold last row of handle at top of bag 1¼” in from opposite seam of Front, taking care that handle is not twisted; ch 3, slip st in next 3 dc of bag, sc through ch-2 space of handle and next dc of bag together, slip st in next 3 dc of bag, dc in top of ch-3 of handle. Fasten off.
Repeat on Back for other handle. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m) Main Color (MC) Cream (06003) 1 ball or 310 yds/282 m
Contrast A Navy (06017) 1 ball or 260 yds/237 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Popcorn = Work 5 dc in indicated space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook into first of 5 dc and pull dropped loop through. Ch 1 tightly to complete popcorn.
measurements: Approx 13" x 15" [33 x 38 cm], excluding handles.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Notes: • Work 2 Motifs with contrast edging. • Side Section is worked around 3 sides of Motif. • Top Border and Straps are worked after Motifs and Side Section are joined. MOTIF  (make 2) See diagram on page 3. With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout). 3 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 4 dc in ring) 3 times. Join with hdc to top of ch 3 (creates last ch-2 sp). 2nd rnd: Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 2. 4 dc) all in ch-2 sp just created. *Ch 1. (4 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *(1 dc. Popcorn. 1 dc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * twice more. (1 dc. Popcorn. 1 dc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 1 dc in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *(1 dc. 1 tr. Ch 1. 1 tr. 1 dc) all in top of next popcorn. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. Rep from * twice more. (1 dc. 1 tr. Ch 1. 1 tr. 1 dc) all in top of last popcorn. 1 dc in each of last 5 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to next corner ch-1 sp. *(2 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc to next corner ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. (2 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) all in last corner ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to next popcorn. *(1 dc. 1 tr. Ch 1. 1 tr. 1 dc) all in top of next popcorn. 1 dc in each dc to next popcorn. Rep from * twice more. (1 dc. 1 tr. Ch 1. 1 tr. 1 dc) all in top of last popcorn. 1 dc in each dc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 7th and 8th rnds: As 5th and 6th rnds. 9th rnd: As 5th rnd. Fasten off (note ‘Fasten off’ point will be bottom edge of Motif ). Motif Edging: With RS facing, join A with sl to front loop only of right corner popcorn in last rnd. Working in front loops only, work 1 sc in each st down side to next corner popcorn. 3 sc in front loop only of corner popcorn. Working in front loops only, work 1 sc in each st across bottom of Motif (where fasten off occurred) to next corner popcorn. 3 sc in front loop only of corner popcorn. Working in front loops only, work 1 sc up side of Motif to next corner popcorn. Working in front loop only, work 1 sc in popcorn. Fasten off. Side Section: 1st row: With RS of 1 Motif facing, locate rem back loops from Motif Edging rnd. Join MC with sl st in first rem loop. 1 sc in same sp. Work 1 sc in rem back loop of each st along the same row as Motif Edging. (This will create a ridge in A). Turn. 2nd to 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Do not fasten off – proceed as follows: Join Side Section to 2nd Motif: Locate rem back loops from 2nd Motif Edging rnd. With RS of pieces facing each other, line up 8th row of Side Section with rem back loops of Motif Edging rnd. Working through both thicknesses, join last row of Side Section with rem back loops of Motif Edging rnd with 1 row of sl st. Fasten off. (This will create a ridge in A). Top Border and Straps Note: When working 1st rnd, take care to work into A ‘ridges’ to align them towards Side Sections (see photo). 1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st on upper edge in top of A ‘ridge’ on left corner of Motif. Ch 1. Work 9 sc across top of Side Section. Work 1 sc in each st across top of Motif (37 sc). Work 9 sc across top of 2nd Side Section. Work 1 sc in each st across top of 2nd Motif (37 sc). 92 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 8th rnd (Place Straps): Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 15 sc. Ch 51. Skip next 25 sc. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Ch 51. Skip next 25 sc. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 144 sc. 10th to 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 3 balls 8251 Neon Orange B, 1 ball each 8671 Neon Green A and 8012 Black C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle, stitch marker
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Bag measures 10” wide x 12” high (25.5 x 30.5 cm), not including handles.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 15 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet with larger hook. Gauge is not critical for this project but tension should be tight.
instructions:
Round 2: Sc in each st around; change to B; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 3: Sc in each st around; change to A; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 4: Sc in each st around; change to B; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 5 and 6: Repeat Rounds 3 and 4. Cut A at the end of Round 6.
Rounds 7–32: Sc in each st around.
Round 33: Sc in each st around; change to A; join with slip st in first sc. Do not cut B.
Rounds 34 and 35: Repeat Rounds 2 and 3.
Round 36: Repeat Round 2.
Rounds 37 and 38: Repeat Round 3 twice.
Round 39: Repeat Round 2. Cut A.
Round 40: Repeat Round 3. Fasten off.
Handles
Lay bag flat and place stitch marker on stitch at left edge of last round.
Round 41: Join A with sc in marked st, sc in next 9 sts, ch 14, skip next 13 sts, sc in next 19 sts, ch 14, skip next 13 sts, sc in next 9 sts; change to B; join with slip st in first sc—38 sc and 2 ch-13 spaces.
Round 42: Sc in each sc to first ch-14 space, 30 sc in first ch-14 space, sc in each sc to next ch-14 space, 30 sc in next ch-14 space, sc in each remaining sc; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Round 43: Join B with slip st in any st, slip st in each st around; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.
Eyes (make 2)
With smaller hook and C, ch 7.
Row 1 (right side): Working in back bars only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog, turn—4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next st, sc2tog, turn—2 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc2tog, turn—1 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, 2 sc in sc; working across ends of rows, sc in each row to Row 1, 2 sc in Row 1, sc in each st across; working across ends of rows, sc in each row to first sc; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Mouth
With smaller hook and C, ch 25.
Row 1 (right side): Working in back bars only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 4 ch, dc in next 14 ch, 5 sc in last 5 ch—24 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Using photograph as a guide for placement, sew eyes and mouth to front of bag, turning corners of mouth upward to create a smile.
Weave in ends.

pattern_name: LILY® SUGAR’N CREAM SHOPPING TOTE BAG
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (70.9 g/2.5 oz)
Main Color (MC) (00083 Cornflower) 6 balls
Contrast A (00010 Yellow) 1 ball
Contrast B (00001 White) 1 ball
Contrast C (01712 Hot Green) 1 ball
Size 6.5 mm (U.S. K or 10 ½) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension
measurements: Approx 7 x 13½ ins [18 x 34.5 cm].
gauge: 11 hdc and 7 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn.
instructions:
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw loop of next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed. Ch 2 does not count as hdc.

Stripe Pat
Work 1 row with A.
Work 1 row with MC.
Work 1 row with C.
Work 1 row with MC.
Work 1 row with B.
Rep last 5 rows twice more.
These 15 rows form Stripe Pat.

Front and Back (make alike)
With 2 strands of MC, ch 38.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 37 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 3 times more. Join A at end of last row.
Next row: (RS). With 2 strands of A, ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in next st through back loop only. *1 hdc in next st through front loop only. 1 hdc in next st through back loop only. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
1st row of Stripe Pat is complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row until 15 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Join MC at end of last row.
Next row: (WS). With 2 strands of MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first hdc. 1 sc in next hdc in back loop only. *1 sc in next hdc in front loop only. 1 sc in next hdc in back loop only. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 sc in last hdc. Place marker at each end of row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 4 times more. Fasten off.

Edging: With RS of Front facing, join 2 strands of MC with sl st to bottom right corner. Ch 1. Work 27 sc up right side of Front. Fasten off.
With RS of Front facing, join MC with sl st to top left corner. Ch 1. Work 27 sc down left side of Front. Rep for Back.

Gusset
With 2 strands of MC, ch 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more.
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc.
Next 7 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc.
Next row: 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 1. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 30 ins [76 cm], ending with RS facing for next row.
Next row: Ch 1. Draw up loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook- sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc.
Next 7 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sc.
Next 6 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.

Handles (make 2)
With 2 strands of MC, ch 51.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 50 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 7 times more. Fasten off.
Fold handle lengthwise and sew closed.

FINISHING
Pin Front and Gusset tog between markers, WS facing. Join 2 strands of MC with sl st at left marker and working through both thicknesses proceed in sc down left side of Bag, across bottom and up right side to opposite marker. Do not turn.
Next row: Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Rep for Back.
With RS of work facing, join 2 strands of MC with sl st to marked st. Ch 1. Work 1 row of reverse sc around upper edge of Bag. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew Handles to inside of Bag 2½ ins [6 cm] in from side edges as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit™ Kit includes 12 balls (50 g/1.7 oz each; 600 g/21 oz total), yardage (85 m/93 yds each; 1020 m/1116 yds total).
Version 1
Contrast A Shocking Pink 1 ball or 16 yds/15 m
Contrast B Cherry Red 1 ball or 12 yds/11 m
Version 2
Contrast A Lavender 1 ball or 16 yds/15 m
Contrast B Royal 1 ball or 12 yds/11 m
or any 2-color combination.
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Puff st = (Yoh and draw up a long loop) 4 times in indicated stitch. 9 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through 8 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through last 2 loops on hook – Puff st made.
measurements: Approx 3½” [9 cm] square.
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Pocket is worked flat then seamed.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
• To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color, yoh with new color and proceed.
• Carry yarn not in use, across top of row. Sts will be worked over loose strand of yarn.
With A, ch 12.
(See Diagram on page 2).
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Join B. Turn. Break A. 10 hdc.
2nd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc to end of row. Join A. Turn. Break B.
3rd and 4th rows: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. With B, puff st in next hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. With B, puff st in next hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn.
6th row: As 3rd row.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. With B, puff st in next hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of last 5 hdc. Turn.
8th row: With A, as 3rd row.
9th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. Ch 6. Skip next 6 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join B. Turn. Break A.
10th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 hdc. 6 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in each of last 2 hdc. Join A. Turn. Break B.
11th row: With A, as 3rd row.
12th to 18th rows: Rep 2nd to 8th rows.
19th row: With A, as 3rd row.
20th row: With B, as 2nd row.
21st row:  With A, as 3rd row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold work in half with WS tog. With ch-6 opening facing up, join B with sl st to left corner of fold. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, join 3 sides with sc, having 3 sc in corners. Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Shetland Chunky (100 g / 3.5 oz) Main Color (MC) (03520 Russet)  5 balls
Patons® Shetland Chunky Tweeds (100 g / 3.5 oz) Contrast A (67031 Earthy Brown Tweeds) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
Small amount of stuffing for Acorns.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcfp made.
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcbp made.
measurements: 12 ins [30.5 cm] wide x 15 ins [38 cm] long x 2 ins [5 cm] deep.
gauge: 14 hdc and 10 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
BODY
Note: Ch 2 does not count as hdc.
Ch 46. 
1st row:(RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 44 hdc. 
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcfp in each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
5th to 7th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dcbp in each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 7th rows of Basketweave Pat until work from beg measures approx 32 ins [81.5 cm], ending with 7th row of pattern.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.
Place markers along side edges 15 ins [38 cm] and 17 ins [43 cm] up from foundation ch to mark Gussets position.
Gussets and Straps (make 2 Gussets and 2 Straps). Ch 7. 
1st row:(RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 5 hdc. 
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 15 ins [38 cm].
FINISHING: Pin pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth, leaving cloth to dry. 
With WS of Body and Gusset facing each other, place foundation edge of Gusset between markers at side of Bag. Align upper edges of Body and Gusset. Join MC with sl st to upper left corner of Bag. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses: 36 sc along side of Bag and Gusset to bottom, 4 sc across bottom, 36 sc up other side of Bag. Fasten off. 
Rep for second Gusset.
Upper edging: With RS of work facing, join MC with sl st at upper left corner of Bag. Ch 1. Work one row of sc around upper edge of Bag. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not turn. 
Next row: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
LEAF (make 4)
With A, ch 2. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in sc. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc.
5th to 8th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
(12 sc at end of 8th row).
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
10th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next 2 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. Sl st in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sl st in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in next 2 sc. Yoh and draw a loop through all 3 loops on hook - Sc2tog made. 1 sc in next sc. Sl st in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn.
Leave rem sts unworked.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
13th to 16th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
(12 sc at end of 16th row).
17th to 19th rows: Rep 10th to 12th rows.
20th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog over next 2 sts) twice. Turn.
21st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Fasten off. 
Edging: With RS of work facing, join A at foundation ch. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around, having 3 sc in each outside curve and miss 1 sc at each inside corner. Do not break yarn. 
Stem: Ch 6. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each of next 4 ch. Fasten off.
ACORN (make 4)
Acorn Body: With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc. Fasten off.
Stuff lightly.
Acorn Cap: With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: (RS). 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing Cap to Body.
Stem: With A, ch 4.
Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each of next 2 ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Straps to top edge of Bag, 2 ins [5 cm] in from sides, as shown in picture.
Sew Acorn Cap to top of Acorn Body. Attach Stem.
Sew Acorns and Leaves to Bag as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart® Granny Square All in One™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m) White-Citrus Twist (2002) 1 ball or 12 Granny Squares
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] square, excluding strap.
gauge: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
Notes:
• Motifs begin (beg) with Color 1 (shortest color repeat (rep)) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• Each color aligns with 1 rnd in the Motif with 5 colors in total. If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• When Motif is complete, cut yarn where Color 5 (longest color rep) ends, leaving a tail for weaving in. Begin next Motif with Color 1 and rep 5 rnds for each Motif.
MOTIF
Make 12
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
Beg with Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd:  (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd:  Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off.

Assembly
Seaming with Flat Sl St Join: (RS). Following Assembly Diagram, sl st Motifs tog, working through back loops only and keeping working yarn to WS of work to create a flat sl st chain detail on RS of work (see diagram).

Note: Keep working yarn to WS of work so only flat sl st chain is visible on RS.

STRAP
Note: To work Strap, use yarn as ‘self-striping’ yarn allowing colors to change as they appear.
Ch 9.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Whipstitch each end of Strap to corner: (3 dc, ch-3, 3 dc) of 2 top Motifs at Bag opening. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Sage Green (00084) 3 balls or 290 yds/269 m
Contrast B Overcast (01042) 2 balls or 140 yds/128 m
Contrast C Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 100 yds/93 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
Split ring stitch marker.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] wide x 12" [30.5 cm] high when folded flat, excluding straps.
gauge: 11 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn worked together.
instructions: Note: Do not join rnds. Work Base in spiral, moving marker onto first st of each rnd for easier counting. Beg at Base, with 2 strands of A, ch 21. 1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 18 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 18 ch. 2 sc in last ch. PM on first sc. 42 sc. 2nd rnd: 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. (2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. (2 sc in next sc) twice. 48 sc. 3rd rnd: 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 54 sc. 4th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 60 sc. 5th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 66 sc. 6th to 9th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc at end of 9th rnd. Break A. Note: To work check pat in next 9 rnds, carry colors when not in use across top of previous rnd and work sts around carried colors. To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st in first color, yoh with new color and proceed. Join these rnds and turn at end of each rnd to alternate RS and WS – this achieves straighter check pat. Check Pat: 10th rnd:  (RS). Join 2 strands of B with sl st in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc; joining C in last sc. *With C, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc; joining B in last sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc; joining C in last sc. Rep from * around to last 3 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 11th rnd: (WS). With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc; joining B in last sc. *With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc; joining C in last sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc; joining B in last sc. Rep from * around to last 3 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 12th rnd: (RS). With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc; joining C in last sc. *With C, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc; joining B in last sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc; joining C in last sc. Rep from * around to last 3 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join B with sl st to first sc. Turn. 13th rnd: (WS). With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc; joining C in last sc. *With C, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc; joining B in last sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc; joining C in last sc. Rep from * around to last 3 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 14th rnd: (RS). With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc; joining B in last sc. *With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc; joining C in last sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc; joining B in last sc. Rep from * around to last 3 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 15th rnd: As 13th rnd; ending with join B with sl st to first sc. 16th rnd: As 12th rnd. Do not join B at end of rnd. 17th rnd: As 11th rnd. 18th rnd: As 12th rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Check Pat is complete. Note: Work rem rnds in spiral (as before), working all rnds on RS and PM on first st of each rnd for easier counting. Break B only. Join 1 strand of A. Next rnds will be worked with 1 strand each of A and C held tog. 19th rnd: (RS). With 1 strand each of A and C, work 1 sc in each sc around. PM on first sc. Rep last rnd 5 times more. Join with sl st to first sc at end of last rnd. Break C. Join another strand of A. Next rnd:  With 2 strands of A, work 1 sc in each sc around. PM on first sc. Rep last rnd until Tote, when folded flat, measures 12" [30.5 cm] long. Join with sl st to first sc at end of last rnd. Fasten off. STRAPS  (make 2-worked  lengthwise) With 2 strands of B, ch 79. 1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 77 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 77 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Sew ends of Straps in position approx 9" [23 cm] apart and 2½" [6 cm] down from top edge (see photo).

materials: Caron® Colorama Bamboo Blend™ (8 oz/227 g; 396 yds/363 m)
Contrast A Blush (82001) 2 balls or 425 yds/389 m
Contrast B Wheat (82006) 1 ball or 375 yds/343 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] deep x 20" [51 cm] long excluding handles.
gauge: 14 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm]; Motif = 7" [18 cm] square.
instructions:
MOTIF (Make 8 with A, make 5 with B)
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 4 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 3 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 3. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * twice more. Ch 3. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each sc to next corner ch-3 sp. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) all in corner ch-3 sp] 4 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th to 16th rnds: Rep 4th rnd 12 times more.
Fasten off.

STRAPS (Make 2)
With B, ch 85.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. (84 sc).
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.

Assembly: Following diagrams, join Motifs tog, matching lettered sides, using rows of sc through back loops.
Bag Edging
With RS facing, join B with sl st to any corner.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around, working 3 sc in each ch-3 sp. Join with sl to to top of first sc. Fasten off.
Sew Straps in position.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g; 102 yds/93 m) Poppy Ombre (02528) 6 balls or 600 yds/546 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Popcorn = Work 5 dc into same stitch or space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 5 dc group. Pull dropped loop through st. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] deep x 20" [51 cm] wide, excluding handles.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
MOTIFS  (make 13)
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to top of ch 3.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 3 dc in ring. Ch 1. (4 dc in ring. Ch 1) 3 times. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 3 dc and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *(4 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in each of next 3 dc and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Skip next dc. *1 dc in each dc to next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before next ch-1 sp. Skip next dc. (2 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 dc in each dc to next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before first ch-1 sp. Join.

4th rnd: Sl st in next dc and next popcorn. Ch 3. (1 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Skip 1 dc. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before next popcorn. Skip next dc. (2 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in top of popcorn. Rep from * twice more. Skip 1 dc. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before next popcorn. Join.
Rep 4th rnd until Motif measures 7" [18 cm] square. Fasten off.

Straps
Ch 75.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 74 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of last row.

FINISHING
Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. With WS tog, following diagrams, join Motifs tog, matching lettered sides and working in sc through back loops only. Edging: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to any corner st. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around, working 3 sc in corners. Join with sl to to top of first sc. Fasten off. Sew Straps in position as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® Holiday®: 1 ball 6040 Green/Silver
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Bag measures 8” x 10” (20 x 25 cm)
gauge: CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Front and Back (Alike)
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 30; dc in 6th ch from hook, * skip 2 ch, 5 dc in next ch, skip 2 ch, dc in next ch, ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch; repeat from * across; turn.
Rows 2-16: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1), skip first dc and next ch-1, dc in next dc, * skip 2 dc, 5 dc in next dc, skip 2 dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next ch-1 **, dc in next dc; repeat from * to last 2 sts, end at **; skip next ch, dc in next ch; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 16.
Side Panel
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 7; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3, skip first sc, dc in next 5 sc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in 5 dc, sc in top of ch-3; turn.
Rows 4-58: Repeat Rows 2 and 3. Fasten off at end of Row 58.
Assembly
With wrong sides of panel and front together, join yarn in upper corner of front; ch 1, sc evenly through both layers down side edge, 3 sc in corner, sc across bottom edge, 3 sc in corner, and sc evenly up next edge. Fasten off. Repeat for back. Weave in ends.
Handle (Make 2)
Ch 30; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across. Fasten off. Sew in place as shown. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Super Size™ (4 oz/113 g; 174 m/190 yds) Contrast A Ecru (18004) 2 balls or 275 yds/250 m
Contrast B Black (18040) 2 balls or 242 yds/220 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Susan Bates® stitch markers
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] wide and 12" [30.5 cm] tall, excluding handles
gauge: 18 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Side and first handle: Beg at side edge, with B, ch 161. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 160 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more. Join A. Break B.
With A, rep last row 8 times. Fasten off at end of last row.
Body: 1st row: (RS). Skip first 27 sc. Join B with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st and each sc to last 27 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
Work on these 106 sc as follows:
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more. Join A. Break B.
With A, rep 2nd row 8 times. Join B. Break A at end of last row. 
With B, rep 2nd row 8 times. Fasten off at end of last row.
Side and second handle: 1st row: (RS). With A, ch 27. 1 sc in each of next 106 sc. Ch 28. Turn.
2nd row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 26 ch. 1 sc in each of next 106 sc. 1 sc in each of last 27 ch. Turn. 160 sc. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 3rd row 5 times more. Join B. Break A. 
With B, rep 3rd row 8 times. Fasten off at end of last row. 
Gusset: (make 2).
With A, ch 51. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 50 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more. Fasten off at end of last row.
Following diagram, PM for Gusset 1¾" [4 cm] apart at each side of Bag base. Pin Gusset in place. 
Holding side edges of Bag and Gusset with WS tog, join B with sl st to top corner of Gusset. Ch 1. 
Working through both thicknesses, work in sc across 3 sides of Gusset to join to body of Bag. Fasten off. 
Rep for other side.
Sew tops of handles tog.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds; stripes: 56.7 g/2 oz; 86 m/95 yds)
main color (mc) Hot Green (01712) 250 m/275 yds or 2 balls
contrast a Lime Stripes (21712) 50 m/55 yds or 1 ball
contrast B Yellow (00010) 40 m/45 yds or 1 ball
contrast c Country Red (01530) 50 m/55 yds or 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
2 sew-on googly eyes
Red zipper 14" [35 cm] long
6 stitch markers
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times in next stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Tr5tog = [(Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 5 times all in next stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] tall x 9" [23 cm] wide excluding straps.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Back
With MC, ch 14.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 
Turn. 13 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn. 17 sc. 
4th and alt rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in last sc. 
Turn. 21 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in last sc. 
Turn. 25 sc. 
9th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in last sc. 
Turn. 29 sc. 
11th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in last sc. 
Turn. 33 sc. 
13th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in last sc. 
Turn. 37 sc. 
15th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in last sc. 
Turn. 41 sc. 
16th to 22nd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Place first set of markers at each end of 16th row. 
23rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 39 sc.
24th to 28th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
29th to 34th rows: As 23rd to 28th rows. 37 sc. Place second set of markers at each end of last row. 
shape head: 35th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn. 41 sc. 
36th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
37th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 45 sc.
38th row: As 36th row. 
39th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 49 sc.
40th row: As 36th row. 
shape eyes: 41st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. (5 tr in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (5 tr in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Turn. 
42nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
43rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. (Tr5tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Tr5tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Turn. 45 sts. 
44th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. 
fasten off.  
shape mouth: 45th row: (RS). Miss first 9 sc. Join MC with sl st to next sc. 
Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each sc to last 9 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. Place third set of markers at each end of row. 
46th to 53rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 11 sts rem at end of last row. 
fasten off. 
Belly
Turn work up-side down. With RS facing, join A with sl st to first ch of foundation chain. 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 12 rem ch of foundation ch. Turn. 13 sc. 
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
7th to 16th rows: As 2nd to 6th rows twice more. 19 sc at end of last row. Place first set of markers at each end of last row. 
17th to 20th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
21st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
22nd to 25th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
26th to 30th rows: As 21st to 25th rows. 
31st row: As 21st row. 13 sts. 
32nd to 34th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. Place second set of markers at each end of last row.
shape bottom head: 35th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 
36th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
37th to 40th rows: As 35th and 36th rows twice more. 19 sc at end of last row.
41st row: Ch 1. (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 23 sc. 
42nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
43rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 27 sc.  
44th and 45th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. Place third set of markers at each end of last row. 
shape mouth: 46th to 53rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Turn. 
Leave rem sts unworked. 11 sts rem at end of last row. 
fasten off. 
rear Legs (make 2) 
With MC, ch 4. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Turn. 
3 sc. 
2nd, 4th and 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc. 
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 
7 sc. 
7th to 11th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 17 sc at end of last row. Do not turn. Join in rnd with sl st to first sc. 
Cont working in rnds:
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until work from foundation chain measures 12" [30.5 cm], joining C at end of last rnd. Break MC. 
next rnd: With C, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 26 sc. 
Divide for webbed feet: 1st toe: 1st rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 1. Miss next 19 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
***2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 1 sc in next ch 1. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. Join with sl st to first st. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Join with sl st to first st. 
5th rnd: Ch 3. Bobble. Sl st to next st. 
fasten off.***
2nd toe: 1st rnd: Join C with sl st to rem loop of ch 1 at right on 1st toe. 
Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 1. Miss next 13 sc. 
1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Work from *** to *** as given for 1st toe. 
3rd toe: 1st rnd: Join C with sl st to rem loop of ch 1 at right on 2nd toe. 
Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 1. Miss next 7 sc. 
1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Work from *** to *** as given for 1st toe. 
4th toe: 1st rnd: Join C with sl st to rem loop of ch 1 at right on 3rd toe. 
Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Work 3rd to 5th rnds as given for 1st toe.**
Front Legs (make 2) 
With MC, ch 17. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st and each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 17 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm], joining C at end of last rnd. Break MC. 
Work from ** to ** as given for Rear Legs. 
Straps (make 2)
With B, ch 8.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. 
Turn. 6 hdc. 
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. 
Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg measures 12" [30.5 cm]. 
fasten off. 
Finishing
Sew Back to Belly matching sets of markers to third set of markers. 
fold opening flat and sew in zipper for mouth.
Sew front Legs at corners of mouth. Sew one end of both Straps at foundation row of Back. Sew other ends of Straps to each of front Legs. 
Beg at foundation row, sew shaped end of Rear Legs at sides of Body. 
Try on Backpack and sew toes of Rear Legs to Straps as shown in picture. 
Sew googly eyes to each Tr5tog group.

materials: RED HEART® Grande™: 3 balls
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 11.5mm [US P-16]
Stitch markers
yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Tote measures 12½” [32 cm] long x 27½” [70 cm] circumference.
gauge: 7 sc = 4” [10 cm]; 8 rows = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in first ch. Place marker in first st for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Working in continuous rounds, 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: *2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around – 18 sts.
Round 4: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 5: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Round 6: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around – 36 sts.
Round 7: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around – 42 sts.
Round 8: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts; repeat from * around – 48 sts.
Rounds 9-20: Sc in each st around.
Shape Handles
Round 21: Sc in first 7 sts, ch 14, skip next 10 sts, sc in next 14 sts, ch 14, skip next 10 sts, sc in last 7 sts – 56 sts.
Round 22: Work sc in each st and ch around – 56 sc.
Round 23: Sc in each st around.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 95 yds/86 m) Main Color (MC) Jute (00082) 1 ball
Contrast A Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball
Small quantities of Country Red (01530) and Hot Orange (01628)
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 stitch markers.
6" (15 cm) zipper.
2 glue-on googly eyes.
Glue.
abbreviations: Dtr = (Yoh) 3 times and draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times
measurements: Approx 5” [12.5 cm] wide x 4¼” [11 cm] high.
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Body
With MC, ch 6.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in last sc. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 3 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. 5 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 5 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sc. 3 sc in next sc, placing marker on center sc. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
9th to 13th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Shape head and tail: 14th rnd: Skip first sc (where last sl st was worked). Sl st in each of next 5 sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Sl st in each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Join with sl st to first sl st.
15th rnd: Skip first sc (where last sl st was worked). Sl st in each of next 6 sts. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Sl st in each of next 7 sts. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Join with sl st to first sl st.
16th rnd: Skip first sc (where last sl st was worked). Sl st in each of next 7 sts. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sl st in each of next 9 sts. 1 sc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 11 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Sl st in last sc. Join with sl st to first sl st.
