17th rnd: Skip first sc (where last sl st was worked). Sl st in each of next 8 sts. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc, placing marker on center sc (tail end). Sl st in each of next 11 sts. 1 sc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc, placing marker on center hdc (head end). 1 sc in last sc. Sl st in each of last 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.
Wing (make 2)
With A, ch 6. 
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in last sc. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 3 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Ch 4. (1 tr. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Tail Feather
With A, ch 7.
1st row: [1 dtr. (Ch 6. Sl st. Ch 6. 1 dtr) twice. Ch 6. Sl st] all in 7th ch from hook. Fasten off.
Comb
With Country Red, ch 4.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 4. Skip first sc. 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 4. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Fasten off.
Beak
With Hot Orange, ch 3.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in last ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Work running st embroidery with MC around 3rd rnd of Wing.
Sew 1 Wing to each side of Body as shown in photo.
Fold Body in half at markers. Sew top of Head along final rnd for 1” [2.5 cm]. Sew zipper in position along top edge (after head seam). Sew Tail Feather and Comb in position. Sew side edge of Beak in position to form triangle. Glue googly eyes in position.

pattern_name: CROCHET HYDRATED HIKER WATER BOTTLE SLING
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/71 g; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC) Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball
Contrast A White (00001) 1 ball
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
measurements: Designed to fit most 17 to 24 oz metal water bottles, approx 8" [20.5 cm] tall excluding handle.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
1st rnd (RS):  With MC, make a magic loop. Video here. Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). [Dc in ring. Ch 1] 7 times. Join with a sl st in third ch. 8 dc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 5 (counts as tr and ch 1). Tr in next ch sp. Ch 1. [Tr in next st. Ch 1. Tr in next ch sp. Ch 1] 7 times. Join with sl st in 4th ch. 16 tr.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each ch sp around. Join with sl st in first sc. 32 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Sc in each st around. Join.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. [Sc in next 8 sts. Ch 7. Skip 7 sts. Sc in next st] twice. Join. 18 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. [Sc in next 8 sts. Sc in next ch sp. Ch 5. Sc in same ch sp. Sc in next st] twice. Join. 22 sc.
7th rnd:  Ch 1. [Sc in next 9 sts. Sc in next ch sp. Ch 3. Sc in same ch sp. Sc in next 2 sts] twice. Join. 26 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 8 (counts as tch and ch 7). Skip 7 sts. [Sc in next 3 sts. Sc in next ch sp. Ch 1. Sc in same ch sp. Sc in next 3 sts]. Ch 7. Skip 7 sts. Rep from [ to ]. Join with sl st in second ch. 16 sc.
9th rnd:  Ch 1. [Sc in next ch sp. Ch 5. Sc in same ch sp. Sc in next 4 sts. Sc in next ch sp. Sc in next 4 sts] twice. Join. 22 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. [Sc in next st. Sc in next ch sp. Ch 3. Sc in same ch sp. Sc in next 10 sts] twice. Join. 26 sc.
11th rnd:  Ch 1. [Sc in next 2 sts. Sc in next ch sp. Ch 1. Sc in same ch sp. Sc in next 11 sts] twice. Join. 30 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. Sc in each sc and ch sp around. Join. 32 sc.
13th - 19th rnds:  Rep 5th - 12th rnds. Break MC.
20th rnd: With A, join to first st of previous rnd. Ch 1. [Sc in next 8 sts. Ch 7. Skip 7 sts. Sc in next st] twice. Join. 18 sc.
21st - 26th rnds:  Rep 5th - 12th rnds. Do not break yarn. Turn.
Make Handle
1st row: Ch 3 (counts as first dc). Dc in next 5 sts. Turn. 6 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. Dc in each st across. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Handle measures approx 48" [122 cm], or to desired length.
Assembly:  Break yarn leaving a 12" [30.5 cm] tail. Whip stitch last row of Handle to opposite side of 26th rnd. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Eco-Cotton™ Blend: 2 skeins Almond
Crochet Hook: 3.75 mm [US F-5]
Stitch marker
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Bag measures 12” wide x 14” tall, unstretched. Bag has considerable stretch.
gauge: Rounds 1-9 = 4” diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
BASE
Round 1 (Right Side): Using adjustable loop technique, work 8 sc in ring – 8 sts. Mark beginning of round, moving marker up each round.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 16 sts.
Round 3: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 32 sts.
Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 40 sts.
Round 6: *Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 48 sts.
Round 7: *Sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 56 sts.
Round 8: *Sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 64 sts.
Round 9: *Sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 72 sts.
Round 10: *Sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 80 sts.
Round 11: *Sc in each of next 9 sts, 2 sc in next st; rep from * around – 88 sts.
Round 12: *Sc in next 10 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 96 sts.
MESH SECTION
Round 1: Sc in first st, *ch 5, skip next 2 sts, sc in next st; repeat from * to last 2 sts, ch 2, skip 2 sts, dc in first st to join – 32 spaces.
Round 2: (Dc just made is first st of rnd), *ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around, end ch 2, dc in first st to join – 32 spaces.
Rounds 3-30: Repeat Round 2.
TOP
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc around length of joining dc, hdc in same place, *3 hdc in next ch-space; hdc in next sc; repeat from * around, end hdc in last space, slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 128 sts.
Round 2: Sc2tog, *sc in next st, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 85 sts.
Rounds 3-5: Sc in each st around.
FIRST HANDLE
Row 1: Working in back loop only, sc in each of next 4 sts, turn – 4 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loop of previous row and unused loop of row below, sc in each st – 4 sts.
Repeat Row 2 until 14” or desired length. Fasten off leaving a long tail.
Skip next 8 sts. Sew short end of handle to next 4 sts.
SECOND HANDLE
Skip next 26 sts. Working in back loop only, join with sc in next st, sc in each of next 3 sts – 4 sts.
Work as for First Handle.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily Sugar ’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g /2.5 oz / Ombres and Prints: 56.7 g/2 oz)
3 Color Version: 2 balls each of Main Color (MC), and 1 ball each of Contrast A and Contrast B
Version 1: MC (Sage Green 84), A (Country Sage 2233), B (Natural Ombre 228)
Version 2: MC (Buttercream Ombre 222), A (Cream 03), B (Soft Ecru 1004)
Version 3: MC (Rose Pink 46), A (Yellow 10), B (Spring Meadows 173)
Version 4: MC (Cornflower Blue 83), A (White 01), B (Cool Breeze Ombre 227)
Version 5: MC (Cornflower Blue 83), A (Yellow 10), B (Violet Veil 223)
2 Color Version: 2 balls each of Main Color (MC) and 1 ball Contrast A
Version 6: MC (Faded Denim 181), A (Denim Blue 192)
Version 7: MC (Rose Pink 46), A (Strawberry 144)
or Lily Sugar ’n Cream Super Size (Solids: 113 g/ 4 oz / Ombres and Prints 85 g/3 oz)
3 Color Version: 1 ball of MC, Contrast A and Contrast B
2 Color Version: 1 ball of MC and Contrast A
Size 4.50 mm (U.S. 7) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 9 ins [23 cm] square
gauge: One Motif = 3½ ins [9 cm] square
instructions:
3 Color Version
Motif (make 8)
With B, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc in ring) 3 times. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join MC with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp. [Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join A with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp. [Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
2 Color Version
Motif (make 8)
Work as given for Motif of 3 Color Version substituting A for B. 
Both Versions: Sew 4 motifs tog for Front and Back.
Edging: Join MC with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 4 dc in same sp. *(1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in sp between 2 Motifs. (1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 5 dc in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
Place WS of Back and Front tog. Join MC at top left corner and work 1 row of sc around opposite corner to join 3 sides of Bag.
Top Edging: With RS of work facing, join MC at seam and work 1 rnd of sc around top of Bag. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Handles (make 2)
With MC, ch 49.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. 47 dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as first dc). 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: As 2nd row. Do not turn. Fold Handle in half length-wise. Work 1 row of sc through rem loop of foundation ch and corresponding st of last row to join edges tog. Fasten off. 
Sew on Handles as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ O’Go (Solids: 7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m; Prints: 5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Main Color (MC) Black (7120) 1 O’Go
Contrast A, B, C, D, and E: Newsprint (7124) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] square x 3" [7.5 cm] deep, excluding handles.
gauge: 12 dc and 7.5 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove
• For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. Follow color guide shown in Materials section for each O’Go (Contrast A, B, C, D, and E). You may find it helpful to place each color section in its own resealable (zip lock) bag and label each bag A, B, C, D, and E.

MOTIFS (make 6 each of Square 1, 2, and 3):
Square 1: A as Color 1, C as Color 2, B as Color 3, MC as Color 4.
Square 2: D as Color 1, B as Color 2, E as Color 3, MC as Color 4.
Square 3: E as Color 1, A as Color 2, C as Color 3, MC as Color 4.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc in ring) 3 times. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any ch-2 corner sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same ch-2 sp as last sl st. *(3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to any ch-2 corner sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same ch-2 sp as last sl st. *3 dc in next sp between 3-dc cluster. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. 3 dc in next sp between 3-dc cluster. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join Color 4 with sl st to any ch-2 corner sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same ch-2 sp as last sl st. *3 dc in next sp between 3-dc cluster twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. 3 dc in next sp between 3-dc cluster twice. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Using Motif Assembly Diagram on page 3, sew Squares tog using MC.

Top Edges of Body of Bag:
With RS facing, join MC with sl st to top right corner of Body of Bag.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc or corner sp to end of Top Edge. Fasten off.
Rep for second Top Edge as indicated in Motif Assembly Diagram.

Bag Sides (make 2).
With MC, ch 44. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 41 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 87 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 42 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 90 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 42 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 93 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 42 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 96 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 42 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 99 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 42 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not turn. 102 sc.
Working across straight edge of Bag Side, ch 1 and work 10 sc evenly across.
Fasten off.
Join Bag Sides to Body of Bag
Using safety pins, pin Sides to Body of Bag as shown in Bag Assembly Diagram on page 3.
With RS of Body of Bag facing, join MC with sl st to top corner of Body of Bag and Side.
1st row: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 104 sc evenly around edge. Fasten off.
Rep for second side.

Bag Handles (make 2).
With MC, ch 67.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 66 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 3" [7.5 cm].
Fasten off.
Sew Handles to Bag as shown in photo.

materials: Caron® Little Crafties™ (20 g/.07 oz per shade x 20 shades)
Jack-o-Lantern: Orange, Black, Kelly Green
Vampire: Orchid, Black
Skull: White, Black
Size U.S G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 6" [15 cm] tall.
gauge: 17 hdc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.

JACK-O-LANTERN
Bag: With Orange, ch 3.
1st rnd:  10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd:  Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
6th to 13th rnds:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
14th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Break Orange. Join with Kelly Green.
15th and 16th rnds:  With Kelly Green, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Fasten off.

Eyes (make 2)
With Black, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.

Mouth
With Black, ch 14.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Ch 1. 1 hdc in next ch. Ch 2. Sl st in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Ch 1. 1 hdc in next ch. Ch 2. Sl st in next ch. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off.
Sew Eyes and Mouth to Bag as shown in photo.

Drawstring
With Kelly Green, ch 55.
Fasten off. Using yarn needle, weave Drawstring through 15th rnd of Bag.

VAMPIRE
Bag: With Orchid, ch 3.
1st rnd:  10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd:  Ch 2. Working in back loops only,  1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
6th to 12th rnds:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
13th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Break Orchid. Join with Black.
14th to 16th rnds: With Black, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Fasten off.
Using length of Black, embroider eyes, eyebrows and mouth using straight st on Bag as shown in photo.
Using length of White, embroider fangs using straight st on Bag as shown in photo.

Drawstring
With Black, work as for Jack-o-lantern Bag.

SKULL
Bag: With White, ch 3.
1st rnd:  10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd:  Ch 2. Working in back loops only,  1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
6th to 16th rnds:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Fasten off.
Eyes (make 2)
With Black, ch 3.
1st rnd:  10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join.
Fasten off.
Sew Eyes to Bag as shown in photo.
Using length of Black, embroider mouth and nose using straight st on Bag as shown in photo.

Drawstring
With White, work as for Jack-o-lantern Bag.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver Stripes™ (5 oz/141g; 236 yds/215 m)
Parrot Stripes (4968) 2 balls or 466 yds/426 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] wide x 15½" [39.5 cm] high x 10" [25.5 cm] deep, excluding handles.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
BAG
Ch 13. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: 2 dc in 4th ch from hook. (Ch 1. Skip next 2 ch. 3 dc in next ch) twice. Ch 1. Skip next 2 ch. [(3 dc. Ch 2) twice. 3 dc] all in next ch. Working along other side of ch, (Ch1. Skip next 2 ch. 3 dc in next ch) twice. Ch 1. Skip next 2 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2) twice all in next ch. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 sts and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 3 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next 2 sts and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 4 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
4th rnd: Sl st in next 2 sts and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 5 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
5th rnd: Sl st in next 2 sts and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 6 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
Cont as established, working (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp and (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in each ch-2 sp, having 1 more dc group along each edge of Bag each rnd, until work measures approx 14" [35.5 cm] across longest edge.
Next rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 sts and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 or ch-2 sp around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
Next rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 sts and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
Rep last rnd until work from last inc rnd measures 14" [35.5 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc or ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.
STRAPS (make 2).
Ch 81.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 80 sc.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fold Strap in half lengthwise and working through both thicknesses to join 5th row to foundation row, work 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew Straps to Bag as shown in photo.

materials: Caron® Cotton Cakes™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 211 yds/193 m) Maritimes (49007) 3 balls
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] wide x 14" [35.5 cm] high, excluding handles.
gauge: 16 hdc and 11 rnds = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
• Join with sl st to first st at end of each rnd.
Base: Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. Join. 30 sc.
Cont as established, inc 6 sc each rnd until there are 126 sc.
Main Section: 1st rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each sc around, inc 4 sts evenly around. Join. 130 hdc.
2nd to 39th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join.
40th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.
Straps (make 2)
With A, ch 100.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 99 sc.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fold Handle in half lengthwise and working through both thicknesses to join 5th row to foundation row, work 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew Straps in position as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 368 Paddy Green A, 624 Tea Leaf B and 512 Turqua C.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5 mm [US K-10 1/2].
Yarn needle.
Yarn needle, 1¾” (4.5 cm) Buttons (JHB International layered toggle #80272 black)
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Finished Size: 17” (43 cm) wide x 14” (35.5 cm) deep. Strap measures 24” (61 cm)
gauge: 8 sts and 8 rows in 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Closure Flap
With one strand each of A and B held together as one, ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each st across; turn – 6 sc.
Row 2-10: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, ch 2, skip next 2 sts, sc in each of last 2 sts; turn — 6 sts.
Change to A and C.
Row 12: With A and C, ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in each of last 2 sts; turn – 6 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in each of next 3 sts, skip next st, sc in last st – 4 sc. Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Bag
With right sides facing, using one strand each of A and B held together as one, sew Front to Back across Edging on 3 sides, leaving top edge open.
Closure Strap and Button
Sew base of Closure Strap to the center top of Back. Bring flap to the front of the bag. Sew button to Front aligned with button hole.
Straps
Starting in 2” (5 cm) from each side of Front, place each end of Strap 1” (2.5 cm) below the inside top of bag and using one strand each of A and B held together as one, sew ends of Strap to Front. In same manner, sew other Strap to Back.
Weave in ends.
BAG
Front/Back (make 2)
With one strand each of A and B held together as one, ch 36.
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook, dc in each ch across; turn – 35 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, *skip next st, (dc, sc) in next st; repeat from * across; turn – 35 sts.
Rows 3-4: Repeat Row 2. At end of last row, change to A and C.
Rows 5-6: With A and C, repeat Row 2. At end of last row, change to A and B.
Rows 7-10: With A and B, repeat Row 2. At end of last row, change to A and C.
Row 11-12: Repeat Rows 5-6.
Row 13-18: Repeat Rows 7-12. At end of last row, change A and B.
Rows 19-25: Repeat Row 2.
Edging
With right side of Front/Back facing, join one strand each of A and B in top left corner, ch 1, working across left side edge, work 24 sc evenly spaced across side, 3 sc in corner st, work 32 sc evenly spaced across bottom, 3 sc in corner st, work 24 sts evenly spaced across side to next corner. Fasten off.
Shoulder Straps (make 2)
With one strand each of A and B held together as one, ch 61.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn – 60 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Change to A and C.
Row 3: With A and C, repeat Row 2. Change to A and B.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton™ Blend”: 2 skeins 1370 Candy Marl.
Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8].
Yarn needle.
Elastic pony tail band.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Bag diameter measures 10” x 12” tall.
gauge: Rounds 1-5 of Base = 6½”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
POUCH
Round 1: Make a slip knot, working around elastic band, work 48 sc around band, slip st to first st in join – 48 sts.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in each st around, slip st in first st to join – 48 sts.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around, slip st to first st in join – 72 sts.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around, slip st in first st to join – 96 sts.
Fasten off.
BASE
Ch 8, slip st in first st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 23 dc in ring, slip st in first st to join – 24 sts.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same space, [2 dc in each st] around, slip st in first st to join – 48 sts.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in each st around, slip st in first st to join.
Round 4: Ch 3, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around, slip st in first st to join – 72 sts.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around, slip st in first st to join – 96 sts.
Round 6: With right sides together, join Base and Pouch, matching sts and working through both thicknesses, ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st in first st to join – 96 sts.
Rounds 7-9: Ch 3, dc in each st around, slip st in first st to join – 96 sts.
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in same st at joining, *ch 5, skip next 3 sts, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last 3 sts, ch 2, dc in first sc forming last loop – 24 loops.
Rounds 11-25: Ch 1, sc in loop just formed, *ch 5, sc in next loop; repeat from * around to last loop, ch 2, dc in first sc to form last loop.
Round 26: Ch 1, 3 sc in loop just formed, 5 sc in each loop around to first loop, 2 sc in loop, slip st in first st to join. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHIING
Strap
Ch 201, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. 
Fasten off. 
Weave through loops of Round 25. Sew ends together.
Weave in ends.
Fold Bag inside Pouch.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz.; 109 m/120 yds)
Version 1: Contrast A Indigo (01114) 3 balls
Contrast B Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball
Contrast C Tangerine (01699) 1 ball
Contrast D Red (00095) 1 ball
Contrast E Stonewash (01118) 1 ball
Version 2: Contrast A Jute (00082) 3 balls
Contrast B Mod Green (01223) 1 ball
Contrast C Hot Green (01712) 1 ball
Contrast D Blueberry (01725) 1 ball
Contrast E Black Currant (01318) 1 ball
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] wide x 14½" [37 cm] high, excluding handles.
gauge: 15 hdc and 12 rnds = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
•  When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
•  Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
•  Join with sl st to first st at end of each rnd.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 6 times. Join. 36 sc.
Cont as established, inc 6 sc each rnd until there are 126 sc. Join B at end of last rnd.
Proceed as follows:
1st rnd: With B, ch 2. Working into back loop only, 1 hdc in each sc around, inc 4 sts evenly around. Join. 130 hdc.
2nd to 9th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join A at end of 9th rnd.
10th rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join C.
11th to 19th rnds: With C, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join A at end of 19th rnd.
20th rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join D.
21st to 29th rnds: With D, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join A at end of 29th rnd.
30th rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join E.
31st to 39th rnds: With E, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join A at end of 39th rnd.
40th rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in sp between each hdc around. Join.
41st rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.
Straps (make 2)
With A, ch 111.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fold Handle in half lengthwise and working through both thicknesses to join 5th row to foundation row, work 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew straps in position as shown in photo.

pattern_name: Popcorn Around the Block Crochet Tote
materials: Caron® Cotton Funnel Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 425 yds/389 m) Peaches (43017) 2 cakes
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Popcorn = 5 dc into same stitch or space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 5 dc group. Pull dropped loop through st. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
measurements: Approx 23" x 70" [58.5 x 178 cm], excluding tassels.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = Approx 7" [18 cm] square.
instructions:
MOTIFS (make 13)
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to top of ch 3.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 3 dc in ring. Ch 1. (4 dc in ring. Ch 1) 3 times. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 3 dc and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *(4 dc. Ch 1. 4 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in each of next 3 dc and next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Skip next dc. *1 dc in each dc to next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before next ch-1 sp. Skip next dc. (2 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 dc in each dc to next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before first ch-1 sp. Join.
4th rnd: Sl st in next dc and next popcorn. Ch 3. (1 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Skip 1 dc. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before next popcorn. Skip next dc. (2 dc. Popcorn. 2 dc) in top of popcorn. Rep from * twice more. Skip 1 dc. 1 dc in each dc to 1 dc before next popcorn. Join.
Rep 4th rnd until Motif measures 7" [18 cm] square. Fasten off.
STRAPS (make 2)
Ch 75.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 74 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of last row.
FINISHING
Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. With WS tog, following diagrams, join Motifs tog, matching lettered sides and working in sc through back loops only.
Edging: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to to any corner st. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around, working 3 sc in corners. Join with sl to to top of first sc. Fasten off. Sew Straps in position.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 ball each of 718 Shocking Pink A, 319 Cherry Red B, 726 Coral C, and 400 Grey Heather D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4mm [G-6 US]
Yarn needle
Stitch markers
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Tote measures: 14” (35.5 cm) long x 14” (35.5 cm) wide x 3” (7.5 cm) deep, excluding handles.
gauge: Heart Motif through Row 5 = 4” (10 cm) across at widest point. Each motif measures 4½” (11.5 cm) long x 4½” (11.5 cm) wide, slightly stretched. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com
©2014 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 2
I Love My Tote 
Bag
Heart motifs are crocheted and sewn 
together in rows for a bag to tote your 
market purchases or to carry necessities 
to the office. This is the perfect gift to show 
your love! 
Row 4: Ch 2, 2 tr in next st, tr in next st, (tr, 
dc) in next st, 2 dc in next st, dc in next st, hdc
in each of next 2 sts, sc in next 3 st, (sc, ch 3,
sc) in ch-3 space, sc in next 3 st, hdc in next 2
st, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, (dc, tr) in next
st, tr in next st, 2 tr in last st, ch 3; join with
slip st in marked st directly below, turn—28
sts and 1 ch-3 sp. Remove this marker; leave
other marker in place.
Row 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first ch-3 space, 2 sc in
next st, (sc, hdc) in next st, 2 ehdc in next st,
(ehdc, hdc) in next st, 2 hdc in next st, (hdc,
sc) in next st, sc in each st across to next ch-3
space, (sc, ch 3, sc) in ch-3 space, sc in each
of next 8 sts, (sc, hdc) in next st, 2 hdc in next
st, (hdc, ehdc) in next st, 2 ehdc in next st,
place marker in 2nd ehdc of 2-st group just
made, (hdc, sc) in next st, 2 sc in last st, 2
sc in last ch-2 space, slip st in marked st of
Round 2. Remove this marker; leave marker in
Round 5 in place. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Motif Border
Note Chain loosely and take care not to twist 
chains when joining to Row 5. 
Round 1: With wrong side facing, join D with 
sc in marked st, sc in next st, ch 6, skip next 
4 sts, sc in each of next 3 sts, ch 14, skip next 
8 sc, sc in 2nd ch of next ch-3 space, ch 14, 
skip next 8 sc, sc in each of next 3 sts, ch 6, 
skip next 4 sts, sc in each of next 2 sts, ch 5; 
join with slip st in first sc, turn—11 sc and 
45 ch.
Tote measures: 14” (35.5 cm) long x 14” 
(35.5 cm) wide x 3” (7.5 cm) deep, excluding 
handles
Special Stitches
ehdc (extended half double crochet): Yarn 
over, insert hook in next st, yarn over, draw 
up a loop (3 loops on hook), yarn over, draw 
through one loop on hook, yarn over, draw 
through all 3 loops on hook.
Notes
1. Tote is made from bordered heart motifs
sewn together to form 2 panels. Panels are
edged then joined to gusset that forms the
sides and bottom of the tote. Handles are
worked on top edge of panels.
2. Each heart is worked in turned rounds. Not
all rounds are joined so follow instructions
carefully. Border is added to create a
square.
3. Squares are joined across horizontal edges
first, then joined across vertical edges.
4. Gusset is designed to stretch. Measure
length along outer edge.
TOTE
Motifs
Heart (make 18: 6 each with A, B, and C)
Ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook; join with slip st in first sc, turn—6 sc.
Note Place markers on Round 2 before joining.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join 
with slip st in first sc, turn—12 sc. Place 
markers in first and last sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first marked st, (sc, hdc) 
in next st, hdc in next st, (hdc, dc) in next st, 
2 dc in next st, (tr, ch 3, tr) in next st, 2 dc 
in next st, (dc, hdc) in next st, hdc in next st, 
(hdc, sc) in next st, 2 sc in next st, slip st in 
last marked st; do not join to first st, turn—20 
sts; 1 ch-3 space. 
RED HEART® Super 
Saver®, Art. E300 
available in solid color 
7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); 
multicolor, heather and print 5 oz 
(141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz 
(141 g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins
Designed by Randy Cavaliere
What you will need:
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 ball 
each of 718 Shocking Pink A, 319 
Cherry Red B, 726 Coral C, and 
400 Grey Heather D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 
4mm [G-6 US]
Yarn needle, Stitch markers
GAUGE: Heart Motif through Row 
5 = 4” (10 cm) across at widest 
point. Each motif measures 4½” 
(11.5 cm) long x 4½” (11.5 cm) 
wide, slightly stretched. CHECK 
YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook 
to obtain the gauge.

CROCHET  
SKILL LEVEL
INTERMEDIATE
SHOP KIT
I LOVE MY TOTE BAG | CROCHET    1 of 2

Round 2 (right side): Ch 1, sc in same st as 
join, sc in each ch to next 2 sc, sc in each of 
next 2 sc, sc in each of next 2 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) 
in next ch (corner made), sc in each of next 3 
ch, sc in each of next 3 sc, sc in each of next 
7 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch (corner made), 
sc in each of 6 ch, sc in next sc, sc in each 
of next 6 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch (corner 
made), sc in each of next 7 ch, sc in each of 
next 3 sc, sc in each of next 3 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) 
in next ch (corner made), sc in each of next 2 ch, sc in last sc; join with slip st in first sc, 
turn—60 sc and 4 ch-2 spaces. Fasten off, 
leaving a sewing length. 
Gusset
With D, ch 14.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch 
across, turn—13 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [ch 4, skip next 3 
sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, turn—4 sc; 3 ch-4 
spaces.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, ch 1, slip st in first 
ch-4 space, [ch 4, slip st in next ch-4 space] 
twice, ch 1, sc in last sc, turn—2 sc and 2 
ch-4 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [ch 4, slip st in next 
ch-4 space] twice, ch 4, sc in last sc, turn—2 
sc; 3 ch-4 spaces.
Repeat Rows 3-4 until Gusset measures 37½” 
(95 cm) long, ending with Row 3.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [ch 4, sc in next 
ch-4 space] twice, ch 4, sc in last sc, turn—4 
sc; 3 ch-4 spaces.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [3 sc in next 
ch-4 space, sc in next sc] 3 times, turn—13 sc
Last Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across—13 sc. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Front/Back Panel (make 2)
Join 9 Motifs together following Assembly 
Diagram for placement. Horizontal Strips 1 
and 2 are joined from last motifs across to 
first motifs, then Horizontal Strip 3 is joined 
to Strip 2 in the same manner. When joining 
vertically, skip over horizontal join and work 
into loops of remaining ch.
Horizontal Join: Hold last Motifs of first and 
2nd panels with wrong sides together, working 
through inner loops of horizontal edges, join 
A with slip st in 2nd ch of first ch-2 space, ** 
*ch 1, slip st in next st; repeat from * across
to next ch-2 space, ch 1, slip st in first ch of
next ch-2 space***, ch 1, slip st in 2nd ch of
ch-2 space of next motif; repeat from ** once;
repeat from ** to *** once. Fasten off. Repeat
to attach Panel 3 to the bottom of Panel 2.
Vertical Join: Rotate panel so right side and
vertical edges are facing. Working through
inner loops of vertical edges, join A with slip
st to 2nd ch of first ch-2 space, ** *ch 1, slip
st in next st; repeat from * across to next
ch-2 space ch 1, slip st in first ch of next ch-2
space***, ch 1, slip st in 2nd ch of ch-2 space
of next motif; repeat from ** once; repeat from
** to *** once. Fasten off.
Repeat Vertical Join across 3 remaining
unjoined Motifs.
Panel Edging 
Round 1: With right side facing, join A with 
sc in any outer corner ch-2 space, working in 
back loops only, *sc in each sc and ch-space to 
next outer corner ch-2 space**, sc in next ch-2 
space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat 
at **; join with slip st in first sc.
Block each panel to 14” x 14” (35.5 x 35.5 cm). 
On top edge, find midpoint over A and C-colored 
hearts and place markers 2 sts to the right of 
each midpoint (for placement of Handles). 
Gusset 
Measuring along long edge, place markers on 
each edge of Gusset to divide it into 3 equal 
sections. Holding long edge to wrong side of 
panel, place first and last rows at sc in ch-2 
spaces at top corners and marked rows to sc 
in ch-2 spaces at bottom corners. Sew Gusset 
to inner loops of Edging around both sides and 
bottom. Repeat to attach other long edge to 
2nd panel.
First Handle 
With wrong side of top of front panel 
facing, join C with sc to first marked st over 
A-colored heart.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in next 4 sc, turn— 
5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1 (does not count as st), hdc in first 
sc, hdc in each sc across, turn—5 hdc.
Repeat Row 2 until strap measures 10” (25.5 
cm) from beginning, change to B.
With B, repeat Row 2 until strap measures 20”
(51 cm) from beginning, ending with a wrong
side row. With wrong side of panel facing, hold
right sides of strap and panel together at 2nd
marked st over C-colored heart.
Last Row: Ch 1, working through double
thickness, sc in each of next 5 sts—5 sc.
Fasten off.
Repeat for Second Handle on back panel.
Weave in ends.

materials: Yarn: Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit™ - 1 Kit
Contrast A Cherry Red: 1 ball or 14.5 yds/13 m
Contrast B Shocking Pink: 1 ball or 21.5 yds/19.5 m
Contrast C Pumpkin: 1 ball or 18 yds/16.5 m
Contrast D Saffron: 1 ball or 32.5 yds/30 m
Contrast E Spring Green: 1 ball or 43.5 yds/40 m
Contrast F Jade: 1 ball or 25.5 yds/23 m
Contrast G Royal: 1 ball or 25.5 yds/23 m
Contrast H Lavender: 1 ball or 25.5 yds/23 m
Contrast I Soft White: 1 ball or 84 yds/76.5 m
Contrast J Black: 1 ball or 65.5 yds/60 m
Tools: Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge, Susan Bates® yarn needle, Tape measure.
measurements: Approx 12" wide x 12½" long, [30.5 x 32 cm], excluding Strap.
gauge: 12 single crochet (sc) and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = 5½" [14 cm] square.
instructions:
MOTIF 
Slip Knot 
With Color 1, make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then draw through to make slip knot. 
Chain 
Yarn over hook (Yoh), 
ReFeRRING t O COLOR MAp, MAKe 8 MOtIFS tOtAL: 

1st rnd: Ch 3. 9 dc in ring. Join Color 2 with sl st to top of beg ch 3. 10 dc. Break Color 1.

2nd rnd: With Color 2, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc. *2 dc in next dc. Repeat (Rep) from * around. Join with sl st to beg ch 3. 20 dc.

3rd rnd: Skip first dc. *(1 dc. 1 treble-crochet (tr) in next dc. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * around, ending by joining with sl st to top of ch-3 of previous (2nd) rnd. Fasten off.

4th rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to any center tr of 3-tr group. Ch 1. 1 sc in same stitch (st) as sl st. *1 half double crochet (hdc) in next tr. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in same st as sl st from previous (3rd) rnd. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc next tr. 1 single crochet (sc) in next tr. Rep from * around, omitting last sc and joining with a sl st to first sc. 

5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as sl st. *1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in next st. 2 dc in next st. (1 tr. Ch 1. 1 tr) in next st (corner made). 2 dc in next st. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Join Motifs 
Notes: With I (Soft White), use Flat Slip Stitch joining method to join Motifs together. Hold working yarn underneath work to create a flat seam. Keep a loose, even tension on the yarn while joining to keep Motifs flat and even. Too tight tension will cause them to bunch up. 

Place 2 Motifs beside each other, Right Side (RS) up. Join I (Soft White) with sl st to Motif on left in ch-1 corner space (sp). Insert hook from front to back into back loop of corner ch-1 on this same left Motif. Insert hook from front to back into back loop of corner ch-1 sp of right Motif. (3 loops on hook). Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw through 3 loops on hook. 

*Insert hook from front to back into back loop of next st on left Motif. Insert hook from front to back into back loop of corresponding st of right Motif. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Rep from * to end of Motif. 

Join 4 Motifs for each side as shown:
 
Flat Slip Stitch Joining Diagram

Front & Back Border 
1st rnd: With RS facing, join I (Soft White) with sl st to any ch-1 corner sp of 4 joined Motifs of Front. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Work 1 rnd of sc around 4 joined Motifs, working 3 sc in each corner ch-1 sp. Work 2 sc in last ch-1 sp (same sp as first sc). Join J (Black) with sl st to first sc. Break I.

2nd rnd: With J, ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sc around, working 3 sc in center sc of each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Rep for Back.

Join Front and Back 
With RS of Front and Back facing, join J (Black) with sl st to top right corner in 2nd sc of 3 sc corner. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each sc down right side, across bottom and up left side, working 3 sc in each corner. Fasten off at top of left side. 

STRAP 
With I (Soft White), ch 76.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 74 hdc.

2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc across. Turn. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Ombra™: 6 balls 3358 Viola
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Rucksack measures about 20” [51 cm] high and about 40” [101.5 cm] around base.
gauge: 12 sts = about 4” [10 cm]; 14 rows = about 4” [10 cm] in single crochet (sc) with 2 strands of yarn held together. 12 sts = about 4½” [11.5 cm] in half double crochet (hdc) with 2 strands of yarn held together.
instructions:
BASE
With 2 strands of yarn held together, ch 21.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—20 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across—21 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc to last sc, 2 sc in last sc—22 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Rows 6–25: Repeat Rows 2–5 for 5 more times—32 sc.
Row 26: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each sc across—31 sc.
Row 27: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 28: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog—30 sc.
Row 29: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Rows 30–49: Repeat Rows 26–29 for 5 more times—20 sc.
Fasten off.

BODY
With 2 strands of yarn held together, ch 54.
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—53 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, hdc in each hdc across.
Repeat Row 2 until piece is long enough for one long side edge to go around outer edge of base (about 40” [101.5 cm]).
Do not fasten off.
Seam First and Last Rows Together: Fold piece in half so that top of sts of last row match base of sts of first row; ch 1, working through both thicknesses, sc in each st across to seam body into a tube.
Fasten off. Turn body inside out so that seam is on inside of body.

SHOULDER STRAPS (make 2)
With 2 strands of yarn held together, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 3rd ch from hook, [ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch] 3 times—4 sc, 3 ch-1 spaces, and 1 beginning ch-space.
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, skip first sc, sc in next ch-1 space, [ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space] twice, ch 1, skip last sc, sc in beginning ch-space.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures about 21½” [54.5 cm] from beginning.
Fasten off. Repeat for second shoulder strap.

PULL CORD
With 2 strands of yarn held together, work chains sts until piece measures about 38” [96.5 cm] from beginning.
Row 1: Working in back bumps, slip st in each ch across.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Arrange one end of body tube around outer edge of base, with seam on inside and at center of one long edge of base (for back). Place one end of each shoulder strap between the base and body tube, on either side of back seam and with ends about 6” [15 cm] apart. 
Hint: You may want to use pins or clips to hold all of the pieces together). Working from right side (outside of body) and through all thicknesses, join yarn with sc anywhere along edge, sc evenly all the way around edge to seam body and ends of straps to base.
Sew tops of straps about 3” [7.5 cm] below top edge of body, about 6” [15 cm] apart and directly in line with the lower ends of the straps.
Weave in ends. 
Beginning at center front of body, thread the pull cord through spaces between stitches about every 2 rows all the way around body, just above top ends of straps. Pull on ends to close bag and tie into a bow.

materials: Caron® Cotton Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m) Green Grapevine (57061) 1 ball
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Yarn needle
Stitch marker
abbreviations: Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] wide x 12" [30.5 cm] tall, excluding fringe, gusset and handles.
gauge: 16 hdc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as a st.
FRONT (worked side-to-side)
Ch 52.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 50 hdc. PM at beg of row for top of Bag.
2nd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 hdc in each of last 10 hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each hdc to next ch-1 sp. Working in front of ch-1 sp, 1 tr in skipped hdc 2 rows below. Skip ch-1 sp behind tr just made. Rep from * to last 7 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 10 hdc. *1 trfp around post of next st 2 rows below. Skip next hdc behind st just made. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 4th and 5th rows for pat until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Note: 10 hdc side is "bottom" edge of Front. 7 hdc side is "top" edge of Front.
BACK (worked side-to-side)
Ch 52.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 50 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Gusset (make 1)
Ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 34" [86.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. With WS of pieces tog, pin Gusset in position to sides and bottom of Front and Back. Work 1 row of sc through both thicknesses to join Gusset to sides and bottom of Front and Back.
Fringe: Cut strands of yarn 9" [23 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, fold in half. Beg from lower row of trfp posts, knot into 2 fringes around each post of trfp matching color of fringe with background fabric. Trim fringe evenly. Rep fringe in the same manner across all 5 rows of trfp. Handles (make 2). Ch 6. Join in ring with sl st in first ch.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. 6 sc. Do not join. PM for end of rnd and slip marker every rnd.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc.
Rep last rnd for 16" [40.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Following diagram fold Gusset inside of Bag and sew through all thicknesses at top edge 1" [2.5 cm] in from side edges. Sew Handles at top edge 1" [2.5 cm] in from side edges as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Flower Power™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Contrast A Cherry Blossom (2000) 2 balls or 14 Flower Power Motifs
Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast B Shocking Pink (0718) 1 ball or 178 yds/163 m
Sizes U/S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle. 2 large safety pins.
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] tall x 12" [30.5 cm] wide, excluding handle and straps.
gauge: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square using larger hook. 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
FLOWER POWER MOTIF
Each Color aligns with specific round(s) in the Motif using 3 Colors in total.
Notes:
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• 2nd and 3rd rnds will be worked in Color 2.
• 4th, 5th, and 6th rnds will be worked in Color 3.
• If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.

• At end of final rnd, Motif should measure 6" [15 cm] square, with long tail (at least 24" [61 cm]) rem.
• Adjust gauge as needed working 4th, 5th and 6th rounds of Flower Motif to maintain 6" [15 cm] square finished size.

MOTIF
Make 14
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st unless otherwise stated.

With larger hook and A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 9 dc in ring. Join. 10 dc. Color 1 complete.
2nd rnd: With Color 2, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 20 dc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next dc. (Ch 3. 1 tr) in same st as last sl st. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. *(1 dc. 1 tr) in next dc. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * around, ending by joining with sl st to top of ch-3 of previous (2nd) rnd. Color 2 complete.
4th rnd: With Color 3, Sl st in first dc (top of ch-3 of 3rd rnd), to beg rnd at start of first Petal. Ch 3. *1 dc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 sc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in dc of 2nd rnd below sl st.** 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 6 (counts as tr and ch-2). 1 tr in same sp as sl st. *2 dc in next st. Ch 1. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Ch 1. 2 dc in next st.** (1 tr. Ch 2. 1 tr) all in next st. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join to 4th ch of ch-6.
6th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 3 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(3 hdc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp.** (3 hdc. Ch 3. 3 hdc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 hdc in first ch-2 sp. Join. Fasten off.

Join Motifs
Notes:
• Motifs are joined using B.
• Hold working yarn underneath work to create a flat seam.
• Keep a loose, even tension on the yarn while joining to keep Motifs flat and even. Too tight tension will cause them to bunch up.

Place 2 Motifs beside each other, RS up. Using larger hook, join B with sl st to Motif on left in Ch-1 corner sp. Insert hook from front to back into back loop of corner ch-1 on this same left Motif. Insert hook from front to back into back loop of corner ch-1 sp of right Motif. (3 loops on hook). Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
*Insert hook from front to back into back loop of next st on left Motif. Insert hook from front to back into back loop of corresponding st of right Motif. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Rep from * to end of Motif.
Join Motifs as shown in diagram:

JOIN SIDES
Fold piece in half lengthwise, with WS tog. Ch 1. Working along side edge, through both thicknesses to join, work 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.

STRAPS (Make 2)
Using smaller hook and B, ch 93.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 92 sc.
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of 6th row.

PLACE STRAPS 
Lay piece flat. Pin Straps into place at top edge on either side of 2 center Motifs, aligning ends of Straps with last 6 sts of each Motif. Place ends of ends of Straps in the center of bottom Motifs. Using yarn needle, sew into place.

DRAWSTRING EDGING
With larger hook join B with sl st to top right corner of back.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *Work 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to First Strap. Working through side of edge stitches on Strap and sts of Motif to join, work 1 sc in each st. Work 1 sc in top of seam. Work through both thicknesses of second Strap and Backpack in each st to join. Cont around, working 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp of Motifs (21 sc along top of each Motif), and 1 sc in top of each joining seam to first sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 132 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.

Eyelet rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as sl st. Skip next 2 hdc. *3 dc in next hdc. Skip next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc around. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

FLAP
With larger hook and B, ch 30.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 28 dc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *Skip next 2 dc. 3 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc (counts as 2 dc). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc between next 3-dc group. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next 3 dc. 2 dc in last dc (3rd ch of beg ch-4 of 3rd row). Turn.
6th row: Ch 3. Skip next dc and 3-dc group. *3 dc between next 3-dc group. Skip next 3-dc group. Rep from * to last 2 dc. Skip next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. (6 groups of 3-dc)
7th row: Ch 3. *Skip next 3-dc group. 3 dc between next 3-dc group. Rep from * to last 3 dc group and dc. Skip next 3-dc group. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. (5 groups of 3-dc)
8th to 10th rows: As 7th row. 2 groups of 3-dc at end of 10th row. Fasten off. 
With yarn needle and B, sew Flap to top edge at back, centering Flap with Center of back.

TOP EDGING
With larger hook, join B with sl st to any sc of last top edging rnd at back. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc around top edge of Bag and evenly along edges of Flap (approx 2 sc into side of each row, and 1 sc in each dc of last row of Flap). Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.

BACK LOOP
With smaller hook and B, ch 25.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 24 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more. Do not fasten off at end of last row. Fold Back Loop in half lengthwise. Joining row: Ch 1. Work 1 sc through each sc and rem loop of foundation ch to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew Back Loop to Backpack, placing each end on either side of Straps.  

DRAWSTRING
With larger hook and 2 strands of B held tog, Ch 140. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Weave Drawstring through eyelet row to create drawstring closure, with ends at center front.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Hot Orange (01628) 2 balls or 230 yds/210 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 3 balls or 350 yds/320 m
Contrast C Black (00002) 1 ball or 17 yds/16 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® steel yarn needle
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] wide x 16" [40.5 cm] long, excluding handles.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
BAG
With A, ch 49.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 98 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 46 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 104 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Rep last rnd until Bag measures 8" [20.5 cm]. Break A, join B.
With B, cont even in rnds until Bag measures 16" [40.5 cm]. Fasten off.

HANDLES (make 2)
With B, ch 105.
1st row:  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 104 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Handle measures 2" [5 cm] wide. Fasten off.

EARS (make 2)
With A, ch 12. 
1st row:  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 11 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 9 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog.
Fasten off, leaving a long end.

EYES (make 2)
Outer Eye
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc. Fasten off.
Pupil (make 2)
With C, ch 2.
Work from 1st rnd to 3rd rnd as given for Outer Eye. Fasten off.
Highlight Pupil with straight stitch using B as shown in photo. Sew Pupil to Outer Eye. 

NOSE
With C, ch 4.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of last 2 ch. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Do not turn. Edging:  Ch 1. Working around Nose, work 1 rnd of sc, having 1 sc in each side, and 2 sc in each ‘corner’ of Nose to make a triangle. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end.

FINISHING
Sew Handles to Bag as shown in picture. Sew Ears to front of Bag at top edge of Cat’s head. Sew Eyes and Nose to front of Bag. Embroider snout and whiskers with C using outline stitch.

materials: Peaches & Crème® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC) Ecru (11006) 5 balls or 597 yds/546 m
Contrast A Pastel Pink (11421) 1 ball or 8 yds/7 m
Contrast B Sunshine (11612) 1 ball or 8 yds/7 m
Contrast C Teal (11756) 1 ball or 8 yds/7 m
Contrast D Bright Orange (11628) 1 ball or 8 yds/7 m
Contrast E Mint (11230) 1 ball or 8 yds/7 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
Stitch marker.
Optional: Sticky back water soluble fabric stabilizer for embroidery transfer.
measurements: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] wide x 34" [86.5 cm] around x 13” [33 cm] tall, excluding handle.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Tote Bottom
With MC, ch 12.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 11 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 14” [35.5 cm], ending on a RS row.
Do not fasten off.

Tote Body
Note: Tote Body is worked in a continuous spiral. Do not join at end of rnds. Place marker on first stitch of rnd to keep place.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 128 sc evenly around all sides of Tote Bottom, placing marker on first st for beg of rnd. Do not join. 128 sc.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep 2nd rnd until work from Tote Bottom measures 13” [33 cm].
Fasten off.

Handle
With MC, ch 12.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 11 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 26" [66 cm].
Fasten off.
Sew Handle to Tote as shown in photo.
Using embroidery pattern, embroider floral pattern on front of Tote.
Options for transferring embroidery pattern:
1. Print and cut out pattern on paper. Pin pattern to Tote. Embroider through paper. Carefully remove paper once complete.
2. Print pattern and transfer onto water soluble fabric stabilizer. Embroider pattern on Tote. Follow instructions with fabric stabilizer to remove from Tote.

Fishbone Leaves
Lazy Daisy Leaves
(all worked in C)
Woven Wheel Roses

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 9440 Lt Grey Heather A
RED HEART® Boutique Sashay®: 1 ball 1936 Waltz B
Susan Bates Crochet Hook: 5mm [H-8 US]
17⁄8” (23mm) button for closure (Sample used JHB #90368: Rippled Circles)
stitch markers
yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Clutch measures 9” (23cm) wide x 7” (18cm) long x 1” (2.5cm) deep
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10cm) in pattern; 16 rows = 4” (10cm). Gauge is not critical to this project.
instructions:
Notes
Clutch is worked from bottom up starting with 3 rows of sc in a long rectangle, then 2 rounds are worked to create shaping. Beginning at 6th round and continuing to top of bag work is created in spirals. Flap is crocheted separately, then sewn on.
To work with Sashay ribbon yarn, spread the yarn open with ladder edge at the top and wider metallic edge at the bottom. Trim the raw edge and fold over so that you’ll work into a double layer of “boxes” through the first 5 stitches. Work into the 2nd row of boxes on the top edge of the ribbon. To create ruffling, work into first stitch and first boxes together, *skip next box, single crochet into next stitch and box together, repeat from * across.

CLUTCH
Body
With A, ch 31.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch, turn—30 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, do not turn.
Note: Continue working in rounds, do not turn.
Round 4: Working across end of rows along first side, ch 1, 2 sc in Row 3, 1 sc in Row 2, 2 sc in Row 1 (place markers in 1st and 5th sc); working in opposite side of Row 1, sc in each st; working across end of rows along 2nd side, 2 sc in Row 1, sc in Row 2, 2 sc in Row 3, (place markers in 1st and 5th sc); working across Row 3, sc in each sc; join with slip st in first sc of round—70 sc.  
Round 5: Ch 1, *3 sc in next marked st, sc in each sc to next marked st; repeat from * 3 times; join with slip st in first sc of round. Remove previous st markers—78 sc.
Round 6: Working in continuous rounds, place marker in first st, ch 1, sc in each sc around, do not join at end of round.

Rounds 7-13: Ch 1, sc in each sc.

Ruffles
Round 14: With right side facing, fold raw edge of B over (see Notes), working in 2nd row of boxes at top edge and in sts of Row 13 together, sc in first st and first box, skip next box, *sc in next st and next box, skip next box; repeat from * around, drop B.
Round 15: With A, sc in each st.
Round 16: Working with A and B together, sc in first st and first box, skip next box, *sc in next st and next box, skip next box; repeat from * around, drop B.
Rounds 17-34: Repeat Rounds 15 and 16 nine times.
Round 35: Repeat Round 15.
Round 36: Working with A and B together, sc in first st and first box, skip next box, *sc in next st and next box, skip next box; repeat from * to last 5 sts from marker, count 18 boxes along top edge of B and cut yarn, fold over end of B as in beginning of Round 14, *sc in next st and next box, skip next box; repeat from * around.
Rounds 37–38: Ch 1, sc in each st; join in beginning sc at end of Round 38. Fasten off.

Flap
With A and leaving a long tail for sewing, ch 37.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch, turn—36 sc.
Row 2 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in same st as beginning ch-3, cross st to last st, dc tr cl last st, turn—17 cross sts.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as beginning ch-3, dc in next st, cross st to last st, dc tr cl last st, turn.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2—18 cross st.
Row 5: Beg dc tr dec, dc next st, cross st to last 4 sts, dc in next st, dc tr dec in last 3 sts, turn—15 cross sts.
Row 6: Beg dc tr dec, cross st to last 3 sts, dc tr dec in last 3 st, turn—14 cross sts.
Rows 7-12: Repeat Rows 5 and 6 three times—2 cross sts at end of Row 12.
Row 13: Ch 4, tr dec, working last st into beginning ch-4. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Flatten body of bag parallel to beginning row. Side where rounds end is back edge of opening. With right sides together, center Row 1 of flap on back edge of body. Using long tail of flap, whipstitch bottom of flap to back edge of bag. Fold flap to front and mark where Row 13 falls. Sew button in place using space between stitches as a buttonhole. Weave in tails. Fluff out ruffles.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® CottonTM (1.75 oz/50 g; 80 yds/73 m)
Contrast A Tangerine (13699) 2 balls or 148 yds/135 m
Contrast B Robin’s Egg (13215) 3 balls or 175 yds/160 m
Contrast C Warm Brown (13130) 2 balls or 137 yds/125 m
Contrast D Off White (00002) 2 balls or 115 yds /105 m
Contrast E Hot Green (13712) 2 balls or 115 yds /105 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
1 toggle
4 markers
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 18" [45.5 cm] wide x 18" [45.5 cm] high (excluding strap).
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Motif (make 3)
(See Chart I on page 4).
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout.
To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color and draw through rem 2 loops and proceed.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 15 dc in ring. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. 16 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook in top of ch 3 and draw dropped loop through. Ch 1 to close st – beg popcorn made. *2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 4 dc in next dc. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook in first of 4 dc and draw dropped loop through. Ch 1 to close st – popcorn made. Ch 5. Popcorn in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. Popcorn in last dc. Ch 5. Join with sl st to top of beg popcorn.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next dc. Beg popcorn in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Popcorn in next dc. *Break A. Join B. Ch 2. 5 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2.** Break B. Join A. Miss next popcorn. Popcorn in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Popcorn in next dc. Rep from * twice more, then rep from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of beg popcorn. Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join A with sl st to next dc. Beg popcorn in same sp as sl st. Popcorn in next dc. *Break A. Join B. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next d c. 3 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2.** Break B. Join A. Miss next popcorn. (Popcorn in next dc) twice. Rep from * twice more, then rep from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of beg popcorn. Fasten off.
5th rnd: Join A with sl st to top of first beg popcorn. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in top of next 4 dc. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook in top of ch 3 and draw dropped loop through. Ch 1 to close st – beg popcorn 2tog made. *Break A. Join B. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 3 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2.** Break B. Join A. (2 dc in top of next popcorn) twice. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook in first dc and draw dropped loop through. Ch 1 to close st – popcorn 2tog made. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join B with sl st to top of beg popcorn 2tog. 6th rnd: With B, ch 3. *2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp.** 1 dc in top of popcorn 2tog. Rep from * twice more, then rep from * to ** once. Break B. Join C with sl st to top of ch 3.
7th rnd: With C, ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. (Dcbp around post of next dc. 1 hdc in next dc) 6 times. *(2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. (1 hdc in next dc. Dcbp around post of next dc) 12 times. 1 hdc in next dc. Rep from * twice more. (2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. (1 hdc in next dc. Dcbp around post of next dc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Note: Carry color when not in use in next rnd loosely across top of previous rnd and work sts around it to avoid stranding.
8th rnd: With C, ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. (Join D. With D, 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Join C. With C, 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts) 3 times. Join D. With D, 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. *Join C. With C, (2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Join D. With D, 1 hdc in next st. (Join C. With C, 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Join D. With D, 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts) 7 times. Rep from * twice more. Join C. With C, (2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Join D. With D, 1 hdc in next st. (Join C. With C, 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Join D. With D, 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts) 3 times. Join C. With C, 1 hdc in last st. Join E with sl st to first hdc. Break C and D.
9th rnd: With E, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 16 hdc. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 33 hdc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 16 hdc. Join A with sl st to first sc. Break E.
10th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 35 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 17 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
11th rnd: Join B with sl st from back to front around post of same sc as last sl st. Ch 3. Dcbp around post of next 18 sc. *(2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Dcbp around post of next 37 sc. Rep from * twice more. (2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Dcbp around post of next 18 sc. Join C with sl st in top of ch 3. Break B.
12th rnd: With C, ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. (Dcbp around post of next st. 1 hdc in next st) 10 times. *(2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. (1 hdc in next st. Dcbp around post of next st) 20 times. 1 hdc in next st. Rep from * twice more. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. (1 hdc in next st. Dcbp around post of next st) 10 times. Join D with sl st to first hdc. Break C.
Note: Carry color when not in use in 13th and 14th rnds loosely across top of previous rnd and work sts around it to avoid stranding.
13th rnd: With D, ch 3. 1 dc in next st. (Join E. With E, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Join D. With D, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts) 3 times. Join E. With E, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. *Join D. With D, (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. ** (Join E. With E, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Join D. With D, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts) 7 times. Join E. With E, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * twice more, then rep from * to ** once. (Join E. With E, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Join D. With D, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts) 3 times. Join E. With E, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Join D. With D, 1 dc in last st. Join with sl st in top of ch 3.
14th rnd: With D, ch 3. 1 dc in next st. (Join E. With E, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Join D. With D, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts) 3 times. Join E. With E, 1 dc in each of next 5 sts. *Join D. With D, (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Join E. With E, 1 dc in each of next 5 sts.** (Join D. With D, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Join E. With E, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts) 7 times. With E, 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * twice more, then rep from * to ** once. (Join D. With D, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Join E. With E, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts) 3 times. Join D. With D, 1 dc in last st. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Join Motifs: Join all sides of Base Motif to other 2 Side Motifs. (See Assembly Diagram on page 3)
To join sides: Place RS of Motifs facing each other, having Base Motif on top of work and pin sides in position. Working through both thicknesses, join D with sl st in any corner ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (Work 1 row of sc to next corner ch-2 sp. 3 sc in corner) 4 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. With WS of work facing, steam press lightly along seams to flatten.
Back Inset (See Chart II on page 4).
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc throughout.
**With A, ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 2 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 3 dc). Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in top of turning ch. Turn. 5 dc.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each dc to turning ch. 2 dc in top of turning ch.
4th to 6th rows: As 3rd row. 13 dc at end of 6th row.**
Place markers at each end of last row.
7th to 13th rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row, ending with 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
14th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc for toggle hole. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
15th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
16th row: Ch 3. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each st to last 3 sts. Dc2tog. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
17th row: As 16th row. 9 sts. Fasten off.
Front Inset
Work from ** to ** as given for Back Inset.
7th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row, ending with 1 dc in top of turning ch. Fasten off.
Sew sides of Front Inset in position as shown in picture. Sew sides of Back Inset to markers into same position on opposite side of Bag. Sew toggle in position to Front Inset.
Strap: Place markers on top corners of 2 Side Motifs on 5th dc on each side of ch-2 sp.
First Half: 1st row: (RS). Join A with sl st in first marker of either Side Motif. Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Turn. 11 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 9 sts.
3rd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Strap measures 11" [28 cm] when slightly stretched. Fasten off.
Second Half: Work as for First Half in marked corner of rem Side Motif. Do not fasten off.
Join Halves: Place RS of Halves tog with Second Half on top of work. Working through both thicknesses, ch 1. Work 1 row of sc to end of row. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® All Day Cotton™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 173 yds/158 m)
Main Color (MC) Grape Popsicle (00020) 2 balls or 228 yds/208 m
Contrast A Kiwi (00010) 1 ball or 84 yds/77 m
Main Color (MC) Cherry (00024) 2 balls or 228 yds/208 m
Contrast A Eyes Blue (00016) 1 ball or 84 yds/77 m
Main Color (MC) Jute (00003) 2 balls or 228 yds/208 m
Contrast A Summer Night (00017) 1 ball or 84 yds/77 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 19" [48.5 cm] wide x 13" [33 cm] long, excluding handles and noting bag fabric will stretch during use.
gauge: 16 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
BODY
With MC, ch 135 (multiple of 7 ch + 2). See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Ch 5. Skip next 6 ch. Sl st in next ch. *Ch 6. Skip next 6 ch. Sl st in next ch. Rep from * to last 7 ch. Ch 5. Skip next 6 ch. 1 sc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 6 (counts as 1 dc and ch-3 sp). Sl st in first ch-5 sp. *Ch 6. Sl st in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * ending with sl st in last ch-5 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
