3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. Ch 5. Skip first ch-3 sp. Sl st in next ch-6 sp. *Ch 6. Sl st in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * to last ch-6 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in last dc (3rd ch of turning ch-6). Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures, when slightly stretched, approx 22" [56 cm], ending on a 2nd row.
Next row: Ch 6. Skip first ch-3 sp. Sl st in next ch-6 sp. *Ch 6. Sl st in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * to last ch-6 sp. Ch 6. Sl st in last dc (3rd ch of turning ch-6). Fasten off.
Fold Body in half, aligning 1st row and Final Row edge, as shown in Assembly Diagram on page 3. Sew 2 side seams with WS tog.
Upper Edging and Straps: 1st rnd: (RS). Beg at side seam, join A with sl st in ch-6 sp at top edge. Ch 1. 4 sc in same ch-6 sp. *4 sc in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 152 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until Edging measures 1" [2.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Make Straps: Next rnd: (RS). Beg at side seam, join A with sl st in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as first sl st. 1 sc in each of next 25 sc. Ch 88 (Strap). Skip next 24 sc. Take care not to twist ch. 1 sc in each of next 52 sc. Ch 88 (Strap). Skip next 24 sc. Take care not to twist ch. 1 sc in each of last 26 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 26 sc. 1 sc in each of next 88 ch. 1 sc in each of next 52 sc. 1 sc in each of next 88 ch. 1 sc in each of last 26 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 280 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last row until Strap measures 1" [2.5 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: Lily Sugar ’n Cream (70.9 g/2.5 oz)
Main color (MC) (White): 1 ball
Contrast A (Cream): 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 4¼ ins [11 cm] wide x 5 ins [12.5 cm] high.
gauge: 14 dc and 6 ½ rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions: With MC, ch 2. 1st rnd:(RS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd:Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc. 4th rnd:Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. 5th rnd:Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 6th rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Miss next sc. 3 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. Miss last sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 7th rnd:Sl st in next dc. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *3 dc in center dc of next 3 dc group. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Rep last rnd 3 times more. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Next rnd:(Eyelet rnd). Ch 4. Miss next sc. *1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. Next rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around to last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. Join A with sl st to first sc. Next rnd:With A, ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Miss last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Bottom Edging: With RS of work facing, join A with sl st to any rem loop of 5th rnd. (1 sc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Miss next 2 loops. (1 sc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next loop. Rep from * to last 2 loops. Miss last 2 loops. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Drawstring: With MC, make a chain 15 ins [38 cm] long. Fasten off. FLOWER (make 2). With A, ch 4. 1st rnd:1 dc in 4th ch from hook. Ch 3. (Sl st. Ch 3. 1 dc. Ch 3) 4 times in same sp. Sl st in same sp. Fasten off. Weave Drawstring through eyelet rnd. Sew 1 Flower to each end of Drawstring. Hanging Loop: Join MC with sl st at opposite side of eyelet rnd to Drawstring opening. Ch 40. Join with sl st in same sp. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Main Color (MC) Aran (0313) 1 ball or 350 yds/320 m
Contrast A Minty (0520) 1 ball or 75 yds/68.5 m
Contrast B Shocking Pink (0718) 1 ball or 75 yds/68.5 m
Contrast C Bright Yellow (0324) 1 ball or 75 yds/68.5 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Safety pins for assembly
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] square x 3" [7.5 cm] deep, excluding handles.
gauge: 12 dc and 7.5 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
MOTIFS (make 6 each of Square 1, 2, and 3):
Square 1: C as Color 1, A as Color 2, B as Color 3, MC as Color 4.
Square 2: A as Color 1, B as Color 2, C as Color 3, MC as Color 4.
Square 3: B as Color 1, C as Color 2, A as Color 3, MC as Color 4.
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dct.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc in ring) 3 times. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any ch-2 corner sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same ch-2 sp as last sl st. *(3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to any ch-2 corner sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same ch-2 sp as last sl st. *3 dc in next sp between 3-dc cluster. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. 3 dc in next sp between 3-dc cluster. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join Color 4 with sl st to any ch-2 corner sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same ch-2 sp as last sl st. *3 dc in next sp between 3-dc cluster twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. 3 dc in next sp between 3-dc cluster twice. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Body of Bag
Using Motif Assembly Diagram on page 3, sew Squares tog using MC.
Top Edges of Body of Bag:
With RS facing, join MC with sl st to top right corner of Body of Bag. 
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc or corner sp to end of Top Edge. Fasten off.
Rep for second Top Edge as indicated in Motif Assembly Diagram.

Bag Sides (make 2).
With MC, ch 44. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 41 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 87 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 42 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 90 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 42 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 93 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 42 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 96 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 42 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 99 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 42 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not turn. 102 sc. 
Working across straight edge of Bag Side, ch 1 and work 10 sc evenly across. Fasten off. 

Join Bag Sides to Body of Bag 
Using safety pins, pin Sides to Body of Bag as shown in Bag Assembly Diagram on page 3.
With RS of Body of Bag facing, join MC with sl st to top corner of Body of Bag and Side.
1st row:  Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 104 sc evenly around edge. Fasten off. Rep for second side.
Bag Handles (make 2). With MC, ch 67.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 66 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 3" [7.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Sew Handles to Bag as shown in photo.

materials: Bernat Handicrafter Cotton (Solids: 400 g/14 oz or 50 g/1.75 oz) or (Ombres and Prints: 340 g/12 oz or 42.5 g/1.5 oz) 300 g/10.5 oz of (#33713 Key Lime Pie) as A and 200 g/7 oz of (#00001 White) as B.
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 17 x 14 ins [43 x 35.5 cm].
gauge: 15 sts and 17 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
FRONT and BACK (make alike).
Note: • Ch 2 does not count as first hdc in row.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through to complete st and proceed in new color.
With A, ch 53.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 51 hdc. 
**2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Last 2 rows form Pat.**
Cont working in pat in the following color sequence: With A, 1 row. With B, 10 rows. With A, 8 rows. With B, 10 rows. With A, 4 rows. Fasten off.
SIDE/BOTTOM PANEL: With A, ch 18.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 16 hdc.
Rep from ** to ** as given above until work from beg measures 45 ins [114.5 cm]. Fasten off.
STRAPS: (make 2). With B, ch 113.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.
FINISHING: With WS of Front and Side tog, join A with sl st to top left corner. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc down left side, across bottom and up right side of Bag. Fasten off. Rep for Back.
Edging: With RS facing, join A with sl st to top of Bag.
1st and 2nd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Work 1 rnd of sc around top of Bag. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of 2nd rnd.
Sew Straps to Bag as shown in picture.
Cut a piece of cardboard 5 x 17 ins [12.5 x 43 cm] and place in bottom of Bag.

materials: Red Heart® With Love Chunky™ (5 oz/141 g; 171 yds/156 m) Taupe (1970) 3 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Two 6" [15 cm] inside diameter round wooden handles (measure the diameter across the opening inside the handles)
stitch marker.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Puff = (Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times in indicated st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 13" x 14" [33 x 35.5 cm], not including handle
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
Tote is worked in 2 pieces: Body and base.
Body is worked back and forth in rows. Side edges are seamed to form back seam of tote. Base is worked separately in rounds and crocheted to bottom edges of body. Knotted fringe is attached around top of assembled tote.

BODY
Ch 70.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—69 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sts, *puff in next st, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * to last st, sc in last st, turn—16 puffs.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across. Turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, puff in next st, *sc in next 3 sts, puff in next st; repeat from * to last 2 sts, sc in last 2 sts, turn—17 puffs.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each st across. Turn.
Rows 6-17: Repeat Rows 2-5 for 3 more times.
Rows 18-33: Ch 1, sc in each st across. Turn.
Row 34: Ch 1, sc in first 34 sts, sc2tog, sc in remaining 33 sts, turn—68 sc.
Row 35 (tassel ridge): Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in back loop only of each st across. Turn.
Row 36: Ch 3, *Dcfp around next st, Dcbp around next st; repeat from * to last st, Dcfp around last st.
Fasten off.
Sew side edges of body together for back seam, forming tube shape.
Lower Edge: Working along opposite side of foundation ch, join yarn with sc in any ch, sc in each remaining ch around; join with slip st in first sc—69 sc.
Fasten off.

HANDLE WRAPS
First Wrap
With right side facing, join yarn with slip st in 25th dc of last row of body.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 3, [Dcfp around next st, Dcbp around next st] 9 times, Dcfp around next st; turn, leave remaining sts unworked—20 sts.
Rows 2-4: Ch 3, *Dcfp around next st, Dcbp around next st; repeat from * to last st, Dcfp around last st. Turn.
Fasten off.

Second Wrap
With right side facing, skip first 14 unworked sts of last row of body following Row 1 of first wrap, join yarn with slip st in next st.
Rows 1-4: Work same as Rows 1-4 of first wrap.
Fasten off.

BASE
Note: Place a marker in last sc made to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Work in continuous rounds. (spiral)
Ch 12.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 9 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working along opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 9 ch, 2 sc in last ch; —24 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in first st, sc in next 9 sts, 2 sc in each of next 3 sts, sc in next 9 sts, 2 sc in each of last 2 sts—30 sc.
Round 3: Sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 3 times, sc in next 9 sts, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] twice—36 sc.
Round 4: Sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 3 times, sc in next 9 sts, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice—42 sc.
Round 5: Sc in first 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 3 times, sc in next 9 sts, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice—48 sc.
Round 6: Sc in first 4 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts, [sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 3 times, sc in next 9 sts, [sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice—54 sc.
Round 7: Sc in first 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts, [sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st] 3 times, sc in next 9 sts, [sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice—60 sc.
Round 8: Sc in first 6 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts, [sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st] 3 times, sc in next 9 sts, [sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice—66 sc.
Round 9: [Sc in next 21 sts, 2 sc in next st] 3 times—69 sc.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
With right sides facing, hold outer edge of base and lower edge of body together with stitches matching. Pin base in place. Working through both loops of both thicknesses, join yarn with sc in any st, sc in each remaining st all the way around to join the base to the body; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.

Attach Handles
Hold one round handle on inside of first wrap. Fold wrap over to cover handle and pin in place. Carefully sew last row of wrap to first row of wrap. Repeat to attach second handle.

Knotted Fringe
Fringe base: Turn tote upside down. Working in loops that were left unworked when making Row 35, join yarn with sc in 3rd loop from center back seam, *ch 4, skip next 3 loops, sc in next loop; repeat from * around to last 3 loops, ch 4, skip last 3 loops; join with slip st in first sc—17 ch-4 spaces.
Fasten off. Turn tote upright.

Attach fringe: Wrap yarn 51 times around 10" [25.5 cm] piece of heavy cardboard. Cut wraps at one end of cardboard only, making 51 strands about 20" [51 cm] long. Holding 3 strands together, fold strands in half. Insert crochet hook from right side through one of the ch-4 spaces of the fringe base. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten (one fringe attached). Repeat to attach fringe in every ch-4 space of fringe base.

Knot fringe: Divide each fringe into 2 groups of 3 strands. Holding 3 strands from one fringe and 3 strands from the neighboring fringe together, tie a loose overhand knot. Repeat tying 3 strands of a fringe and 3 strands of its neighboring fringe together all the way around the tote. Trim ends of fringes evenly.

Weave in ends.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Luster Sheen®: 1 ball 251 Orange
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Bag measures 16” (41cm) wide x 18” (46cm) long, excluding handle
gauge: 5 pattern repeats = 5½” (14cm); 4 rows = 3” (8cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com ©2013 Coats & Clark Lacy Crochet Market Bag Keep this roomy bag handy for shopping or when travelling. Crochet it in a bright color as shown, or any color you wish. This is a great gift and a simple way to encourage ecology times, insert hook in same st, pull up a loop, [yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (4 loops remain on hook – 2nd leg of first star st completed), yo, pull through all loops remaining on hook (first star st completed), **ch 5, yo 3 times, pull up loop in 5th ch from hook, [yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (2 loops remain on hook – first leg of star st completed), yo 3 times, pull up a loop in same st as last leg of previous star st, [yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (3 loops remain on hook), yo 3 times, pull up a loop in same st, [yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (4 loops remain on hook – 2nd leg of star st completed), yo 3 times, skip next 2 sts, pull up a loop in next st, [yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (5 loops remain on hook), yo 3 times, pull up a loop in same st, [yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (6 loops remain on hook – 3rd leg of star st completed), yo, pull through all remaining loops on hook (star st completed); repeat from ** around working last leg of last star st in same st as first leg of first star st, ch 5, dtr in 5th ch from hook, join with slip st to eye of first star st—32 star sts. Note: The “eye” of a star stitch is the ring where all of the legs of the star meet. Round 10: Ch 5, yo 3 times, insert hook in same st, pull up a loop, [yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (2 loops remain on hook – first leg of first star st completed), yo 3 times, insert hook in eye of next star st, yo, pull up a loop, [yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (3 loops remain on hook), yo 3 times, insert hook in same st, pull up a loop, [yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (4 loops remain on hook – 2nd leg of first star st completed), yo, pull through all remaining loops on hook (first star st completed), *ch 5, yo 3 times, pull up loop in 5th ch from hook, [yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (2 loops remain on hook – first leg of star st completed), yo 3 times, pull up a loop in same st as last leg of previous star st, [yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (3 loops remain on hook), yo 3 times, pull up a loop in same st, [yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (4 loops remain on hook – 2nd leg of star st completed), yo 3 times, pull up a loop in eye of next star st, [yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (5 loops remain on hook), yo 3 times, pull up a loop in same st, [yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 3 times (6 loops remain on hook – 3rd leg of star st completed), yo, pull through all remaining loops on hook (star st completed); repeat from *around working last leg of last star st in same st as first leg of first star st, ch 5, dtr in 5th ch from hook, join with slip st to eye of first star st. Rounds 11 - 25: Repeat Round 10. Do not fasten off. Band and Handles Round 1: Ch 60, skip 6 star sts, *4 sc around first leg of next star st, sc in eye of same star st; repeat from * 9 more times, ch 60, skip 6 star sts, *4 sc around first leg of next star st, sc in eye of same star st; repeat from ** to end of round. Do not join. Round 2: Ch 3, dc in each st or ch around. Do not join. Round 3: Slip st in each st around. Join with slip st to first st at beginning of round. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

pattern_name: UH NO MESH CROCHET TOTE BAG
materials: YARN MEDIUM 4 Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
• Contrast A Pretty 'n Pink (0722) 1 ball or 350 yds/320 m
• Contrast B Grey Heather (0400) 1 ball or 2 yds/2 m
TOOLS • Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
• Susan Bates® steel yarn needle.
• Tape measure.
measurements: Approx 18" [45 cm] wide x 211/2" [54.5 cm] long, excluding straps.
gauge: 17 stitches (sts) and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Mesh Pattern (Pat).
instructions: USING THIS GUIDE Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools. NOTES • Chain (ch) 2 at beginning (beg) of row does not count as stitch (st). • Ch 5 at beg of row counts as [1 double crochet (dc). Ch-2 space (sp)]. FRONT & BACK Chain (Ch) 61. 1st row: 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 60 sc. 2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Beg working in Mesh Pattern (Pat) as follows: (see diagram below) 1st row: [Right side (RS)]. Ch 5 [counts as 1 dc and ch-2 space (sp) here and throughout]. Skip next sc. 1 double crochet (dc) in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 dc in next sc. [(Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 dc in next st) twice. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 dc in next sc] 6 times. *Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 26 dc and 25 ch-2 sps. 2nd row: Ch 5. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 19" [48 cm]. Fasten off. Joining Place Front and Back of Bag tog with Wrong Sides (WS) facing. Using Flat slip stitch (sl st), join sides of bag together (tog). Whipstitch bottom seam closed. Border and Handles Join yarn with sl st to first ch-2 sp to left of side seam. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same ch-2 sp. **1 sc in next dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. [(1 sc in next dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 sc in next dc. 2 sc in next ch-1 sp] 6 times. (1 sc in next dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp) 5 times. 1 sc in side seam. ** 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from ** to ** once more. 118 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep 2nd rnd until Border measures 2" [5 cm]. Fasten off. Following chart below, chain stitch "Uh, no.", centered under Strap opening on front of Bag as shown. Straps With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to align with side seam. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 18 sts. Ch 70 (Strap). Skip next 23 sts. 1 sc in each of next 36 sts. Ch 70 (Strap). Skip next 23 sts. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each sc to next 70 ch. Work 70 sc in ch-70 sp) twice. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until Straps measure 1½" [4 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Soft Ecru (01004)
Contrast A Hot Green (01712)
Contrast B Teal (01133)
Contrast C Seabreeze (01201)
Contrast D Tangerine (01699)
Contrast E Rose Pink (00046)
Contrast F Tea Rose (00042)
5 balls or 600 yds/545 m
1 ball or 50 yds/46 m
1 ball or 19 yds/17 m
1 ball or 41 yds/37 m
1 ball or 13 yds/12 m
1 ball or 24 yds/22 m
1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Straight pins. 2 stitch markers. Tapestry needle.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch.
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] square, excluding handles and fringe
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Tote Body is worked flat in one piece. Handles are worked in 2 pieces and seamed to WS of Tote Body before Body is folded and sides are seamed.
TOTE BODY
With MC, ch 50.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 49 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until piece from beg measures 15" [38 cm], ending on a WS row.
Next row: (Fold line-RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc across. PM at beg and end of row to mark fold line. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row until piece from beg measures 16½" [42 cm], ending on a WS row.
Proceed with chart on page 3 as follows:
Note: When working from chart, wind small balls of the colors to be used, one for each separate area of color in design. Start new colors at appropriate points.
1st to 40th rows: Work rows 1 to 40 of Chart in sc, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right.
Next row: (RS). With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row until piece from beg measures 30" [76 cm], ending on a WS row.
Fasten off.
HANDLES (make 2)
With MC, ch 170.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 169 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Handle measures 2" [5 cm] wide.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Embroidery (see Embroidery Diagram on page 3):
With A, embroider ridges on Cactus #1 using chain stitch as seen in diagram.
With C, embroider ridges on Cactus #2 using chain stitch as seen in diagram.
With B, embroider ridges on Cactus #3 using chain stitch as seen in diagram.
Attach Handles:  With Body flat and WS facing, attach handles to Body as seen in Assembly Diagram on page 4. Align short edges of handles along Fold Line (as indicated by markers) 2½" [6.5 cm] from side edge of Body. Be sure not to twist Handles. Pin Handles in place. With MC, sew edges of Handles in place through WS of Body sts making sure yarn does not show on RS of Body.
Seam side edges:  Fold Body in half along fold line with WS facing each other. Join MC with sl st at corner to seam first side of Tote. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly across. Fasten off. Rep on opposite side.
Pompoms (make 2 with D, make 1 each with E and F)
Wind yarn around 3 fingers approx 50 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Tote. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of cacti as seen in photo.
Fringe: Cut strands of C, D, E, and F 6" [15 cm] long. Taking 4 strands tog (1 of each color), fold in half and knot into fringe in every other rem loop along Fold Line. Trim Fringe evenly.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 0319 Cherry Red A and 0312 Black B.
Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6].
Yarn needle, 2 buttons 7/16”, 2 buttons 1”.
abbreviations: A, B, etc. = Color A, B, etc.
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Backpack measures 8¾” x 9”
gauge: 16 sc = 4”; 24 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FRONT
Row 1 (Right Side): With A, ch 21, sc in the back ridge of each ch across; turn – 20 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in next st, sc in each st across to last st, 2 sc in last st; turn – 22 sc.
Rows 3-8: Repeat Row 2; turn – 34 sc.
Rows 9-24: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Row 25: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 9 sts, drop A and change to B, with B sc in next 12 sts, drop B and change to A using the small ball of A, with A sc in next 9 sts, sc2tog; turn – 20 sc in A, 12 sc in B.
Row 26: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 7 sts, change to B, sc in next 14 sts, change to A, sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog; turn – 16 sc in A, 14 sc in B.
Row 27: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 5 sts, change to B, sc in next 16 sts, change to A, sc in next 5 sts, sc2tog; turn – 12 sc in A, 16 sc in B.
Row 28: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts, change to B, sc in next 18 sts, change to A, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog; turn – 8 sc in A, 18 sc in B.
Row 29: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc, change to B, sc in next 20 sts, change to A, sc, sc2tog; turn – 4 sc in A, 20 sc in B.
Row 30: Ch 1, sc2tog, change to B, sc in next 20, change to A, sc2tog, change to B; turn – 2 sc in A, 20 sc in B.
Row 31: Continuing with B, ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 18 sts, sc2tog; turn – 20 sc in B.
Row 32: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Row 33: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc across to last 2 sts, sc2tog; turn – 18 sc.
Rows 34-36: Repeat Row 33; turn – 12 sc.
Row 37: Repeat Row 32; do not turn.
FRONT EDGING
With right side facing, continuing with B, 2 sc in last st of Row 37, sc evenly spaced in ends of rows to beginning of A, change to A, sc evenly spaced in ends of rows to Row 1, 3 sc in 1st st on Row 1, sc in each st across, 3 sc in last st on Row 1, sc evenly spaced in ends of rows to beginning of B, change to B, sc evenly spaced in ends of rows to 1st of Row 37, join with a slip st to first st of Row 37. Fasten off.
BACK
Work as for FRONT through Row 37, turn.
Your little lady will love carrying her special things in this unique back pack. Crocheted with machine wash and dry yarn, it’s easy to keep it looking great no matter where it travels.

UPPER STRAPS
Row 1: With right side facing and B, join with a slip st to 4th st on Row 35 of Back, sc around post of same st, sc around post of next 7 sts; turn – 8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn. Do not fasten off.
Divide for straps:
Right strap: Row 3: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sts; turn – 4 sc.
Rows 4-55: Repeat Row 3; turn.
Row 56: Ch 1, sc in next 2 sts, place marker, sc in next 2 sts; turn.
Rows 57-68: Repeat Row 3; turn.
Row 69: Ch 1, sc in next st, ch 2, skip next 2 sts, sc in last st; turn – 2 sc, 1 ch-2 sp (button-hole made)
Row 70: Ch 1, sc in next st, 2 sc in ch-2 space, sc in last st; turn – 4 sc.
Rows 71-75: Ch 1, sc across; turn.
Row 76: Repeat Row 69; turn.
Row 77: Repeat Row 70; turn.
Rows 78-82: Ch 1, sc across; turn.
Row 83: Ch 1, sc2tog twice; turn – 2 sc.
Row 84: Ch 1, sc2tog. Fasten off.
Left strap:
Row 3: With right side facing, join B with a slip st in the 5th st of Row 2, sc in same st, sc in next 3 sts; turn – 4 sc.
Rows 4-84: Ch 1, repeat Rows 4 – 84 as for right strap.

Gusset
Row 1: Ch 5, sc in back ridge of each ch across; turn – 4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Rows 3-78: Repeat Row 2. Do not fasten off.

ASSEMBLY
With right side facing and A and starting where A begins, slip st gusset and Back together, slip st across gusset edge, slip st gusset and Front together. Fasten off.
Sew buttons for eyes to front to match buttonholes on flap.
Sew buttons for straps at markers. Thread upper straps through ch-6 loop on edge of lower strap then secure at button.
Weave in ends.

Begin Flap
Row 38: Ch 1, sc in front loop only in each st across; turn – 12 sc.
Rows 39-42: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Row 43: Ch 1, sc in back loop only in each st across; turn.
Row 44: Ch 1, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts, 2 sc in last st; turn – 14 sc.
Row 45 and 46: Ch 1, repeat Row 44; turn – 18 sc.
Row 47: Ch 1, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts, ch 1, skip next st, sc in next 4 sts, ch 1, skip next st, sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in last st; turn – 18 sc and 2 ch-1 button-hole spaces.
Row 48: Ch 1, sc in next 7 sts, sc in ch-1 space, sc in next 4 sts, sc in ch-1 space, sc in next 7 sts; turn – 20 sc.
Row 49: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog; turn – 18 sc.
Rows 50-52: Ch 1, repeat Row 49; turn – 12 sc.
Row 53: Ch 1, sc in each st across; do not fasten off.
BACK EDGING
With right side facing, 2 sc in last st of Row 53, sc evenly spaced in ends of rows to beginning of A, change to A, sc evenly spaced in ends of rows to Row 1, 3 sc in 1st st on Row 1, sc in each st across, 3 sc in last st on Row 1, sc evenly spaced in ends of rows to beginning of B, change to B, sc evenly spaced in ends of rows to first of Row 53, join with a slip st to first st of Row 53. Fasten off.
FRONT EMBELLISHMENTS
With A and right side facing and holding yarn in back of work, insert hook in stitch 10 of Row 1 edging, attach slip knot to hook and pull through to front of work, * skip next row, insert hook from front to back, yarn over and pull up a loop, draw through loop on hook, repeat from * to B. Fasten off.
Spots (Make 6)
Round 1: With B, ch 3, join to first ch with a slip st, ch 3 (counts as first dc), 8 dc in ring, join to 3rd ch of ch-3 with a slip st. Fasten off, leaving an 8” tail.
Sew spots to Front using yarn needle.

LOWER STRAPS
Right Strap
Row 1: With right side facing and B, join with a slip st to 3rd st on Row 3 of Back, sc around post of same st, sc around post of next 3 sts; turn – 4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sts; turn.
Rows 3-6: Repeat Row 2, turn.
Row 7: Ch 6, skip 2 sts, slip st in next st (ch-6 loop made). Fasten off.
Left Strap
Row 1: With right side facing and B, join with a slip st to 19th st on Row 3 of Back, sc around post of same st, sc around post of next 3 sts; turn – 4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sts; turn.
Rows 3-6: Repeat Row 2, turn.
Row 7: Ch 6, slip st to last st of Row 6. Fasten off.

materials: Coats® “Crème De La Crème™”: 2 balls 1 White A, 1 ball 205 Golden Yellow B.
Crochet Hooks: 4mm [US G-6].
Yarn needle.
White fabric 14” x 28” for lining.
Matching sewing needle and thread.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Bag is 12½” x 12”, excluding drawstring.
gauge: Round 1 = 2½” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
SQUARE (Make 8)
With B, ch 6, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: (Ch 3, 2 dc in ring, turn, ch 3, dc in next 2 sts, dc in top of turning ch, turn – beginning petal made), holding petal to front, [(work 3 dc in ring, turn, ch 3, dc in next 3 sts, turn – petal made)] 7 times, slip st to top of beginning ch – 8 petals.
Fasten off.
Round 2: Join A in any space between petals, (ch 3, 2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 2, sc in next space between petals, ch 2, [(3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next space, ch 2, sc in next space, ch 2] 3 more times, slip st to top of beginning ch.
Round 3: Slip st to ch-2 corner space, *(3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in corner ch-space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next space] twice, ch 1; repeat from * 3 more times, slip st to first dc to join.
Round 4: Slip st to corner ch-space, *(3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in corner ch-space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next space] 3 times, ch 1; repeat from * 3 more times, slip st to first st to join.
Round 5: Slip st to corner ch-space, *(3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in corner ch-space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next space] 4 times, ch 1; repeat from * 3 more times, slip st to first st to join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew 4 Squares together to make a Larger Square for Front. In same manner, sew remaining 4 Squares together for Back.
EDGING
Round 1: Join A in any corner space of Front, *(3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in corner space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next space] 5 times, [2 dc in next corner space] twice, [ch 1, 3 dc in next space] 5 times, ch 1; repeat from * around; slip st to first dc to join.
Round 2: Slip st to corner space, *(3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in corner space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next space] to next corner; repeat from * around, slip st to first dc to join.
Fasten off.
Joining: With wrong sides of Front and Back pieces together, join A in any corner space, working through both layers, sc pieces together along 3 sides.
Fasten off.
Top Edge
Round 1: Join A in any st, sc in each st around, slip st in first sc to join.
Round 2: [Ch 5, skip next st, slip st in next st] around, slip st to first st to join.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton (50 g/1.75 oz)
Main color (MC) (13742 Hot Blue) 4 balls
Contrast A (13712 Hot Green) 2 balls
Contrast B (13628 Hot Orange) 2 balls
Contrast C (13740 Hot Pink) 2 balls
Contrast D (00089 Banana Yellow) 2 balls
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 18½ ins [47 cm] wide x 12½ ins [32 cm] high.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Motif
With color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd:6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 3 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 18 dc. Fasten off.
Flower: First Petal: 1st row:Join color 2 with sl st to front loop only of any dc. *Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in front loop only of next dc. 2 dc in front loop only of next dc. 5 dc for petal. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc of petal. Turn.
3rd row:Ch 3 (counts as dc). (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook– dc3tog made. 1 dc in last dc. Fasten off leaving a long end.*
Second Petal: **Rejoin color 2 with sl st to front loop of next unworked sc of 2nd rnd. Rep from * to * once.**
Third to Sixth Petals: Rep from ** to ** 4 times more. 6 petals.
3rd rnd:Join color 3 with sl st to rem back loop of any dc of 2nd rnd. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp. 2 dc in each rem back loop around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 5 dc. 2 dc in each of next 4 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 56 dc.
5th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 5 tr in next dc for corner. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 dc.** 1 sc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around, working 3 sc in corners. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Using yarn ends from each petal, sew around outer edges of petals.
Motif I (make 2)
Work as for Motif using MC for color 1, A for color 2 and C for color 3.
Motif II (make 2)
Work as for Motif using D for color 1, C for color 2 and B for color 3.
Motif III (make 2)
Work as for Motif using A for color 1, D for color 2 and MC for color 3.
Motif IV (make 2)
Work as for Motif using C for color 1, D for color 2 and MC for color 3.
Motif V (make 2)
Work as for Motif using B for color 1, MC for color 2 and A for color 3.
Motif VI (make 2)
Work as for Motif using MC for color 1, B for color 2 and C for color 3.
Sew Motifs tog as shown in diagram for Front and Back.
Side and Bottom Section
Note: When changing colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st, then draw new color through rem 2 loops and proceed.
With MC, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch across. 9 sts. Join A. Turn.
2nd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc across. Join MC. Turn.
3rd row: With MC, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc across. Join A. Turn.
4th row:As 2nd row. Join B. Turn.
5th row: With B, as 3rd row. Join C. Turn.
6th row: With C, as 2nd row. Join B. Turn.
7th row: As 5th row.
8th row: With C, as 2nd row. Join A. Turn.
9th row: With A, as 3rd row. Join MC. Turn.
10th row:With MC, as 2nd row. Join A. Turn.
11th row: With A, as 3rd row. Join MC. Turn.
12th row:With MC, as 2nd row. Join C. Turn.
13th row: With C, as 3rd row. Join B. Turn.
14th row:
With B, as 2nd row. Join C. Turn.
15th row: With C, as 3rd row. Join B. Turn.
16th row:With B, as 2nd row. Join MC. Turn.
17th row: With MC, as 3rd row. Join A. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 17th rows until work from beg measures length to fit down one side of Back or Front, across bottom, then up rem side.
Fasten off.
Pin Side and Bottom Section to Front and Back along 3 sides.
Edging: 1st rnd:Join MC with sl st in top left corner of Front or Back of Bag. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as sl st. Work sc evenly around, working 3 sc in corners and working through both thicknesses where Front and Side sections meet. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Rep edging for Back of Bag.
Handles (make 2)
With MC, ch 50.
1st row:(RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch across. 48 sts. Turn.
2nd and 3rd rows:Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc across. Turn.
Fold Handle in half lengthwise and work 1 row of sc through 3rd row and rem loops of foundation ch. Fasten off.
Sew on handles as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Black (0312) 1 ball or 170 yds/155 m
Contrast B White (0311) 1 ball or 104 yds/95 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Pair of purse handles with approx. 7" [18 cm] internal opening.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] square, excluding handles.
gauge: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
MOTIF  (make 8)
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join. Break A.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Break B.
3rd rnd: Join A with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Break A.
4th rnd: Join B with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Break B.
5th rnd: With A, as 4th rnd. Fasten off.

Assembly
Seaming with Flat Sl St Join: 
(RS). With A, sl st Motifs tog, working through back loops only and keeping working yarn to WS of work to create a flat sl st chain detail on RS of work (see diagram). Following diagram, join Motifs into rectangle: 2 wide and 4 long. Fold piece in half widthwise with WS facing and with A, working through both thicknesses, join sides with Flat Sl St join.

FLAT SLIP STITCH JOIN
Note: Keep working yarn to WS of work so only flat sl st chain is visible on RS.
Join A with sl st at side seam of bag opening. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around Bag opening. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
With A, securely sew wooden handles to center front and back.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 oz; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Bright Navy (00009)  3 balls
Contrast B White (00001)  2 balls
Contrast C Red (00095)  2 balls
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] wide x 15" [38 cm] high, excluding handles.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" (10 cm)
instructions: Note: When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed. Bag Body is worked sideways. Stripe Pat With A, work 3 rows. With B, work 3 rows. These 6 rows form Stripe Pat. BAG Bag Body: With A, ch 51. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Skip next ch. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch. *Skip next 2 ch. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Skip next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd row for pat until work from beg measures approx 34" [86.5 cm], ending on 3 rows of B. With RS tog, sl st last row and rem loops of foundation ch tog. Fasten off. Note: At end of rnd, join with sl st to first sc. Bottom: With RS facing, join C with sl st to side edge of Bag Body. 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 120 sc evenly around side edge of Bag Body. Join. 2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Sc2tog) 8 times. Join. 112 sts rem. 6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. (1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Sc2tog) 7 times. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join. 104 sts rem. 7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Sc2tog) 8 times. Join. 96 sts rem. 8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. (1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog) 7 times. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join. 88 sts rem. Cont dec in same manner until 8 sts rem. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely. Edging: Join A with sl st to top of Bag. 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 120 sc evenly around side edge of Bag Body. Join. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off. Straps: (make 2). With A, ch 105. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off at end of last row. Fold Strap in half lengthwise and working through both thicknesses to join 5th row to foundation row, work 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off. Sew Straps to Bag as shown in picture.

materials: Lily Sugar’n Cream
Size 4 mm (U.S. G/6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Optional: cardboard
measurements: Finished size: Approx 17 x 14 ins [43 x 35.5 cm]
gauge: 15 sts and 17 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Front and Back (make alike)
Note: Turning ch 2 does not count as st.
Ch 53.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 51 hdc.
**2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Last 2 rows form Pat.**
Keeping cont of pat, work a further 35 rows. Fasten off.
Side / Bottom Panel 
Ch 18.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 16 hdc.
Rep from ** to ** as given above until work from beg measures 45 ins [114.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Straps: (make 2). 
Ch 113.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of 4th row.
FINISHING
With WS of Front and Side tog, join yarn with sl st to top left corner. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc down left side, across bottom and up right side of Bag. Fasten off. Rep for Back.
Edging: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st, to top of Bag.
1st and 2nd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Work 1 rnd of sc around top of Bag. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of 2nd rnd.
Sew Straps to Bag as shown in picture.
Optional: Cut a piece of cardboard 5 x 17 ins [12.5 x 43 cm] and place in bottom of Bag.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m)
Contrast A Black (28040) 2 balls
Contrast B White (28005) 1 ball
Contrast C Pumpkin (28630) 1 ball
Contrast D Glowing Gold (28607) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Tapestry needle.
measurements: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] tall x 14" [35.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 10 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes
• If following graph instead of written pattern, each pixel square is equal to 1 sc.
• When joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Carry color not in use across top of previous row and work sts around it to prevent stranding.
FRONT AND BACK (Make alike)
With A, ch 36. See chart on page 2.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 35 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 35 sc.
4th and 5th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. With D, 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Ch 1. Turn.
6th and 7th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. With D, 1 sc in each of next 25 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Ch 1. Turn.
8th and 9th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. With D, 1 sc in each of next 27 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
10th to 15th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. With D, 1 sc in each of next 29 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn.
16th and 17th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 27 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
18th and 19th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 25 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Turn.
20th and 21st rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Turn.
22nd and 23rd rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 7 sc. Turn.
24th and 25th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 8 sc. Turn.
26th and 27th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 9 sc. Turn.
28th and 29th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 10 sc. Turn.
30th and 31st rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 11 sc. Turn.
32nd and 33rd rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 12 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 12 sc. Turn.
34th and 35th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 13 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 13 sc. Turn.
36th and 37th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 14 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 14 sc. Turn.
38th and 39th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 15 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of last 15 sc. Turn.
With A only, proceed as follows:
40th to 42nd rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
43rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sc. Ch 15. Skip next 15 sc. 1 sc in each of last 10 sc. Turn.
44th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch to end of row. Turn. 35 sc.
45th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
46th row: Sl st in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
FINISHING
With WS of Front and Back together, join with sl st along edges. Leave top handle portion open. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Jumbo™ (12 oz/340 g; 595 yds/544 m) Contrast A Zinnias (09053) 1 ball or 67 yds/61 m
Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/454 g; 812 yds/742 m) Contrast B Raspberry (10659) 1 ball or 253 yds/231 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
measurements: Approximately (approx) 12" [30.5 cm] wide x 14" [35.5 cm] deep, excluding handles.
gauge: 15 stitches (sts) and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Moss stitch (st).
instructions:
Notes:
• To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color, yarn over with new color and proceed. 
• Join all rounds (rnds) with slip stitch (sl st) to first single crochet (sc).
With B, ch 46.
1st round (rnd): 2 single crochet (sc) in 2nd chain (ch) from hook. 1 sc in each of next 43 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in remaining (rem) loops of foundation chain, 1 sc in each of next 43 ch. 1 sc in last ch. Join. 92 sc.
2nd rnd: (Set-up rnd). Ch 1. 1 sc in same space (sp) as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 22 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 22 times. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 48 sc and 44 ch-1 sps (92 sts total).
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *(1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 21 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp.* 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to * once more. 1 sc in last sc. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 21 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc.* 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to * once more. 1 sc in last sc. Join.
5th to 22nd rnds: With B, rep last 2 rnds 9 times more. Join A, break B.
23rd to 49th rnds: With A, rep last 2 rnds 13 times more, then 3rd rnd once. Join B, break A.
50th rnd: With B, as 4th rnd.
51st and 52nd rnds: As 3rd and 4th rnds.
Do not fasten off.
Straps: 53rd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *(1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Ch 45. Skip next 25 sts. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc) 5 times.* 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to *. Join. 42 sc and 2 ch-45 sps.
54th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 1 sc in each of next 45 ch. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. 1 sc in each of next 45 ch. 1 sc in each of last 10 sc. Join.
55th and 56th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off.

materials: COATS® Crème De La Crème®: 3 balls of 350 Dark Linen A
2 balls of 501 Aqua Jade B
1 ball each of 625 Brite Green C, 1 White D, and 856 Navy E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4 mm [US G-6]
Pins, yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
measurements: Purse measures about 9 x 11” [23 x 28 cm], not including strap.
gauge: 15 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 16 rows = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet (sc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FRONT
Beginning at lower edge with A, ch 42.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—41 sc.
Rows 2–36: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Top Edging (right side): Ch 1, do not turn, reverse sc in each st across. Fasten off.
Side and Lower Edging (right side): With right side facing, join D with slip st in end of top edging to work down a side edge, sc in end of each row down side edge, 3 sc in corner; working in opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch across lower edge, 3 sc in corner, sc in end of each row up other side edge; join with slip st in edge of top edging. Fasten off.
BACK WITH FLAP
Back
Work same as Front through Row 36.
Row 37: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Flap
Rows 38–56: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Round 57: Ch 1, turn, 3 sc in first st (corner made), sc in each st to last st, 3 sc in last st (corner made), sc in end of each row down side edge, 3 sc in corner; working in opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch across lower edge, 3 sc in corner, sc in end of each row up other side edge; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
STRAP AND SIDES
Sides
With B, ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—7 sc.
Rows 2–108: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Strap
Row 109: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog—5 sc.
Row 110: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 2 sts, sc2tog, sc in last st—4 sc.
Rows 111–272: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 273: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in last 2 sts—5 sc.
Row 274: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in last st—7 sc.
Edging
Work sc evenly spaced around entire outer edge of piece, working 3 sc in each corner; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
CROSS-STITCH EMBROIDERY
Embroider cross-stitch paisley pattern on right side of Front, following Front chart.
Embroider cross-stitch paisley pattern on right side of Flap, following Flap chart.
Notes: Flap is top part of Back piece, Rows 38–57. The Flap is folded down over the front. This means that Row 57 is at the bottom of the Flap Chart and Row 38 is at the top.
FINISHING
Attach Front to Strap and Sides: With wrong sides of pieces together (right sides facing out), carefully pin one edge of Rows 1–108 of Strap and Sides piece to side and lower edges of Front, leaving remaining rows of Strap and Sides piece free for Strap. Working through both thicknesses, join D with slip st in top right corner of Front (if you are left-handed, join in top left corner of Front), ch 1, reverse sc in each st down side edge, across lower edge, and up 2nd side edge; slip st in end of top edging of Front. Fasten off.
Attach Back to Strap and Sides: With wrong sides of pieces together (right sides facing out), carefully pin free edge of Rows 1–108 of Strap and Sides piece to side and lower edges of Rows 1–37 of Back and Flap piece. Working through both thicknesses, join D with slip st in top right corner of Back (Row 37) (if you are left-handed, join in top left corner of Back), ch 1, reverse sc in each st down side edge, across lower edge, and up 2nd side edge to other top corner of Back; working through single thickness of flap, reverse sc in each st around flap edges; join with slip st in beginning ch-1. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m) Playtime (02741) 1 ball or 90 yds/82 m
Sizes U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) and U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® stitch marker
Susan Bates® steel yarn needle
Coats & Clark™ Yarn Zip 9" [23 cm]
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] wide x 5" [12.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Notes: 
• To use Coats & Clark™ Yarn Zip, a foundation of chain stitches will be worked directly into the zipper.
• Body of Pouch is then worked directly into these chains on zipper.
• After 2nd rnd, Pouch is worked in continuous rnds. Do not join at end of rnds.

Setting Up Stitches on Coats & Clark™ Yarn Zip
Prepare zipper:
Using a pen or pencil, make small dots along right side of zipper ¼" [0.6 cm] up from bottom zipper stop and 8" [20.5 cm] up from this bottom mark. Make small markings every ¼" [0.6 cm] between these 2 points along right side of loose-weave channel on zipper tape. There should be 33 dots spaced evenly along side of zipper. 
Repeat on left side of zipper.

Begin working into zipper:
With smaller hook, insert hook into top of zipper at bottom mark ¼" [0.6 cm] up from zipper stop. Holding yarn behind zipper, draw up a loop. Insert hook at next ¼" [0.6 cm] marking and draw up a loop (2 loops on hook). Draw this loop through first loop, being sure to not pull too tightly. 
Continue in this manner, inserting hook at each ¼" [0.6 cm] marking, pulling up a loop and drawing it through loop on hook. Once top of zipper is reached, you should have 32 chain sts along right side of zipper.
Pull zipper head down below top marking. Working across top of zipper, insert hook into top marking on left side, drawing up a slightly longer loop to span across top of zipper.
Work down left side of zipper as on opposite side to bottom marking. Make 1 last chain st across bottom of zipper, into same space as first chain. Pull loop from top of zipper to WS and fasten off. Cut yarn leaving approx 4" [10 cm] tail.

POUCH
1st rnd: With larger hook, join yarn with sl st to first ch st on right side. Ch 1. Working through right ‘leg’ of chain only, work 1 sc in each ch st to top of zipper (32 sc). Work 1 sc in ch across top of zipper. Work 1 sc in each of 32 ch down left side of zipper. Work 1 sc in ch across bottom of zipper. Join with sl st to first sc. 66 sc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. Do not join. Place marker on last st. 62 sts.

3rd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Rep last rnd, moving end of rnd marker up at end of each rnd, until work from edge of zipper measures 5" [12.5 cm].

FINISHING
Sl st in next sc to complete final rnd. Fasten off, leaving a long yarn end to seam bottom of Pouch. Lay Pouch flat, aligning sts of last rnd. Using yarn tail, sew bottom of Pouch closed. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton Blend™”, 2 Balls Denim.
Crochet Hook: U.S. Size G-6 [4mm].
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Tote measures 12½” tall x 12” wide.
gauge: 17sts = 4”; 6 rows 2¾“ in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
TOTE
Ch 40.
Rnd 1:  2 Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 35 ch, 5 dc in last ch, working on opposite side of beginning ch, dc in next 35 sts, 2 dc in same ch as first 2 dc; join to top of ch-3 – 80 sts.
Rnd 2:  Ch 3, * [2 dc in next dc] twice, dc in next 35 dc, [2 dc in next dc] twice **, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join – 88 sts.
Rnd 3:  Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next 37 dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] 4 times, dc in next 36 dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; join – 96 dc.
Rnd 4: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc; yo and insert hook from the front to the back to the front around the post of next st, yo and draw lp through, [yo and draw through 2 lps] twice – front post dc (fpdc) made; dc in next 41 dc, fpdc, dc in next 5 dc, fpdc, dc in next 41 dc, fpdc, dc in last 2 dc; join.
Rnd 5 and 6:  Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, fpdc, dc in next 41 dc, fpdc, dc in next 5 dc, fpdc, dc in next 41 dc, fpdc, dc in last 2 dc; join.
Rnd 7:  Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, * fpdc, dc in next dc, [ch 1, skip next st or sp, dc in next dc] 20 times, fpdc **, dc in next 5 dc; repeat from * to last 2 dc, end at **; dc in last 2 dc; join.
Rnds 8 and 9:  Repeat Rnd 7.
Rnd 10:  Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, * fpdc, dc in next dc; [yo and draw up a lp to height of current row} 3 times all in next ch-1 sp, yo and through all 7 lps on hook – puff st made; [ch 1, skip next dc, puff st] 19 times, dc in next dc, fpdc **, dc in next 5 dc; repeat from * to last 2 dc, end at **; dc in last 2 dc; join.
Rnd 11: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, * fpdc, dc in next dc, [ch 1, skip puff st, dc in sp] 19 times, ch 1, skip puff st, dc in next dc, fpdc **, dc in next 5 dc; repeat from * to last 2 dc, end at **; dc in last 2 dc; join.
Rnds 12 and 13: Repeat Rnd 7.
Rnd 14: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, * fpdc, [dc in next dc, dc in next sp] 20 times, dc in next dc, fpdc **, dc in next 5 dc; repeat from * to last 2 dc, end at **, dc in last 2 dc; join.
Rnds 15-19: Repeat Rnd 5.
Rnds 20-27: Repeat Rnds 7-14 once more. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Strap
With right side facing, skip last 3 sts made, attach thread in next dc to the right.
Row 1:  Ch 2, fpdc, dc in next 5 sts, fpdc, dc in next dc; turn.
Row 2: Ch 2; yo and insert hook from the back to the front to the back around the post of next st, yo and draw lp through, [yo and draw through 2 lps] twice - of next st, yo and draw lp through, [yo and draw through 2 lps] twice.

materials: RED HEART® Classic™: 3 skeins 0334 Tan A
2 skeins 0401 Nickel B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75mm [US F-5]
2 leather straps with rings, 20-22" [51-56 cm] long
yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Finished Measurements: 16" [41 cm] wide x 14" [35.5 cm] high x 4" [10 cm] deep
gauge: 20 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 21 rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BASE (make 2)
With B, ch 71.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook, sc in each ch across – 70 sc.
Rows 2-19: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off one Base piece, do not fasten off second Base piece.
Joining Base Pieces
Round 1: Holding wrong sides of Base pieces together, lining up sts and working through both layers, ch 1, turn to work down one short edge, [sc 17 sts evenly along short edge, turn to work along one long edge, 3 sc in first st of next long edge, sc 68 sts evenly to last st, 3 sc in last st] twice, slip st in first sc to join – 182 sc.
Body
Round 2: Ch 2 (does NOT count as a hdc here and throughout), working in back loops only, hdc in each sc around, slip st in first hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in each horizontal bar on back of hdc around, do not join.
Rounds 4-7: Hdc in each horizontal bar on back of hdc around. Fasten off.
Round 8: Change to A, ch 1, sc in each horizontal bar on back of hdc around, slip st in first hdc.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, do not join.
Rounds 10-60: Sc in each sc around.
Round 61: [Sc in next 12 sc, sc2tog] 13 times – 169 sc.
Round 62: Sc in each sc around.
Round 63: [Sc in next 11 sc, sc2tog] 13 times – 156 sc.
Round 64: Change to B, ch 2, hdc in each sc, slip st in first hdc.
Rounds 65-67: Ch 2, hdc in each horizontal bar on back of hdc around, slip st in first hdc. Drop B, change to A.
Round 68: Ch 2, hdc in each horizontal bar on back of hdc around, slip st in first hdc. Cut A.
Round 69: Change to B, ch 2, hdc in each horizontal bar on back of hdc around, slip st in first hdc. Fasten off.
Side Tabs (make 2)
With B, ch 10.
Row 1: Hdc in second ch from hook, sc in each ch across – 9 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, working in back loop only, hdc in each hdc across.
Row 3: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each horizontal bar on back of hdc across. Fasten off.
Sew one Side Tab in middle of lower edge of each short side.
Pocket
With A, ch 21.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook, sc in each ch across – 20 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Cut A.
Row 3: Change to B, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Cut B.
Row 5: Change to A, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Rows 6-28: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Trim Round: Turn to work along one long edge, sc evenly spaced along edge to corner, turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, (sc, ch 1) in first ch, sl st in each ch across to last st, (ch 1, sc) in last st, turn to work along opposite long edge, sc evenly spaced along edge to corner. Fasten off. Do not work last row for bottom of Pocket.
Use yarn needle and photo as guide, sew Pocket to Tote Body.
Tassel (make 2)
Cut 25 lengths of A, each 12" [30 cm] long. Use one length to tie remaining lengths together in center securely. Fold lengths in half at tied center and hide ends of knot in center. Cut a 12" [30 cm] length of B. Wrap around folded length, 1" [2.5 cm] from secured end. Trim ends evenly.
With A, slip st in top of tassel, ch 40, slip st in top of second tassel. Fasten off.
Top Cuff
With A, ch 17.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook, sc in each ch across – 16 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Sew Top Cuff over slip st joins on top of Tote.
FINISHING
Sew handles onto bag.Tote. Add tassels to handle ring. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Warm Brown (01130)  2 balls or 218 yds/200 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 2 balls or 181 yds/166 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 12" x 14" [30.5 x 35.5 cm], excluding strap.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Bag is worked in a continuous spiral.
• Do not join at end of rnds.
• Place marker on first st of rnd and move marker each rnd to keep place.
BAG
With A, ch 40.
1st rnd: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Do not join. 80 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep 2nd rnd 10 times more.
Begin working Chart in rnds, (see page 2) noting each square of chart is equal to 1 sc, reading rnds from right to left and noting 16-st rep will be worked 5 times around. Carry color not in use across top of entire previous rnd and work sts around it. Carry both colors up WS of work.
After 26 rnds of Chart are complete, cont as follows.
Next 12 rnds: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around.
Final rnd: Sl st to next sc. Fasten off.
STRAP (worked lengthwise)
With A, ch 85.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 84 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 1½" [4 cm].
Fasten off.
Sew Strap to Bag as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Ways™ Bamboo Wool™”: 3 Balls each 3365 Cocoa, 3650 Dill, 3920 Cayenne, 3845 Twilight; and 2 balls 3116 Ivory.
Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Beg PS (Beginning Puff Stitch) = Ch 2, [yo and draw up a long loop, yo and draw through 2 loops] twice all in space indicated, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
PS (Puff Stitch) = [Yo and draw up a long loop, yo and draw through 2 lps] 3 times all in st or space indicated, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
measurements: Bag measures 28” x 18” before felting.
gauge: Rnd 1 and 2 = 3½” across; Square measures about 9” x 9”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SQUARE (Make 12 in random color combinations never using Ivory in the last 2 Rnds)
With first color, ch 4; join with a slip st in 4th ch from hook to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Beg PS in ring, ch 1, [PS in ring, ch 1] 7 times; join with a slip st in top of Beg PS – 8 puff sts.
Rnd 2: Slip st to next ch-1 space, (Beg PS, ch 1, PS, ch 1) all in next ch-1 space, * [PS, ch 1] twice all in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of Beg PS – 16 puff sts. Fasten off.
Rnd 3: Join 2nd color in any ch-1 space; (Beg PS, ch 4, PS) all in same space, * ch 1, [PS in next ch-1 space, ch 1] 3 times **, (PS, ch 4, PS) all in next ch-1 space for corner; repeat from * around, end at **; join – 20 puff sts. Fasten off.
Rnds 4 and 5: Join next color in any corner ch-4 space; (Beg PS, ch 4, PS) all in same space, * ch 1, PS in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to next corner; ch 1 **, (PS, ch 4, PS) all in corner ch-4 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join. Fasten off.
Rnd 6: Join last color in any corner ch-4 space; (ch 3, 2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in same space, * 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to next corner **, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in corner ch-4 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join with a slip st in top of ch-3.
Rnd 7: Ch 3, * dc in each st to corner **, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in corner ch-3 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
STRAP (Make 2)
With Cocoa, leaving a long tail for sewing, ch 96.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn – 95 sc.
Rows 2-5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off at end of Row 5 leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
With Ivory and right sides of squares together, slip st squares in a 3 x 4 rectangle. Fold in half and slip st sides together. Sew ends of straps to top opening of bag at seams on each side of center top square.
FELTING
Felting is not an exact science due to the many different variables, however approximately 30% of the dimensions may be lost in the felting process.
Place bag and 1 or 2 bath towels in the washing machine in the smallest load with hottest water setting and a small amount of liquid detergent through two wash cycles. Do not use fabric softener. Remove bag and check amount of felting during this process. Two or more wash cycles may be needed before you will be satisfied with the effect. One or two tablespoons of baking soda in the wash may speed the process – check frequently. Repeat until pieces are felted and bag is desired size. Rinse in cool water to stop the felting process and to remove the soap. Pull bag into shape and allow to dry away from sun or heat for a day or two. Felting may cause a certain amount of pilling which is easily removed by brushing briskly with a hard nylon brush.
RED HEART® “Eco-Ways™ Bamboo Wool™”, Art. 754 available in 1.76 oz (50 g), 87 yd (80 m) balls.

materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 3 balls 8012 Black A and 1 ball 8671 Neon Green B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
stitch marker
8 black shank buttons: 2 each 7⁄8” (22 mm) and 3⁄8” (9.5 mm), four ½” (13 mm), two ½” (13 mm) ball buttons
sewing needle and black thread
fabric sealant (optional)
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
measurements: Tote measures 10” wide x 12” high (25.5 x 30.5 cm), not including handles.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 15 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet with larger hook. Gauge is not critical for this project but tension should be tight.
instructions:
BAG
With larger hook and A, ch 31.
Round 1: Working in back bumps only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 28 ch, 3 sc in next ch; working on opposite side of foundation ch, sc in first 29 ch, 3 sc in last ch; join with slip st in first sc—64 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2–34: Sc in each st around.
Round 35: Sc in each st around; change to B; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 36: Ch 1, sc in each st around; change to A; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 37 and 38: Repeat Rounds 35 and 36. Cut B at end of Round 38.
Round 39: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

Straps (make 2)
With larger hook and B, ch 51.
Round 1: Working in back bumps only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 48 ch, 2 sc in next ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 49 ch, 2 sc in last ch; join with slip st in first sc—102 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

EYES
Large Round Eyes (make 2)
With smaller hook and B, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join and in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join, sc in next 2 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Small Round Eyes (make 2)
Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of large round eyes. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

“Bug” Eyes (make 2)
With smaller hook and B, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join, sc in next 5 sts; join with slip st in first sc—7 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Large Semi-Circular Eyes (make 2)
With smaller hook and B, ch 3.
Row 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in last ch, turn—6 sc and 1 slip st.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in slip st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] twice, sc in next st, slip st in last st, turn—8 sc and 1 slip st.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in slip st, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice, sc in next st, slip st in last st—10 sc and 1 slip st.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in slip st, sc in next 2 sts, [2 sc in st, sc in next st] 3 times, 2 sc in last 3 sts—18 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, working across ends of rows and in opposite side of foundation ch, sc 8 sts evenly spaced, slip st in first sc of Row 4. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Small Semi-Circular Eyes (make 2)
Rows 1–3: Work same as Rows 1–3 of large semi-circular eyes. Do not turn at end of Row 3.
Row 4: Ch 1, working across ends of rows and opposite side of foundation ch, sc 6 sts evenly across, slip st in first st of Row 3. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

FINISHING
Use photograph as a guide for placement of straps and eyes. 
Pin a strap to each side of bag at top edge, evenly spaced from side edges, and sew in place.
Position eyes on bag as desired and sew in place. For “bug” eyes only, stuff scraps of yarn under each eye before sewing is finished for bug-eyed appearance.
With sewing needle and thread, securely sew buttons for pupils on each pair of eyes. Alter the positions of the buttons to create various expressions. Optional: Apply a drop or 2 of fabric sealant on the sewing thread to ensure that the knot doesn’t open.
Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Shetland Chunky (100 g / 3.5 oz)
Main Color (MC) (03430 Wine) 1 ball
Contrast A (03532 Deep Red) 1 ball
Contrast B (03242 Dark Sage Green) 1 ball
Contrast C (03608 Mustard) 1 ball
Contrast D (03031 Earthy Brown) 6 balls
Size 6 mm (U.S. J or 10) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
Toggle.
gauge: 13 sts and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Front and Back (Make 2 pieces alike)
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw loop in next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in next color.
With MC, ch 9. With D, ch 23. With A, ch 12.
Foundation row: (RS). With A, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 9 ch. With D, 1 sc in each of next 23 ch. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 10 ch. Turn. 43 sc.
Next Foundation row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. (Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 4 times. (With D, ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 11 times. (With A, ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 5 times. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Work Chart I to end of chart beg each row with ch 1, and noting side decs will be worked as follows: Draw up a loop in each of first 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made.
Side and Handle
With D, ch 8.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 6 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). Miss first dc. 1 dc in next dc and each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work fits length to measure down one side, across bottom and up other side of Purse. Work 11 ins [28 cm] more for Handle, omitting turning ch at end of last row. Fasten off.
Joining Side: Fold Side in half lengthwise. Join D with ss in corner of Side. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each sc across first and last rows. 
Joining Front, Back and Side: Place WS of Front and Side Section facing each other, placing seam of Side at center of bottom.
1st rnd: (RS). Join D with ss in left top corner of outer edge of Front. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each st down to bottom, across bottom, up to top of outer edge of Front and along side of Handle. Join with ss to first sc.
2nd rnd: Working from left to right instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 sc in each sc around for reverse sc. Join with ss to first sc. Fasten off.
Rep for opposite side. 
With RS of work facing, join D with ss to top right corner of inner edge of Front. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. Work 1 row of sc evenly along to opposite corner. 
Next row: Working from left to right instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 sc in each sc for reverse sc. Fasten off.
Rep for opposite side.
Toggle loop: With D, ch 16. Fasten off. Sew to inner edge of Back to form a loop. Sew toggle on Front to correspond.
Chart I
= MC
= Contrast A
= Contrast B
= Contrast C
= Contrast D
= Ch 1 with appropriate color

materials: RED HEART® “Classic™”: 1 Skein 246 Sea Coral B.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9].
Bamboo purse handles, stitch markers, yarn needle.
RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein each 505 Aruba Sea A and 305 Aspen Print C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
measurements: Bag measures 11” wide x 10” tall.
gauge: 13 hdc = 4”; 11 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BAG
Front
Top Panel
With A, ch 13.
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch across.
Rows 2-17: Ch 2, turn, Fpdc in each st across, hdc in top of beginning ch – 11 sts.
Rows 18-34: Change to B, repeat Row 2. Fasten off.
Center Panel
With C, ch 20.
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch across.
Rows 2-28: Ch 2, turn, Fpdc in each st across, hdc in top of beginning ch – 18 sts.
Rows 29-34: Change to A, repeat Row 2. Fasten off.
Bottom Panel
With B, ch 13.
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch across Rows 2-17: Ch 2, turn, Fpdc in each st across, hdc in top of beginning ch – 11 sts.
Rows 18-34: Change to A, repeat Row 2. Fasten off.
Back
With A, ch 37.
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across.
Rows 2-28: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc in each hdc across, turn – 36 hdc. Fasten off.
Bottom Gusset
With C, ch 37.
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across.
