Round 11: Ch 2, 4 dc in same st as join, *skip next 4 sts, 5 dc in next st; repeat from * 22 times, skip last 4 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 12: Ch 2, dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Rounds 13–26: Repeat Rounds 11 and 12 seven times.
Round 27: *Ch 20, skip next 10 sts, dc in next 50 sts; repeat from * once; join with slip st in first ch—100 dc and 2 ch-20 spaces.
Round 28: Ch 2, dc in each st and ch around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—140 dc.
Round 29: Ch 1, *sc2tog, dc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—120 sc.
Round 30: Ch 1, *sc2tog, dc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—100 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Main Color (MC) Shocking Pink (0718) 2 balls or 692 yds/629 m
Contrast A Pumpkin (0254) 1 ball or 323 yds/294 m
Sizes U.S. F/5 (3.5 mm) and U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdcrb = Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw up a loop in space one row below where previous stitch was worked. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 12" [24 cm] wide x 14" [18 cm] tall x 3" [7.5 cm] deep, excluding handles.
gauge: 15 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook. 11 sts and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook in Hdcrb pat.
instructions:
Notes: • Join each rnd with sl st to first st. • Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st. • To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
BOTTOM
See Diagram on page 4.
With MC and larger hook, ch 30.
1st rnd: (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in 3rd ch from hook. PM on ch-1 sp. 1 hdc in each ch to last ch. [(1 hdc. Ch 1) twice. 1 hdc] in last ch. PM on 1st and 2nd ch-1 sps. Do not turn. Working across rem loops of foundation ch, 1 hdc in each of rem 26 ch. 1 hdc in ch where first hdc made. Join with sc to top of first hdc (counts as ch-1 sp). 58 hdc and 4 ch-1 sps.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc around post of joining sc. 1 hdc in next hdc. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in next ch-1 sp. 1 hdc in each hdc to next ch-1 sp. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in next ch-1 sp. 1 hdc in next hdc. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in next ch-1 sp. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. 1 hdc around post of joining sc. Join with sc to top of first hdc. 66 hdc and 4 ch-1 sps.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc around post of joining sc. *1 hdc in each hdc to next ch-1 sp. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. 1 hdc around post of joining sc. Join with sc to top of first hdc. 82 hdc and 4 ch-1 sps.
Note: Hdcrb-sts of Sides are wider than hdc for Bottom. Sides will spread wider naturally.
SIDES
See Diagram on page 4.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdcbp around each hdc, skipping ch-1 sps, to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. 82 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdcrb in each st around. Join with sl st to first st. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 13" [33 cm]. Join A. Break MC.
Border: 1st rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join.
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdcbp around post of each hdc to end of rnd. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
HANDLES (make 2)
See Diagram on page 5.
With A and larger hook, ch 95.
1st rnd: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. PM on 1st sc of just made 3-sc group. Do not turn. Working across rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. 1 sc in sp where first 2 sc were made. Join. 190 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to next marked sc. 2 sc in marked sc. PM on first sc of 2-sc group just made. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 196 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to next marked sc. 2 sc in marked sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 142 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
REVERSE SC
Rnd of surface sl st: With MC, larger hook and RS facing, work surface sl st across last rnd of sc as follows: Hold MC at WS of work. Insert hook in any sc of last sc rnd from front to back and draw up a loop. *Insert hook in next sc of last sc row from front to back and work sl st loosely (do not pull fabric). Rep from * around. Fold Handles in half lengthwise and using A sew sides tog, leaving 4" [10 cm] of each end unsewn.
BUTTON (make 4)
See Diagram on page 4.
Note: Button is worked with WS facing. With MC and smaller hook ch 2, leaving a long end.
1st rnd: (WS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th and 5th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
6th rnd: (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 12 sts.
7th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts. Fasten off leaving a long end. Using long ends from foundation chain, fold button flat and sew through the center for tufted shape.
With A, sew 4" [10 cm] unfolded sections of Handles to Tote below orange section, working through both thicknesses and surface sl st. Sew buttons as shown in picture.
FLOWER (make 1)
See Diagram on page 5.
Note: Do not join at each end of rnd. Work in spiral rounds, moving marker as work progresses.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in each of next 5 sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 36 sc. Join with sl st in next sc.
First Petal: **1st row: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 8 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 10 sc. Turn.
4th to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
7th to 9th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts at end of last row.
10th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.** 
Second to Sixth Petals: Join A with sl st to next sc of 6th rnd. Work from ** to ** as given for First Petal. Do not fasten off at end of last Petal.
Outer edge: 1st rnd: (RS). With A, ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in last st. *11 sc down left side of Petal. Sl st between 2 Petals. 11 sc up right side of next Petal.** (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in top of Petal. Rep from * around, ending at **. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. With MC, work surface sl st around Flower, 1 st in from edge as shown in photo. Sew Flower to front of Bag as shown in picture.

materials: Bernat Handicrafter Cotton (Solids: 50 g/1.75 oz) or (Ombres: 42.5 g/1.5 oz) 5 balls
Size 4.5 mm (U.S. 7) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 11 ½ x 18 ins [29 cm x 45.5 cm].
gauge: 14 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions: Base: Ch 43. 1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Do not turn.Working into other side of ch, work 1 sc in each rem loop of ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 84 sc. 2nd rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 6 times more. Mesh Section: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. *Ch 5. Miss next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with ch 2. Miss last 3 sc. 1 dc in first sc. 2nd rnd:*Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 loop. Rep from * around, ending with ch 2. 1 dc in last dc of previous rnd. Rep last rnd until work from base when folded flat measures 12 ins [30.5 cm]. Next rnd: Sl st in next ch-5 loop. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp. *1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next ch-5 loop. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in last dc. Join with sl st to first sc. 84 sc. Next rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd once more. Fasten off. Strap: Lay bag on a flat surface. Mark centre 12 sts on upper edge of one side. Join yarn with sl st to first of these 12 sts. 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Ch 1. Turn. 2nd row:Draw up a loop in each of first 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook-sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Ch 1. Turn. 3rd row: 1 sc in each st across. Ch 1. Turn. 4th row:Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. 8 sts. Ch 1. Turn. 5th row: 1 sc in each st across. Ch 1. Turn. Rep last row until strap measures 18 ins [45.5 cm] ending with WS facing for next row. Next row:2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last st. 2 sc in last st. Ch 1. Turn. Next row:1 sc in each st across. Ch 1. Turn. Next row:2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last st. 2 sc in last st. 12 sts. Join strap to other side of bag working 1 sl st through corresponding centre 12 sts of bag AT SAME TIME working sl st through 12 sts of strap. Strap and Upper Edging: With RS of work facing, join yarn with sl st to one side of strap and work 1 rnd sc evenly along strap edge and top edge of Bag. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep around other side of Bag.

materials: Bernat® Maker™ Splash™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 305 yds/279 m) Cherry Swirl (35005) 2 balls or 507 yds/463 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 8¼" [21 cm] diameter.
gauge: 12 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc.
• Ch 4 at beg of rnds counts as tr.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st, unless otherwise stated.
Base: Ch 3.
1st rnd: 7 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 7 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 14 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join. 21 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join. 28 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join. 35 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join. 42 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join. 49 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 6 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join. 56 hdc.
9th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 7 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join. 63 hdc.
10th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 8 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join. 70 hdc.
11th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 9 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join. 77 hdc.

Sides: 12th rnd: (Set-up rnd). Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each hdc around. Join.
13th rnd: (Scale rnd). Ch 4. 4 dc down post of first dc of previous rnd. Ch 1. (4 dc. 1 tr) up post of 2nd dc of previous rnd – beg scale st made. Skip next 5 dc. *(1 tr. 4 dc) down post of next dc of previous rnd. Ch 1. (4 dc. 1 tr) up post of next dc of previous rnd - scale st made. Skip next 5 dc. Rep from * 10 times more. Join. 11 scale sts.
14th rnd: Sl st to 3rd dc of last skipped 5-dc group of previous rnd. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc between 2 dc of scale st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc.** 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * 9 times more, then rep from * to ** once more. Join.
15th rnd: Beg scale st. Skip next 5 dc. *Scale st. Skip next 5 dc. Rep from * around. Join.
16th to 29th rnds: Rep last 2 rnds 7 times more. 
30th rnd: Sl st to 3rd dc of last skipped 5-dc group of previous rnd. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each dc around. Join. 77 hdc
31st and 32nd rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 
33rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc.** 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * 9 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn. 55 hdc and 22 ch-1 sps.
34th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp.** 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * 9 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn. 77 hdc.
35th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each hdc around. Join and fasten off.

DRAWSTRING
Ch 91.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off.
Tie a knot 1" [2.5 cm] up from each end of Drawstring.
STRAP
Ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until strap measures approx 30" [76 cm] or desired length, ending on WS. Do not fasten off.
Border: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 3 sc in last sc. Working down side edge of strap, 1 sc in side of each row to next corner. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 3 sc in next ch. Working up side edge of strap, 1 sc in side edge of each row to first corner. 2 sc in same sp as first sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Contrast A Golden Haze (69024) 1 ball
Aunt Lydia® Crochet Thread Classic™ 10 (400 yds/366 m) Contrast B Natural (154-0226) 1 ball
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 stitch markers.
Yarn needle.
7" [18 cm] long zipper.
Matching sewing thread and needle to sew in zipper.
abbreviations: Hdc3bl = Half double crochet through 3rd loop at back of work.
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] diameter.
gauge: 20 sc and 22 rows = 4" [10 cm] with Bernat® Softee® Cotton. 28 sc and 30 rows = 4" [10 cm] with Aunt Lydia® Classic™ 10
instructions:
SIDE (make 2)
Note:  Sides are worked in a continuous spiral. Do not work ch at beg of rnd; simply work directly into next st (noting marker to indicate end of rnd moves up each rnd).
**With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.  See diagram on page 3.
Set-up:  (3 sc. 7 hdc) all in ring. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. Place marker in last hdc for end of rnd. 10 sts.
1st rnd:  2 hdc3bl in each hdc around. 20 hdc3bl.
2nd rnd:  *2 hdc3bl in next st. 1 hdc3bl in next st. Rep from * around. 30 hdc3bl.
3rd rnd:  *2 hdc3bl in next st. 1 hdc3bl in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 40 hdc3bl.
4th rnd:  *2 hdc3bl in next st. 1 hdc3bl in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 50 hdc3bl.
Cont as established, inc 10 sts every rnd until there are 130 sts. Sl st in next st. Fasten off.
Surface crochet: Join B with sl st to 1st st of spiral. *Insert hook from right to left, behind next st and pull up a loop. Pull loop through loop on hook. Rep from * around all sts in spiral. Fasten off at end of spiral.
GUSSET
With A, ch 9.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Gusset, when slightly stretched, measures approx 25" [63.5 cm], ending on a RS row.
Do not fasten off at end of row.
Turn Gusset to work edging along side edge.
1st row: Ch 1. Work 130 sc evenly along side edge. Fasten off.
Join A with sl st and work 130 sc evenly across opposite side edge. Fasten off.
Sew foundation row and final row edges tog.
ATTACH GUSSET AND SIDES
First side: With WS of pieces tog, align sts of both Gusset and Side. (You may find it helpful to pin or clip pieces in position).
1st rnd: Join B with sl st to back loop of any Side st. Ch 1. Working through back loop of Side and front loop of Gusset AT SAME TIME, join Side and Gusset by working 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Second side:  Place markers 7" [18 cm] apart along second side for zipper opening. With WS tog, align sts of both Gusset and rem side.
1st row: Join B with sl st to first marked st. Ch 1. Work 2 sc in each sc to second marked st. Fasten off.
HANDLE
With A, ch 9.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd to 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Beg working in rnds: 1st rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not turn. 1 sc in first sc. Place marker in last sc for end of rnd. Work 1 sc in each sc around until Handle measures 24" [61 cm].
Beg working in rows: 1st row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd to 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of last row.
FINISHING
With sewing thread and needle, sew zipper into top of Bag in zipper opening. Sew sides of Handle worked in rows to either side edge of Gusset.

materials: Caron® Cotton Cakes™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 211 yds/193 m) Hollyhock (49018) 4 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx. 20" [51 cm] deep x 20" [51 cm] long.
gauge: 14 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm]; Motif = 7" [18 cm] square.
instructions:
Motif (Make 13)
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 4 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 4 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 3. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * twice more. Ch 3. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each sc to next corner ch-3 sp. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) all in corner ch-3 sp] 4 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th to 16th rnds: Rep 4th rnd 12 more times.
Fasten off.
Straps (Make 2)
Ch 85.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. (84 sc).
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.
Assembly: Following diagrams on page 2, join Motifs tog, matching lettered sides, using rows of sc through back loops.
Bag Edging
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to to any corner.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around, working 3 sc in each ch-3 sp. Join with sl to to top of first sc. Fasten off.
Sew Straps in position.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 2 skeins 254 Pumpkin A, 1 skein 312 Black B.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9].
Stitch marker, yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Bag measures 5” tall x 7” diameter at top.
gauge: 6 sts and 6 rows = 2”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Special Stitch
Decrease single crochet (sc2tog) = [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Round 1: Using A, ch 2; 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed – 8 sc.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 16 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 24 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 32 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 40 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 48 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 56 sc.
Rounds 8 – 10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 64 sc.
Rounds 12 – 20: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 21: [Sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog] 8 times – 56 sc.
Round 22: Sc in each sc around.
Round 23: [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 8 times – 48 sc.
Round 24: Sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
Handle
Using 2 strands of A, ch 50.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to last ch; 5 sc in last ch; working in free loops of beginning ch, sc to beginning sc; 4 sc in same st as first sc. Join with slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off.
Eyes (Make 2)
Using single strand of B, ch 4.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 chs; turn – 3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog; turn – 2 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog; turn – 1 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in next sc. 
Fasten off.
Nose
With a single strand of B, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 chs, turn – 4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 1 sc, sc2tog, 1sc, turn – 3 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, 1 sc, sc2tog, turn – 2sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, turn – 1sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in next sc. Fasten off.
Mouth
Using single strand of B, ch 19.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, sc in next 2 chs, hdc in next 2 chs, dc in next 2 chs, [2 dc in next ch] twice, dc in next 2 chs, hdc in next 2 chs, sc in next 2 chs, slip st in last 2 chs. Fasten off.
Finishing
Weave in ends. Using single strand of B, work blanket stitch around top of bag. Sew on handle. Using single strand of A and blanket stitch, sew on eyes, nose and mouth.
RED HEART® “Super Saver®” Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multicolor, heather and print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz (141g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins.

pattern_name: BERNAT HANDICRAFTER COTTON TWISTS CROCHET BAG
materials: Bernat Handicrafter Cotton Twists (42.5 g/1.5 oz) 7 balls of #41117 (Denim Twists)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G/6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Plastic ring 3 ins [7.5 cm] in diameter for decoration
measurements: Approx 14 ins [35.5 cm] wide x 25 ins [63.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 15 hdc and 11 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. 
FRONT and BACK (make alike).
Ch 40.
1st row:(RS). 2 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to last ch. 2 hdc in last ch. Turn. 40 hdc.
Next 6 rows:Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 52 hdc at end of last row.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row for 10 ins [25.5 cm], ending with a WS row. 
**Shape strap: Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 17 hdc. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - Hdc2tog made. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 18 sts.
Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows once more. 14 sts. 
Next 3 rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows 7 times more. 6 sts.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until strap measures 16 ins [40.5 cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off.**
With WS of work facing, join yarn with sl st to first st.
Work from ** to ** as given above, noting RS becomes WS. 
FINISHING
With WS of Front and Back tog, sew bottom and side seams to top of Straps. 
Decorative Flap: Ch 17. 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. 15 hdc.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row for 6 ins 18 cm], ending with a WS row. 
Fold ¾ inch [2 cm] of Flap around ring and sew in position. Sew Flap to Back. 
Fringe: Cut yarn, 5 ins [12.5 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, knot into fringe around Ring. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Contrast A  Jute (00082) 1 ball
Contrast B  Ecru (00004) 1 ball
Contrast C  Bright Navy (00009) 1 ball
Contrast D  Orchid (01137) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® Steel Yarn Needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 11½ [29 cm] wide x 18" [45.5 cm] long, excluding handle.
gauge: 14 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note:  Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Base:  With A, ch 43. 
1st rnd:  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Do 
not turn. Working into other side 
of ch, work 1 sc in each rem loop 
of ch. Join. 84 sc. 
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as 
last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. 
Join. 
Rep last rnd 6 times more. Join B at 
end of last rnd. Break A. 
Mesh Section: 
1st rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same 
sp as last sl st. *Ch 5. Skip next 3 sc. 
1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, 
ending with ch 2. Skip last 3 sc. 
1 dc in first sc. 
2nd rnd: *Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 
loop. Rep from * around, ending 
with ch 2. 1 dc in last dc of previ -
ous rnd.
Rep last rnd until work from base 
when folded flat measures 12" 
[30.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Next rnd: Join A with sl st in next 
ch-5 loop. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as 
last sl st. *1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in 
next ch-5 loop. Rep from * around, 
ending with 1 sc in last dc. Join. 
84 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as 
last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. 
Join. 
Rep last rnd twice more. Fasten off.
Strap: Lay Bag on a flat surface. 
Mark center 12 sts on upper edge 
of one side. Join C with sl st to first 
of these 12 sts.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as 
sl st. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. 
Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each 
of next 8 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
3rd row: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in each 
st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each 
st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. 8 sts. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each 
st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until strap measures 
18" [45.5 cm] ending on a RS row.
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc 
in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 
Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc 
in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 
12 sc. Join strap to other side of 
bag working 1 sl st through both 
thicknesses of corresponding 
centre 12 sts of Bag and 12 sts of 
Strap.
Strap and Upper Edging: With RS 
of work facing, join A with sl st to 
one side of strap and work 1 rnd 
sc evenly along strap edge and 
top edge of Bag. Join. Rep around 
other side of Bag.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream Stripes (56.7 g / 2 oz) 4 balls of #21532 (Holiday Stripes)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H / 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
4 grommets
measurements: 9 x 12 x 3½ ins [23 x 30.5 x 9 cm]
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions: Front and Back (make alike). Ch 27. 1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of ch. Turn. 26 sc. Work in sc for 11 ins [28 cm]. Next row: (Eyelet row). Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) twice. Turn. Work 2 rows in sc. Fasten off. Apply grommets in eyelets. Gusset: Ch 12. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 11 sc. Work in sc for 33 ins [84 cm]. Fasten off. With WS tog, crochet Gusset to sides and bottom of Front and Back. Handles: Ch 5. Join with sl st in first ch. 1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. 5 sc. Place marker for end of rnd and slip marker every rnd. Work in sc for 16 ins [40.5 cm]. Fasten off. Thread handles through grommets and knot ends.

pattern_name: CAT IN THE BAG CROCHET TOTE
materials: Peaches & Crème® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Bright Orange (11628) 2 balls or 230 yds/210 m
Contrast B Ecru (11006) 3 balls or 350 yds/320 m
Contrast C Black (11040) 1 ball or 17 yds/16 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] wide x 16" [40.5 cm] long, excluding handles.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
BAG
With A, ch 49.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 98 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 46 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 104 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Rep last rnd until Bag measures 8" [20.5 cm]. Break A, join B.
With B, cont even in rnds until Bag measures 16" [40.5 cm]. Fasten off.

HANDLES (make 2)
With B, ch 105.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 104 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Handle measures 2" [5 cm] wide. Fasten off.

EARS (make 2)
With A, ch 12.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 11 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 9 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog.
Fasten off, leaving a long end.

EYES (make 2)
Outer Eye
With B, ch 2.
**1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sc.**
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc. Fasten off.
Pupil (make 2)
With C, ch 2.
Work from ** to ** as given for Outer Eye. Fasten off.
Highlight Pupil with straight stitch using B as shown in photo. Sew Pupil to Outer Eye.

NOSE
With C, ch 4.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of last 2 ch. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Do not turn.
Edging: Ch 1. Working around Nose, work 1 rnd of sc, having 1 sc in each side, and 2 sc in each ‘corner’ of Nose to make a triangle. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end.

FINISHING
Sew Handles to Bag as shown in picture. Sew Ears to front of Bag at top edge of Cat’s head. Sew Eyes and Nose to front of Bag. Embroider snout and whiskers with C using outline stitch.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 5142 Cherry Red A and 4601 Off White B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5mm [H-8 US] and 5.5mm [I-9 US]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Gift bag measures 6” long x 5½” wide (15 x 14 cm), not including handles
gauge: 4 sts = 1” (2.5 cm); 5 rows = 1” (2.5 cm) in single crochet with larger hook.
instructions:
Here’s My Heart Gift Bag
This bag is perfect for the little miss to carry or to use as a gift bag for girls of any age! Crochet it in any color your heart desires and trim with a sweet white edging.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, skip next 2 sts, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, 3 dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, dc in next st, next skip 2 sts, sc in last 3 sts, turn—9 dc and 6 sc.
Row 17: Skip first 3 sts, [2 dc next st, dc next st] twice, 3 dc in next st, [dc next st, 2 dc next st] twice, skip next 2 sts, slip st in last st—15 dc. Fasten off.
Second Lobe
With right side facing and larger hook, join A with slip st in ch-2 space.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in ch-2 space, sc in next 4 sts, skip next 2 sts, 5 dc in next st, skip 2 sts, sc in last 5 sts, turn—5 dc and 10 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Repeat Rows 16 and 17 of first lobe. Do not fasten off.
Edging
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 2 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, sc in last st of Row 16 of second lobe, ch 1, slip st in marked ch-2 space, ch 1, sc in first st of Row 16 of first lobe, sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 3 times; *sc in ends of next 16 rows,* (sc, ch 2, sc) in beginning ring; repeat from * to * once; join with slip st in first st—74 sc and 1 ch-2 sp. Fasten off.
Lace Heart
Mitered Square
Work same as Rows 1–10 of large heart—20 sc and 1 ch-2 sp. Place marker in ch-2 space of Row 10.
First Lobe
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, skip next 2 sts, 5 dc in next st, skip 2 sts, sc in last 2 sts, sc in ch-2 space, turn—5 dc and 6 sc.
Row 12: Skip first 3 sts, 2 dc in next 2 sts, 3 dc in next st, 2 dc in next 2 sts, skip 2 sts, slip st in next st—11 dc and 1 slip st. Fasten off.
Second Lobe
With right side facing and larger hook, join A with slip st in ch-2 space.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in ch-2 space, sc in next 2 sts, skip next 2 sts, 5 dc in next st, skip 2 sts, sc in last 3 sts, turn—5 dc and 6 sc.
Row 2: Repeat Row 12 from first lobe of lace heart—11 dc.
Edging
With right side facing, join B with slip st in marked ch-2 space.
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first st of Row 11 of second lobe, *[2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 3 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st;* sc in ends of next 11 rows, (sc, ch 2, sc) in beginning ring, sc in ends of next 11 rows, sc in next st; repeat from * to * once, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st of Row 11 of first lobe, turn—56 sc and 1 ch-2 sp.
Row 2: Ch 3, sc in next st, *[ch 3, skip next st, sc in next st] 13 times, ch 3,* skip ch-2 sp, sc in next st; repeat from * to * once, slip st in last st, turn—28 sc and 28 ch-3 sps.
Row 3: Ch 1, slip st in first ch-3 space, [ch 3, skip next sc, sc in next ch-3 space] 14 times, ch 3, sc in same ch-3 space as just worked, [ch 3, skip next sc, sc in next ch-3 space] 13 times, ch 3, slip st in last ch-3 space—28 sc and 29 ch-3 sps. Fasten off.
Side Gusset
With larger hook and A, ch 52.
Row 1 (right side): Working in back bars, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—51 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each st, turn.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in each st, ch 2; working in spaces between rows, sc 4 sts evenly across to Row 1, ch 2; working in opposite side of Row 1, sc in each ch, ch 2; working in spaces between rows, sc 4 sts evenly across to Row 5; join with slip st in first sc—110 sc and 4 ch-2 sps. Fasten off. Place markers on center sts of each long edge.
Handles (make 2)
With smaller hook and B, leaving an 8” (20.5 cm) tail, ch 41.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch, turn—40 slip sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, slip st in each st. Fasten off, leaving 8” (20.5 cm) tail.
FINISHING
With right side facing, place lace heart on top of right side of large heart. With B, sew through both lower edges, leaving 18 stitches open across top to create pocket. With wrong sides together, align one marked stitch on gusset with point of large heart. With A and overcast stitching, sew through both edges to create a raised seam on right side of bag. Repeat to attach 2nd heart to gusset. Using photograph as a guide for placement, sew ends of handles to wrong side of large hearts. Weave in ends.

pattern_name: LILY SUGAR'N CREAM STRIPES BAG TO CROCHET
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Stripes (56.7 g / 2 oz) #21010 (Natural Stripes) 4 balls
OR Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Stripes Super Size (70.9 g / 2.5 oz) #23010 (Natural Stripes) 3 balls
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
4 grommets.
measurements: 9 x 12 x 3½ ins [23 x 30.5 x 9 cm].
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Front and Back (make alike).
Ch 28.
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of ch.
Turn. 27 sc. Work in sc for 11 ins [28 cm].
Next row: (Eyelet row). Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) twice. Turn.
Work 2 rows in sc. Fasten off.
Apply grommets in eyelets.
Gusset: Ch 12.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch.
Turn. 11 sc. Work in sc for 33 ins [84 cm]. Fasten off.
With WS tog, crochet Gusset to sides and bottom of Front and Back.
Handles: Ch 5. Join with sl st in first ch.
1st rnd:(RS).
Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. 5 sc.
Place marker for end of rnd and slip marker every rnd.
Work in sc for 16 ins [40.5 cm]. Fasten off. Thread handles through grommets and knot ends.
